title: Demand Planner
description:
Doka’s expertise in formwork technology is unparalleled in the industry and we are proud of the difference we make globally! “It’s not just formwork – it’s DOKA” is impressively demonstrated worldwide in buildings like the Burj Khalifa (Dubai), in hydroelectric generating stations like the Keeyask (Nelson River in northern Manitoba) – and in parts of the Brenner Base Tunnel (European Alps). Collaborative teamwork of nearly 7000 employees in over 160 distribution/logistics facilities in more than 70 countries is one of the primary reasons behind our success. With more than 150 years of history as a family owned company, we recognize and appreciate our employee’s work every day by rewarding them with flexible work hours, competitive wages, bonuses, training/development opportunities and a comprehensive group benefits program including RRSPs.


Summary of Position:

The Demand Planner works collaboratively with several Operations personnel (Commercial Office Coordinators, Logistics Coordinators, Project Managers and Sales) to place accurate orders for materials needed for customer’s projects.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Responsible for material planning & availability as per project forecast;
  • Ensure material order processing from DC (Distribution Center) or other Doka subsidiaries on time & in full as per customers need & requirements;
  • Attend Sales & Operations meetings with Sales to understand the future requirements and forecast from the sales team;
  • Coordinate with the commercial department any order processing requirement and updates of Delivery dates in DISCOS II;
  • Monitor and optimize stock levels including safety stock for all Doka items to ensure availability at lowest possible costs and inventory level as per budget;
  • Coordinate sourcing with Supply Planner & Head of Operation branch to avoid negative inventories;
  • Timely reserving the material in system for customer orders and should be always on top of all issues with respect to orders;
  • Coordinate with Engineering for substitution or alternate material in case of shortage or long Lead Time of material available in Stock;
  • Coordinate and check return planning from client’s jobsites with other departments to ensure stock levels are met and avoid any surplus of materials;
  • Proactively monitor all material movements and solve any problems arising from disputes during the project period;
  • Adhere to reporting deadlines and support period closings (month and year end).
  • Ensure orders are created & seek approvals on timely manner as per authority levels;
  • Take care of all logistics requirement within the branch;
  • Timely closing of purchase orders or any journals for the reporting period;
  • Coordinate actively with all other subsidiaries transport & release of materials;
  • Other work related tasks upon request of Head of Operations – Canada;
  • Source & confirm inter-company orders in compliance Work Instructions & Logistics guidelines set in DCAN & NAM region.

Other Responsibilities / Peripheral Functions:

  • Actively participates in Sales & Operations Department meetings as required;
  • Performs other tasks/projects as assigned;
  • Coordinate capacities with the Yard Team & Operations;
  • Proactively work on Transport Cost reduction;
  • Any other official duties as may be assigned by the management;
  • Works effectively in a complex, result driven environment requiring strong decision-making skills.


Qualifications / Technical Proficiency:

  • High school diploma required;
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply chain or Logistics. Commercial / Technical qualification is a plus;
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in relevant area;
  • Must be analytical and possess strong numeric aptitude;
  • Possess an assertive, take-charge management style with an ability to work independently and achieve results with minimal supervision;
  • Able to work effectively in a team and achieve desired objectives;
  • Must possess exceptional organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills;
  • Know-how and product knowledge (cost calculation, company accounts, inventory valuation, order processing, inventory and data management systems);
  • Substantial working knowledge of logistics processes and policies (material/yard/ transport logistics); Doka-specific knowledge preferred;
  • Knowledge of Doka´s supply network concept, strategies & policies is considered an asset;
  • Site construction knowledge;
  • Customer Support Function knowledge.

Skills / Characteristics:

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and go the extra mile
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Team player
  • Well organized
  • Customer oriented
  • Process and improvement drive approach

Problem Solving

  • Possesses strong skills in problem-solving, decision-making, creativity methods, error prevention;
  • Able to analyze management ratios and controlling instruments (i.e., cost accounting, key performance indicators and project controlling) ensuring actual figures are in line with budgets.

Communication

  • Extensive daily interaction with internal colleagues, headquarters, management and customers;
  • Able to perform effectively in a team environment and possess the ability collaborate with others ensuring Company/ Distribution Center targets are achieved.

Mental Effort

  • Position requires the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to be organized and manage time effectively to meet deadlines;
  • Consistently possess a positive attitude towards others in the working environment (colleagues, supervisors, senior management, clients, suppliers, etc.);
  • Open to new ideas and changing processes;
  • Open-minded towards different cultural groups;
  • Awareness of responsibility and identification with function, team, employees and targets;
  • Ability to inspire self and others;
  • High resilience.

Working Conditions

  • Conditions vary from an office environment: dry, cool, well lighted, to outside conditions (equipment yard or job site), high noise level in certain areas, extreme outdoor temperatures.


If you have a passion to support business accuracy and development, we look forward to receiving your application for this new role!

This position will remain open until suitable candidate(s) are located. If interested, please submit your resume as quickly as possible as interviews will be conducted intermittently.

To qualify:

  • applicants must currently reside in Canada and must be authorized to work for any employer in Canada (Permanent resident or Canadian work permit holder);
  • must clearly state their desired salary expectations in their cover letter;
  • should preferably reside within local area of the facility as there is no relocation allowance designated for this position.

Important note for remote work - this role is set to work within the office but you may be asked to work remotely, as required. Working remotely is not guaranteed.

Doka is an Equal Opportunity Employer. A company of the Umdasch Group.

title: newAnalyst, Supply Chain
description:
Job Address:
1425 The Queensway, Etobicoke, Ontario, M8Z 1T3

Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts. We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.
Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake. We are hiring a supply chain analyst who will play a critical role in the daily execution of the supply and distribution plan across the network. This role is ideal for someone who has excellent organizational and problem solving skills as well as familiarity with food production or fast moving consumer goods.
What You'll Do:
  • Support daily operations, working with Bakeries, Transport and Distribution to co-ordinate flow of goods through the network
  • Maintain and publish daily KPIs and undertake process improvement efforts, focused on improving Case Fill Rate
  • Execute seasonal activities plans provided by planners and develop holiday and long weekend plans to adjust delivery schedules
  • Analyze and ensure all data management pertaining to product allocations and movements are maintained
  • Assist in handling special requests/orders from Key Account Managers and CSRs on major customers’ behalf
  • Recommends process changes leading to more efficiency in the supply chain where applicable
What You'll Need:
  • Post-secondary education in Business, Economics, Engineering or Marketing
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret large amounts of data is required
  • Must be detail oriented and must be able to handle multiple priorities in a faced-paced environment
  • Good interpersonal & communication skills (oral & written)
  • Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment
  • Must have strong computer skills, especially with Excel
  • Previous experience with SAP is an asset

Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Number of openings:
1
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

title: newHighway Planner (Transportation)
description:
Planner
Mississauga, ON
The Planner is accountable for coordinating assets to satisfy the needs of clients, drivers and the company. Key roles of the Eastern Region Scheduler are to accurately predict availability and potential of assets in their assigned region, and properly acquire freight to effectively utilize those assets in the best of interest of the company. They must solve problems, realize opportunities and communicate in a thorough and timely fashion with all co-workers.
Specific responsibilities include:
  • Establish resource availability through analysis of the drivers, tractors and trailers in their region and interpret what restrictions and opportunities they present. The RP must take all relevant factors into consideration from individual driver requirements, equipment restrictions and overall balance issues
  • Assemble the overall strategy by taking all relevant information, developing a plan and communicating it in an effective and timely manner to the Fleet Management group for execution. Recognizing the need to adjust plans, such as required, is critical
  • Regularly monitor the highway operations and accurately receive, update and distribute driver information.
  • Responsible for freight management and generation for daily business needs.
  • Management of satellite, telephone and in-person communication.
  • Identification and resolution of all non-routine or time-sensitive issues that arise during business hours
Our Ideal Candidate will possessa

Why Bison:
  • Thrive in a supportive team that provides coaching and training to help develop your skills and progress your career
  • Dispersed work environments that promote a healthy work-life balance
  • Meaningful and impactful work and projects with an essential service provider
  • Join our engaging Wellness Program & extracurricular sports teams
About Bison:
  • Celebrating over 50 years in Business
  • Named as Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures
  • Active in giving back through Corporate Social Responsibility and Charitable Giving
  • Committed to environmental sustainability
Bison Transport is committed to Diversity and Inclusion in the Workplace.

title: Planner, Aviation
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

FLEXIBLE WSP LOCATIONS IN THE GREATER TORONTO AREA

WSP is currently seeking an Intermediate to Senior Aviation Planner to join our Aviation Planning and Advisory Team. This position will have the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects for aviation sector clients. Assignments include: airport planning and design studies, heliport planning and design studies, airside/apron layout planning, facility planning, strategic planning, aeronautical impact assessments, regulatory compliance issues, and other aviation-related studies.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collect and interpret transportation data and statistics, capacity/demand analysis;
  • Work with the planning team in preparing airport master plans and other planning studies including land use plans, terminal area plans, strategic plans and aviation subdivision plans;
  • Prepare aeronautical impact assessments, plan of construction operations (PCOs), meteorological assessments and other studies;
  • Prepare business development proposals;
  • Prepare drawings using AutoCAD;
  • Preparation of graphics, technical memos, and reports to communicate technical results and recommendations;
  • Prepare PowerPoint presentations;
  • Liaise with clients, project team members and authorities having jurisdiction regarding project requirements;
  • Undertake site visits to obtain relevant information and engage with airport operators and stakeholders;
  • Undertake the preparation and execution of public consultation events

QUALIFICATIONS

  • University degree or college diploma in a relevant field including planning, transportation engineering or aviation management;
  • Minimum 7-10 years hands on experience in aviation planning for consideration as an intermediate planner;
  • An understanding of airport airside, landside and terminal operations;
  • Ability to work in a team environment as well as working independently with minimum supervision;
  • Ability to work on multiple projects demonstrating good time management skills;
  • Demonstrated competency in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access);
  • Proficiency with AviPLAN would be an asset;
  • Firm knowledge of airport planning and design standards including Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs) Transport Canada TP312 4th and 5th Editions, TP 1247, ICAO Airport Planning Manual;
  • Proficiency in English with good verbal and written skills;
  • Strong technical writing skills;
  • Ability to travel on short assignments.

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Thornhill, ON

title: newDéveloppeur(euse) Java
description:
CiM est une firme d’ingénierie qui développe le logiciel Visual Planner Suite (Planificateur visuel), un produit complémentaire pour IBM Maximo et SAP Plant Maintenance. Visual Planner permet aux planificateurs et superviseurs de maintenance d'optimiser l’utilisation de leur main d’œuvre. Il est utilisé par des centrales électriques, des systèmes de métro, des usines de traitement d’eau, des raffineries de pétrole, des entreprises manufacturières et autres types d’organisations qui ont beaucoup d’équipement à entretenir.

Nous recherchons un-e développeur(euse) Java intéressé-e-s à se joindre à notre équipe et participer au développement des nouvelles versions de Visual Planner. Ce poste vous permettra de travailler sur des projets stimulants pour des grandes entreprises de partout dans le monde, dont plusieurs du Fortune 500.

Préalables :

  • Forte expérience en Java.
  • Bonne compréhension des concepts de développement d’applications web d’entreprise et de systèmes distribués.
  • Bilingue en français et en anglais.

Autre expérience pertinente :

  • Nos clients utilisent une variété de technologies de bases de données et de serveurs d’applications, donc de l’expérience avec Oracle, SQL Server, WebSphere, WebLogic, Red Hat OpenShift ou Kubernetes sont des plus.
  • De l’expérience en personnalisation des objets d’affaires Maximo (MBO), avec Spring Boot, en développement SAP Fiori ou avec le language de programmation ABAP de SAP sont des gros plus.
  • Nous utilisons Git, Mockito, Docker et JIRA, donc une maîtrise de ces outils est aussi un plus.

Notre candidat-e idéal-e est :

  • Créatif-ive et motivé-e par les défis. Nous concevons des solutions logicielles sur mesure pour répondre à des problèmes complexes pour des très grandes entreprises, souvent avec des très grandes quantités de données, qui œuvrent dans une grande variété d’industries (transport, pétrole et gaz naturel, manufacturier, minier, etc).
  • Intéressé-e à travailler au sein d’une petite équipe de développement, où son/sa contribution sera significative et immédiatement reconnaissable, et qui est à l’aise avec ce niveau de responsabilité.
  • Impliqué-e et proactif-ive. Étant une petite entreprise, nous avons la capacité de changer nos façons de faire rapidement. Nous cherchons une personne qui est à l'affût des nouvelles façons d’améliorer le développement, telles des nouvelles méthodes ou des nouveaux outils, et qui est motivée à implanter ces améliorations.

Principales responsabilités :

  • Développer et tester des applications complémentaires à IBM Maximo et SAP Plant Maintenance conçues en Java.
  • Travailler avec notre équipe des consultants en fiabilité d’actifs à la conception de nouvelles solutions et fonctionnalités qui répondent aux besoins et demandes de nos clients.
  • Travailler avec notre équipe d’assurance qualité pour corriger les anomalies (bugs) afin d’améliorer la fiabilité et la performance des applications.

Environnement de travail:

  • Presque entièrement à distance. On se rencontre une fois par semaine à nos bureaux entièrement rénovés près du Terminus Panama à Brossard.
  • Horaire de travail flexible.
  • Équipe de direction accessible et transparente.

Type d'emploi : Temps plein

Salaire : 70 000,00$ à 110 000,00$ par an

Avantages :

  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vie
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Événements d'Entreprise
  • Horaires flexibles
  • Stationnement sur place
  • Tenue Décontractée
  • Travail à domicile

Horaire :

  • Du Lundi au Vendredi

Formation:

  • DEC (Obligatoire)

title: Planner, Material and Logistics
description:
Carry out the scheduling, release and delivery tracking of materials and parts required for production in order to meet production schedules and keep inventories to a minimum using just-in-time principles. You will be at the forefront of operations, working with suppliers and internal customers, such as the teams responsible for material handling, transport, procurement, engineering and quality assurance.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Schedule and monitor the delivery of parts.

Work with suppliers and transport companies to find creative solutions to avoid production stoppages.

Analyze the best strategies to meet just-in-time objectives.

Manage business relationships with suppliers and negotiate in BRP's best interest.

Identify and coordinate improvement opportunities in relation to the team's objectives.

Establish a supplier recovery plan and meet with suppliers as required.

PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
A degree in administration, operations management or any other related field, or a Diploma of College Studies (DEC) in administration or any other related field, including at least 18 months to 3 years experience.

Bilingual French and English both written and oral.

Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and SAP software.

Available to travel, if required.

OTHER DESIRED SKILLS:
Ability to work independently and be a leader.

Ability to work under pressure in a constantly changing environment.

Good priority management and ability to work in a team.

Excellent communicator, ability to analyze and negotiate.

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 14,500 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours.

AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA! >
#LI-SD1

title: Site Planner / Dispatcher
description:
Mammoet is currently in need for a self-starting individual to join our Operations team at our Fort McMurray branch. This position offers the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment with one of the biggest Heavy Lift and Heavy Transport companies in the world. The role plans and executes mobilization and demobilization of personnel and project equipment for some of the largest projects in the region, in order to achieve an optimum utilization of resources to execute the work.

The successful candidate will require strong organizational and communications skill to effectively coordinate the planning of crane equipment and manpower for the region in an unionized work environment.

Responsibilities (including but not limited to)

  • Conduct all business in a professional, respectful manner
  • Set up appropriate planning of personnel and/or equipment in the applicable systems
  • Utilize SAP for planning, tracking and organizing equipment and manpower
  • Reviews, approves and data enters daily timesheets and crane work orders in SAP
  • Ensure operators are scheduled according to union collective and/or project labour agreements
  • Maintain a strong client focus with interactions with both internal and external clients
  • Positively influence others with proposed options/solutions to customers and operations
  • Ensures new hires and properly briefed in current operation procedures
  • Takes direction from Site Manager, Operations Manager, Lead Branch Planner
  • Analyse and reconcile SAP entries to ensure accuracy
  • Review and enter weekly timesheets – When applicable
  • Create invoices, purchase orders, and reports as necessary

Site Manager
  • Service orientated
  • Multi-tasker
  • Strong communicator

  • High school diploma
  • Completed post-secondary diploma in a business administration or a related field from an accredited institution.
  • Minimum 3 to 5 years office experience.
  • Comfortable with high pressure / short lead time 24 / 7 environment.
  • Knowledge of the crane industry is an asset.
  • Working knowledge of regulations in various districts, provinces and states
  • Intermediate computer skills

Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and optimize the uptime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Our services are focused on the petrochemical and mining industries, civil engineering, power generation and offshore projects. The logistic challenges in these industries are growing daily. Factors such as remote locations, harsh climates and a strong emphasis on the environment are constantly driving us towards smarter and safer solutions.

We provide the following services:

  • Engineered lifting and transportation services
  • Lifting, transportation and installation of modular constructions
  • Factory-to-foundation projects
  • Plant turnaround logistics
  • Salvage and wreck removal
  • Decommissioning of onshore and offshore installations
  • Trading in new and used equipment worldwide

For over two hundred years, we’ve been known for the unique capability of our state-of-the-art equipment. But it’s the trust of our clients that has brought us where we are today. Their confidence inspires 5,000 Mammoet professionals to give it their all each day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world.


This will be a cost reimbursable full-time position operating out of our Fort MacKay office. Flights from Edmonton/Calgary available, camp accommodation is available and 7/7 10 hour shifts.

As you are aware, effective December 21st, all Service Provider Contractor employees will be required to have received all required doses of a Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine. Only those people who are in compliance with this policy will have or obtain activated site access badges. All others will have their badges deactivated on December 21st.

There are no exemptions given to Service Provider Contractors for medical or religious reasons.

title: Material Handler
description:
Position Summary:
To load and unload freight, scan, and sort freight within the facility. To transport freight within and between facilities. To enter all the material into the system and follow up for the shortages or requirements.To load and unload freight, scan, and sort freight within the facility. To transport freight within and between facilities. To enter all the material into the system and follow up for the shortages or requirements.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Assist with shipping and receiving activities, including unloading trucks, checking in merchandise, matching purchase orders to sales orders and distributing orders to sales associates for processing.

Read customer orders, work orders, shipping orders and requisitions to determine items to be moved, gathered, distributed and/or shipped.

Fill requisitions, work orders or requests for materials, tools, and other stock items; distribute items to shipping team.

Ensure warehouse is accessible and safe for employee and customer traffic.

Complete your work in a safe manner; adhere to all safety policies and procedures.

Report all the discrepancies to the reporting manager from time to time.

Coordinate with Material Planner and provide all the information for the parts/spare/hardware availability in warehouse for better planning.

Coordinate with procurement team related to material planning and make sure all the information required are provided on time.

Coordinate with IT superuser for the Maximo implementation and record all the material in and out from warehouse.

Responsible for the proper and correct asset tagging on physical assets as per warehouse software.

Assist and coordinate with LRV supervisors, staff, and Manager for providing timely delivery of parts to the designated location.

Assist Indus team in the industrialization and implementation of various improvements within warehouse and maintenance floor.

Coordinate with third party vendor for the material planning and calibration of tools by making sure that TAT is minimum most

Qualifications:
High school diploma

Dock or warehouse experience in the transportation industry

Forklift experience in a freight or Less-than-Truckload (LTL) environment

Hands on experience on crane operations.

Experience loading and unloading trailers.

Basic written and verbal communication skills

Experience on warehouse IT software.

Job conditions:
Availability to work a variety of shifts, including days, evenings, nights and weekends, due to varying freight volumes

title: Junior Logistics Planner
description:
Responsabilités

Relations avec les transporteurs :

  • Développer des solides relations avec les transporteurs.
  • Surveiller et fournir des commentaires sur la performance globale du transporteur au planificateur logistique
  • Communication proactive avec les transporteurs pour s’assurer que les expéditions sont exécutées comme prévues
  • Retracer l’état des expéditions et fournir des informations au Planificateur d’expéditions au besoin
  • Gérer les informations initiales sur les réclamations pour pertes / dommages et pénurie sur les expéditions.
  • Toutes les commandes comptabilisées en temps réel
  • Problèmes en transit communiqués en temps réel

Relations avec la clientèle :

  • Terminer les mises à jour des expéditions TMS
  • Effectuer des audits EDI
  • Mettre à jour / réconcilier les vérifications de cour
  • Suivi, rapport et facturation des frais accessoires

Responsabilités de l’entreprise :

  • Assumer toutes les responsabilités ci-dessus conformément aux objectifs stratégiques de l’entreprise.
  • Assumer toutes les responsabilités ci-dessus conformément à aux valeurs de l’entreprise de LEAD WITH GRACE

Responsabilités en matière de mesure :

  • S’assurer que l’intégrité des données est élevée lors de la gestion et de l’exécution des commandes
  • Vérifier que les données du transporteur sont exactes avant de terminer les commandes

Autres responsabilités :

  • Soutenir et remplacer d’autres membres de l’équipe au besoin

Culture:

  • Soutenir la culture d’entreprise et les principes fondamentaux de XTL - LEAD WITH GRACE
  • Leadership
  • Autonomisation
  • Appréciation
  • Diversité
  • Éthique de travail
  • Intégrité
  • Confiance
  • Honnêteté
  • Croissance
  • Respect
  • Agilité
  • Créativité
  • Excellence

Compétences et aptitudes

  • Être impatient, prêt à relever de nouveaux défis
  • Excellentes compétences en service à la clientèle et comportement professionnel
  • Doit avoir des compétences interpersonnelles et de communication exceptionnelles
  • Autonome avec un bon jugement, bien organisé, professionnel et axé sur les détails
  • Capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois et à gérer les priorités, à respecter les délais, à travailler sous pression et à assumer des tâches supplémentaires
  • Une bonne connaissance de la géographie nord-américaine est un atout
  • Des études postsecondaires sont requises
  • Une connaissance pratique de l’AS400 est considérée comme un atout
  • Capable de travailler dans un environnement à rythme rapide
  • Capable de travailler dans une atmosphère d’équipe avec un minimum de supervision

Veuillez communiquer avec Antonio au 514-636-1499, poste 5104 ou au 438-820-3414

XTL est une opportunité d'emploi égale qui englobe la diversité en milieu de travail et tient compte de manière équivalente des candidatures de femmes, d'hommes, de minorités visibles, d'autochtones et de personnes handicapées qualifiés. Nous accueillons les candidatures de toutes les personnes intéressées

Responsibilities

Carrier Relations:

  • Grow & develop strong carrier relationships.
  • Monitor and provide feedback on carrier overall performance to the Carrier Logistic Planner
  • Proactive communication with carriers to ensure shipments are being executed as scheduled
  • Trace status of shipments and provide information back to Shipper Logistics Planner as needed
  • Handle initial information on loss/damage and shortage claims on shipments.
  • All orders accounted for in real time
  • In-transit issues communicated in real time

Customer Relations / Reporting:

  • Complete TMS shipment updates
  • Conduct EDI audits
  • Update / Reconcile yard checks
  • Book Lumpers
  • Track, report and bill accessorial charges

Corporate Responsibilities:

  • Perform all of the above responsibilities in alignment with our corporate strategic objectives.
  • Perform all of the above responsibilities in alignment with our corporate values of LEAD WITH GRACE

Measurement Responsibilities:

  • Ensure data integrity is high when managing and completing orders
  • Verify carrier data is accurate before completing orders

Other Responsibilities:

  • Support and replace other team members as needed

Culture:

  • Support Company Culture and XTL's Core Principles - LEAD WITH GRACE
  • Leadership
  • Empowerment
  • Appreciation
  • Diversity
  • Work Ethic
  • Integrity
  • Trust
  • Honesty
  • Growth
  • Respect
  • Agility
  • Creativity
  • Excellence

Skills and Abilities

  • Must be eager, up for new challenges, and not willing to settle
  • Excellent customer service skills and professional demeanour
  • Must have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
  • Self-starter with good judgment, well organised, professional and detail oriented individual
  • Ability to multi-task and manage priorities, meet deadlines, work under pressure and take on additional tasks
  • A good knowledge of North American geography is an asset
  • Post-secondary education is required
  • Working knowledge of AS400 is preferred
  • Able to work in a fast pace environment
  • Able to work in a team atmosphere with minimal supervision

Please contact Antonio 514-636-1499 ext. 5104 or 438-820-3414

XTL is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity in the workplace and equivalently considers applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal people and persons with disabilities. We welcome applications from all interested individuals

title: Dispatch Opportunities
description:
Dispatchers

*CURRENT and FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES*

Midland Transport Limited has become a leader in the transportation industry by providing superior quality service to our customers. Our services include LTL, T/L, Courier Services, and Third Party Logistics/ Brokerage, which provide the convenience of one-stop shipping.

Midland Transport is looking for strong candidates to join us as Dispatchers based at our head office in Dieppe, NB. We are looking for future talent to join our team!

Qualifications:
  • Minimum High school diploma;
  • Experience in a Dispatch/Operations role an asset;
  • Solid interpersonal, communication (oral and written) and organizational skills;
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision under pressure and time constraints;
  • Knowledge of computerized dispatch systems – AS400, ICC Logistics an asset;

Key Responsibilities:
  • Day to day communication, via phone and satellite, with an assigned fleet of drivers to ensure proper load instructions are passed along and carried out;
  • Manage service concerns, as required, to limit exposure and minimize impact to the customer;
  • Coordinate with Planners to keep them updated on any issues within the fleet;
  • Update trip records in the dispatch system ensuring the accuracy of miles paid accessorials and log hours;
  • Assist other Dispatch staff as required during spikes in workload;
  • Assist Planners by preparing and analyzing various Linehaul reports as required;
  • Provide Drivers with the correct information and equipment to make the entire customer experience positive from start to finish.

What to Expect:
All applications will be reviewed by one of our recruiters. If the recruiter sees a potential opportunity that matches your skills and experience, you will be contacted to discuss your qualifications. Only those candidates who have the necessary qualifications will be contacted.
We appreciate your interest in our company!

title: Planner Dispatcher
description:
Mammoet is currently in need for a self-starting individual to join our Operations team at our Grande Prairie branch. This position offers the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment with one of the biggest Heavy Lift and Heavy Transport companies in the world. The role plans and executes mobilization and demobilization of personnel and project equipment for some of the largest projects in the region, in order to achieve an optimum utilization of resources to execute the work. The successful candidate will require strong organizational and communications skill to effectively coordinate the planning of crane equipment and manpower for the region in an unionized work environment.

Responsibilities (including but not limited to)

  • Conduct all business in a professional, respectful manner

  • Set up appropriate planning of personnel and/or equipment in the applicable systems

  • Schedules assignments and coordinates activities for our vehicles, operators and crews

  • Liaise between Crane Operators, Supervision, Clients, Project Managers and the Sales and Tendering Department for effective planning of jobs

  • Utilize SAP for planning, tracking and organizing equipment and manpower

  • Reviews, approves and data enters daily timesheets and crane work orders in SAP

  • Ensure operators are scheduled according to union collective and/or project labour agreements

  • Prepare daily manpower and equipment reports for the operations group

  • Initiate the permit application process for movement of equipment

  • Uses specialized software to create appropriate maps and direction charts to follow all permit laws

  • Maintain a strong client focus with interactions with both internal and external clients

  • Positively influence others with proposed options/solutions to customers and operations

  • Ensures new hires and properly briefed in current operation procedures

  • Monitors all crane and truck activities and ensures related regulations, policies and procedural guidelines are followed

Operations Manager
  • Planning and organizing


  • Delivering results and customer expectations


  • Following instructions and procedures


  • Coping with pressures and setbacks


  • Accuracy and attention to detail


  • Deciding and initiating action


  • Working with people


  • High School Diploma or General Equivalency Diploma from an accredited institution


Experience


  • Minimum three years of fast paced office related experience


  • Proficient with computer software applications to include basic knowledge of Microsoft Office applications


  • Previous experience with scheduling or dispatching is an asset


  • SAP experience is an asset

Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and optimize the uptime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Our services are focused on the petrochemical and mining industries, civil engineering, power generation and offshore projects. The logistic challenges in these industries are growing daily. Factors such as remote locations, harsh climates and a strong emphasis on the environment are constantly driving us towards smarter and safer solutions.

We provide the following services:



  • Engineered lifting and transportation services

  • Lifting, transportation and installation of modular constructions

  • Factory-to-foundation projects

  • Plant turnaround logistics

  • Trading in new and used equipment worldwide


For over two hundred years, we’ve been known for the unique capability of our state-of-the-art equipment. But it’s the trust of our clients that has brought us where we are today. Their confidence inspires 5,000 Mammoet professionals to give it their all each day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world.

This will be a full-time position operating out of our Grande Prairie location on a full-time basis. Office hours are Monday to Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Some on call work may be required during seasonal peaks

title: Production Manager
description:
Reference No. R2642563

Position Title: Production Manager

Department: DTPPD Adsorptions

Location: Sanofi Pasteur Limited, Toronto

Sanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine company

Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.

Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.

Position Summary:

The incumbent is mainly responsible for the PPD (Purified Protein Derivative) manufacturing and Adsorption activities (if needed) in compliance with cGMP, and is accountable for the administration and supervision of the Adsorption and PPD Department in Bulk Manufacturing. The incumbent is responsible for the preparation of all necessary documentation required to release the products and is responsible for supervising the activities of the staff in the department. This includes being accountable for the efficiency and accuracy of the formulation processes and documentation; adherence to SOPs, cGMPs and safe work procedures; quality assurance and improvements; maintenance of the Adsorption facility and effective scheduling and control of expenses. The incumbent will act as a core member of the Autonomous Production Team (APT) and participate in all cross-functional activities to support the B90 APU.

  • As a core APT member, plans the strategy and execution of the production schedule in collaboration with a team including QO, MTech, Maintenance, Supply Chain, and other production members.

  • Oversees all PPD related activities, e.g. the preparation of PPD stock solutions, PPD bulks, and all adsorption activities.

  • Participate in deviation investigation, CCR, and CAPA.

  • Participates in the annual budget for Adsorption department.

  • Day Shift and work hours may shift depending on activities.

Key Responsibilities:

Supervise the PPD manufacturing activities including PPD stock solution and PPD bulk, and Adsorption activities (if needed):

  • Plan daily work schedule for PPD production activities and Adsorption activities if needed.

  • Ensure SOPs, BPRs are adhered to, oversee maintenance of production equipment and clean rooms.

  • Plan detailed schedule for the area to ensure delivery of product to meet demand.

  • Co-ordinate and monitor document review of batches manufactured.

  • Perform supervisory roles & hiring, & maintain a high level of performance from employee reports.

Plan work schedule with Divisional Planner to meet SAP requirements:

  • Work with planner, scheduler & formulation departments to meet delivery times.

  • Maintain, and update BOMs, recipes and material master data.

  • Coordinate activities to ensure cleaning, validation, EM requirements, training, maintenance and safety programs are met.

  • Maintain manufacturing cycle times & improve on time deliveries based on customer requirements.

Maintain documentation including BPRs, SOPs, Process Descriptions and Test Requirements with the relevant QO and MTech department personnel to meet cGMP documentation requirements:

  • Review and approve documentation for all products produced in PPD and Adsorption department, including BPRs, SOPs, filter integrity tests, equipment records, log books, particle counts and Deviation investigations.

  • Update and approve revisions to master batch records, in compliance with change control procedures.

  • Maintain high level of security & document integrity for all files in orderly manner for review & retrieval.

Participate in deviation investigations and appropriate corrective and preventive actions (CAPA), Participate in special projects to assist development goals, maintain stability programs and improve production processes to simplify procedures, meet new GMP requirements or reduce costs to division:

  • Involve in deviation investigation and CAPA implementation.

  • Execute validation protocols to maintain compliance, while reducing manufacturing costs without compromising product or licenses.

  • Meet with other departments to assist projects needed for product licensing, cGMP improvements and better customer service.

Maintain PPD and Adsorption clean rooms to meet cGMP requirements including aseptic validation, personnel training, daily cleaning and environmental monitoring activities:

  • Maintain clean room requirements during manufacturing operations; ensure log books are up to date on a routine basis.

  • Schedule routine and emergency maintenance with Technical Services, including certification of HEPA filters, particle counters, scales, weight & integrity testers as per QO policies.

  • Lead regulatory inspection tours in the area, and respond promptly to all regulatory requests.


Maintain large controlled inventory for manufacturing:

  • Maintain inventory in controlled refrigerator units to meet cGMP cold chain; maintain 4 refrigerators in B90.

  • Ensure safe transport of products to Formulations weekly.

  • Responsible for approving purchase orders and following approved budget.

Key Requirements:

  • Preferred MSc in Microbiology/Biochemistry/Related Science.

  • Minimum Honors BSc in Microbiology/Biochemistry/Related Science.

  • 3 to 5 years experience in Aseptic Manufacturing in a pharmaceutical clean room environment.

  • Must be able to lead through example and possess managerial skills for handling a group of individuals (building/leading/training a team).

  • Good knowledge of cGMP in pharmaceuticals/biological is essential.

  • Understanding of key activities including sterile manufacturing and aseptic techniques.

  • Experience in validation, aseptic processing, sterilization & disinfection, sterile broth fills & formulations.

  • Good problem solving skills and documentation skills, clear written and oral communication.

  • Ability to lead a group handling high value products.

  • Knowledge of Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.

Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request.

Thank you in advance for your interest.

Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Sanofi, Empowering Life

#GD-SP #LI-SP

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

title: newJunior Environmental Scientist
description:
AECOM is seeking a Junior Environmental Scientist to be based in Markham, ON.

_This position is expected to begin in May/June 2022._

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

+ Assist with a variety of projects while utilizing basic scientific principles, theories, practices, and existing technologies to develop solutions for technical problems.

+ Interpret and record data, conduct analyses and compare findings to relevant studies and provincial and federal regulations to ensure compliance.

+ The field activities will consist of surface water and sediment collection and the potential oversight of subcontractors, environmental impact assessments to support environmental assessment projects and potentially soil and groundwater sampling

+ Coordination with task and project managers, working with on-site subcontractors and field staff, supporting sampling, data collection, develop surveys, environmental investigations, aquatic toxicity testing and additional studies, and field documentation.

+ The office activities will involve the preparation of investigation reports, remediation reports, environmental assessments, data analyses, environmental fate and exposure modelling, and risk assessments.

+ Apply knowledge of natural sciences to explain observations.

+ Prepare drawings.

+ Possesses technical report writing skills.

+ Travel to various job sites within Canada.

+ Flexibility to work on a multitude of diverse projects, a positive attitude, and commitment to workplace health and safety

+ Ability/willingness to travel to job sites and perform field work as needed

Minimum Requirements

+ Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Toxicology, or other related discipline

+ Valid Canadian Driver's License

Preferred Qualifications

+ Master's degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Toxicology, or other related discipline

+ Proficiency in standard office suite software applications

+ Ability to travel to out of province job sites, including Nova Scotia and working out of province for extended periods of time.

+ Experience working in the field, evaluating environmental assessments, with developing conceptual site models, developing sampling plans and bioassays, laboratory testing, and analytical data analysis, preparing environmental risk assessments (HHERAs), and remediation strategies.

+ Knowledge of human health and ecological risk assessment, environmental toxicology, aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems, fate, transport, and effects of contaminants in the environment (i.e., metals, petroleum hydrocarbons, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, volatile organic compounds, pesticides, and emerging contaminants).

+ Ability to demonstrate professional demeanor in written and verbal communications with clients, regulatory officials, and fellow employees.

+ Ability to write and to convey complex thoughts and ideas in a clear, concise manner. Ability to learn through on-the-job experience.

+ Tolerance for work in outdoor environments in a range of weather conditions.

Additional Information:
+ Relocation per diem is not available for this position.

+ Sponsorship is not available for this position.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: newREQ22-080 Senior coordinator electrical reliability and main...
description:
• RAGLAN MINE
  • Raglan Mine, North-of-Quebec, Quebec, Canada
  • Rotation schedule of 2/2: equivalent to 2 consecutive weeks of work followed by 2 weeks of leave.

SENIOR COORDINATOR - ELECTRICAL RELIABILITY AND MAINTENANCE
(1 PERMANENT POSITION)

Service: Concentrator operations and energy production services
Location: Raglan Mine Site
Reference number: REQ22-080

Reporting to the Energy Production Services Superintendent, you will work in a safe, unique and motivating environment. You will oversee the entire maintenance management system of the Energy Production Department. Your primary duties will be:

  • Supervise and coordinate a team of planners and maintenance engineers.
  • Establish process management guidelines and ensure sound data governance.
  • Maintain and develop tools to optimize maintenance planning.
  • Develop the management and planning system (SAP) in order to optimize the reliability of surface and underground electrical installations
  • Participate in the implementation, maintenance and improvement of the preventive maintenance program for the mine's electrical installations.
  • Produce reports related to the planning and follow-up of major shutdowns.
  • Follow up and ensure the implementation of the required action plans according to the observed deviations.

Your profil:

  • Bachelor's degree in electrical, industrial engineering, or other field deemed equivalent
  • Experience with master maintenance data governance and maintenance planning management.
  • In-depth knowledge of SAP PM as well as experience with the implementation of reliability management systems.
  • Interest and curiosity for new technologies (tele-operations, LTE communication, vehicle telemetry).
  • Leadership, strong organizational and planning skills.
  • Knowledge of codes and regulations governing electrical work.
  • Bilingual (English / French).

What we offer :

  • Work shifts of 11 hours per day.
  • Rotation schedule of 2/2: equivalent to 2 consecutive weeks of work followed by 2 weeks of leave.
  • Private air transport is provided from Montreal, Quebec, Rouyn-Noranda, Mont-Joli or Inuit communities (depending on place of residence) to the mine site and return.
  • Accommodation and meals are provided.
  • Competitive salary along with a comprehensive benefits package.

Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Raglan Mine is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Join a well-established company with a bright future!

title: Bid Manager - NA (contract)
description:
About Us

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work and visit, by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company, building a fare payments and ticketing platform that allows passengers to simply tap and ride using mobile phones, bank cards and smart cards to travel.

Proving ourselves as true innovators and industry leaders, we launched the Justride SDK - a first for public transit - allowing urban mobility providers, like journey planners (Transit) and bike and ride-sharing services (Uber), to integrate our market-leading mobile ticketing platform into their applications, connecting services together for a seamless user experience.

Our platform, Justride, is deployed in numerous cities around the globe, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, The Hague, Los Angeles, Sydney and many more, with an exciting industry-first SDK deployment with Uber in Denver enabling the purchase of public transport tickets right within the Uber application.

Come join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.


The role

Masabi is looking for a Bid Manager to join our Bids team in North America, working across the business, writing and managing proposals mainly for public transit agencies and operators worldwide.

As a Bid Manager, you will develop a deep understanding of our products and, working closely with internal stakeholders, write, lead and review compelling bids.

This role is the glue between sales, product, engineering, services and finance, collating information from all these functions and proposing solutions to business problems combining that information into a coherent bid to ultimately win new business. This is both an internal and external-facing position.


Responsibilities

  • Own bid from qualification to contract award according to internal processes:
  • Ensuring all required reviews and sign-offs are completed in time
  • Facilitating key meetings, such as kick offs, bid/no bid and sign off meetings
  • Manage/provide input into the value proposition, strategy and solution development, commercial considerations and risk management
  • Work closely with the Business Development, Product, Engineering, Services and Financial teams in the preparation and delivery of technical and commercial proposals, including draft terms and conditions, pricing and milestone payments.
  • Manage, review and edit inputs from multiple stakeholders. Document creation, writing and formatting; mainly Word, Powerpoint or Google Docs/Slides
  • Responsible for document production and delivery
  • Actively report bid progress, wins and losses to the appropriate internal teams, determining reasons for bid outcomes and making effective changes where necessary


What you will learn

As part of the Bids team, you will be working collaboratively with Business Development, Product, Services, Engineering and Finance which would give you a unique perspective of how a fast-paced technology company operates.


About You

  • Have experience writing proposals, technical documentation or similar, in a fast-paced, technology/software environment.
  • Have experience working on complex projects or products where gathering information from multiple stakeholders is critical to developing a competitive bid.
  • Are a perceptive analytical thinker with a systematic approach to problem-solving.
  • Have excellent attention to detail and ideally a good eye for design and layout.
  • Have great interpersonal communication skills and ability to quickly build relationships and rapport with a variety of stakeholders.
  • Have exceptional command of the English language and are able to produce reports, documentation and proposals to a high standard.
  • Are used to working to tight deadlines, with a focus on quality.
  • Have advanced Office skills including Word, Excel and Powerpoint or Google Suite equivalent offer.
  • Preparing and reviewing the commercial terms of the bid, understanding costs and profitability.
  • French or Italian would be considered advantageous (For European based applicants).


Some of our benefits

  • Competitive salary package
  • 20 days of vacation per year (in addition to public holidays), plus the option to buy an additional 5 days of vacation each year. On top of this, our office is shut every year between Christmas and New Year, totalling a whopping 28+ days of vacation
  • Private Healthcare and Life Insurance via Trinet
  • Choice of a workstation
  • $250 per year to spend on your home office
  • Flexibility to work from home whenever you need to and flexible working hours (we are currently operating fully remote due to COVID-19)
  • Ability to work for up to 3 months per year from any country in the world
  • Regular social gatherings with a monthly spending allowance for each employee
  • Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world


Diversity

We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply and we don’t discriminate. Also, please notify our team of any preferred pronouns at any point of your application.


Interviewing

In light of the continued Covid-19 risks, all interviews are expected to take place by phone or video.


Remote working

Masabi’s flexible working policy will allow you to work fully remotely, or from one of our offices in London, Cluj, New York, Denver or Boston. The choice about where you work from will be largely made by you. Regardless of where you choose to work from, you will be allowed to work outside of the country of your employment for up to 3 months each year (tax laws permitting).


To find out more about who we are and how we work, please have a read about how our business reacted to the Covid pandemic: https://www.masabi.com/2021/08/02/emerging-stronger/

title: Sr. Buyer
description:
Are you looking for an exciting challenge with a rapidly growing corporation in Canada and the US? Are you solution-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced environment?


GN Corporations Inc. (GN) is an industry leader in manufacturing and assembly for the Oil and Gas, Automotive, Aerospace and Defense industries. GN manufactures quality products within its Canadian facility with its world class, advanced technology. GN is leading the way in Industry 4.0 with many data driven and integrated platforms.


Summary of duties and responsibilities include:

  • New supplier development - develop and improve overall supplier and supply base capabilities, be responsible for new supplier selection, audit and approval. Support new product and program development.
  • Maintain AVL (Approved Vender List) and Supplier Scorecard – supplier monthly performance of on-time delivery and Supplier NCR (receiving and manufacturing).
  • Prepare and issue Request for Quotation (RFQ) to approved suppliers. Evaluate the RFQS factors such as terms, conditions, price, delivery, quality etc. and negotiate with suppliers the best prices and delivery times to ensure that company quality, price and delivery times are achieved.
  • Initiative annual purchasing cost saving plan and update PPV (Purchasing Price Variance) report weekly to take actions to meet cost saving target.
  • Facilitate engineering changes and other projects to enable savings and/or sourcing flexibility.
  • Prepare and issue Purchase Orders (PO’s) to suppliers to ensure that company quality, price and delivery times are achieved.
  • Maintain and monitor progress of purchase orders including daily or weekly communication with suppliers to obtain purchase order status updates and take proactive actions to ensure that company quality and delivery requirements are achieved.
  • Update daily Syteline Workbench reports and take proactive actions to work with Master Planner to ensure that company quality and delivery requirements are achieved.
  • Undertake other duties from time to time as directed by supervisor.


EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Proven 5 years’ successful experience as a supply chain, purchasing and logistic or relevant role dealing with North American and International suppliers.
  • Must have demonstrable experience of successful negotiation of pricing and delivery.
  • Knowledge and experience of raw material of steel, aluminum and machining process strongly preferred.
  • Ability to read and evaluate engineering drawings and specification.
  • Knowledge of market research, data analysis and purchasing best practices.
  • Practical experience of using electronic communication methods to keep track of purchase orders, delivery times, transport costs and performance evaluation.
  • Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Excel, and MRP/ERP systems.
  • Demonstrate an aptitude for problem-solving; ability to determine solutions for customers.
  • Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
  • Must be results-orientated and able to work independently.
  • Have a post-secondary degree in a technical/engineering, mechanical engineering (preferred).

GN Corporations Inc. is a proud Alberta corporation, in operation for over 50 years headquartered at 2873 Kingsview Blvd SE, Airdrie, Alberta, T4A 0E1, Canada.


We will be expanding our operations in the coming year to include Texas, USA. GN boasts an incredible organization filled with operators from over 42 countries. GN is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


GN Offers:

  • competitive salary;
  • Company medical, dental, and vision plan;
  • RSP matching program;
  • Endless opportunities to take part in job related training and development.

To learn more about GN Corporation Inc., please visit our website at www.gncorporations.com

We appreciate the interest of all applicants and qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Rail engineering technician
description:
AECOM 's Transportation group is searching for a Rail engineering technician for full time employment in a secondment role with our client in their Halifax, NS office, as a CN Design & Construction Officer.

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

+ Responding to stakeholder and public questions regarding CN.

+ Providing support with regards to CN Work Permits required by third-party agents looking to work on or around CN property.

+ Providing support with regards to Utility Crossings required by third-party agents looking to cross over/under CN property.

+ Supporting CN Design & Construction Engineer with project management responsibilities.

+ Act as CN’s representative at meetings with external stakeholders.

+ The position requires awareness of Transport Canada regulations and liaises with municipalities and internal/ external stakeholders (Engineering, public relations and regulatory affairs).

+ The individual must work in collaboration with external stakeholders to formalize utility crossings into an agreement, including making adjustments to reflect the specifics of each project.

Minimum Requirements

+ High school diploma

+ 4+ years of related experience

Preferred Qualifications

+ Technical knowledge, writing and communication skills;

+ Negotiation skills;

+ Time management and problem solving skills;

+ Hold a Civil Technologist Degree, Engineering degree, or related degree/diploma

+ Communication in both English and French is considered an asset;

+ Railway experience is considered an asset.

Additional Information:
+ Sponsorship is not available for this position.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: Maintenance Planner
description:
Maintenance Planner

Full Time

Saskatoon SK


Rise Air is western Canada's largest full-service aviation operation. Based in Saskatoon, here is your opportunity to work in the fascinating aviation industry for a dynamic company that exceeds customers' expectations, strives for operational excellence, and has a strong employee culture.

Job Purpose

Under the general direction of the Technical Services Manager, this position is responsible for the planning and scheduling of various maintenance activities and ensuring that required parts and materials are available. This position ensures that operational policies and procedures provide for an acceptable level of safety, and that all activities are carried out in accordance with Transport Canada regulations and standards.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Review maintenance forecasts and flight operations schedules to plan and schedule short term maintenance activities.
  • Review maintenance forecasts and budgetary reports to plan long term maintenance activities.
  • Forecast and plan for provisioning of parts and materials required for scheduled maintenance.
  • Assist in assessing new maintenance information for impact on maintenance programs and schedules.
  • Create and/or revise inspection forms as required to ensure maintenance procedures and programs are implemented as efficiently as possible.
  • Track progress of major projects and inspections.
  • Meet with operational control personnel (Dispatch) daily to discuss schedule changes, and their possible impact on flight operations and maintenance.

General Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain knowledge of the company's mission, vision, and values.
  • Foster a team-based environment through collaborative working relationships.
  • Ensure optimal communication with all employees and internal partners.
  • Maintain current knowledge of all CARs and Transport Canada rules, regulations and policies as required.
  • Participate in special projects as required.
  • Ensure compliance with quality assurance and safety programs to promote an incident and injury free culture.

Qualifications

Typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position include an M1 or M2 AME license and a minimum 5 years of related maintenance systems and quality assurance requirements is preferred. A combination of education and experience may be considered.

Skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
  • Demonstrated research skills and ability to interpret complex regulatory information.
  • Sound problem solving, decision-making, analytical thinking, planning, prioritization, and execution skills.
  • Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects and tasks and execute effectively and in a timely manner.
  • Strong self-leadership skills and a hands-on, self-motivated, and demonstrated positive, can-do attitude.
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize, multi-task and prioritize.
  • Proficient in utilizing Microsoft Office applications and software specific to company operations.
  • Ability to support, strengthen and enhance safety initiatives.


Typical Physical and Cognitive Demands

  • Majority of the work is completed in an indoor or outdoor hangar environment and on elevated workstations.
  • Able to prioritize and organize objectives and meet deadlines in a fast-paced office environment.
  • Must quickly adapt to changing assignments.
  • Required to act professionally and use mature judgment.
  • Occasional ground and/or air travel required.

title: Planners
description:
PLANNER

RST Industries Limited and Sunbury Transport Limited are leading carriers utilizing the most advanced technology to deliver world class transportation services throughout North America. We offer a wide range of creative transportation solutions; specializing in chemicals, petroleum, bulk, flatbed, van and food grade products.

Sunbury Transport is currently seeking a highly motivated individual to fill the role of Planner located in Saint John, NB.

Qualifications:
  • Education Required: Bachelor's Degree in Business; concentration in Supply Chain or Logistics considered an asset
  • Years of Experience Required: 2-5 years work experience; Transportation and/or Logistics experience considered an asset
  • Computer software skills are essential; experience working with ERP systems considered an asset
  • Superior organizational, decision-making and problem-solving abilities
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Team-oriented and results-driven
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be committed to quality, safety, and service
  • Must be available for weekends on-call

Key Responsibilities:
  • Plan and coordinate all loads and equipment with Fleet Managers
  • Coordinate with Customer Service and Dispatch on all commitments (i.e. meeting volume metrics, exceeding the needs of our customers, completing driver requirements)
  • Ensure maximum utilization on all equipment (trucks, trailers, satellite, etc.); tracking trailers to ensure customer needs are met
  • Coordinate trailer maintenance; ensuring property damage is thoroughly investigated and reported

To Apply for this Career Opportunity:

Please apply online by _____.

We appreciate your interest in our company however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
