title: Technicien(ne) spécialisé(e) en génie routier
location: Hybrid remote in Quebec City, QC
description:
En forte expansion, notre groupe Transport est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) technicien(ne)spécialisé(e) en génie routier, pour la grande région de Québec. Le candidat choisi pourra faire progresser sa carrière à partir du bureau de Québec. L’équipe au sein de laquelle évoluera le candidat est constituée de professionnels et ressources œuvrant en génie routier.

Maîtrisant les aspects du génie routier et possédant une expérience particulière dans la réalisation de projets pour le compte du ministère des Transports Québec, la personne recherchée possède l'expérience requise afin de mener à bien, avec le soutien de l'équipe technique, la conception d'infrastructures de génie routier.

Sous la supervision du chargé de projet et du coordonnateur de l’équipe :

  • Participer au dessin et à la conception des ouvrages de génie routier;
  • Effectuer des analyses techniques ;
  • Traiter les relevés d’infrastructures;
  • Collaborer à la conception d’infrastructures de transport pour des projets de petite, moyenne et grande envergure;
  • Préparer les plans, dessins et détails requis dans le cadre des projets;
  • Participer à la coordination interdisciplinaire.
Chez AECOM, nous offrons un monde meilleur.

Nous estimons que l’infrastructure crée des occasions pour tous. Que ce soit pour améliorer votre trajet matinal, éclairer les foyers, rendre l’eau potable accessible ou transformer le paysage urbain, notre travail aide les gens et les collectivités à prospérer.

Nos clients nous font confiance pour consacrer les meilleures personnes, idées, expertises techniques et solutions numériques à notre travail dans les secteurs du transport, du bâtiment, de l’eau, de l’environnement et des nouvelles énergies. Au sein d’une même équipe mondiale, nous sommes 47 000 à poursuivre ensemble l’objectif d’offrir un monde meilleur.

Minimum Requirements

+ DEC en génie civil ou disciplines connexes;

+ 4+ années d'expérience pertinentes.

Preferred Qualifications

+ Expérience dans le génie conseil.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: Plant Material Planner 1
description:
Plant Material Planner 1

Date: 14-Apr-2022
Country/Region: CA
City: Brampton
Contract Type:
Requisition ID: 34620

New trends and expectations are reshaping the automotive industry. Inspired by the exciting new challenges associated with this revolution, Faurecia anticipates the future of mobility developing cutting-edge solutions for smart life on board and sustainable mobility. If you’re willing to contribute and create value for tomorrow’s cleaner and smarter mobility, Faurecia is the place to be.


About Faurecia

Faurecia products and systems are in one out of three vehicles on the road today, including vehicles manufactured by the biggest and most well-known automotive brands in every region of the world.

Our comprehensive offer for SUSTAINABLE MOBILITY includes zero-emission hydrogen solutions, ultra-low emissions solutions, systems for advanced driver assistance and products made with a range of optimized and sustainable materials.

With our COCKPIT OF THE FUTURE, we create value for brands and connected experiences for consumers with our expertise in seating, interiors, lighting, body electronics, sensors, actuators and other display technologies and cockpit electronics.

But Faurecia is also so much more than a top-7 global automotive and technology leader. We inspire safer, more comfortable, more personalized and more sustainable mobility. We create advanced solutions to accelerate the transition towards CO2 neutrality.

We believe people matter. We work on challenges that matter. If you join us, you’ll take a journey that matters.


We’re hiring a PC&L Material Planner for our FCM Brampton facility located in Ontario, Canada.

The role of a PC&L/Material Planner is to verify that production line delivery aligns with minimum stock targets and logistics costs.


The main missions of the role are to:

  • Build up the Procurement Program by dividing and leveling piece procurements
  • Follow up the Procurement Program realization by managing alert systems and follow the unloading, receipt and transportation of pieces.
  • Follow supplier delivery performance (supplier Misdeliveries Per Million) and the service of logistics partners and propose appropriate improvement action plans.
  • Achieve the transportation program on a monthly basis and the transportation scheme semi-annually.
  • Direct packaging management.
  • Ensure that logistics conventions comply with purchasing objectives and support conditions set by suppliers for procurement and packaging and by logistics partners for transport and services.
  • Verify that Sales and Production Plan (PIC) capacity requirements can be supported by suppliers and implement corrective actions when necessary.
  • Meets/exceeds targets for improvement ideas.
  • Customer scheduling as required
  • Organize cycle counts;
  • Implement corrective measures
  • Lead organizational aspect of physical inventory as needed
  • Coordinating and managing PC&L database’s as required
  • All other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have/be:


Minimum education level: A degree in a materials related field


Experience:

  • Experience in fast paced automotive production environment
  • Proven experience scheduling/planning production lines in an automotive manufacturing environment

Skills and competencies:

  • Good attendance record
  • Bi-lingual is an asset (English required)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Commitment to the highest ethical standards and willingness to adhere to Faurecia’s Code of Ethics and Code of Management

Faurecia is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.


Join us, and take a journey that matters

.

title: newTour and Transportation Manager
description:
Tour and Transportation Manager

Typically doubling revenues year over year since our founding in 2016 has created an opportunity for a key person in our burgeoning business.

For this pivotal management role, typical career categories include 1) Inside Sales 2) Event Planner 3) Dispatcher 4) Logistics Manager 5) Office Manager 6) General Manager.

THE JOB SUMMARY.

The Tour and Transportation Manager clearly communicates with Ski, Airport, Golf, Wedding, Event, Employers, and Tour customers by phone and email, provides accurate quotations, enters data correctly into the reservations system, assigns the proper vehicles, requests the available tour guides or drivers, designs the itineraries with precision, and conscientiously prepares the daily trip sheets. For wine tours, the Manager makes venue reservations, orders the food, and assembles the picnic supplies.

THE COMPANY AND ITS LEGENDARY REPUTATION

Founded in 2016, Cheers! Okanagan Tours quickly vaulted from 124th place to first place on TripAdvisor and today is RANKED TOP 10% WORLDWIDE by TripAdvisor.

“Cheers! Okanagan Tours” = https://cheersokanagantours.com/

“TripAdvisor” = https://www.tripadvisor.ca/Attraction_Review-g154933-d10595131-Reviews-Cheers_Okanagan_Tours-Kelowna_Okanagan_Valley_British_Columbia.html

Cheers! delivers unmatched tour and transportation experiences throughout Southern British Columbia.

· 51 Cat-Skiing, Heli-Skiing, and Resort Skiing Destination Shuttles

· 4 Tiers of Wine Tours

· Airport Shuttles

· Wedding Transportation

· Golf Transportation

· Dinner Transportation

· Party Transportation

· Corporate Transportation

· Employee Transportation

Cheers! is a LEGITIMATE tour and transportation operator. We are EI, CRA, and Employment Standards Compliant, WorkSafeBC Insured, CGL Insured, ICBC Commercial Fleet Insured, BC Passenger Transportation Licenced for passenger directed stops, National Safety Code and Transport Canada Certified.

THE COMPENSATION - $25 TO $35 PER HOUR

We gladly pay above-average wages. We’ll work with you to ensure you’re pleased with your salary. We’re of the opinion, whoever you choose to work with, you deserve the best. Most importantly, you deserve personal fulfillment. We understand meaningful recognition, clear company policies, career opportunities, and performance management are key drivers of employee engagement in our culture.

The Tour and Transportation Manager works ~40 hours per week in sync with other managers as we’re open 7 days of the week, 365 days of the year. We’re looking for a brilliant, highly accurate, positive-minded, self-disciplined person who possesses a can-do attitude to join our administration team in our central Kelowna office. Once mastered, the role can continue to be performed from the home office, our Kelowna airport office, or remotely.

THE RIGHT PERSON – THE RIGHT FIT

The RIGHT people are our most important asset. The RIGHT person has more to do with character traits and innate capabilities than with specific knowledge, background, or skills.

Simon Sinek says, “Great companies don’t hire skilled people and motivate them, they hire motivated people and inspire them.” Becoming a “Great Company” is one of our goals so we’re only interested in motivated people for this position.

Demonstrating unparalleled growth for over six years, we’re constantly evolving, introducing innovative experiences and services, creating fresh opportunities for employee-partners, scaling into new communities, generating economic development, growing our brand, all-the-while bringing our love, philanthropy, and community-mindedness into every Okanagan community we serve. Mamas for Mamas, Freedom’s Door, Dreams Take Flight, and Cops for Kids are just a few of our favorite charities.

12 PREFERRED QUALITIES OF OUR TOUR AND TRANSPORTATION MANAGER

1. You’re a non-smoker.

2. You have a valid driver’s license.

3. You’re an articulate communicator.

4. You’re accurate (precise, particular)

5. You’re a critical thinker.

6. You’re teachable, personable, flexible, and creative.

7. You’re a task-stacking, task-splitting aficionado.

8. You show initiative, think on your feet, and work efficiently under pressure.

9. You’re resilient. When, not if, “the stuff hits the fan”, your feisty, uncompromising, courageous, inner badass comes to life.

10. Your moral code requires building excellence for its own sake.

11. Your benchmarks are typically excellence or perfection – rarely “good enough” or mediocre.

12. You love to be a part of creating something great.

For this position, we’re hiring a personally engaging, customer service aficionado who understands the value of meaningful relationships across the board and is eager to learn the ins and outs of an international award-winning tour and transportation company. You’re looking for that rare culture that surrounds you with other like-minded, imaginative, talented, driven, dedicated, respectful and self-motivated people.

If you're ready for a fast-paced, think-on-your-feet, occasionally having-to-put-out-a-fire... kind of rewarding experience, then we’d like to chat with you! Having absolutely exemplary individuals supporting our 15,000+ annual customers, 26+ employee-partners, and 200+ vendors is paramount to us.

At Cheers! we function in a very collaborative environment firmly embracing teamwork paradigms such as...

· “None Of Us Is As Smart As All Of Us”

· “Innovation Is Simply Group Intelligence Having Fun”

· “Diversity: The Art Of Thinking Independently Together”

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

Experience in Logistics, Operations, Communications, Data Entry, Quoting, Dispatch, Event Planning, Tourism, Customer Service, and Sales is helpful.

Successfully running a home and raising responsible young adults is fantastic experience!

Experience may have been acquired while attempting a start-up business, or being a business owner, successful parent and homemaker, triage or trauma nurse, event planner, stage manager, air traffic controller and may include: Operations, Inventory Control, Purchasing, Inbound and Outbound Phone Transactions, General Office Management, Logistics & Team Coordination, Tour and Transportation Coordination including assigning drivers, vehicles and routes, quote preparation, follow up, and sales. Knowledge of the Okanagan’s communities and winery locations is a real plus.

You appreciate being: celebrated, heard, provided with feedback on your performance, given opportunities to learn new skills, given autonomy, and informed on the direction and strategy of the company.

ABOUT US

At Cheers! we are shamelessly obsessed with three simple ideas.

#1) To become the “most recognized” (legendary) tour and transportation brand in the Okanagan,

#2) To become the top-rated employer in the Okanagan, and

#3) To become the best-managed company in the Okanagan.

HOW TO APPLY?

Please send us 1) a personal value proposition* that details why you feel you're the ideal candidate, and 2) a results-oriented resume* that focuses on quantitative accomplishments, rather than vague tasks that are unaccompanied by credible statements.

Although conveying your pride, self-respect, self-esteem, honor, privilege, and dignity is somewhat of an art, nevertheless, we need a fascinating reason to consider hiring you. What sets you apart from the crowd?

* “A personal value proposition” = https://www.indeed.com/career-advice/finding-a-job/personal-value-proposition

* “A results-oriented resume” = https://www.indeed.com/career-advice/resumes-cover-letters/results-oriented-resume

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $25.00-$35.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • This job is in Kelowna, BC. How long is your commute for this job in Kelowna BC?

Language:

  • English Perfectly (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's Licence? (required)

title: Hub Implementation Specialist
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.


We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.


Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.


Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity:


There is an immediate opening for an Hub Implementation Specialist to be located at our Toronto office at 10 Dyas Rd. The successful candidate will be a result-oriented individual with industry knowledge and technology experience in Rogers for Bussiness(R4B), Access, and Core network deployments.


The Implementation Specialist supports the region’s deployment of network equipment for R4B, Core network and Access layer programs. This position will focus on supporting the R4B equipment and documentation. There will be travel required in the region to be onsite performing physical checks on equipment and supporting the implementation of new deployments. The specialist will also support the local access planners with database updates based on physical surveys and project documentation.


What you will be doing:

  • Implementation of R4B projects in the Toronto Region
  • Material orders and management
  • Installation and Testing of telecommunications equipment
  • Contractor management
  • NCT tickets and Hub site access
  • Work order management and circuit activation and cross connects
  • On site physical surveys and documentation of HFC platform equipment and connectivity
  • Accountable to oversee headend infrastructure augmentation (BDFB, Cable Infrastructure, etc)
  • Provide technical support and troubleshooting for the implementation of R4B, Access and Core network deployments (Transport, IP Core, Spine & Leaf, etc)
  • Collaborating with headend and wireless operational teams on project execution
  • Beware and adhere to all applicable health and safety regulations, in accordance with legislation and related company policy


What you will bring:

  • Practical Headend or data center experience
  • Knowledge of all HFC & telecommunications inside plant design and construction practices
  • Understanding of network transport technology and systems
  • 5 years of HFC and telecommunications or related network industry experience.
  • Post-secondary education in Electronics or Telecommunications or equivalent industry experience.
  • Autocad Spatialnet experience
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office and the associated software.
  • Familiar with standard computer hardware and interfaces.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Valid driver's license

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: No Selection
Work Location: 10 Dyas Road (234), North York, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Hardware
Requisition ID: 267694
At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https://digital.rogers.com/
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
Posting Notes: Digital & Technology

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Coordonner et exécuter toutes les activités de l'entrepôt, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter :
  • Contrôle des stocks et tenue du magasin.
  • emballage et préparation des commandes clients.
  • Expéditions locales et internationales.
  • Réception des marchandises, des fournisseurs et des clients.
  • Activités de décontamination.
  • Assister et participer aux réunions hebdomadaires et quotidiennes pour coordonner les activités.
  • Suivre les directives de l'entreprise et les processus de qualité. À traduire

___________________________________________________________________________________________________


Coordinate and execute all warehouse activities, which include and are not limited to,
  • Inventory control and Store keeping.
  • Picking, packing, and preparing customer orders.
  • Shipments both local and international.
  • Reception of goods, from suppliers and customers.
  • Decontamination activities.
  • Assist and engage in weekly and daily meetings to coordinate activities. Follow company guidelines and Quality processes
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Contrôle des stocks - tenue du magasin.
  • Responsable du contrôle des mouvements de stock dans l'inventaire ou à d'autres endroits, le cas échéant.
  • Vérifier périodiquement l'intégrité des produits en stock, par ex. emballage et étiquettes.
  • Coordonner l'inventaire périodique afin d'assurer l'exactitude du niveau de stock.

Expédition :
  • Coordonner les expéditions quotidiennes et communiquer avec les parties internes sur l'état des expéditions,
  • Remplir tous les papiers et formulaires administratifs nécessaires au transport de la marchandise,
  • Contactez les transporteurs spécifiques et organisez le ramassage.
  • Établir et s'engager à respecter un calendrier quotidien de ramassage et de livraison.
  • Élaborer et tenir à jour les directives d'emballage et de transport.
  • Coordonner les envois spéciaux qui nécessitent un suivi et une planification approfondis avec divers fournisseurs

Reception :
  • Réception quotidienne dans les délais et directives de réception de l'entreprise.
  • Réception selon le calendrier du planificateur, des fournitures, composants, instruments, outils, équipements et les retours clients.
  • Identifier et étiqueter les composants, instruments, outils et équipements reçus.
  • Décontamination.
  • Si nécessaire, effectuer la décontamination des produits en suivant les procédures établies et des lignes directrices.
  • Effectuer l'entretien de l'équipement selon les dates prévues.
Emballage • Nettoyer les composants, les instruments, les outils et l'équipement, le cas échéant.
  • Emballer les composants, les instruments, les outils et l'équipement selon les spécifications et la qualité des lignes directrices.
  • S'assurer de conserver un matériel d'emballage adéquat et suffisant pour répondre aux besoins.



__________________________________________________________________________________________________

Inventory Control – Store Keeping.
  • Responsible to control the movement of stock into inventory, or other locations as applicable.
  • Periodically check the integrity of inventory products, e.g. package, and labels.
  • Coordinate Periodic inventory count, to ensure accuracy of stock level.



Shipping.
  • Coordinate daily shipments and communicate with internal parties on the shipment status,
  • Complete all paperwork and administrative forms required to transport the goods,
  • Contact the specific carriers and organize pickup.
  • Establish and commit to daily pickup and delivery schedule.
  • Follow-up on daily shipments to ensure delivery to the final destination and communicate shipment progress to customer service and customers where and when needed.
  • Initiate, follow-up on complaints and disputes for damages or services not met by Transport Company per contracted services.
  • Develop and maintain packaging and transport directives.
  • Coordinate special shipments that require extensive follow-up and planning with various suppliers (handlers) e.g. Robot.

Receiving.
  • Daily receiving within company reception timeframe and guidelines.
  • Receiving per planner schedule, of supplies, components, instruments, tools, equipment, and customer returns.
  • Identify and label received components, instruments, tools, and equipment.

Decontamination.
  • Where required, perform decontamination of products following set procedures and
guidelines.
  • Perform equipment maintenance per scheduled dates.

Packaging:
  • Clean components, instruments, tools, and equipment where applicable.
  • Pack components, instruments, tools, and equipment according to specifications and quality Ensure to maintain adequate and sufficient packaging material to fulfill needs
Expected Areas of Competence
• Capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique au rythme rapide. Sens de l'urgence et capacité à gérer des situations stressantes.
  • Compétences efficaces en communication orale et écrite
  • Orienté vers la résolution de problème. Ose sortir des sentiers battus

  • Ability to work in a dynamic fast pace environment. Sense of urgency and ability to handle stressful situations.
  • Problem solver and able to think outside the box.
  • Effective oral and written communication skills.
Education/Experience Requirements
• FedEx Power Ship, facture commerciale, B13, exigences douanières et transfrontalières.
  • Connaissance des applications Microsoft Office, y compris Excel ;
  • Connaissance pratique du MRP et des systèmes d'information informatisés, expérience préférée dans ACCPAC, JDE, Sage X3.
____________________________________________________________________________________________________


FedEx Power Ship, Commercial invoice, B13, Customs, and Cross-border requirements (MUST).
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, including Excel; working knowledge of MRP and computer-based information systems, preferred experience in ACCPAC, JDE, Sage X3.
Travel Requirements
Non applicable
____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Not Applicable.

title: Mobility system analyst senior
description:
Req ID:239904

Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide


Purpose of the job:



The Green Mobility Innovation (GMI) business nursery executes programs for developing new business from acceleration to commercialization phase. On top GMI is supporting Regions & product lines with End-to-end analysis of Environmental aspects and TCO for complete mobility systems, typically comparing different solutions with TCO evaluation etc.

The Mobility System Analyst do execute studies and analysis for example for

  • TCO and Environmental impact of Alternative power supplies solutions (Electrification vs. Battery trains vs. Hydrogen or eFuels)
  • Market trends and competitor landscape re energy, emissions and circular economy

For this a Mobility System analyst is typically performing

  • Plan project work for the own and other contributors work (Deliverables, time, efforts)
  • Do desk research & data collection with Alstom Product lines and regions, authorities, planners, customers, consultants
  • Prepare and perform Mobility System calculations & simulations (eg. Total cost of owernship, Envorinmentatl impact, etc.)
  • Analyse and investigate data, synthesise scenario evaluation and benchmarks, perform TCO optimization
  • Prepare and lead studies by consultants
  • Prepare reports and presentations
  • Support pre-tender and tender projects with application specific analysis
  • Presenting and promoting to customers and other key market stakeholders.

MAIN RESPONSABILITIES

Prepare and execute Analyst tasks and projects, such as eg. (not limited to)

  • TCO Analysis and benchmark for different rail and road transport technologies and solutions, for passengers and freight
  • CAPEX/OPEX optimizing, for rolling stock and infrastructure
  • Environmental impact analysis (CO2, EcoFootprint,…)
  • Report and promote results to internal and external audiences
  • Contribute to competency development, with own internal and external network

Performance measurements:

  • High quality deliverables for business nursery projects (analysis, calculations, value proposition design, customer presentations marketing kits…)

Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?


Equal opportunity statement:
Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.


Job Type:Experienced


Job Segment: Systems Analyst, Technology, Research

title: Expéditeur-Réceptionneur / Shipper-Receiver
description:
À propos de TMI

Solutions Climatiques TMI Canada est le premier fabricant de systèmes CVC de l’industrie pour des applications telles que les sites industriels, les grandes installations médicales, les laboratoires pharmaceutiques et de recherche, les universités, les bâtiments gouvernementaux et les centres de données. L’usine à la fine pointe de la technologie de TMI de 165 000 pieds carrés à Pointe-Claire, au Québec, permet à TMI d’accroître sa capacité mondiale de fabrication et d’exportation. Notre usine renforce non seulement le leadership de TMI dans les systèmes HVAC sur mesure, mais elle prépare également le terrain pour améliorer l'offre de produits avec une plus grande variété d'unités de traitement d'air.

Résumé de la position

La personne sera responsable de la gestion de la vérification, de l'inspection, de l'acceptation, du comptage et de l'entrée de toutes les marchandises entrantes et de leur état dans le système ERP et du suivi des produits non conformes reçus. Ils chargeront, déchargeront, transporteront et stockeront également les marchandises à l'aide d'un chariot élévateur, d'un pont roulant, d'un transpalette ou d'un diable et coordonneront la manutention et la livraison de l'équipement aux clients internes à l'intérieur de l'usine.

Rôles et responsabilités

  • Organiser le travail de l'équipe (alimenter la chaîne de production) conformément au calendrier et aux priorités établis par le planificateur et les superviseurs
  • S'assurer que l'équipe dispose de toutes les informations nécessaires pour effectuer le travail et aider l’équipe à obtenir les informations manquantes
  • Planifier les travaux futurs et préparer les documents afin qu'ils soient prêts pour la réception, l'inspection et l'expédition
  • Traiter les réceptions dans le système ERP
  • Communiquer le manque de composants et/ou d'équipements à la chaîne d'approvisionnement, au directeur d'usine et aux superviseurs
  • Coordonner les livraisons avec le responsable logistique
  • Confirmer les dimensions et le poids des unités et des unités Knock-Down et imprimer les BOL
  • Préparer les documents de transport (bon de livraison, fiches signalétiques, demandes de P/O) et assurer le suivi lorsque requis
  • Coordonner l'expédition et le suivi de plainte client et du service après-vente
  • Attachez des élingues, des crochets ou d'autres dispositifs pour soulever et manipuler l'équipement et les matériaux
  • Regrouper, envelopper ou attacher le matériel pour l'expédition
  • Communiquer avec l’approvisionnement et la qualité toute livraison non conforme et achever le rapport de non-conformité (zone de quarantaine)
  • Maintenir et gérer les articles Kanban (cartes Kanban)
  • Maintenir les zones de stockage d'équipement pour assurer un inventaire précis
  • Participer aux dénombrements d'inventaire/matériel
  • Autres responsabilités assignées

Qualifications

Éducation: Diplôme d'étude secondaire ou DEP

Expérience: Trois (3) à cinq (5) ans d'expérience pertinente

Compétences informatiques: Suite Microsoft Office, ERP system

Certificats et licences: Licence chariot élévateur, licence manutention avec pont roulant

  • Bonnes compétences en communication écrite et orale
  • Sens aigu du temps, de l'organisation et de l'urgence
  • Capable de travailler de façon autonome et au sein d'une équipe
  • Effectuer un travail avec précision et minutie
  • Travailler à un rythme soutenu et de produire un travail de qualité
  • Trouver une solution ou à traiter de manière proactive les problèmes liés au travail
  • Polyvalent, autonome et responsable
  • Évaluer ses propres forces et faiblesses
  • Rechercher des opportunités de formation et de développement
  • Développer continuellement ses connaissances et ses compétences
  • Partager son expertise avec les autres
  • Communiquer efficacement avec les autres verbalement et par écrit - anglais et français

Employeur de l'égalité des chances

Solutions Climatiques TMI Canada est un employeur de l'égalité des chances. Nous sommes heureux de considérer tous les candidats qualifiés pour un emploi sans considération de race, religion, croyance, couleur, origine nationale, âge, sexe, orientation sexuelle, état matrimonial, statut d'ancien combattant ou handicap. Solutions Climatiques TMI Canada encourage et accueille les candidatures de personnes handicapées. Des locaux seront mis à disposition à la demande du candidat.

Seuls les candidats sélectionnés seront contactés pour une entrevue. Nous remercions tous de l'intérêt que vous portez à ce poste et à Solutions Climatiques TMI Canada.

___________________________________________________________________

Job Title: Shipper / Receiver

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent

Location: Pointe-Claire, Québec

About TMI

TMI Climate Solutions Canada is the industry’s leading HVAC manufacturer for applications including industrial sites, major medical facilities, pharmaceutical and research laboratories, universities, government buildings and data center. TMI’s 165,000-square-foot, state-of-the-art facility in Pointe-Claire, Quebec allows TMI to increase its global manufacturing and export capacity. Our facility not only reinforces TMI‘s leadership in custom-engineered HVAC systems, but it also sets the stage for enhancing the product offering with a wider variety of air handling units.

Job Summary

The individual will be responsible for managing the verification, inspection, acceptance, counting and entry of all incoming goods and their condition into the ERP system and to follow-up on non-compliant products received. They will also load, unload, transport and store goods using a forklift, overhead crane, pallet jack truck or hand truck and coordinate the handling and delivery of equipment to internal customers inside the plant.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Organize the team’s work (supply the production line) in accordance with the schedule and priorities established by the Planner and Supervisors
  • Ensure the team has all the information needed to do their work and assist them in getting missing information
  • Plan future work and prepare documents so that they are ready for receiving, inspection and shipping
  • Process receiving in ERP system
  • Communicate lack of components and/or equipment to Supply Chain, Plant Manager and Supervisors
  • Coordinate deliveries with Logistics
  • Confirm dimensions and weight of units and Knock-Down units and print BOLs
  • Prepare transport documents (packing slip, MSDS, P/O requests) and provide tracking when required
  • Coordinate shipping and tracking of customer complaints and after-sales service
  • Attach slings, hooks, or other devices to lift and handle equipment and materials
  • Bundle, wrap or band material for shipment
  • Communicate all non-compliant deliveries to Supply Chain and Quality and complete non-compliance report (quarantine area)
  • Maintain and manage Kanban items (Kanban cards)
  • Maintain equipment storage areas to ensure accurate inventory
  • Participate to inventory/material counts
  • Other responsibilities as assigned

Qualifications

Education: High School Diploma or DEP

Experience: Three (3) to five (5) years of relevant experience

Computer Skills: Microsoft Office Suite, ERP system

Certificates & Licenses: Forklift and overhead crane license

  • Strong sense of time, organization, and urgency
  • Able to work independently and within a team
  • Perform work with precision and thoroughness
  • Work at a steady pace and produce quality work
  • Find a solution or proactively deal with work-related issues
  • Versatile, autonomous, and responsible
  • Assess one’s own strengths and weaknesses
  • Look for training and development opportunities
  • Continuously develop knowledge and skills
  • Share expertise with others
  • Ability to communicate effectively with others verbally and in writing - English and French

Equal Opportunity Employer

TMI Climate Solutions Canada is an equal opportunity employer. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or disability. TMI Climate Solutions Canada encourages and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations will be made available upon candidate request.

Only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview. We thank all for your interest in this position and with TMI Climate Solutions Canada.

Work remotely

  • Non

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vie
  • Assurance Vision
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Programme d'Aide aux Employés
  • REER Collectif
  • Stationnement sur place

Horaire :

  • 8 Heures
  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Quart de jour

Formation:

  • École Secondaire (Souhaité)

title: Responsable performance livraison fournisseur
description:
Ouvrant la voie de la transition énergétique, Alstom développe et commercialise des solutions de mobilité qui constituent des fondations durables pour l’avenir du transport. Son portefeuille de produits comprend notamment des trains à grande vitesse, des métros, le monorail, des tramways et des bus électriques ainsi que des systèmes intégrés, des services sur mesure, de l’infrastructure, des solutions de signalisation et des solutions de mobilité numériques. Alstom compte 150 000 véhicules en service commercial à travers le monde. Avec l’intégration de Bombardier Transport le 29 janvier 2021, le chiffre d’affaires proforma combiné du Groupe élargi atteint 14 milliards d’euros pour la période de 12 mois close le 31 mars 2021. Basé en France, Alstom est désormais présent dans 70 pays et emploie 70 000 personnes dans le monde. Son siège social de la région des Amériques est à St-Bruno au Québec. Au Canada, Alstom compte plus de 4 300 employés, dont 1 800 au Québec. www.alstom.com

MISSION :

  • Assurer la capacité du fournisseur à répondre aux besoins d'Alstom.
  • Animer les performances de livraison des fournisseurs et la gestion des risques.
  • Effectuer les audits de capacité et de capacité SC pour les fournisseurs.

RESPONSABILITÉS :

  • Animer les performances de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Contribuer à l'évaluation et à la gestion des risques de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Gérer la crise de livraison (Site seul et multi-Sites)
  • Évaluer la capacité des fournisseurs ad hoc
  • Évaluer la capacité de la chaîne d'approvisionnement des fournisseurs ad hoc
  • Plan d'amélioration de la performance de livraison du fournisseur principal
  • Assurer le développement des compétences du Material Planner SDPM (formation/coaching)

Mode prédictif (nouveau contrat ou contrat à venir)

  • Conduire les Light Supply Chain Audit (LSCA) et Capacity Assessment (CA) si nécessaire
  • Conduire un audit complet de la chaîne d'approvisionnement (FSCA) si nécessaire
  • Contribuer aux évaluations des risques de livraison des fournisseurs et suivre le plan d'atténuation lorsqu'il est impliqué

Mode d'exécution : avec l'équipe de planification du matériel

  • Animer les performances de livraison avec les principales parties prenantes
  • Effectuer une analyse des causes profondes des fournisseurs ciblés pour comprendre la non-performance
  • Si nécessaire, conduire des évaluations de la capacité et/ou de la capacité de la chaîne d'approvisionnement
  • Mettre en œuvre et suivre les actions de récupération le cas échéant
  • Définir et suivre le plan d'action pour améliorer les performances de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Assurer le rapport et la mise à jour du plan d'action pour les meilleurs fournisseurs
  • Collaborer avec les autres SDPM en cas d'impact multi-sites
  • Coordonner les activités et impliquer les principales parties prenantes en cas de problème majeur de livraison
  • Former et coacher les Material Planners sur différents sujets SDPM
  • Participer à l'élaboration de la feuille de route APSYS et au déploiement des normes
  • Respecter la politique EHS d'Alstom
  • Participer à l'amélioration EHS et à l'atteinte des objectifs
  • Respecter les codes d'éthique et de conformité d'Alstom

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

  • Diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires ou en ingénierie ou en chaîne d'approvisionnement.
  • Certification Supply Chain ou Lean Management. (Souhaitable)
  • Expérience sur des projets de Lean Management, production, industrialisation.
  • Connaissance de la réalisation d'audits (Souhaitable)
  • Expérience en chaîne d'approvisionnement, en gestion de projet et en qualité (souhaitable)
  • Planification des besoins en matériaux
  • Gestion des performances de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Techniques de gestion des stocks et de planification du matériel
  • Systèmes d'information de la chaîne d'approvisionnement
  • Ordonnancement industriel
  • Transport & Distribution
  • Gestion d'équipe
  • Anglais et Français fonctionnel
  • Entrepreneuriat
  • Agilité
  • Collaboration
  • Vision globale

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.


An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.


Alstom is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.


Effective 29 January 2021, Alstom completed the acquisition of Bombardier Transportation. This is a Bombardier Transportation Legal Entity Position - positions at Bombardier Transportation companies are all members of the Alstom Group.



Job Segment: Supply, Supply Chain, Operations

title: Material Management Coordinator
description:
ABOUT ENERCON

Established in Germany over 35 years ago, ENERCON is an international leader in wind turbine design and manufacturing. Known worldwide for its gearless generator technologies, high quality standards, and comprehensive long-term service agreements, the company has become synonymous with reliability and performance. ENERCON's product line ranges from 800 kW to 5.5 MW. To date, the company has installed more than 31,300* turbines worldwide representing more than 56.9 GW of installed capacity.

A major player in the Canadian market since its entry in 2001, ENERCON has its North American headquarters in Montreal, Quebec, multiple service stations from coast-to-coast and an accredited training and warehouse facility in Boucherville, Quebec. ENERCON has currently over 2 400 MW of installed capacity throughout eight provinces and territories in Canada.*

ENERCON is currently looking for a Material Coordinator to work in Jenner, Alberta. This is a temporary position for 7 months. The candidate will support in the tasks of the Supervisor of installation work by:

  • Support the Supervisor with on-site activities;
  • Providing customer service and advising clients and contractors;
  • Participating in various meetings regarding the tools and materials to order
  • Doing follow-ups, ordering the required materials and organizing transportation
  • Managing inventories levels and accuracy, material orders and receptions, coordinate transports, tool handovers, back shipping, etc.
  • Creating work documents to facilitate tools and material management
  • Participate in continuous improvement of material management process and procedure.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2-4 years of experience in material handling, material organization, rigger course or any relevant experience in similar role
  • Experience with forklift and telescopic handler
  • Basic health and safety knowledge
  • Lifting equipment and PPE inspection
  • Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel;
  • Knowledge of the SAP or other ERP similar software is an asset
  • Professional proficiency in English
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment and under pressure

Key words: Production Planner, Logistics Clerk, Supply Technician, and Supply Specialist.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

title: B100 Operations Manager - Adsorptions
description:
Reference No. R2641795

Position Title: B100 Operations Manager - Adsorptions

Department: B100 Adsorptions

Location: Sanofi Pasteur Limited, Toronto

Sanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine company

Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.

Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.

Position Summary:

The B100 operations manager is responsible for the relevant manufacturing operations in compliance with cGMP according to their specific production area (upstream, downstream, Adsorption, MWS, etc). The manager is responsible for the daily activities of unionized staff in a cGMP facility in compliance with company policies. This includes responsibility for the scheduling and execution of all operations with adequate level of GMP documentation. This includes support for B100 project activities and adherence to SOPs, cGMP and HSE procedures.

The incumbent is responsible for sterile filtration and adsorption of cP products and Diphtheria/Tetanus in compliance with cGMP, and is accountable for the administration and supervision of the Adsorption Department in B100.

This incumbent will also be responsible to manage procurement, replenishment, and transport of all required raw materials to B100 operations teams as required. This will include pre-assembled connections, single-use technologies, vessels, outsourced large scale buffer supply and other raw materials such as glycerol, filters, powder raw materials and miscellaneous production related materials.

Key Responsibilities:

Support Adsorption area (Sterile filtration and Adsorption of cP, Dip/Tet) through all stages of projects

  • Support the design, startup, and troubleshooting of B100 process and equipment operations through all stages of project (URS, IQ/OQ, Engineering and Consistency runs, full operations).

  • Review and approve technical and quality related documentation.

  • Provide troubleshooting and problem-solving guidance for daily project and manufacturing issues, and implement preventative/corrective actions.

  • Develop and execute production schedules from project through full scale manufacturing, ensure that project support and production activities are executed as per defined schedules.

  • Lead operations team execution on the shop floor for equipment, processes, and facilities. Monitor and communicate team and project performance with respect to deliverables using visible metrics.

  • Support development of operating budget and staffing for operations and project related activities.

  • Develop communication approach for operations topics to ensure project milestones are met (escalation, cascading).

  • In collaboration with QOOQ and QOSA, ensure compliance with GMP requirements, develop quality continuous improvement initiatives, develop staff quality culture, and GMP knowledge.

  • Ensure that all Operating Procedures, training plans, and manufacturing documentation are current, developed in adherence to global and site policies, and completed in a timely manner.

  • Through appropriate shop floor oversight, ensure that facilities & equipment are compliant, and that process deviations and environmental incidences are addressed in a compliant manner.

  • Support internal and external regulatory audits/inspections and coordinate appropriate responses.

  • Organize and develop staff to ensure a high performing team. Provide individual feedback on staff objectives and development, coaching each team member on personal development milestones.

  • Contribute to the B100 Operations management team, communicate and co-operate with other departments to obtain consensus and achieve project and operational goals.

  • Hire and on-board new employees, apply company’s discipline procedures when applicable, manage team attendance and performance against established criteria.

  • Implement lean management systems and continuous improvement of processes established for Bulk.

  • Identify and lead initiatives to increase process efficiency, quality and/or yield. Implement solutions or changes via change control, plan and manage facility and organization improvements.

  • Provides metrics and other reports as requested, including the scheduling of PM plans, spare parts, BOMS.

  • Ensure that employees work within the policies, procedures and regulations including responding promptly to all health and safety concerns or incidents; critical incidents and accidents are reported to the appropriate authorities; potential safety and health hazards are identified and known by staff and that protective equipment and clothing are required and are used; continuous EHS awareness and improvement by integrating team with site and Bulk initiatives.

  • Cooperation with and assistance to the EHS management and Joint Health and Safety Committee in carrying out their functions.

Lead B100 Logistics and Materials Management strategy to support B100

  • liase with planner, B91 warehouse operations, B92 Final Formulations, B100 Operations (MWS, cP Upsteam, cP Downstream, D&T, Adsorption), Powder Dispensing Departments and external suppliers to meet delivery and supply requirements for B100.

  • Lead logistics and materials management readiness for B100 Operations. Interface and coordinate M-Tech, Local and Global Procurement and suppliers to develop strategies and solutions for large scale buffer supply, dispensing operations, cold storage and warehousing.

  • Develop site and B100 interface and materials management and logistics plan.

  • Accountable for developing and implementing materials organization to support B100 operations through project phase into facility start-up and ramp-up.

  • Develop and implement logistics and materials management and storage strategy for B100 operations including but not limited to raw materials, consumables, SUT, dispensed and kitted materials, testing, sampling, and equipment.

  • Develop dashboards to communicate key performance and quality metrics to ensure operational readiness.

  • Lead the building of SAP material masters, recipes, BOMs and LIM sampling plans for B100 semi-finished goods for different phases of the project.

  • Interface with IMS, Master Data, Planning and Finance to develop strategy and structure for recipes, cost centers, work centers and storage locations.

  • Interface with iShift team to ensure compatibility.

Key Requirements:

  • Minimum Honors BSc in Microbiology/Biochemistry/Chemical Engineering or Related Science and additional business and management training.

  • Minimum 5 years of experience in pharmaceutical and GMP area.

  • Must be able to lead through example and possess managerial skills for handling a group of individuals (building/leading/training a team).

  • Good knowledge of cGMP in pharmaceuticals/biological is essential.

  • Understanding of key activities including sterile manufacturing and aseptic techniques.

  • Experience in validation, aseptic processing, sterilization & disinfection, sterile broth fills & formulations.

  • Good problem solving skills and documentation skills, clear written and oral communication.

  • Ability to lead a group handling high value products.

  • Knowledge of Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.

Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request.

Thank you in advance for your interest.

Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Sanofi, Empowering Life

#GD-SP #LI-SP

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

title: Equipment Engineering Specialist
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.


We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.


Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.


Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity:


There is an immediate opening for a Equipment Engineering Access Planner in our Hub Implementation team located at our Richmond Hill office supporting the SYD region. The successful candidate will be a results-oriented individual with industry knowledge and technology experience. The Planner will be accountable to develop design plans and platform capacity management based on engineering guidelines for access layer.


The Equipment Engineering Specialist works very closely with the regional planning, construction, and operations teams to ensure that all required site level details are provided for the successful completion of projects. This position will focus mainly on Headend Node designs for RPHY and XGSPON Deployments.


In addition, the role will be accountable for Access Layer Platform (DOCSIS, ROD/SDV/QPSK) deployments in the region.


The Planner responsibilities includes:

  • The preparation and issue of DDP’s Detail Design Packages and BD Build Documents
  • Creating site specific rack elevations, detailed wiring diagrams, and cable run lists
  • Preparation and submission of detailed equipment lists (MOR, MRF)
  • Verify Space, Power, and Cooling
  • Vet all documentation and test plans
  • Tracking projects to ensure deliverables are on schedule and on budget
  • Providing project updates in various workflow tools and weekly Project management meetings as required
  • Documentation of all additions or changes to the Network including Spatialnet and data files
  • Receive, Verify and update project as-built’s
  • Capacity Planning, Identification and design
  • Visiting Head End sites and completing site surveys for equipment installation
  • Generating purchase orders for contractors
  • Accountability for quality control of all network inventory tools supporting access layer plans
  • Remain current with the latest company and industry technologies, policies and standards.


Qualifications:

  • Practical Head End or Data Center experience
  • Knowledge of all HFC platforms and inside plant design and construction practices.
  • Understanding of all analog, digital and other network transport technology and systems.
  • Five years of CATV or related network industry experience.
  • Post-secondary education in Electronics or Telecommunications or equivalent industry experience.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office and the associated software.
  • Working level ability with Autocad (Spatialnet)
  • Familiar with standard computer hardware and interfaces.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Valid driver’s license.


Core Competencies:

  • Adaptable to change
  • Strong organizational and communication skills to understand and to be understood, have an eye for detail, and be able to put ideas into a tangible form
  • Ability to work independently within a dynamic team and organize time among multiple tasks.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage work to project timelines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to learn new technologies, applications and solutions

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 244 Newkirk Road (WFH), Richmond Hill, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 25%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 266724
At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https://digital.rogers.com/
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment

title: Shipper and Receiver
description:
Join our team! We are looking for a strong, organized person who is detail oriented.

You will be responsible for shipping, receiving, inspecting and packaging a variety of products according to detailed instructions.

This is a full time position in our Oakville facility. Our assembly area is clean, bright, and spacious with high ceilings.

Hours are Monday to Friday 8am – 4:30pm with possible overtime.

Benefits:

We offer a very generous benefit package consisting of: 100% company paid comprehensive benefits (Health/Dental/Insurance), a matching RRSP program, a pension plan and complimentary access to a licensed financial planner.

Perks: Get your birthday off with pay. A spacious working environment with great Company culture, summer BBQs and other exciting employee events during the year.

Essential Functions (other duties may be assigned):

  • Prepare necessary documents to ship finished goods.
  • Pack and prepare goods for shipping using appropriate packing and shipping materials. This includes adding tagging, small parts (keys, couplings, etc).
  • Perform product inspections at receiving and prior to shipping.
  • Schedule pick up with transport companies. Load and unload delivery trucks.
  • Maintain shipping records. Close out shipped orders on computer system.
  • Receive goods on computer system and close out shipped orders on computer system.
  • Drive forklift or use pallet jacket to move bulk product to the proper destination point.
  • Ensure housekeeping and organization (5S) of the shipping area.
  • Perform product inspections at receiving and prior to shipping
  • Ensure any parts received without part numbers are tagged with appropriate number.
  • Create labels for any new, special or not previously stocked items.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Three (3) years of warehouse, receiving or shipping experience.
  • Competent computer skills (Microsoft Office)
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs

About Us:

SM Cyclo of Canada, Ltd. is also known globally as Sumitomo Drive Technologies. We offer superior products, and it is our team members that cement our customer relationships by delivering superior service and performance to meet or exceed customers' expectations. We expect our team members to give their best every day, and in return we strive to deliver the same superior service, performance, and rewards to our employees.

Other Accommodations:

Upon request, Sumitomo Drive Technologies will provide reasonable accommodation to persons with disabilities throughout the hiring and employment process. It is the policy of Sumitomo Drive Technologies to recruit the most qualified individual for every opportunity in an efficient, professional and nondiscriminatory manner. Sumitomo focuses on recruiting, employing, and advancing members in diverse groups in an ever-changing market.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Warehouse employees wear masks. Regular cleaning. Social distancing encouraged. Start times staggered.

Experience:

  • Receiving: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Environmental Planner - Transportation Infrastructure
description:
Minimum Clearance Required to Start:

Not Applicable/None

Job Description:

Environmental Planner – Transportation Infrastructure – Toronto, Ontario

Opportunity : Parsons is hiring an Environmental Planner to support Transportation Infrastructure projects in the Toronto Metropolitan Area.

The Environmental Planner’s key responsibilities include:

  • Work with other Environmental Planners on Environmental Assessment (EA) projects (MTO, Municipal and Transit projects)
  • Utilize basic foundation of established experience in the field for various planning initiatives in the Toronto Metro region
  • Be involved in a range of infrastructure projects tasks including research, report writing, and supporting consultation programs
  • Work with staff at other Parsons offices and with project sub-consultants
  • Coordinate with internal and external technical service areas, discipline leads and technical staff, on technical studies and preparation of environmental assessment documentation
  • Coordinate, support and be involved with public consultation and stakeholder engagement, including consultation with Indigenous Communities
  • Assist environmental field staff in completing environmental inventories, as required

Skills & Qualifications :

  • Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma in environmental planning, biology, natural sciences, planning or another related discipline
  • 5+ experience working as an Environmental Planner, preferably in the Ontario province
  • Exceptional organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to work in as a part of a multidisciplinary project team and independently
  • Experience in Environmental Assessments including MTO Class EA, Municipal Class EA, Transit Project Assessment Process, Canadian Environmental Assessment Act
  • Familiar with environmental permitting and approvals process
  • Experience in the Ontario market with a focus on infrastructure projects (local/regional municipalities, MTO, Metrolinx, TTC)
  • Experience with regulatory agencies and key stakeholders (NDMNRF, MECP, Conservation Authorities, Transport Canada, Parks Canada, Fisheries and Oceans Canada)
  • Experience with Indigenous Community consultation/engagement an asset
  • Exceptional writing and presentation skills
  • Eligibility for a Registered Professional Planner (RPP), and/or Canadian Institute of Planners (MCIP) professional designation
  • Knowledge of local, provincial and federal environmental policies, legislation and applicable law
  • Ability to travel (locally) to multiple sites
  • Thorough knowledge of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint, experience with GIS software an asset

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.

title: Planificateur(trice) sénior(e) / Senior Planner
description:
***English version will follow***

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

Le groupe de services Contrôles de projets de SNC-Lavalin inc. est à la recherche d'un planificateur sénior pour travailler sur le projet du REM

Le projet :

Le Réseau express métropolitain (REM) représente la plus grande infrastructure intégrée en transport public depuis le métro de Montréal, inauguré en 1966 et aura un tracé équivalent au quatrième plus grand réseau de transport automatisé au monde ! Ajouté aux systèmes de transport public existants (métro, trains et autobus), il ouvre une nouvelle ère de développement pour le transport collectif dans la région métropolitaine. Ce nouveau réseau, entièrement électrique, proposera une solution de transport efficace et accessible pouvant contribuer à la diminution de près de 680 000 tonnes de GES sur 25 ans et donc à une économie sobre en carbone. Il pourrait également permettre de réduire les pertes économiques liées à la congestion routière, qui sont estimées à 1,9 milliard de dollars annuellement dans la région métropolitaine. (Source : CDPQ Infra)

Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

  • Travailler avec des équipes multidisciplinaires sur divers stades des projets : conception, approvisionnement, construction sur un contrat du type P3 ;

  • Interagir avec les différents partenaires, les clients internes/ externes et les sous-traitants pour développer des échéanciers, documenter les impacts sur les projets et élaborer des mitigations potentielles aux problématiques rencontrées ;

  • Analyser et/ou participer à l’établissement de la documentation décrivant les changements d’envergure, pour en faire une analyse d’impact détaillée ;

  • Superviser l ’implantation et la mise à jour de la planification du projet sur une base régulière.

  • Agir à titre d’interface auprès de l’équipe de planificateur du côté du client

  • Préparer et émettre des rapports relatifs à la planification et les fichiers du MFL sur une base mensuelle.

Que recherchons-nous ?

  • 7-10 années d'expérience en planification principalement pour la phase ingénierie des projets de développement d’infrastructure ;

  • Connaissance approfondie de Primavera, et experience avec le logiciel Time-Location est un atout

  • Compréhension pratique de la gestion du changement et des tendances de planification

  • De l'expérience en : mesure de rendement (CPI, SPI), gestion des changements, analyse de retard

  • Expérience de l'analyse logique, de la structure de découpage du travail, des ressources, de la courbe S

  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles afin de travailler efficacement avec les équipes multidisciplinaires, la direction, les sous-traitants et le client ;

  • La maîtrise du français et de l'anglais (parlé et écrit) est essentielle.

  • Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps.

  • Leadership

Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin

Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, régime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).

Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

**************************************************************

Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d’alléger le texte.

Chez SNC-Lavalin, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiés. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences.

SNC-Lavalin se préoccupe de votre confidentialité. SNC-Lavalin et les autres filiales ou entreprises affiliées de SNC-Lavalin (communément désignées « SNC-Lavalin ») sont déterminées à protéger votre confidentialité. Veuillez consulter notre Avis de confidentialité sur notre site Carrières pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous recueillons, utilisons et transférons vos données personnelles.

En fournissant vos renseignements personnels à SNC-Lavalin, vous confirmez que vous avez lu notre Avis de confidentialité et que vous l’acceptez.

Fondée en 1911, SNC-Lavalin est une entreprise spécialisée en gestion de projet offrant des services professionnels entièrement intégrés, exploitant des bureaux dans le monde entier et dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, technologie et données afin de concevoir, de réaliser et d’exploiter les projets les plus complexes. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif – consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de la construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. – et nous les offrons aux clients dans des secteurs stratégiques tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital. D’autres nouvelles et renseignements sont accessibles sur le site snclavalin.com ou suivez-nous sur LinkedIn et Twitter.

______________________________________________________________________________

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin Inc.'s Project Controls services group is looking for a senior planner to work on the REM project

The project:

The Réseau express métropolitain (REM) represents the largest integrated public transportation infrastructure since the Montreal metro, inaugurated in 1966, and will have a route equivalent to the fourth largest automated transportation network in the world! Added to the existing public transportation systems (metro, trains and buses), it opens a new era of development for public transportation in the metropolitan region. This new all-electric network will offer an efficient and accessible transportation solution that could contribute to the reduction of nearly 680,000 tons of GHGs over 25 years and thus to a low-carbon economy. It could also reduce economic losses related to road congestion, which are estimated at $1.9 billion annually in the metropolitan region. (Source: CDPQ Infra)

How will you contribute to the team?

  • Work with multidisciplinary teams at various project stages: design, procurement, construction on a P3 contract.

  • Interact with the various partners, internal / external clients and subcontractors to develop deadlines, document impacts on projects and develop potential mitigations to the problems encountered.

  • Analyze and / or assist in the preparation of documentation describing major changes for a detailed impact analysis.

  • Supervise the implementation and updating of the project schedule on regular basis

  • Interface with the client planning team representative

  • Prepare and issue planning reports and MFL file monthly

What will you contribute?

  • 7-10 years of planning experience primarily for the engineering phase of infrastructure development projects;

  • In-depth knowledge of Primavera, and experience with Time-Location software is an asset

  • Practical understanding of change management and planning trends

  • Experience in: Performance Measurement (CPI, SPI), Change Management, Delay Analysis

  • Experience in logical analysis, work breakdown structure, resources, S curve

  • Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with multidisciplinary teams, management, subcontractors and the client;

  • Fluency in French and English (spoken and written) is essential.

  • Excellent time management skills.

  • Leadership

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin?

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

-

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available at snclavalin.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
