title: newProject Manager, Facilities Communications Infrastructure
description:
Why Fraser Health?:
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

As a Project Manager, Facilities Communications Infrastructure you will use your creativity to tackle technical complexities and coordinate with various partners. You will be responsible to assist in negotiation of new third party Telecom access agreements, manage existing agreements, coordination, implementation and support of Macro cellular antenna systems, Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS) and other approved FHA facilities project implementations on matters relating to telecommunications infrastructure equipment installation and modification at Fraser Health (FH).

Your diverse background in project management, interior design or architecture will prepare you to use your creative skills in the planning, coordination and development of design and construction project.
We are a diverse team composed of dedicated professionals who thrive in a collaborative culture. We support learning, customer service, communication and success.

Build on your education and career experience as you:
  • Manage carrier compliance with unique Master Agreement conditions pertaining to Telus, Rogers and Freedom Mobile (in-building and macro), engaging the carriers and stakeholder FHA depts for input, assistance and approval as required and appropriate per FHA corporate policy.
  • Receive, review, process, coordinate and communicate to FHA stakeholders as required for the approval of applications to install or modify telecommunications equipment on FHA properties and buildings from third party telecommunications companies.
  • Assist with negotiating License Agreement(s) and/or Agreement Schedule addition(s) for third party telecommunications equipment installations or modifications.
  • Liaise with the telecommunications applicant and FHA departments to assist applicants in development of efficient engineering designs, drawings and a construction schedule for FHA approval.
  • Regarding FHA capital projects establish a project budget, team structure and provide leadership to project teams on facilities projects by directing the work of the contractors, consultants and designated capital projects or FMO staff, and supervising the work of assigned capital projects or FMO staff ensuring the completion of the work to the required standards.
  • Liaises with IMIT, FMO, capital projects teams, vendors and Telecom carriers on matters pertaining to High Band (Cellular) and Low Band (UHF), Microwave or fibre transport backhaul components of telecommunications systems.
  • Liaises with IMIT, FMO, capital projects teams, vendors and mobile communications providers on matters pertaining to internal and external Facilities Maintenance communications networks, portable / mobile communications devices and supporting network wiring and devices.
We would like you to have:
  • Diploma in Telecommunications, Civil or Electronic Engineering, or Electrical Trades Qualification Certificate supplemented by appropriate formal training in telecom carrier License Agreement negotiation, project management of telecommunications projects and BICSI training or equivalent in structured cabling, grounding, bonding and outside plant.
  • Seven (7) to nine (9) years' recent, related experience in managing, leading and directing telecommunications projects within a large, complex organization, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • An equivalent combination of education, training and experience is acceptable
We are looking for a hardworking individual who has the ability to develop project budgets, construction estimates and has experience in space planning and construction management.

This is a Regular Full Time opportunity located in New Westminster, BC and will allow you to make a difference in the communities we live and serve. Travel to other FH sites through the communities we serve may be required for this role.

Effective October 26, 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

Valued benefits
Do you have a passion for leading projects? If so, take the next step and apply, so we can continue the conversation about you joining Fraser Health. We value diversity in the workforce and strive to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.
A career with Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to be a part of a dedicated team of professionals in a dynamic and rewarding health care environment. We offer a competitive compensation and benefit package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage

Detailed Overview:
Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:
Responsible to assist in negotiation of new third party Telecom access agreements, manage existing agreements, coordination, implementation and support of Macro cellular antenna systems, Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS) and other approved FHA facilities project implementations on matters relating to telecommunications infrastructure equipment installation and modification at Fraser Health (FH). Regional coordination of internal and external communications systems including VHF radio, Facilities Maintenance wireless mobile communication systems and devices, and Facilities systems IMIT cabling standards and installers. Duties further include; project and construction management, project scheduling and construction budgeting, dispute resolution, contractor cost overrun resolution, liaison with IM/IT staff on matters related to Distributed Antenna Systems, directing third party telecom carriers, contractors and consultants, and supervision of assigned capital projects and Facilities Maintenance & Operations (FMO) staff.
Responsibilities:
  • Manage carrier compliance with unique Master Agreement conditions pertaining to Telus, Rogers and Freedom Mobile (in-building and macro), engaging the carriers and stakeholder FHA depts for input, assistance and approval as required and appropriate per FHA corporate policy.
  • Receive, review, process, coordinate and communicate to FHA stakeholders as required for the approval of applications to install or modify telecommunications equipment on FHA properties and buildings from third party telecommunications companies.
  • Assist with negotiating License Agreement(s) and/or Agreement Schedule addition(s) for third party telecommunications equipment installations or modifications.
  • Liaise with the telecommunications applicant and FHA departments to assist applicants in development of efficient engineering designs, drawings and a construction schedule for FHA approval.
  • Regarding FHA capital projects establish a project budget, team structure and provide leadership to project teams on facilities projects by directing the work of the contractors, consultants and designated capital projects or FMO staff, and supervising the work of assigned capital projects or FMO staff ensuring the completion of the work to the required standards.
  • Liaises with IMIT, FMO, capital projects teams, vendors and Telecom carriers on matters pertaining to High Band (Cellular) and Low Band (UHF), Microwave or fibre transport backhaul components of telecommunications systems.
  • Liaises with IMIT, FMO, capital projects teams, vendors and mobile communications providers on matters pertaining to internal and external Facilities Maintenance communications networks, portable / mobile communications devices and supporting network wiring and devices.
  • Develop and manage the project plan(s) in conjunction with Project Managers, Facilities Planners and Managers, and FMO for the onsite construction projects ensuring successful and coordinated completion of the facilities construction project. Conducts regular construction site inspections to ensure construction and equipment installations comply with approved design drawings and maintenance requirements.
  • Review engineering drawings and specifications produced by external project consultants, Carriers, systems and device vendors ensuring the efficient and effective use of space and power and proper integration of systems and processes with existing systems and processes. Reviews project design and scope making recommendations as required.
  • Manages Carrier and vendor access to all FHA sites and supervises installations, modifications and maintenance of all equipment in compliance with telecommunication carrier Master Agreement & Access Protocol and vendor service agreements.
  • Takes leadership to resolve schedule, construction and operational issues (interference) with or between Carriers and vendors in compliance with regulatory agencies.
  • Maintains current knowledge of all regulatory requirements and commonly accepted standards including WorkSafe BC, fire, building, electrical and plumbing and all local by-laws and other related regulations.
  • Seeks Authorization for and coordinates systems shutdowns affecting the campus operations.
  • Liaises with project stakeholders and sponsors to communicate the project status and work activities affecting the campus operations.
  • Provides guidance in resolving construction-related issues pertaining to telecommunications, in collaboration with stakeholders and staff; assists with the resolution of disputes with construction contracts/consultants.
  • Provides assistance to FHA during the design development stage, focusing on telecommunications construction implementation issues and value management; assists the Facilities Planners and the Facilities Maintenance & Operations Managers in planning and implementing designated projects.
  • Represents FH on matters relating to the construction and commissioning phases of the project including equipment installation; works in partnership with stakeholders and staff to develop project management and construction standards and procedures.
  • Provides quality control in collaboration with advisors to ensure that the project meets FHA requirements as set out in the contract.
Qualifications:
Education and Experience

Diploma in Telecommunications, Civil or Electronic Engineering, or Electrical Trades Qualification Certificate supplemented by appropriate formal training in telecom carrier License Agreement negotiation, project management of telecommunications projects and BICSI training or equivalent in structured cabling, grounding, bonding and outside plant.
Seven (7) to nine (9) years' recent, related experience in managing, leading and directing telecommunications projects within a large, complex organization, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

Demonstrates the LEADS capabilities of Leads Self, Engages Others, Achieves Results, Develops Coalitions and supports Systems Transformation.
Professional/Technical Capabilities:
  • Experience working for or with Wireless & Wired Telecommunications companies.
  • Demonstrated experience in developing, implementing, renewing wireless and wired telecommunications equipment License Agreements.
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate complex telecommunication projects through organizational approvals.
  • Ability to develop an agreed implementation schedule.
  • Working knowledge of Access & Operational protocols.
  • Possesses strong knowledge of typical structural design requirements, electrical requirements, radio frequency testing, construction and maintenance of DAS and Cellular telecommunications sites.
  • Demonstrated experience working with Municipal, Provincial and Federal legislation, regulations, codes and by-laws, WSBC requirements pertaining to cellular telecommunications designs and installations.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret blueprints and drawings.
  • Ability to operate related equipment including relevant software applications.
  • Experience working in and/or leading a cross function-al team of design professionals
  • Ability to work in all physical areas of the FHA properties

Conducts regular construction site inspections to ensure construction and equipment installations comply with approved design drawings and maintenance requirements.', 'Demonstrated experience in developing, implementing, renewing wireless and wired telecommunications equipment License Agreements.', 'Regarding FHA capital projects establish a project budget, team structure and provide leadership to project teams on facilities projects by directing the work of the contractors, consultants and designated capital projects or FMO staff, and supervising the work of assigned capital projects or FMO staff ensuring the completion of the work to the required standards.', 'Working knowledge of Access & Operational protocols.', 'Experience working for or with Wireless & Wired Telecommunications companies.', 'Provides guidance in resolving construction-related issues pertaining to telecommunications, in collaboration with stakeholders and staff; assists with the resolution of disputes with construction contracts/consultants.', "Seven (7) to nine (9) years' recent, related experience in managing, leading and directing telecommunications projects within a large, complex organization, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.", 'Demonstrated ability to interpret blueprints and drawings.', 'Takes leadership to resolve schedule, construction and operational issues (interference) with or between Carriers and vendors in compliance with regulatory agencies.', 'Provides quality control in collaboration with advisors to ensure that the project meets FHA requirements as set out in the contract.', 'Manage carrier compliance with unique Master Agreement conditions pertaining to Telus, Rogers and Freedom Mobile (in-building and macro), engaging the carriers and stakeholder FHA depts for input, assistance and approval as required and appropriate per FHA corporate policy.', 'Experience working in and/or leading a cross function-al team of design professionals']

title: newSessional Lecturer I - ERS211H5: Sedimentology and Stratigra...
description:
Position Type: Sessional Lecturer I

Course Title: ERS211H5: Sedimentology and Stratigraphy

Course Description: Sedimentology and stratigraphy concerns the origin, formation, accumulation, alteration, and preservation of sediments in the geological record. This course will focus on the reconstruction, correlation, and interpretation of ancient carbonate and siliciclastic paleoenvironments and facies based on the analysis of sedimentary structures, depositional environments, stratigraphic successions, and fossils. The interplay between biological and geological factors responsible for sedimentary deposits will form the core of the course, including the physical transport and biological accumulation of sediments, the effects of climate-driven sea-level change on sediment deposition, the importance of resource management and sustainability. This course will include a laboratory component with hand samples, thin sections, and physical models, in addition to a field trip, allowing for first-hand experience with describing and interpreting sedimentological units.

Number of Positions (est): 1

Course Enrolment (est): 30

TA Support (est): Dependent on enrollment.

Class schedule: For the most up-to-date course timetable and delivery methods, please visit UTM timetable Planner: https://student.utm.utoronto.ca/timetable/.

Dates of appointment: 08 September 2022 to 31 December 2022.

Salary: $8,489.67 (Sessional Lecturer I); $8,869.25 (Sessional Lecturer I Long Term); $9,085.58 (Sessional Lecturer II); $9,301.90 (Sessional Lecturer III). Please note that should rates stipulated in the collective agreement vary from rates stated in this posting, the rates stated in the collective agreement shall prevail.

Qualifications: Ph.D. in relevant area of Earth Science. Currency and mastery of subject area required. Past teaching experience and demonstrated excellence in teaching similar course.

Description of Duties: All normal duties related to the design and teaching of a university credit course, including but not limited to preparation and delivery of course content, development, administration and marking of assignments, tests and examinations, calculations and submission of grades, provide direction and supervision of TA's, and holding regular office hours.

Application instructions: Send a cover letter and CV addressed to: Professor Lindsay Schoenbohm, Chair, Department of Chemical and Physical Sciences, University of Toronto Mississauga, 3359 Mississauga Road, Mississauga, ON L5L 1C6; by e-mail in a PDF format to: cpssljobs.utm@utoronto.ca.

Application Closing Deadline: 19 May 2022

This job is posted in accordance with the CUPE 3902 Unit 3 Collective Agreement.

It is understood that some announcements of vacancies are tentative, pending final course determinations and enrolment. Should rates stipulated in the collective agreement vary from rates stated in this posting, the rates stated in the collective agreement shall prevail.

Preference in hiring is given to qualified individuals advanced to the rank of Sessional Lecturer II or Sessional Lecturer III in accordance with Article 14:12 of the CUPE 3902 Unit 3 collective agreement.

title: Responsable finance projet - Turnkey Amérique du Nord
description:
Ouvrant la voie de la transition énergétique, Alstom développe et commercialise des solutions de mobilité qui constituent des fondations durables pour l’avenir du transport. Son portefeuille de produits comprend notamment des trains à grande vitesse, des métros, le monorail, des tramways et des bus électriques ainsi que des systèmes intégrés, des services sur mesure, de l’infrastructure, des solutions de signalisation et des solutions de mobilité numériques. Alstom compte 150 000 véhicules en service commercial à travers le monde. Avec l’intégration de Bombardier Transport le 29 janvier 2021, le chiffre d’affaires proforma combiné du Groupe élargi atteint 14 milliards d’euros pour la période de 12 mois close le 31 mars 2021. Basé en France, Alstom est désormais présent dans 70 pays et emploie 70 000 personnes dans le monde. Son siège social de la région des Amériques est à St-Bruno au Québec. Au Canada, Alstom compte plus de 4 300 employés, dont 1 800 au Québec. www.alstom.com


VUE D’ENSEMBLE :

Copilote du chef de projet, le Responsable finance projet se consacre à l’atteinte des objectifs financiers des projets de turnkey. Il/elle fournit les informations financières relatives projets, supporte la gestion de projet, contrôle les marges mensuelles, contrôle le processus de changement de l’EAC (Estimate At Completion), supporter la planification projet, et s’assurer du respect des instructions en matière de comptabilité. Le Contrôleur agit comme point de contact pour toutes les questions relatives à son portefeuille de projets et assiste dans l’élaboration des rapports pour le portefeuille TK (clés en main). Il/elle évalue et mesure l'impact financier des risques et opportunités, suit de près les plans d'action et challenge les flux de trésorerie et les marges brutes du projet.


RESPONSABILITÉS :

Calculs de projet :

  • S'assurer que les calculs de projet reflètent l'état actuel du projet, le TAC (coût total approuvé/total à l'achèvement) approuvé et proposé dans l’outil Global FORE, en préparant les demandes de modification de l’EAC.
  • Saisir et mettre à jour des calculs du projet dans Global FORE et dans l’ERP
  • Élaborer et mettre à jour des chiffres du budget et des prévisions du projet dans Global FORE
  • Examiner et analyser du coût EAC du projet pour le budget, les prévisions et les chiffres réels dans Global FORE et le système ERP
  • Examiner et analyser les écarts entre les chiffres du budget, les prévisions et les chiffres réels, commenter les écarts dans les rapports mensuels – avec une attention particulière pour le pourcentage d'avancement des ventes, la marge et le flux de trésorerie disponible, les risques et opportunités et les contingences
  • Examiner et analyser les éléments du bilan liés aux contrats pour minimiser les actifs nets utilisés (niveau des stocks, paiements anticipés, comptes débiteurs, etc.)

Rapports de projet :

  • S’assurer que l’équipe projet soit au fait de la situation financière
  • Préparer et présenter l'état actuel et les scénarios alternatifs
  • Amener les membres de l'équipe à atteindre ou à améliorer leurs objectifs
  • Préparer, mettre à jour les rapports mensuels et les présenter lors des réunions de revue de projet
  • Contribuer aux discussions sur les risques et opportunités et assurer le suivi des plans d'action

Comptabilité :

  • Être responsable de la facturation des douanes et des clients, TVA (taxe sur la valeur ajoutée), du contrôle des créances et des paiements.
  • Gérer les flux de trésorerie (c.-à-d. saisie des données chiffées du projet dans le Cash Planner)
  • Assurer les activités de couverture en collaboration avec la trésorerie (si nécessaire) (ForeX Planner)
  • Déterminer les instructions d'expédition, élaborer, obtenir, distribuer les documents d'expédition et, si nécessaire, les documents douaniers; assurer toutes les activités d'expédition pertinentes (connaissement, lettres de transport aérien, liste de colisage, factures douanières, etc.)
  • Cas d'assurance (fret, maintenance, tiers, etc.)
  • Coordonner les affaires commerciales des partenaires internes, c'est-à-dire vérifier les ventes et les achats inter-entreprises (interco matching)
  • Fournir des paramètres d'entrée pour le processus d'approbation des offres et soutenir les activités d'appel d'offres Blue Book pour les ordres de variation
  • Contrôle des coûts et des heures directes
  • Contrôle de l'écriture homme/heure
  • Approvisionnement /Ingénierie : Quantifier l'impact des ordres de modification (calcul de la rentabilité), évaluer l'impact sur les éléments de coût dans le calcul (la nomenclature et les heures d'ingénierie)
  • Maintenir un niveau approprié de contingence

Au sein de l'équipe projet:

  • Tenir l’équipe au fait de la situation financière du projet et des potentiels risques et opportunités
  • Créer et maintenir des de bonnes relations inter-fonctionnelles
  • Assister le responsable projet ou le responsable des réclamations dans la préparation et négociations des réclamations

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

  • DESS compatibilité
  • Certification CPA, obligatoire
  • 5-10 ans d'expérience en comptabilité/finance
  • Comptabilité de projet, un atout
  • Anglais fluent, Français un atout
  • Logiciel : SAP, Suite Office, Excel Power BI

Note : Le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

title: Technicien en genie civil /surveillant de chantier
location: Hybrid remote in Quebec City, QC
description:
AECOM est à la recherche d'un(e) Technicien(ne) surveillant(e) de chantier pour un poste temps plein basé à Québec.

Maitrisant les aspects du génie routier et possédant une expérience particulière dans la réalisation de projets pour le compte du ministère des Transports du Québec et/ou de la ville de Québec la personne recherchée possède l'expérience requise afin de mener à bien, avec le soutien de l'équipe technique, la surveillance de travaux d'infrastructures de génie routier.

Les principales responsabilités sous la supervision du surveillant de travaux et à titre de représentant du surveillant au chantier comprennent, entre autres :

  • Surveillance de chantiers autoroutiers, routiers et municipaux;
  • Surveillance des travaux de maintien de circulation et coordination avec le MTQ et la ville de Québec;
  • Responsable d'une ou des équipes de surveillants;
  • Participation aux réunions de chantier;
  • Faire la coordination technique avec le bureau pour l’approbation des plans d’atelier;
  • Prendre connaissance des documents contractuels et s’assurer de leur bonne compréhension;
  • Rédaction de journaux de chantier;
  • Compilation des quantités et préparation de demande de paiement;
  • Arpentage au besoin.
Chez AECOM, nous offrons un monde meilleur.

Nous estimons que l’infrastructure crée des occasions pour tous. Que ce soit pour améliorer votre trajet matinal, éclairer les foyers, rendre l’eau potable accessible ou transformer le paysage urbain, notre travail aide les gens et les collectivités à prospérer.

Nos clients nous font confiance pour consacrer les meilleures personnes, idées, expertises techniques et solutions numériques à notre travail dans les secteurs du transport, du bâtiment, de l’eau, de l’environnement et des nouvelles énergies. Au sein d’une même équipe mondiale, nous sommes 47 000 à poursuivre ensemble l’objectif d’offrir un monde meilleur.

Minimum Requirements

+ 4 ans et plus d'expérience à titre de technicien pour chantiers autoroutiers, routiers du MTQ ou en surveillance de travaux avec la ville de Québec;

+ Avoir suivi le cours de Santé et sécurité générale sur les chantiers de construction;

+ Accès à un véhicule et posséder un permis de conduire valide;

+ Bonne connaissance des normes et façon de faire du MTQ et/ou de la ville de Québec;

+ Bonne connaissance des logiciels de la suite MS Office (Excel, Word et Outlook).

+ Bonne connaissance de la langue française (écrite et parlée);

+ Expérience en surveillance des travaux dans les domaines du génie routier du MTQ et/ou de la ville de Québec

Preferred Qualifications

+ DEC en génie civil ou expérience équivalente;

+ 7 ans et plus d'expérience à titre de technicien pour chantiers autoroutiers, routiers du MTQ

+ Connaissance du logiciel BDP (MTQ).

+ Communique efficacement – À l’interne comme à l’externe;

+ Démontre un souci de la satisfaction du client, de la qualité des services rendus, du respect des échéanciers et de l’atteinte des objectifs financiers des projets réalisés.

+ Dynamique, autonome, démontrant un esprit d'initiative et des aptitudes pour le travail d'équipe;

+ Ouverture pour des travaux à l’extérieur de la région de Québec (atout);

+ Avoir suivi les cours de l’AQTR dont STC-SUP-1 (STC-102) ainsi que Gestion des impacts des travaux routiers (STC-201) (atout).

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: Chief Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) - CFTS
description:
Company Description


Canadian Helicopters is a diversified company providing helicopter charter, maintenance support and flight training services. Canadian Helicopters has been operating rotary wing aircraft since 1947 and is the largest helicopter operator in Canada with 25 locations across the country and a fleet of close to 100 single and twin-engine aircraft.

Canadian Helicopters has authorization for day/night, VFR/IFR, and NVG operations. The company provides transportation services to a variety of industries including emergency medical services, hydro, oil and gas, mining, environmental, recreational, police, and military, and has a diverse project portfolio with operations in a variety of challenging and austere environments including Arctic/Antarctic, mountainous and desert environments.

We currently have an exciting career opportunity in our Southport, Manitoba, DND training & Maintenance support facility for a Chief Aircraft Maintenance Engineer.


Job Description


Reporting to the Vice President and Director of Maintenance, the CFTS Chief Engineer responsibilities includes:

  • As the Canadian Helicopters (CHL) on-site representative ensure the CHL AMO is compliant with the FTU maintenance agreement;
  • Ensure compliance with the KF Aerospace Defence Programs MCPM;
  • Provide aircraft status updates to KF Aerospace Defence Programs;
  • Provide oversight to the shared Stores department;
  • Liaise with the KF Aerospace Defence programs planner;
  • As the rotary wing SME, review applicable ADs and SBs using KF Aerospace’s Q-pulse system;
  • Manage aircraft maintenance;
  • Promote and develop team and company synergies with both internal and external stakeholders;
  • Organize crew resources;
  • Oversee organization and housekeeping of the hangar facility.

Qualifications
  • Shall be holder of a valid Transport Canada M1 and/or M2 rated AME licence;
  • Shall hold or have previously held Aircraft Certification Authority (ACA) on the Bell 206 and/or Bell 212 and/or Bell 412 for at least five (5) years;
  • Previous experience on multi-engine IFR aircraft in a military environment would be considered an asset;
  • Shall possess excellent organizational skills;
  • Demonstrate excellent communication and leadership skills;
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office;
  • Be customer focused and a team player;
  • Be able to obtain access to controlled goods approval.

Additional Information


We offer a flexible benefits program that include a complete dental and medical protection, life insurance, short and long-term disability insurance and a pension plan. Partial relocation assistance may be provided under certain conditions.

Canadian Helicopters Limited is committed to employment equity and diversity and encourages applications from women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.

For more information we invite you to visit our website: www.canadianhelicopters.com

Follow us on LinkedIn: https://ca.linkedin.com/company/canadian-helicopters-limited

title: newSenior Hydrogeologist/ Groundwater Modeller
description:
AECOM ’s Burnaby/Victoria offices are currently seeking a Senior Hydrogeologist/ Groundwater Modeller to join our team. We are looking for candidates that are enthusiastic and team-oriented with strong technical capabilities in physical hydrogeology. In this role, you will work with our experienced team of hydrogeologists on projects in the mining, remediation, civil infrastructure, waste management, and water supply sectors across Canada and internationally. Alternative locations including the flexibility of remote work will also be considered for the right candidate.

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Responsibilities:
+ Develop 3D hydrogeological conceptual models using software packages such as Leapfrog, Earth Volumetric Studio, Surfer, and more.

+ Develop numerical groundwater flow and contaminant transport models to support environmental impact assessments, water budget analyses, dewatering programs and design of groundwater extraction systems using software packages such as Groundwater Vistas, FEFLOW, and more.

+ Project Management duties including preparing proposals/workplans and managing project budgets, schedules, health + safety and project staffing.

+ Work within a team of hydrogeologists, geologists, geochemists, and groundwater modellers on a wide variety of projects.

+ Implement hydrogeological investigations including drilling and logging of soil and rock core, soil, rock, groundwater and vapour sampling, borehole instrumentation, monitoring well design and installation, and aquifer testing.

+ Interpret and report groundwater flow and aqueous geochemistry data.

+ Evaluating surface water and groundwater resources to guide their sustainable management.

+ Development of junior and intermediate staff through ongoing mentoring.

+ Support offices in British Columbia, across Canada, and internationally.

About AECOM’s Environment Business Line

Join AECOM to be part of an expert global team who is connected through a well-developed, worldwide, internal technical practice network through which you can learn from and brainstorm with the best in the world. AECOM is an industry-leading, world class environmental firm, and we want you to succeed within it. We respect and encourage your own pathway to excellence via our Freedom to Grow initiative.

AECOM is known for our award-winning technical excellence, leading-edge science and innovative project delivery. We provide sustainable solutions for some of the world’s most challenging issues. Our global clients and their projects are diverse and interesting. They span market sectors and geographies and require innovative technical solutions to solve wide-ranging environmental problems within diverse community profiles.

AECOM’s Sustainable Legacies program describes our approach to the environment, social equity and governance (ESG.) We embed sustainability throughout our business and help clients embed sustainable practices into their work. We help clients reduce their impact on the environment, achieve compliance and reduce risks.

Minimum Requirements

+ B.Sc. in Hydrogeology, Hydrology, Geology or related engineering discipline with an emphasis on quantitative hydrogeology.

+ Registered as a Professional Geoscientist or Engineer with Engineers and Geoscientists British Columbia (EGBC).

+ 8 years of experience conducting hydrogeological investigations and developing numerical groundwater models.

+ A valid class 5 driver’s license with no restrictions.

Preferred Qualifications

+ M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Hydrogeology, Hydrology, Geology or related engineering discipline with an emphasis on quantitative hydrogeology.

+ Ability to work independently and within a multi-disciplinary team.

+ Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and strong written and oral communication skills.

+ Willingness to complete field investigations, travel, and periodically adjust personal schedules to meet project needs.

+ Experience with software packages such as gINT, AQTESOLV, ArcGIS, Surfer, Grapher, and PHREEQC.

+ Knowledge of geostatistical methods and experience with conceptual modelling software such as Earth Volumetric Studio and Leapfrog.

+ Experience with numerical modelling software such as Groundwater Vistas, FEFLOW, MODHMS, GSFLOW, MIKE SHE, and HydroGeoSphere.

+ Experience with developing, using, or manipulating programs/scripts in MATLAB, Python and Flopy, FORTRAN, or other.

+ Working knowledge of relevant provincial, federal and municipal acts and regulations including BC Environmental Management Act, BC Contaminated Sites Regulation and BC Water Sustainability Act.

Additional Information:
+ Relocation is not available for this position.

+ Sponsorship is not available for this position.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: Responsable performance livraison fournisseur
description:
MISSION :

  • Assurer la capacité du fournisseur à répondre aux besoins d'Alstom.
  • Animer les performances de livraison des fournisseurs et la gestion des risques.
  • Effectuer les audits de capacité et de capacité SC pour les fournisseurs.

RESPONSABILITÉS :

  • Animer les performances de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Contribuer à l'évaluation et à la gestion des risques de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Gérer la crise de livraison (Site seul et multi-Sites)
  • Évaluer la capacité des fournisseurs ad hoc
  • Évaluer la capacité de la chaîne d'approvisionnement des fournisseurs ad hoc
  • Plan d'amélioration de la performance de livraison du fournisseur principal
  • Assurer le développement des compétences du Material Planner SDPM (formation/coaching)

Mode prédictif (nouveau contrat ou contrat à venir)

  • Conduire les Light Supply Chain Audit (LSCA) et Capacity Assessment (CA) si nécessaire
  • Conduire un audit complet de la chaîne d'approvisionnement (FSCA) si nécessaire
  • Contribuer aux évaluations des risques de livraison des fournisseurs et suivre le plan d'atténuation lorsqu'il est impliqué

Mode d'exécution : avec l'équipe de planification du matériel

  • Animer les performances de livraison avec les principales parties prenantes
  • Effectuer une analyse des causes profondes des fournisseurs ciblés pour comprendre la non-performance
  • Si nécessaire, conduire des évaluations de la capacité et/ou de la capacité de la chaîne d'approvisionnement
  • Mettre en œuvre et suivre les actions de récupération le cas échéant
  • Définir et suivre le plan d'action pour améliorer les performances de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Assurer le rapport et la mise à jour du plan d'action pour les meilleurs fournisseurs
  • Collaborer avec les autres SDPM en cas d'impact multi-sites
  • Coordonner les activités et impliquer les principales parties prenantes en cas de problème majeur de livraison
  • Former et coacher les Material Planners sur différents sujets SDPM
  • Participer à l'élaboration de la feuille de route APSYS et au déploiement des normes
  • Respecter la politique EHS d'Alstom
  • Participer à l'amélioration EHS et à l'atteinte des objectifs
  • Respecter les codes d'éthique et de conformité d'Alstom

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

  • Diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires ou en ingénierie ou en chaîne d'approvisionnement.
  • Certification Supply Chain ou Lean Management. (Souhaitable)
  • Expérience sur des projets de Lean Management, production, industrialisation.
  • Connaissance de la réalisation d'audits (Souhaitable)
  • Expérience en chaîne d'approvisionnement, en gestion de projet et en qualité (souhaitable)
  • Planification des besoins en matériaux
  • Gestion des performances de livraison des fournisseurs
  • Techniques de gestion des stocks et de planification du matériel
  • Systèmes d'information de la chaîne d'approvisionnement
  • Ordonnancement industriel
  • Transport & Distribution
  • Gestion d'équipe
  • Anglais et Français fonctionnel
  • Entrepreneuriat
  • Agilité
  • Collaboration
  • Vision globale

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

#LI-CR1

title: Responsable finance projet - Garantie NAM
description:
Ouvrant la voie de la transition énergétique, Alstom développe et commercialise des solutions de mobilité qui constituent des fondations durables pour l’avenir du transport. Son portefeuille de produits comprend notamment des trains à grande vitesse, des métros, le monorail, des trams et des bus électriques ainsi que des systèmes intégrés, des services sur mesure, de l’infrastructure, des solutions de signalisation et des solutions de mobilité numériques. Alstom compte 150 000 véhicules en service commercial à travers le monde. Avec l’intégration de Bombardier Transport le 29 janvier 2021, le chiffre d’affaires combiné du nouveau Groupe a atteint 14 milliards d’euros pour la période de 12 mois close le 31 mars 2021. Basé en France, Alstom est désormais présent dans 70 pays et emploie plus de 70 000 personnes dans le monde.

VUE D’ENSEMBLE :
Copilote du chef de projet, le Responsable finance projet se consacre à l’atteinte des objectifs financiers des projets de garantie. Il/elle fournit les informations financières relatives projets, supporte la gestion de projet, contrôle les marges mensuelles, contrôle le processus de changement de l’EAC (Estimate At Completion), supporter la planification projet, et s’assurer du respect des instructions en matière de comptabilité. Le Contrôleur agit comme point de contact pour toutes les questions relatives à son portefeuille de projets et assiste dans l’élaboration des rapports pour le portefeuille garantie. Il/elle évalue et mesure l'impact financier des risques et opportunités, suit de près les plans d'action et challenge les flux de trésorerie et les marges brutes du projet.

RESPONSABILITÉS :
Calculs de projet :
S'assurer que les calculs de projet reflètent l'état actuel du projet, le TAC (coût total approuvé/total à l'achèvement) approuvé et proposé dans l’outil Global FORE, en préparant les demandes de modification de l’EAC.

Saisir et mettre à jour des calculs du projet dans Global FORE et dans l’ERP

Élaborer et mettre à jour des chiffres du budget et des prévisions du projet dans Global FORE

Examiner et analyser du coût EAC du projet pour le budget, les prévisions et les chiffres réels dans Global FORE et le système ERP

Examiner et analyser les écarts entre les chiffres du budget, les prévisions et les chiffres réels, commenter les écarts dans les rapports mensuels – avec une attention particulière pour le pourcentage d'avancement des ventes, la marge et le flux de trésorerie disponible, les risques et opportunités et les contingences

Examiner et analyser les éléments du bilan liés aux contrats pour minimiser les actifs nets utilisés (niveau des stocks, paiements anticipés, comptes débiteurs, etc.)

Rapports de projet :
S’assurer que l’équipe projet soit au fait de la situation financière

Préparer et présenter l'état actuel et les scénarios alternatifs

Amener les membres de l'équipe à atteindre ou à améliorer leurs objectifs

Préparer, mettre à jour les rapports mensuels et les présenter lors des réunions de revue de projet

Contribuer aux discussions sur les risques et opportunités et assurer le suivi des plans d'action

Comptabilité :
Être responsable de la facturation des douanes et des clients, TVA (taxe sur la valeur ajoutée), du contrôle des créances et des paiements.

Gérer les flux de trésorerie (c.-à-d. saisie des données chiffées du projet dans le Cash Planner)

Assurer les activités de couverture en collaboration avec la trésorerie (si nécessaire) (ForeX Planner)

Déterminer les instructions d'expédition, élaborer, obtenir, distribuer les documents d'expédition et, si nécessaire, les documents douaniers; assurer toutes les activités d'expédition pertinentes (connaissement, lettres de transport aérien, liste de colisage, factures douanières, etc.)

Cas d'assurance (fret, maintenance, tiers, etc.)

Coordonner les affaires commerciales des partenaires internes, c'est-à-dire vérifier les ventes et les achats inter-entreprises (interco matching)

Fournir des paramètres d'entrée pour le processus d'approbation des offres et soutenir les activités d'appel d'offres Blue Book pour les ordres de variation

Contrôle des coûts et des heures directes

Contrôle de l'écriture homme/heure

Approvisionnement /Ingénierie : Quantifier l'impact des ordres de modification (calcul de la rentabilité), évaluer l'impact sur les éléments de coût dans le calcul (la nomenclature et les heures d'ingénierie)

Maintenir un niveau approprié de contingence

Au sein de l'équipe projet:
Tenir l’équipe au fait de la situation financière du projet et des potentiels risques et opportunités

Créer et maintenir des de bonnes relations inter-fonctionnelles

Assister le responsable projet ou le responsable des réclamations dans la préparation et négociations des réclamations

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :
DESS compatibilité

Certification CPA, obligatoire

5-10 ans d'expérience

Expérience comptabilité de projet, un atout

Anglais fluent, Français un atout

Logiciels : SAP, Suite Office, Excel Power BI

Note : Le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

title: Bridge engineer
description:
We are looking for a talented, motivated Intermediate Bridge Engineer to join our teams in Vancouver and Calgary. In this position you will work on multi-disciplinary projects with teams of engineers, technologists and planners to design, build, assess, and maintain bridges and transportation structures across Canada and around the world.

Specific duties are likely to include, but are not limited to:
  • Designing new bridges and transportation structures such as retaining walls, cut-and-cover tunnels and buried structures, and assessing and designing rehabilitation and seismic upgrades to existing structures
  • Working with other professionals, clients and third parties as required
  • Writing technical memos and reports to communicate your work
  • Completing structural analyses and design calculations, preparing calculation packages
  • Working with technicians to develop BIM models and engineering drawings
  • Reviewing project documents and drawings for quality and accuracy
  • Preparing cost estimates, technical specifications and contract documents
  • Providing technical and contract administration support during construction
  • Periodic site visits to complete inspections, field reviews, etc.
  • Planning projects and managing projects, including developing scope statements, fee estimates and schedules
  • Preparing proposals and engaging with clients
  • For the right candidate with demonstrated ability, this position offers the opportunity for increasing responsibility and project leadership roles

Candidate Specification

The right candidate is a versatile and creative thinker, able to provide practical solutions to complex problems. The candidate will have the following qualifications:
  • A Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from a recognized university and between 5 and 10 years of structural engineering experience with an emphasis on bridges and transportation structures (Master’s degree and BC/AB experience are assets but not required)
  • A Professional Engineer in BC or AB (or eligible for registration)
  • Strong verbal, written, and graphical communication skills
  • A team player who is self-motivated and able to manage multiple responsibilities in a dynamic, interdisciplinary environment
  • A thorough understanding of the design of reinforced concrete, prestressed concrete and structural steel (timber experience is an asset)
  • An understanding of earthquake engineering and performance-based design
  • Familiar with the range of relevant codes, standards, and specifications including CAN/CSA-S6 and AASHTO LRFD
  • Proficient in structural analysis software such as SAP2000, CSiBridge, MIDAS Civil
  • Familiar with CAD and BIM software such as AutoCAD, Civil 3D, Revit, Rhino; and
  • Excellent data analysis skills including Excel (Python is an asset but not necessary)
  • As part of your application, please submit a cover letter detailing your qualifications and motivation for applying
Mott MacDonald requires employees working in person at a Mott MacDonald workplace to either provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination or periodic testing. Therefore, to be considered for this position, you must abide by Mott MacDonald policy. This policy will be reviewed periodically and may be subject to change.

Job Profile

Opening opportunities with connected thinking.

Together with our clients, Mott MacDonald is solving some of the world's most intricate challenges. We search out the connections others fail to make; we unlock creativity and deliver better outcomes for the lives we touch every day.

Mott MacDonald is a wholly independent, employee-owned, multidisciplinary engineering and development consultancy servicing public and private sectors around the world with over 16,000 staff working out of 180 principal offices and delivering projects in 150 countries. Every day we build upon our reputation for technical excellence by taking on some of the world’s most prominent and challenging projects, particularly in areas such as highways and bridges, rail and transit systems, tunnels, and pipeline services.

We are positioned for healthy growth, profitability, and career opportunities across North America and around the world. As part of our growing business, we want to hear from you: the enthusiastic, collaborative, and talented individuals who enjoy problem solving and pitching in to grow a successful business. Join our team of seasoned professionals who are finding opportunities through connected thinking to develop our Mott MacDonald global presence.

Other Information

Equality, diversity and inclusion
We put equality, diversity and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

Agile working
At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team and personal commitments. We embrace agility, flexibility and trust.

More about Mott MacDonald

Our purpose is to improve society by considering social outcomes in everything we do, relentlessly focusing on excellence and digital innovation, transforming our clients’ businesses, our communities and employee opportunities.

title: Principal project manager/account lead
description:
Mott MacDonald is currently seeking an energetic and enthusiastic Principal Project Manager/Account Lead interested in delivering small to large-scale infrastructure engineering projects in a dynamic work environment. This position would be fitting for those looking to further their career in consulting engineering focusing on Civil Engineering in the Transportation sector having a particular interest in delivering freight railroad engineering projects.

As a key member of our rail and transit team, you will direct project team members in the planning, design and construction supervision of freight rail, ports and other transportation infrastructure projects as required.

As well as supporting the wider business in delivering transportation projects, a key part of the role will be to further develop and grow the Class 1 and Short line Railroad business for Mott MacDonald, with a particular focus on markets in and surrounding the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area. The role will be challenging, demanding, varied and offer opportunities for career development with the opportunity and challenge to grow the business in support of a rail business across North America.

As a Principal Project Manager/account lead, working as an integral part of Mott MacDonald, your duties will include but not be limited to:
  • Leading the delivery of ongoing projects and development of new opportunities with Class 1 Railroads across Canada as well as supporting on projects in the United States.
  • Leading and mentoring a team of exemplary rail professionals.
  • Formulating and developing long range goals and objectives for specific market sectors, coordinating and expediting activities to attain these goals and objectives.
  • Providing leadership in compiling preliminary and detail design documents for transportation projects.
  • Project management and coordination of linear infrastructure engineering projects in rail transportation.
  • Growing external relationships and building and maintaining strong networks with key clients, business partners and competitors, driving joint initiatives where appropriate and using these networks to influence, close deals and impact the growth and direction of the rail business.
  • Mentoring, supporting and development of technical staff.
  • Acting as a role model and ambassador for Mott MacDonald, articulating and representing the brand, vision and value proposition internally and externally.
  • Preparation of technical specifications and design reports.
  • Providing support to business development and strategic initiatives, including preparation and the leading of proposals.
  • Nurturing an innovative, challenging, collaborative and high performing work environment, which supports and fosters the Mott MacDonald values and culture where results are driven by a total team effort.

Candidate Specification

The ideal candidate will have consulting experience in the delivery of linear transportation projects and possess the following skills and experience:
  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in civil engineering
  • Registered professional engineer in Ontario
  • A minimum of 12+ years of experience within a civil engineering consultancy
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver projects relevant to Class 1 Railroad / rail infrastructure projects in public or private sectors
  • Self-directed nature, with ability to work well / seamlessly with a larger team, including outside experts (e.g., financial, legal, regulatory, etc.)
  • Experience working with other professionals including planners, engineers, and managers, toward the successful delivery of projects
  • Familiarity with rail industry standards, practices, and regulations, particularly those relating to Class 1 Railroads.
  • Demonstrated innovation and creative thinking using the latest digital design approaches.
  • Ability to deliver projects on-time and budget to the satisfaction of clients.
  • Ability to network within a large organization to bring the best solutions to our clients from around the world.
  • Management experience of both large projects and teams, for the total delivery of projects from their inception to construction completion and operation
  • Experience managing financial aspects of contracts (fee payment, subcontractors, income/expenses, etc.) to protect company’s interest and simultaneously maintaining good relationship with client
  • Have a keen interest in delivering projects that embrace digital technology as a means of showcasing engineering solutions
Mott MacDonald requires employees working in person at a Mott MacDonald workplace to either provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination or periodic testing. Therefore, to be considered for this position, you must abide by Mott MacDonald policy. This policy will be reviewed periodically and may be subject to change.

We are positioned for healthy growth, profitability, and career opportunities across North America and around the world. title: Manager, Client Advice I - Pearson International Airport
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit
CIBC.com
Job Description
What you’ll be doing
As a member of the Personal and Business Banking team, you’ll develop and coach a team of client service and financial service professionals, working towards a shared goal – delivering an exceptional client experience and deepening client relationships. As a Manager, Client Advice, you’ll inspire team members to perform at their best, while supporting a “One Team” approach that connects each client with the right advice to meet their financial needs. You’re flexible to work our banking centre hours which may include evenings and weekends. To help deliver a great client experience, you’re flexible to work at multiple banking centres within a reasonable travel distance.
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, you’ll be on-site full-time. You will be required to work rotational shift work between the hours of Monday to Sunday 5:30am to 10:30pm.
How you’ll succeed
  • Client experience - Lead by example, show your team how to deepen client relationships and meet client financial needs while providing a high standard of service. Deliver the client experience by encouraging employees to quickly resolve client complaints, escalating when necessary, and manage hard to solve issues. Empower clients to utilize self-service channels.
  • Results driven leadership - Create a culture of collaboration across multiple client offers so that clients are served by those best able to meet their financial needs. Support the Banking Centre Leader in monitoring business performance, put action plans in place to close any gaps and work as one team with all partners to increase the banking centre’s overall performance.
  • People Leadership - Create a team oriented, positive and productive working environment by recognizing the contributions of your team. Lead and coach a successful client service and financial services team. Advocate CIBC within the community to recruit employees who share and demonstrate our values.
Who You Are
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take initiative, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You are a caring and accountable leader. You’re passionate about developing and growing team members abilities. You have experience providing coaching and hands on support to meet team goals.
  • You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.
  • You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You connect with others through respect and authenticity
  • You will be required to obtain the Transport Canada Airport Clearance.
  • It's an asset if you have current accreditation and good standing Mutual Funds License (Canadian Securities Course or Investment Funds In Canada) and you’ve completed any of the following: Branch Compliance Officer’s Course (BCO), Branch Managers Examination Course (BME), Conducts & Practices Handbook (CPH) Wealth Management Essentials (WME); or Certified Financial Planner (CFP)
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
What you need to know
  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact
    Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.
Job Location
5980 Airport Rd, Pearson Int
Employment Type
Regular
Weekly Hours
37.5
Skills
Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Customer Service

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic Shop Supervisor - Winnipeg
description:
Shop Supervisor - 65k - 80k/ year - NW Winnipeg

Are you an experienced Heavy Duty Mechanic with proven leadership qualities? Are you looking for a supervisory position where you're able to utilize your coaching skills to assist mechanics of all experience levels with troubleshooting, as well as ensuring productivity and work quality goals are met?
If so we would love to learn more about you! A National Logistics company is looking for a Shop Supervisor with Journeyman/Red Seal Heavy-Duty Mechanic experience to join their expanding team.

Permanent position
Continental shifts: i.e. 7 - 12hr shifts over a 2 week period
Night 5pm - 5am or Day 5am - 5pm (for the ideal candidate)
Salary: 65k - 80k per year (based on certification and experience)

Advantages
This Transport Repair company offers you:
  • permanent, full-time work
  • competitive salary
  • night shift premium
  • managers incentive plan
  • phone allowance
  • boot allowance
  • RRSP matching
  • gas discount program
  • comprehensive benefits
  • 2 weeks vacation + additional personal days
  • opportunities for career advancement
  • friendly work environment

Responsibilities
As a Shop Supervisor, a normal day would include:
  • supervise Maintenance, Administration, and technical staff to ensure day-to-day action plans are being executed. Providing support where required.
  • assist mechanics with troubleshooting and solving mechanical problems as well as ensuring productivity, maintenance programs, and work quality goals are met
  • communicate with Planners, Operations, Drivers, and other departments as necessary in order to make decisions and adjustments to the workload schedule
  • partner with Shop Managers to ensure that production and quality objectives are met
  • responsible for ensuring on-the-floor resource availability is sufficient to complete workload, by assigning and controlling overtime, time-off, and vacation days
  • monitor and administer safe shop and work practices
  • ensure database information, files, repair entry and schedules are accurate shop and work practices
  • attend and contribute to team meetings on a daily, project and management goals

Qualifications
What do you need for this position?
  • Journeyman’s certifications or equivalent experience preferred
  • ideal candidates will have prior supervisory experience
  • excellent interpersonal and leadership skills
  • ability to positively motivate individuals and teams
  • strong organizational and planning skills
  • strong written and verbal communication skills
  • ability to maintain composure, effectiveness and flexibility under pressure will be key to your success in this position

Summary
If you are interested in applying for this exciting Shop Supervisor position within the logistics sector, please apply for the role today!
How to apply?
1) Apply directly to this ad
2) Email your resume to ty.hinds@randstad.ca put "Shop Supervisor" in the subject.
3) Apply online at Randstad.ca Today!

We thank all interested applicants, only those qualified will be contacted by our office.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Position Scope

Under the direction of the Vice President, Operations, the Logistics Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, and overseeing the logistics department, prioritizing and coordinating service activities in the field, as well as supervising the movement and distribution of supplies and materials within the company to optimize Magnum’s entire transportation cycle. This includes strategically planning for and managing logistics for both internal and external customers of Magnum.

Job Responsibilities

Leadership
  • Supervise, coach, and train department employees.
  • Review job performance of direct reports, provide feedback on work techniques and completed projects, and encourage continuous improvement in work undertaken.
  • Collaborate with managers on staff and equipment availability to create efficient schedules for service staff.
  • Coordinate and communicate with Operations Managers and other departments to facilitate efficient daily operations.
  • Maintain departmental records and reports.
  • Participate in meetings and training to further the effectiveness of the Logistics Manager role.
Logistics
  • Learn all logistics systems and processes. Maintain and develop existing systems.
  • Document actions by completing job summaries, tickets, and other applicable records as required.
  • Assist Vice President, Operations with planning asset allocation beyond the immediate future.
  • Work with the Vice President, Operations to set cost, productivity, accuracy, and timeliness targets for the department.
  • Take accurate information from customers regarding jobs and convey information to Sales or Programming.
  • Follow up on outstanding customer requests to ensure timely completion.
  • Operate GPS and communication equipment to correctly identify and determine location of company resources.
  • Document actions by completing job summaries, tickets, and other applicable records as required.
  • Monitor hours of service and utilize predictive information to make efficient and effective assignment decisions.
  • Focus on full utilization of equipment and drivers.
  • Help develop predictive reports and schedule boards.
  • Maintain inter-departmental metrics, analyze data to assess department performance and recommend improvements.
  • Identify, investigate, and resolve any customer complaints and / or issues.
  • Comply with all local laws, regulations, and legal requirements, as applicable.
General
  • Participate in training and development activities.
  • Other related duties as required.
Required

Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in a supervisory logistics/dispatch or relevant industry-related role.
  • Experience and ability to lead, motivate, and manage employees to meet objectives.
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.
  • Able to be on call as needed during a 5 days on and 2 days off schedule.
  • Ability to work evenings and overtime, as needed.
  • Legally eligible to work in the country the role is based out of.
Looking For
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Logistics, or Supply Chain, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook), standard logistics software, and records management software.
  • Excellent customer service and spoken and written communication skills.
  • Strong work ethic, positive attitude, reliable, and dependable.
  • Flexible and able to adapt to change.
  • Able to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Understands the importance of safety.
  • Team player and customer service focused.
  • Demonstrated initiative and results orientated.
Assets
  • Oil and gas services experience and industry knowledge, preferably in oilfield cementing.
  • Understanding of cement blends and remedial and primary cementing job procedures. Customer-based and technical knowledge is preferred.
Founded in 2008, Magnum quickly became an established well cementing service company with a broad operational footprint in North America.

Through those roots, Magnum continues to develop and diversify to offer our customers a unique blend of technical expertise with a history of project execution excellence. We are competent in providing primary and remedial (P&A) oilfield cementing services, downhole isolation technologies, soil stabilization and fluid services. Many of these services can be applied across various industries, such as oil & gas, agriculture, construction, roads and infrastructure, laydown yards, and retention ponds.

By applying technical expertise, synergy, efficiency, and the highest quality standards in everything that we do, Magnum separates ourselves from our competitors in all the services that we offer.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Logistics Manager


Tackling single-use consumerism while envisioning a world where products live their lives to the fullest – this is what Laps is all about.

We’re on a mission to transform the way customers shop and sell pre-loved goods. Sports are our starting point, but we won’t stop there. With established brands such as Cycling Avenue, Golf Avenue and Golfbidder, we aspire to offer the largest platform of resale and purchase of reconditioned goods online.

Circular economy is the value we’re built upon: we make it convenient for customers to sell us their gear, we expertly extend the product’s life, and we finally re-sell the gear over our online platforms.

Join us and let’s give second-hand a whole new lease on life!


The Opportunity

At Laps, we believe that transportation is one of the most important constituents of a successful circular economy ecosystem. Reporting to the VP- Supply Chain, the Logistics Manager will lead our transportation solutions across North America, the UK and Europe. He/ She will be directly responsible for our carrier performance, transportation cost and will drive all projects geared towards establishing a superior delivery and reverse logistics experience for our worldwide customers.


Responsibilities :

  • Manage all carriers’ performance w.r.t inbound and outbound delivery SLA (Ship to deliver)
  • Work closely with fulfillment operations and customer service to ensure seamless delivery of sale and purchase orders
  • Develop and lead our last mile pick up project in North America
  • Own and strengthen commercial / operational relationships with our 3PL carriers; lead the contract negotiation process towards continuous optimization of service and cost
  • Introduce new and relevant service offerings such as same day / next day delivery,
  • Set up and manage a robust exception management process – including carrier claims, parcel tracing, customs troubleshooting and peak planning
  • Conceptualize, document, and drive the transportation tech requirements with product team
  • Hire and manage logistics coordinator/s depending on business needs
  • Responsible for developing, generating, and analyzing transportation metrics with the support of the analytics team


Your profile


A customer obsessed professional will be able to build customer backwards solutions and innovate on their behalf. You take ownership of your projects while maintaining stakeholder trust. You are an analytical and data driven operator with proven root cause analysis and fix ability. You can also navigate around resource limitations.


With:

  • A passion for building an experience-led transportation program that goes beyond meeting SLAs and minimizing cost
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering, operations, supply chain or a related area. MBA or master’s degree is an asset
  • 4-6 years of direct, progressive 3PL carrier management experience, preferably in e-commerce
  • Experience in end-to-end 3PL carrier selection – from RFP to steady state operation
  • Good understanding of Canadian customs documentation and processes; exposure to UK and Europe international shipments a bonus


Up to 10% international travel required.


What we offer

Independence in your role: Your work isn't judged by the number of hours you punch in, but rather by the impact that you have.

A stimulating work environment in a rapidly growing organization.

The benefits of a group insurance program, unlimited vacations and employee discounts on our Golf and Cycling products.

Most importantly, passionate colleagues who have your back & will help inspire you to put your best foot forward.
