title: Logistics Manager
company: Centre for Probe Development and Commercialization
description:
The Centre for Probe Development and Commercialization (CPDC) is a global leader of next-generation radiopharmaceuticals. At CPDC we are working with our partners to discover, develop and distribute the next generation of imaging agents and targeted radiotherapeutics for the detection and treatment of human diseases such as cancer.

Our Centre has the full range of scientific, technical, regulatory and business expertise combined with specialized infrastructure required to translate radiopharmaceuticals from clinics to the commercial marketplace. CPDC's success in the radiopharmaceutical industry results in the ability of our talented staff to develop reproducible processes that yield high quality products while adhering to international regulations governing nuclear safety, transportation of goods, and pharmaceutical manufacturing. Our staff takes pride in the impact we make every day in the lives of patients across the globe.

Location: Hamilton

About the Role:

Radiopharmaceuticals are perishable products that are manufactured following a just-in-time model to meet the needs of patients. Shipment of such finished product requires well planned supply routes, specialized packaging and a detailed understanding of the international regulations pertaining to the shipment of dangerous goods.


Responsibilities

  • Shipment of dangerous goods nationally and internationally
  • Hands-on, stand-alone role in supply chain and logistics
  • Identifying and managing third-party logistics vendors
  • Work with production managers to plan manufacturing schedule
  • Developing and validating primary and secondary supply routes
  • Development/sourcing and validation of Type 7A packaging
  • Real-time shipment monitoring
  • Prompt remediation of shipping issues
  • Sourcing and managing of materials to meet the needs of our clients in the most effective manner.
  • All other duties as assigned


Required Education/Experience:

  • College or University level education in logistics and/or supply chain management
  • 8-10 years’ experience in the international shipment of dangerous goods
  • Knowledge of international shipping requirements in the areas of documentation, brokerage services, and customs/regulatory release, e.g. HC, FDA, etc.
  • Experience assisting with production scheduling is considered an asset
  • Customer oriented with strong communication skills, including proficiency in the English language, both written and oral
  • Multi-tasking capability to manage the logistics for multiple projects at once
  • Ability to work independently and possess excellent organizational skills
  • Proficient in utilizing Microsoft Office software including Excel, Word, Power Point
  • Ability to forecast material requirements for production and development
  • Experience with IATA regulations required
  • Experience working within a GMP environment (cleanroom facility) would be considered as asset
  • The ability to work flexible hours and be available after hours as necessary

CPDC offers:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Medical and dental benefits, sick days & more
  • Opportunity for long-term growth
  • Professional & collaborative environment with experienced individuals in the field
  • Join a passionate team making a difference in patients’ lives and Canadian healthcare

If you require accommodation for your application or interview, please contact Human Resources directly at 905.525.9140 ext. 21112 or by email at careers@imagingprobes.ca

We thank all those who apply but only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Access Transport Planner
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.

We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.

Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.

Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity

This position, reporting to the Manager of Access Transport Planning & Engineering, will be part of a technical team responsible for planning and preliminary design work transforming and evolving the IPRAN network to a Unified Access Transport network supporting Service Expansion and major Wireless/Wireline Programs such as 5G, New Site Builds.

Responsibilities
  • Support the develop of the short and long range capital budget plans to sustain and grow the access Transport network, in collaboration with Regional Planning teams and business partners
  • Transitioning of the IPRAN transport network to a Unified Access Transport network supporting Wireless, Residential & R4B traffic.
  • Support the preliminary design and preparation of capital & operating cost estimates for IPRAN/Unified Access Transport (UAT) to support programs rollouts.
  • Preparation of Engineering planning/design specifications for changes to the IPRAN/UAT Network.
  • IPRAN/UAT topology design, optimization, and capacity dimensioning
  • Issuance of Transport Program Plans to support UAT, Service Expansion, and Wireless programs
  • Development of capacity planning reports and audits
Qualifications
  • Highly effective individual, adaptive to shifting priorities, strong communication skills
  • Strong understanding of Transport Networks and well versed on industry and Rogers standards, vendor roadmaps for next generation networks & products
  • Experience in planning and designing Optical, Microwave and Fibre Networks is recommended
  • Experience with advanced analytics in Excel, VBA, SQL, and data visualization
  • Experience in deriving and communicating data-driven insights
  • Education experience should include a post-secondary education, preferably Bachelor of Electrical Engineering or Engineering.
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Full time

Shift Day

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON

Travel Requirements Up to 10%

Posting Category/Function Technology & Engineering

Requisition ID 263894

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work

Our people are at the heart of our success

Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do

We do what’s right, each and every day

We believe in the power of new ideas

We work as one team, with one vision

We give back to our communities and protect our environment

What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Job brief

We are looking for a reliable and experienced Logistics Manager to be responsible for the overall supply chain management. Logistics Manager responsibilities include oversight of merchandise orders full international transportation and delivery cycle of goods.


The goal is to manage the entire order cycle so as to enhance communication and execution that enables business development, ensure sustainability, and customer satisfaction.


This role will report to the Country Director of Canada and functionally to the Director of Global Logistics, Newtimes Group America.


Responsibilities

  • Strategically plan and manage logistics, transportation, Customs entry, last mile delivery, and customer services
  • Direct, optimize and coordinate full order cycle
  • Liaise and negotiate with suppliers, manufacturers, retailers and internal NTB merchant team
  • Keep track of quality, quantity, documentation, delivery times, transport costs and efficiency
  • Gather and provide reporting to different business partners
  • Resolve any arising problems or complaints
  • Meet cost, productivity, accuracy and timeliness targets
  • Maintain metrics and analyze data to assess performance and implement improvements of internal operations and vendors
  • Comply with laws, regulations, and policies


Requirements and skills

  • Proven working experience as a Logistics Manager (3 year min experience)
  • Demonstrable ability to communicate across a multi-national organization
  • Proficient in standard logistics software and practices
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
  • Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects
  • BS in Business Administration, Logistics or Supply Chain

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Due to growth, our client who is a leader in retail logistics is in need of a Logistics Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the Logistics operations including equipment, replenishment, and shipments.  

 

 

RESPONSIBILITES:

  • Analyze data related to movement of product and efficiencies
  •  Provide coaching, leadership and performance feedback  for the full time and contingent workforce up to 40+ staff
  • Negotiate all freight rates inbound and outbound
  • Schedule the incoming and outgoing movement of all freight and deliveries
  • Efficient movement of product in and out of DC  
  • Ensure health and safety standards are being met
  • Projects within the logistics
  • Establish and maintain Key Performance Indicators for warehouse team
  • Accountable for annual budget
  •  Product recovery /staging / warehouse facilities.

 


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum Post Secondary education in Logistics and or related discipline
  • Project Management experience an asset
  • Proven ability for continuous improvement and innovative thinking
  • 5 years experience in a distribution/manufacturing/logistics field in a manager role
  • Demonstrated ability to lead an operations facility
  • Financial and analytical skills required
  • Strong leadership skills required
  • Proven ability to manage operations in a high volume warehouse
  • Proficient computer skills

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Reports To: Vice-President, Operations - International


Bring your creativity and fresh thinking to an iconic brand owned by Onex ($31B assets) that has been trusted for its high quality and innovation since 1952. Helping our consumers work better is a key priority at Walter Surface Technologies. Continuous Operations improvement process has helped Walter achieve best-in-class service levels in its industry and is key to our culture. We are continuously looking at new opportunities to better support our fast growth and ensure the best services to our clients.


Job Summary

We are looking for an experienced logistics manager to be responsible for overseeing the logistics of our company's transportation-related activities in North America. In this role, you'll be keeping track of transportation operations and ensuring that all policies, procedures, and safety rules are followed.

To be a successful logistics manager, you should possess exceptional leadership skills and maintain the company's high standard of customer service. Ultimately, a top-notch logistics manager should be able to display extensive knowledge of transportation management systems and have excellent analytical skills.


Responsibilities

  • Align with Walter strategic goals, including but not limited to, cost reduction, EBIT reductions, cost avoidance and special project implementation.
  • Optimize the Transportation network to achieve best practices in alignment with business requirements by preforming of RFP
  • Be responsible for compliance and knowledge of Transport Canada regulations, CTPAT security program, PIP (Partner in Protection) and CSA (Custom Self-Assessment) and all related audits, and other safety standards.
  • Source and negotiate for services and preferential rates for freight forwarders or carriers for international and national freight in sea, air, land, and parcel shipments.
  • Organize and control the inbound and outbound of goods. Focusing on efficiency, pricing, and service levels.
  • Look for opportunities to reduce/optimize overall freight cost envelop. Recommend solutions/propose new initiatives to continuously improve our transport operation processes, customer services and become more efficient.
  • Oversee custom clearance operations for imports and exports for both Canada and USA and provide needed paperwork.
  • Create and maintain measurable performance metrics (KPI’S) for Inbound and Outbound transportation activities.
  • Monitor company’s or department’s performance, prepare reports for senior management, and plan for changes to schedules and policies.
  • Recruit and train staff in job duties, safety procedures and company policies.
  • Planning, organizing, and managing subordinate staff members to ensure work is completed and consistent with the company's standards.
  • Directing investigations to verify and resolve customer or shipper complaints.
  • Arrange for shipping documentation and the tracking and tracing of goods in transit.
  • Oversee the scheduling of land transportation, cargo ships and trains.
  • Monitors supplier’s KPI`s and generate report for the same.


Required skills & aptitudes

  • Good communication skills are a must with excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Good knowledge of ERP systems including TMS.
  • Solid knowledge of the transportation industry and logistics.
  • Knowledge of CBSA on commercial importation.
  • Knowledge of 3PL, 4PL, and Transport logistics.
  • Knowledge of Incoterms 2020.
  • Experience in strategic sourcing & budgeting.
  • Recognized for your leadership and innovation (C.I.).
  • Advanced knowledge in the Microsoft Office environment (MS Project, Word, Excel, Power Point and MS Outlook).
  • Strong capabilities in operational, commercial, and financial management.
  • Excellent leadership skills.
  • Good conflict resolution skills.


Education and Experience Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in in Transportation/Logistics, Engineering or Business Administration or any other university degree from a relevant field.
  • Minimum of 8 years of experience in transportation operations is required, including supervisory experience.
  • Experience in shipping Dangerous Goods is an asset.
  • Bilingualism in French & English is a must.



Working Conditions

Walter Surface Technologies offers competitive salary packages, an incredible work environment, and career advancement opportunities.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Logistics Manager for OEM


  • Plan, direct, and manage activities related to inbound and outbound distribution, warehouse, and on Delivery operations.
  • Oversee and manage domestic traffic operations, and provide warehouses and vendors with guidelines to be used for outbound dealer shipments and inbound warehouse shipments
  • Lead and Develop the Logistics Team
  • Develop performance standards (KPIs) to measure customer satisfaction and cost effectiveness and implement strategies for continuous improvement of departmental performance
  • Handle service provider selection and negotiations for all spend blocks – RO/RO, Air, Small Parcel, Rail, LTL, TL, Ocean (container) in conjunction with KBT Japan, and milk runs, as applicable.
  • Develop analyses, processes and tools to drive Lean performance, increase capacity, and reduce costs.
  • Monitor the cosmetic and general condition of goods received at warehouses and shipped to dealer by handling shortage and damage claims
  • Traffic operations monitored include: pricing, service levels, damage control, claims, theft, and performance measurement.
  • Prepare and manage the annual budget for all transportation activities
  • Outbound load builds are efficient and meeting shipment commitments for both parts and whole goods.
  • Control and transparency of inbound freight, providing forward planning and communications with warehouse
  • Responsible for KPI’s managed on a weekly/monthly basis
  • KPI’s such as but not limited to - Quality, lead times, pricing, customer service, load building etc.
  • Coordinate with Purchasing, and Warehousing Managers and staff to ensure products are available and loads are built and loaded timely and adequately
  • Negotiate all contracts with Freight Forwarding companies, 3 PL’s and work with 3rd Party Freight Audit to ensure freight company billing is as negotiated

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Logistics or related field
  • Logistic Certification
  • Successful Leadership/Management skills
  • Proven on the job management experience in all areas of distribution and “product” logistics including traffic, warehousing, order processing, inventory management, computer systems used to operate manage. High level of analytical skills
  • SAP knowledge
  • Knowledge of carrier networks and all transportation modes
  • Subject matter expert in logistics – international and domestic
  • Ability to design, develop, and implement logistic operations from inception.
  • Strong computer, analytical, communication skills

title: Logistics Manager
description:
DCL International Inc. - Protecting our planet with advanced technologies!


LOGISTICS MANAGER

Located in Concord, Ontario, DCL International Inc. (www.dcl-inc.com) is a well-established and fast-growing family business and is currently hiring full time for a Logistics Manager. DCL designs, manufactures and sells advanced engineering technologies worldwide to reduce emissions and to produce clean energy. 

Would you like to be a part of a team of global leaders in clean air technology? Then DCL is right for you!


RESPONSIBILITIES

• Oversee supply chain, materials and components inbound and finished goods outbound.

• Implement continuous improvement and Global Supply Chain best practices to ensure material on time for production.

• Establish strategies to support sales development across multiple geographies to ensure on-time delivery to our worldwide customers.

• Responsible for improving service and gaining new businesses opportunities in the international trade arena. 

• Engage with multiple stakeholders & processes ensuring smooth delivery & customs compliance.

• Evaluate critical purchases reducing yearly costs on new agreements under global procurement strategies, while strengthening key vendor relationships.

• Develop and reviewed internal procedures to manage shipping, packaging, reverse logistics, warehousing and distribution, all in accordance to ISO standards.

• Improve upon shipping accuracy in order to minimize shipping errors.

• Negotiate freight agreements that will lead reduction in overall exports freight costs and reduced lead-times by providing faster deliveries.

• Support order scheduling and reduce monthly shipping delays.

• Collaborate and support cross-functional teams to improve performance, review and implement critical KPIs on a monthly basis.

• Lead Operational and Strategical meetings. 


REQUIREMENTS

• Bachelor’s Degree in supply chain management, operations, logistics, business administration, transportation, engineering, or related field

• 10+ years of related Logistics/Supply Chain/Operations/Inventory/Distribution experience

• Background in any or all of the following: production control, materials planning, scheduling, warehousing, transportation in a manufacturing environment

• Previous experience leading/coach/train a team and demonstrated ability to get results

• Experience with logistics and inventory software - ERP or MRP systems

• Highly skilled in building relationships, influencing others, leading change and developing talent.

• Knowledge of continuous improvement methodology; experience identifying improvement opportunities and leading teams to complete projects

• Effective communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively across functions and obtain necessary “buy in” from stakeholders

• Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and prioritize duties to meet deadlines daily with limited supervision

• Proven record of delivering results

• Strong analytical and problem solving skills

• Excellent computer skills; Microsoft Office Excel and Word

• Able to travel occasionally to other locations


WHY US?

• We are a proud Canadian company, and we care about our shared environment.

• We provide a safe and clean work environment.

• We offer competitive pay and benefits.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Report to : Directors of Operations

Department : Operations

Position Type : Permanent, Full-Time

Location : Richmond, BC

Summary :

Responsible or all inventory allocations and transactions for any adjustments, Sales Order fulfillment, inventory issuing to and Purchase Order receiving. Responsible for planning, executing and reconciling weekly inventory cycle counting. Allocate inventory and create shipment schedules for all Microwave sales order by coordinating, prioritizing and supporting all other operational functions to expedite delivery. Work with Quality Control manager for planning the test schedule to ensure any compliance issues are resolved and certifications and compliance documents accompany the shipment. Coordinate with the purchasing department to minimize inventory on hand while ensuring inventory is available for production schedules.

Responsibilities:
  • Managing a team of three people including a shipper, a kitter/receiver and a materials handler in order to ensure inventory accountability, the on-time supply of kitted inventory to the production team, and the delivery of products to Norsat customers in accordance with the shipping schedule.
  • Creating manufacture order numbers and issuing inventory material and labour time calculations for product modifications and new development for the Microwave division.
  • Inventory adjustments in ERP system for any discrepancies with inventory on hand.
  • Issuing of inventory to MO’s used by Production and Engineering for the Satellite Division.
  • When required, working together with configuration manger in setting up and managing the structure and function of inventory part numbers in ERP system.
  • Working closely with accounting team for any discrepancies or issues with use of GL codes, sales order fulfillment issues, invoicing, credit issuing and inventory adjustments
  • Responsible for creating and refining processes in bi-weekly inventory cycle counting and year end inventory counting.
  • Responsible for coordinating the count of bi-weekly inventory cycle counting and year end inventory counting.
  • Responsible for reconciling any discrepancies during the count.
  • Help to develop and refine ERP/MRP processes.
  • Maintaining a well-organized, safe and clean warehouse for efficient operations.
  • Other tasks and duties as may be assigned.

Qualifications:
  • 5+ years shipping, receiving, warehouse, and inventory experience
  • Valid forklift license is an asset
  • Knowledge of ERP systems, Microsoft NAV is a plus
  • Experience with FedEx and UPS terminals is highly desirable
  • Experience in preparing Custom/brokers paperwork for importation/exportation into/from Canada and US/International shipments.
  • Experience with inventory control
  • Experience using Microsoft Office

Security Screening Requirement:

Norsat is a secure facility; thus, all employment is contingent upon the selected candidate’s successful clearance from federal security screenings, including Criminal Record Check.

No recruiters please.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Freight and Logistics Manager
description:
Description

Are you looking to work in one of Canada’s BEST MANAGED organizations that promotes teamwork, diverse and inclusive work atmosphere, and collaborative office culture? Are you looking to make a difference, be creative, and contribute to a variety of projects? This is your chance to help contribute to the Canadian family-owned Company’s success. You have the chance to be the next success story!

Why work at BE?
  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience
  • Group medical and dental benefits including
  • Employee and family assistance program
  • Company RRSP matching plan
  • Flexible work hours and potential for hybrid work arrangement
  • Healthy work life balance
  • Employee discount program
  • Training and development opportunities
  • Team socials and engagement events in and outside of the office
  • Modern, well-equipped work environment with excellent staff facilities
  • Employee welcome package and other SWAG
  • Excellent team

About The Role

This is a new role for BE as our faster than industry growth will continue accelerating over the coming years. The Freight/Logistics Manager will report directly to the COO and is responsible for building out our freight logistics processes with our global partners. We import more than 450 containers from global vendors and then ship to our distribution centers and customers (80% North American); The successful candidate will lead shaping this significant part of our business.

Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in logistics, supply chain, business administration, or transportation.
  • 5+ years of experience working in logistics, warehouse, or transportation operations.
  • Firm grasp of supply chain, freight, distribution, and business principles.
  • Strong team player.
  • Exceptional communication and negotiating skills.
  • Ability to manage, coach, and develop direct reports.
  • Exceptional organizational and analytical skills.
  • Working knowledge of logistics, inventory, and MS Office software.

We thank all applicants for their interest however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Logistics Manager


Position Reporting To – VP, Supply Chain


Summary/Objective

The Logistics Manager oversees the company’s transportation needs for inbound shipping. The incumbent will work closely with the Director, Operations & Warehousing to ensure relationships with ground and ocean carriers is maintained, and service levels are consistent. This role is responsible for acting as a liaison between Supply Chain (Oversea and Domestic), Warehouse Operations (shipping/receiving), Sales and Finance. This role will be overseeing a team of Import Specialists.


Essential Functions

· Manage the daily Logistics activities of transportation, import/export, customs compliance, shipping and receiving in a manner that provides an uninterrupted flow of inventory to all internal and external customers.

· Ensures all required domestic or international paperwork is accurately completed, filed and communicated to all necessary parties on time.

· Establishes and maintains effective relationships with carriers, 3PL providers, brokers, customs, regulatory and government agencies, working collaboratively to ensure issue-free border crossings, on-time arrival, and cost-effective operations.

· Reviews invoices received from vendors and brokers relating to imports / exports for accuracy, making sure entries are made properly, and report discrepancies to correspondent broker office as needed for correction.

· Manage and assist with the Helpdesk response system.

· Manage overages and shortages files, corresponding with finance and factories for all BU’s

· Reviewing and clearing inventory in direct locations in Navision on a monthly basis

· Working with I.T on any updates needed for logistics functions

Customs Process:

· Review the customs duty codes on a yearly basis (for all BUs)

· Internal audit of customs entries to ensure compliance

· Review quarterly the unliquidated entries for all BUs

· Track bond renewals and bond amounts in conjunction with Finance to ensure enough coverage for business

· Duty Drawbacks annual process lead

· Engage with Customs broker to ensure company compliance on regulatory framework changes

· Lead monthly and annual review meeting of Customs Broker; Lead RFQ if needed

Data Analytics and Process Improvement:

· Utilize quantitative skills to analyze, validate, manipulate and manage large amounts of data specific to problem solving and trend analysis reporting.

· Define a usable set of supply chain, inventory and cost improvement KPIs that are complementary for each team and aligned to objectives; Develop the KPIs to ensure they reflect current performance, are used to identify issues and tracking to objectives and that help prioritize improvements. Provide reporting on a Monthly Basis.

· Identify potential cost savings opportunities based on process, past acquisition costs and implement process changes to realize savings; identify other potential cost savings opportunities based on past consumption and spend for potential cost reductions.

· Analyzes, recommends, and implements plans to improve process flows, optimize the utilization of staff and resources, and reduce supply chain operating costs.

People:

· Plan staffing levels required to meet all order fulfilment, inventory, and shipping deadlines.

· Provide oversight and direction to the employees in the operating unit in accordance with the organization's policies and procedures.

· Lead employees to meet the organization's expectations for productivity, quality, continuous improvement, and KPI/goal accomplishment.

· Responsible for overall selection, hiring, discipline and termination of department personnel.

Quality Assurance:

· Ensures all documentation and processes are handled accurately and according to both internal Quality System procedures and external regulatory requirements.

· Tracks and resolves problems involving damaged or poor-quality goods, incorrect orders, and missing goods and the quick reporting of such issues to QA, Finance, Production and Purchasing Departments accordingly.


Travel

· 5-10% National and International travel will be required.


Overseas Interaction

In this role you will be required to work after hours, as needed, to accommodate meetings with colleagues from head office and vendors who are in different time zones to manage business needs.


Skills and Qualifications

Enthusiastic, positive person who embraces and facilitates change with a sense of urgency and persistence. Ability to solve complex process problems creatively while keeping "big picture" in mind. Strong decision maker with exceptional time management and organizational skills. Solid project management skills are essential. High attention to detail. Capability to balance a dynamic workload, set priorities daily and maintain flexibility. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. Familiar with enterprise-level SCM track-and-trace systems, as well as implementation experience. Good financial and business awareness. Strong written and verbal skills to communicate with all levels of the organization and its executive team. Strong quantitative and critical thinking skills. Strong customer service orientation. Proven interpersonal and communication skills with a demonstrated focus on leadership skills. Ability to work independently within a complex matrixed organization and building consensus with others. Analytical, as well as strategic thinking required; flexible, creative, process and service oriented.


Required Education and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain or Business Management, or equivalent experience.

3-5 years of experience working in Logistics and Customs Compliance.

Knowledge of current industry Best Practices in Supply Chain Management, Transportation and Import/Export.

Experienced with Customs Brokerages and international transportation/logistics experience with an excellent understanding of import/export regulations.

Direct working knowledge of operations, warehouse management, inventory control, and transportation management.

Knowledge of Canadian, U.S. and Global Regulations in relation to imports from Asia.

Demonstrated business knowledge and experience meeting project objectives.

Experience in managing third-party logistics providers.

High proficiency with Excel required.

ERP experience is required (SAP and Microsoft Navision is preferred).

Experience with Power BI or similar reporting tool an asset.


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Logistics + Supply Chain Manager
description:
Position Overview 

Gee Beauty is looking for a proactive Logistics & Supply Chain Manager to create and implement processes and systems to scale their operational activities. The ideal candidate will need to have knowledge in logistics and supply chain management in both Canada and U.S markets. The Operations Manager would need to be comfortable with overseeing day-to day operational activities as well as strategically plan and execute operational projects. 

Job Duties 

· Oversight of operations in the three business units: Retail, 6 by Gee, eCommerce and Product Development. 

· Create Processes in relation to inventory, product manufacturing and distribution. 

· Develop lead-time policy for products to achieve desired service levels for new products, while considering strategies for improvement. 

· Responsible for ensuring optimal inventory levels and maintenance of minimum safety stocks in order to avoid stockouts. 

· Provide direction and leadership for Integrated Supply Chain systems for both Canada & US markets. · Responsible for completeness and accuracy of SKU setup in system for both existing and new SKUs. Includes accuracy of product costing and SKU coding. 

· Manage customer fulfillment such as in-stock, late purchase, order management, vendor fill rates, system lead days etc. 

· Performs cost-analysis regarding outbound fulfillment of orders. Minimizing costs on freight, packaging costs on order fulfillment for various e-commerce platforms. 

· Responsible for ensuring validity and control over purchase orders. Developing new distribution channels for new retailer partnerships. 

· Collaborate with leadership to devise and implement short and long-term business strategies. 

· Working with contract manufacturers and vendors in Canada and the U.S., responsible for procurement, and tracking of the supply chain, for raw materials and components in the production of Gee Beauty branded product and ensuring that finished product is received on schedule and to Gee Beauty standards. 

· Product Development of Gee Beauty branded product – Ensure costing on all product components are optimal and consistent with Gee Beauty quality of standards. 

· Manage and grow relationships with external stakeholders in both Canada and U.S. Included but not limited to suppliers, manufacturers and regulatory bodies. 

· Assess current tools and systems (i.e., Shipstation, Book 4 Time & Shopify), identify inefficiencies and put in place the proper tools and systems for corrective action, while providing relevant KPI’s and information. 

· Working with Finance oversees and coordinates regular physical inventory and cycle counts and working with Finance to ensure accurate inventory valuations. Responsible for inventory security and inventory shrinkage. 

· Liaise with cross-border agents in ensuring proper duties are charged on importations and management importation issues. 

· Collaborate with Finance and the leadership team on various projects pertaining to supply chain and logistics management. 

· Create and enforce SOP’s for Inventory and Supply Chain management. 

· Initiate and manage projects and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders on ensuring that projects are kept on track. 

Required Qualifications 

· Post-secondary education in Business Management (specific diploma or degree) preferably certifications in Logistics and Supply Chain. 

· Minimum 3-5 years of progressive working experience, with a strong background in Supply Chain management, production management and eCommerce manufacturing and distribution. With specialized experience in implementing processes and systems. 

· Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel (reporting and analysis), PowerPoint and Adobe. 

· Preference will be given to candidates with experience in CPG/beauty industry as well as those with experience in both Canadian and U.S markets. 

Key Attributes for Success 

· Strong and articulate communicator. 

· A self-starter with a high degree of initiative. 

· Proven ability to build strong working relationships, internal and external to the organization. 

· Experience overseeing multiple functions across an organization (versus specialization in only one function). 

· Experience in scaling companies for high growth would be an asset 

· Strong experience in operations (services and manufacturing) and sales 

· Excellent financial acumen. 

· Direct-to-consumer distribution experience is a must, plus strong technical skills to build on the eCommerce platform at its successful early stages. Lifelong passion and interest in wellbeing, keen fashion sense and always working in building a positive self-image. 

· Positive attitude on work and life. 

· Great coach and team player. 

· High level of confidentiality. 

· Results oriented with very meticulous attention to detail. 

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent 

Salary: $85,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

title: Scheduling and Logistics Manager
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


At Iron Horse Security we are passionate about being Canada’s innovator of Customer Service focused Security Services. We are an award winning “people first” security service provider that has excelled by breaking from the norms in security and providing smiling, happy, concierge style guards.


Iron Horse Security is now hiring a bilingual, upbeat, and intelligent, problem-solving Scheduling and Logistics Manager. This person will report directly to our Director of Operations and our Executive Team.


We are a true team environment where people look forward to coming in each day. You will be treated with dignity, respect, humor and laughter. We will not keep track of each minute you work, when you take time off or look over your shoulder. We will trust you and expect you will always do what is in the best interest of our customers.


We expect personal sacrifice from you, but will give the same in return. Everyone at Iron Horse will help you when you need help, and support you to the best of our abilities. We will ensure you are healthy and happy in the workplace so you can enjoy life to the fullest. We expect that this will translate into a true commitment to everyone on our team, to our company, and to our customers. You are not applying for a job, but rather a place on our team and more importantly someone our customers can depend on, no matter what. We are different and very proud of it.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


• Scheduling of 300+ Full-Time and Part-Time Frontline Staff


• Communicating with clients to ensure duties, directives and assigned coverage in place 24/7/365


• Overseeing frontline staff training assignments, Heath & Safety and MoL compliance


• Develop solutions for clients and raise awareness of IHS’s capabilities in the local market


• Proactively identify and resolve potential concerns / failures in service


• Take initiative daily to constantly improve and ensure total customer satisfaction at all times


• Maintain communications with existing and potential clients


• Develop strategies for customer retention and satisfaction


• Assist with developing polices and procedures for staff


• Oversee our Mobile services team and assist as required


• Someone that enjoys solving difficult and complex problems, strong attention to detail.


• Will do whatever it takes 24/7 to ensure total client satisfaction


QUALIFICATION


• Exceptionally organized


• Educational background in a Law and Security, Private Security, Public Safety, Business, and/or Client Services related field(s)


• Ability to obtain security clearance (clean criminal record)


• Great problem-solving skills


• Solid knowledge of standard business practices


• Exceptional interpersonal skills, communication, and relationship management skills


• Strong influencing and negotiating skills


• Advanced computer literacy, with full working knowledge of MS Office


• Experience in Account Management with mid to large size businesses, Municipal, Provincial and Federal Gov’t agencies and Crown Corporations


ASSETS


• Bilingual in both official languages (English and French)


• Experience using CRM and/or Scheduling software


• Experience in Account Management


• Experience providing employee training / education / oversight


• Overseeing employees in a unionized environment / working under a Collective Agreement


OUR AWARDS


We are proud to be Canada’s Innovator of Customer Service based guarding. This has also led us to become one of Canada’s highest award winning Security Guard Companies. Some of our awards include: 13 time Consumers Choice Award, 6 time Profit 500 Award, 4 time Profit 100 Award, Top Choice Mark of Excellence, 25 year Better Business Bureau Honour Roll, Chamber of Commerce Business of the Year, Chamber of Commerce Mid Market Business of the Year, Multiple 40 Under Forty Award winners, Premier of Ontario – Premier’s Award, Ottawa Business Journal Book of Lists – 6th largest private sector employer, Ottawa Business Journal Book of Lists – 2nd largest security employer in Ottawa.


HOW TO APPLY


To join our award winning team, please apply by email only. The subject line of your email must read “Scheduling and Logistics Manager”. The body of your email should explain why you are Ottawa’s best candidate for the role, along with what sets you apart from other applicants. It should also include your start date availability. Your resume must be included as a separate attachment in either Word or PDF format only.


Job Type: Full-Time

Starting @ $20/hr+, plus bonuses, commissions and full benefits.


Please send resumes to hr.ottawa@ironhorsesecurity.com

title: Planner, Scheduler
description:
PLANNER/SCHEDULER
REFERENCE # 2022-276

Ornge is a modern, vital, evolving organization that is dedicated to providing the highest quality transport medicine services to the province of Ontario. From air transport services to our critical care land transport program, we provide a range of services to patients and hospitals across the province.  We are looking for individuals who are dedicated and energetic and who are looking for a career with a dynamic, patient-focused organization.  Ornge is committed to creating and promoting diversity, accessibility and inclusion in the workplace.

The Workforce Planning and Scheduling Department currently has the following vacancy:

Position Available: Planner/Scheduler 

Status: Full-time; Non-Union
Hours of Work: This role is expected to be able to work rotational shifts, including days, nights, weekends and holidays.

Location: 5310 Explorer Drive, Mississauga, ON



Reporting to: Manager, Workforce Planning and Scheduling

Department: Workforce Planning and Scheduling 

Find out more about our comprehensive total rewards package at: https://www.ornge.ca/careers/working-for-ornge



Position Summary:

The role of the Planner/Scheduler will contribute in a variety of ways to the day to day operations of the Workforce Planning and Scheduling department at Ornge.  S/he will plan and forecast short and long term needs of stakeholders related to the staffing of the Ornge fleet and Ornge Communications Center, as well as assist in scheduling training sessions and changes for staffing requirements.   S/he will arrange travel, accommodations (HOTAC), car rentals, and other Ornge related business travel for Paramedics, Pilots, AMEs and other personnel as required.  S/he will need to become familiar with multiple Collective Bargaining Agreements, service providers, and adhere to Ornge Policy.  S/he will work cross functionally with the Operations Control Centre, Aviation, Human Resources and Labour Relations, Medical Operations, and Paramedic Education, in a range of capacities.  

Key Accountabilities:

  • Collaborate with other business units to ensure educational requirements are scheduled timely and efficiently;
  • Monitor and manage crew operations and schedules to ensure compliance with Transport Canada Civil Aviation Regulations, Collective Agreements and company policies; 
  • Planning and scheduling Continuing Medical Education (CMEs) and Initial Education (IE) 
  • Accurately record and maintain scheduling records;
  • Monitor flight and duty time compliance and respond to irregularities; 
  • Complete monthly reports as required;
  • Book travel in a timely manner as required and approved and ensure reservations are confirmed and prepared itineraries are met;
  • Provide support and respond to issues regarding travel scheduling, reservations, cancellations and general inquiries;
  • Prepare purchase orders, compare training related invoices with vendor contracts; 
  • Complete monthly credit card reconciliations; and
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary education;
  • Experience in scheduling 24/7 operations; aviation and/or medical preferable;
  • Understanding of the provincial Transport Medicine system is an asset;
  • Ability to interpret and execute policies relating to Collective Agreements;
  • Ability to work within policies and practices of multiple stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze issues, develop solutions and execute plans;
  • Ability to establish and effectively manage numerous priorities and meet deadlines;
  • Strong planning and organizational skills; 
  • Knowledge or familiarity with Scheduling Software Systems is an asset; 
  • Basic knowledge of travel booking tool (Carlson Wagonlit); 
  • Must be available to work shift rotation after business hours, on weekends and holidays;
  • Proficient with MS Outlook, Excel, Word, Power Point and Internet Explorer;
  • Ability to multi-task work with flexibility in a fast-paced environment under minimal supervision; 
  • Excellent communication skills.

How to Apply:

Qualified candidates are invited to apply on-line at www.ornge.ca/careers no later than May 19, 2022.  If you require a disability accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us and provide your contact information. A member of the Human Resources team will contact you within 48 hours.

Ornge is an inclusive employer.  Accommodation is available under the Human Rights Code and in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Logistics Manager

Emmerson Packaging is a third-generation family-owned company. We are an industry leader in flexible packaging solutions, and we love what we do! We pride ourselves on meeting and exceeding the highest quality standards in everything we do, including adding talented people to our team! This passion and pride have won us the distinction of being named one of Canada’s Best Managed companies for 11 years running.

Our Values say it best: 

  • We enhance our lives by helping others succeed
  • We care about our clients, each other, and our communities
  • We are responsible for the outcome of our actions
  • We strive to do the right thing, even if it costs us

 

JOB SUMMARY:

The Logistics Manager manages and directs the activities of the Logistics Department to ensure finished goods are transported to the proper destination in a cost-efficient, timely and efficient manner. 


 

JOB TASKS:

  • Ensures compliance with all safety standards
  • Business Process Owner (BPO) for the department-specific SAP module
  • Develops analytics to improve department efficiencies and monitor internal workload
  • Leads and directs the Logistics and Shipping areas to ensure timely delivery of raw materials and finished goods to internal and external customers
  • Coordinates warehouse facilities to ensure an integrated warehouse and scheduling strategies while minimizing inventory cost
  • Ensures high-quality movement of finished goods from production facilities to the customer
  • Review and approves cost control reports, cost estimates, and plant requirement forecasts
  • Establishes and maintains appropriate commercial relationships with carriers; identifies the best suppliers for price, quality, and delivery
  • Negotiates service and savings agreements with carriers

 

COMPETENCIES:

  • Proven strong technical knowledge of supply chain management
  • Superior analytical skills
  • Proven strong negotiation skills
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Word and Excel software programs
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing
  • Strong time-management and organizational skills
  • Demonstrate strong attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy; detail-oriented
  • Able to use team-oriented problem-solving and team-building techniques
  • Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills (people skills) 

 

REQUIRMENTS:

  • Business degree with a specialization in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or related field
  • Professional APICA or PMAC certification
  • Five (5) years’ management experience in warehousing and scheduling

 

PREFFERED:

  • Undergraduate degree in purchasing, materials, operations, or a related field (B.SCM)



What's in it for YOU?

  • Competitive wages
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits
  • Defined contribution pension plan
  • Profit Sharing program
  • Training and development support
  • On site gym and cafeteria
  • Being part of an awesome team

If this sounds like you, please visit the careers section on our website and apply today at https://www.emmersonpackaging.com/careers/

We are an industry leader in flexible packaging solutions, and we love what we do! title: Logistics Manager
description:
About Supernova


We are the fastest growing health & beauty social e-commerce company. We build iconic beauty and lifestyle brands for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach, we connect with over 15 million women on social media every week. Headquartered in Singapore, we currently have offices in Berlin, London and LA. Our brands include Sand & Sky and Coco & Eve.


About Supernova’s Internal Engine


Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova.


This means that investing in hiring, developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #MakeAnImpact, #TalkAboutIt, #SeekNewOpportunities, #DelightAndSurprise and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious, smart, natural collaborator who likes taking risks, influencing, and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.


Located out of our warehouse in New Jersey, this role provides tremendous opportunity for the right candidate: to capture the energy and rapid pace of a fast growing start up, while being responsible for a sizeable and growing part of our global footprint.


About The Job


We are looking for an amazing Logistics Manager, who can bring an energetic, accurate and dedicated hand to manage fulfillment at Supernova for a selection of major global markets. Together with our colleagues in freight logistics and demand planning you will be the backbone of our international supply chain. You should be a process and analytical focused person that is very comfortable with spreadsheets, ERPs and cost/benefit analysis to prioritize every problem according to its impact to the bottom line. You are a strong communicator both with our external fulfillment partner as well as internal stakeholders.


The ideal candidate will have a complete obsession for quality, continuous improvements, and customer satisfaction. You thirst for a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment and maintain high energy levels in a constantly changing environment as you share our core values.


Responsibilities


  • Manage 2+ international 3PL warehouses in different time zones
    • Partner with the 3PL to implement and maintain best practice processes in warehouse operations, inventory management and fulfillment
    • Performance monitoring and management against SLAs & KPIs
    • Prioritisation of outbound and inbound processing
    • Communication of forecasts for capacity planning
    • Communication of special packaging requirements to the 3PL
    • Monitor inventory accuracy vs ERP
    • Manage/approve all inventory adjustments and root cause analysis
    • Claims management for picking errors, delivery issues, damaged and lost products.
    • Participate to quarterly business review
  • Manage 7+ local last mile delivery and international last mile delivery partners
    • Monitor delivery performance and communicate any delays back to the business for notification on site and to customers
    • Continuous review of potential providers and cost / delivery timeline improvements.
    • Help onboard new last mile providers and coordinate this within the business and 3PL
  • Systems management
    • Ensure all product SKUs are set up in the 3PL WMS system
    • Inventory reconciliation between Supernova ERP and WMS for each 3PL
    • Ensure Order alignment between Supernova ERP and WMS for each 3PL
    • Ensure ASN/PO alignment between Supernova ERP and WMS for each 3PL
    • Ensure Inventory Adjustments are correctly reflected
    • Conduct root cause analysis for any variances between Supernova ERP and 3PL WMS systems and enforce process adherence / re-engineering to prevent future issues
  • Ensure DIFOT of all orders to all sales channels. This includes:
    • Individual orders for D2C (Direct to consumer) orders from our ecommerce websites
    • Bulk Wholesale orders to major retail partners globally
    • Bulk replenishment orders to our marketplace partners such as Amazon
  • Support onboarding of new retail partners from a fulfillment perspective including:
    • Coordination with Sales Operations on delivery requirements / labeling
    • Delivery windows / bookings with partner warehouses
  • Ongoing analysis and improvement of service quality and/or cost efficiency of warehouse and fulfillment partner
  • Active support the set up of new warehouses in new markets we enter.


Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree or ability to demonstrate equivalent
  • Experience in CIN7 ERP or other major ERPs (SAP, NetSuite or other WMS)
  • Min 3-5 years relevant experience within e-commerce, supply chain or fulfillment
  • An analytical mind - comfortable with computer systems an online tools
  • Strong experience with complex Excel spreadsheets or similar data tools
  • Experience in a fast-growing startup is a plus
  • These characteristics describe you: punctual, reliable, upbeat, organized, and a strong communicator, “can do” attitude – no job is too big or too small
  • Proactive with a strong attention to detail
  • Excellent organization, project management skills, and time management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize work
  • Positive attitude – always willing to go the extra mile


In Return You Will


  • Flat hierarchy and co-operative working atmosphere
  • Freedom to execute own ideas
  • Competitive package
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • Health Insurance program


Are you ready to apply your experience to this new exciting opportunity? Do you enjoy managing a challenge in a systematic way and enjoy when things run like clockwork?


Then we would love to hear from you. Please note that we can only contact successful applicants.


Supernova is an equal opportunity employer. Our values define the working culture and environment we strive to create – fair, diverse, respectful and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. We promote harmonious working relationships and encourage a learning and development culture. We welcome applications from talented people coming from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.


See our Applicant Data Protection policy for information on how we collect, use and process your personal data: http://www.supernova.xyz/applicant-data-protection-notice/


See our Applicant Data Protection policy for information on how we collect, use and process your personal data: http://www.supernova.xyz/applicant-data-protection-notice/

title: Coordonnateur(trice) au transport/ Load Planner
description:
We heard you knock!

OBJECTIF GÉNÉRAL DU POSTE

Organiser et développer une planification quotidienne des expéditions de production qui optimise l'efficacité de notre usine et du camionnage tout en répondant aux exigences de livraison de nos clients.

FONCTIONS ET RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES
  • Élaborer le calendrier de production quotidien de l'usine dans la séquence la plus efficace tout en répondant aux exigences des clients.
  • Développer la planification quotidienne des camions.
  • Coordonner avec les compagnies de transport afin de s'assurer que les horaires de livraison sont établis de manière à maximiser les chargements dans un ordre efficace tout en répondant aux exigences des clients.
  • Coordonner avec le service clientèle pour la programmation de la production et l'expédition des commandes des clients dans les temps.
  • Informer l'équipe de production des problèmes ou des situations qui peuvent affecter la performance de l'usine.
  • Respecter le calendrier de production quotidien. Faire des recommandations pour optimiser le calendrier afin d'atteindre les objectifs de coût, de qualité, de livraison et de service.
  • Mettre en œuvre et suivre les plans visant à améliorer les délais de livraison et la productivité de l'usine.
  • Suggérer et mettre en œuvre des plans pour aider à réduire les coûts de l'entreprise en matière de livraison et d'efficacité de l'usine.
  • Examiner la force de livraison pour rechercher les domaines à améliorer.
  • Communiquer avec les collègues pour éviter les problèmes entre les départements.
  • Créer un bon moral au sein du service en faisant preuve d'équité, de cohérence et d'intérêt pour les problèmes des employés. Maintenir la confidentialité.
  • Mettre en œuvre, maintenir et soutenir toutes les politiques et procédures de l'entreprise, le programme de sécurité et la bonne tenue des locaux.
  • Produire des rapports quotidiens sur la ponctualité des livraisons et trouver des moyens d'améliorer la ponctualité des livraisons.
  • D'autres tâches peuvent être assignées par la direction.
Connaissances/ compétences/ aptitudes
  • Habile communicateur, tant à l’écrit que verbal
  • Doit être motivé et capable de travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe.
  • Apte à bien prioriser et travailler sous pression
  • Excellent sens de l'organisation et qualités de leadership
  • Compétence dans l'utilisation de Microsoft Word, Excel et Outlook.
  • Travailler avec intégrité et respect en faisant preuve de tact et de diplomatie.
Qualifications
  • Formation en transport et logistique
  • Minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience connexe en gestion du transport
GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB

Organize and develop daily production shipment planning that optimizes our plant efficiencies, trucking efficiencies yet meet our customers’ delivery requirements.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
  • Develop daily plant production schedule in the most efficient sequence while meeting customer requirements.
  • Develop daily Truck
  • Supervise external truck Drivers and ensure delivery schedules are set to maximize loads in an efficient sequence while meeting customer requirements.
  • Coordinate with CSR’s for the production scheduling and shipment of the customer orders on time.
  • Inform production team of problems or situations that may affect plant performance.
  • Adheres to daily production schedule. Makes recommendations for optimizing the schedule to meet cost, quality, delivery and service goals.
  • Implement and track plans to improve delivery times and plant productivity.
  • Suggest and implement plans to help reduce company costs in delivery and plant efficiency.
  • Review Mobile Delivery Force to investigate areas for improvement.
  • Communicate with colleagues to avoid problems between departments.
  • Establish high morale within department by showing fairness, consistency, and an interest in employee problems. Maintain confidentiality.
  • Implement, maintain, and support all company policies and procedures, safety program, and good housekeeping.
  • Produce daily on-time delivery reports and find ways to improve on-time delivery
  • Additional duties may be assigned by management.
Knowledge/ Skills/ Abilities
  • Skilled communicator, both written and verbal
  • Must be self-motivated and able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to prioritize and work well under pressure
  • Excellent organizational and leadership skills
  • Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Work with integrity and respect by being tactful and diplomatic.
Qualifications
  • Shipping and logistics scholarship
  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years related experience in transportation management
Open to extraordinary!

title: Responsable Logistique
description:
Cette position est responsable de gérer les activités de la logistique, en respectant les normes établies par l'entreprise. Votre supérieur hiérarchique est le directeur d’usine.



RESPONSABILITÉS ET autorité (QUALITÉ, SÉCURITÉ, ENVIRONNEMENT, SÉCURITÉ ALIMENTAIRE, AMÉLIORATION CONTINUE)



  • Signaler des situations problématiques à l’équipe de direction, initier des actions correctives, suivre un plan d’action, s’assurer de l’efficacité des mesures correctives selon les dispositions des différentes certifications (FSSC 22 000, ISO 45001, ISO 9001, ISO 14001, WCM)
  • Maintenir les standards ISO et les standards de sécurité
  • Contribuer à l'amélioration continue
  • Maintenir les standards demandés par les bonnes pratiques manufacturières et d'entreposage
  • Empêcher toute contamination des produits
  • Refuser l’accès d’un employé, ou un sous-contractant ou un visiteur si non-conforme


Mission:


Gérer les flux physiques et les données (production, informatives, douanières et financières) s'y rapportant, dans le but de mettre à disposition les ressources correspondant aux besoins de production déterminés en respectant les délais, les conditions économiques et légales prévues et la satisfaction des clients.


Tâches et responsabilités:


  • Gestion de la logistique (droits de douanes, import/export, supervisions des transports, etc.)
  • Gestion des achats de matières premières (commandes, négociations de prix, traitement des litiges, etc.)
  • Gestion de l'inventaire et de la planification de la production(analyse des goulots d’étranglement & priorités)
  • Gestion de l'entreposage et du FIFO (interne/externe, gestion des rejets, etc.)
  • Gestion du département de logistique et de ses employés
  • Gestion IT (lien avec fournisseurs et sous-traitants, équipements, troubleshooting, implantation, etc.)
  • Administration des payables et recevables (approbation de factures des fournisseurs, émission des factures clients, etc.)
  • Supervision du partage de l'information / communication dans le département de logistique ainsi qu'avec les autres départements
  • Planification des effectifs en collaboration avec RH et production (embauches, absences, vacances, congés)
  • Travaille en étroite collaboration avec les services connexes (maintenance, qualité, RH, production, ventes)
  • Rédaction de divers formulaires, rapports et documents en lien avec le travail
  • Participation et leader des comités d'amélioration continue (WCM)
  • Participation au maintien des certifications ISO (processus, formulaires, etc.)



Profil:


  • Niveau d’éducation : Diplôme (DEC) en gestion logistique, administration, gestion industrielle (ou expérience équivalente)
  • Langues : bilingue français - anglais


Expérience et aptitudes requises :


  • Connaissances avancées en logistique
  • Connaissances avancées en gestion de l’entreposage
  • Connaissances avancées en inventaire et planification
  • Capacité organisationnelle
  • Orienté vers la gestion, la résolution de problèmes et l'amélioration continue
  • Autonomie
  • Connaissances des normes ISO (9001, 14001, 22 000 et PAS 223) et OHSAS 18001
  • Connaissances en comptabilité d'entreprise
  • Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais
  • Connaissances avancées en informatique (Excel, Word, Power Point, iScala ou autre progiciel de gestion intégrée –ERP-)

title: Logistics Manager
description:
The Distribution Manager will plan, direct, and coordinate inventory control and distribution operations, and manage the warehouse employees. The Distribution Manager will develop and improve efficiency in receiving and processing products, provide exceptional customer service, and build relationships with customers and vendors.

Responsibilities
  • Supervises the staff across a multi-shift operation, as well as provides materials, equipment, and supplies by directing receiving, warehousing, and distribution services.
  • Initiates, coordinates, and enforces program, operational, and personnel policies and produces to maintain receiving, warehousing, and distribution operations.
  • Studies existing and new legislation of local warehousing, material handling, and shipping requirements to comply with federal/provincial; enforcing adherence to requirements; advising management on required actions.
  • Establishes and monitors security procedures and protocols to safeguard warehouse operations and contents.
  • Manages physical counts to control inventory accuracy; reconciles with data storage system.
  • Inspects equipment to maintain physical condition of warehouse; issues work orders for repair and requisitions for replacement.
  • Track wear, schedule and/or notify for standard maintenance on vehicles, lifts and trailers
  • Schedules and assigns employees to complete warehouse operations requirements; follows up on work results.
  • Coaches, counsels, and disciplines employees to maintain warehouse staff job results; plans, monitors, and appraises job results.
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
  • Project lead for any new systems or enhancements to the company inventory and warehouse management system.
  • Continuously improve system for reliability and productivity. Actively review inventory storage strategies to improve pick and put away flows.
Qualifications And Experience

7+ years of logistics and customer service experience.

5+ years of managerial experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Basic computer skills using applications in word processing, spreadsheets, and presentation software. Experience using an Enterprise Resource Planning system (Oracle) is an asset.

A demonstrated ability to lead people and get results through others.

Ability to work independently in a fast paced, detail-oriented environment as well as ability to shift priorities on short notice.

title: Logistics Procurement Manager - Remote Canadian Opportunity
description:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way. As a member of our team, you can too.

We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate.

We Actively Look For Prospects Who
  • Are passionate about client success.
  • Enjoy collaborating with others.
  • Strive to exceed expectations.
  • Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions.
You Are

Job Description:

A Results-driven Contributor who can execute strategic sourcing activites while displaying vast knowledge of the ecommerce logistics industry. You are an Enthusiastic team player who can lead and interact in a cross-functional environment and execute to the overall strategic goals of the organization.

You Will
  • Develop global logistics ecommerce vendor strategies (Canada Domestic final mile, small parcel, parcel processing, customs) based on operational needs and market trends.
  • Have focused responsibilities with Canadian domestic transportation vendors.
  • Lead strategic sourcing initiatives while demonstrating an understanding of project management methodologies that deliver cost savings and stakeholder satisfaction.
  • Ability to work and build relationships with internal stakeholders and logistics vendors.
  • Experience in running detailed complex RFPs, analyzing the submissions, and presenting overall results and recommendations to executive level management.
  • Lead and manage the contract life-cycle process. The Ability to negotiate complex logistics contracts while displaying knowledge of contract law and trade compliance regulations.
  • data-driven analysis that address and balance cost with service level requirements (within a business unit and across multiple business units)
  • Domestic / International Travel Required.
  • Work in a collaborative environment with Transportation Operations, Transportation Finance, and Procurement legal among other groups.
Your Background

As a Logistics Procurement Manager, you have:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Business, Supply Chain Management or related field required; MBA Preferred
  • 5 to 10 years of professional experience working both in logistics procurement roles and within the ecommerce logistics industry.
  • Intimate knowledge of best-in-class procurement procedures, policies and resources; e-tools and systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communications (verbal, written, email) and presentation (verbal and deck development) skills; prefer experience in presenting to senior leaders.
  • Strong business and financial acumen
  • High degree of financial and problem solving ability
  • Driven, Motivated and a Team Player
  • Active in professional logistics affiliations.
  • Proficient in Microsoft excel
  • Proficient in Power BI is a plus
Preferred
  • Experience working with Canadian domestic transportation providers and customs brokers.
  • Experience working in ecommerce logistics.
We Will
  • Provide the will: opportunity to grow and develop your career
  • Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas
  • Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization
  • Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)
Pitney Bowes values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.

All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.
