title: Logistics Manager
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener , smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

La version française de cette offre d'emploi est disponible: Version française - cliquez ici

Overview

The Logistics Manager (On-Road) leads Lafarge Eastern Canada’s on-road transportation team, encompassing the customer-facing Customer Service Centre (CVC) and the administrative On-Road Freight Team. The Manager is responsible to maintain senior relationships with numerous contracted third-party carriers and accountable to ensure effective and efficient shipping of finished materials and, in some cases, inbound trucking of materials. Additionally the incumbent will have direct responsibility for the oversight of 3rd Party owned and operated cement terminals in Quebec contracted to Lafarge. This position will be the point of contact for truck-related topics, and will manage the carrier selection process to define service requirements, review bids and measure truck carrier performance against freight contracts to optimize truck assets and cost of delivery.

Critical for success in the role will be the ability to bring creativity and manage complexity to drive cost performance while maintaining service levels. As an expert for on-road logistics, the Logistics Manager (On-Road) ensures delivery of top-notch service for all Customer, Plant, and Terminal touch-points and interactions managed by the CVC and Freight teams. Focus must be on the utmost highest standards for safe, quality assured, environmentally-friendly, reliable and low-cost delivery of Lafarge’s products to both customer and intermediate storage locations as per the supply plan. Lastly, the Logistics Manager (On-Road) is accountable for the administration and resolution of carrier accounts as well as support to the other cement teams in resolving issues.

Safety

 Responsibilities
  • Initiates, develops and maintains appropriate programs, priorities, and resources to manage health and safety risks for employees, customers, and vendors.
  • Actively leads implementation and compliance of Transport Canada and Lafarge Safety Standards.
  • Takes the lead on reporting/investigating any safety issues that involve local truck carriers.
Customer Focus
  • Build and maintain relationships of trust with customers in assigned geography.
  • Drive and own customer satisfaction at all times.
  • Responsible for continuous improvement of customer service results.
  • This includes KPI development and tracking. Supervise a team tasked with providing consistent and reliable customer service from order placement through delivery and carrier payment.
  • Maintain an ordering and subsequent delivery service that is a positive, value-added experience for Lafarge’s customers.
  • Maintain an efficient order management process
Operational Excellence
  • Actively selects opportunities to improve shipping schedule to minimize delivery times while providing oversight of transportation optimized by source, customer and margins to minimize cost of delivery.
  • Coordinate with Site Managers to assist in inventory management including a thorough understanding of related customer demand, daily coordination with onsite personnel, and consistent engagement of the inventory replenishment pipeline/plan for these locations.
  • Ensure the most productive use of asset through robust lane selection strategies are employed.
Carrier Management
  • Maintain strong working relationships with carrier/external truck partners in order to support overall customer experience.
  • Function as primary point of contact with senior carrier management.
  • Lead tactical planning/asset management to match carrier fleet capacity with customer requirements in each market.
  • Leverage internal and vendor interactions to support service strategy, manage costs, and identify and incorporate opportunities for improvement.
  • Take leadership role in identifying and implementing changes to improve capacity utilization, improve service quality, and reduce costs.
Carrier Administration
  • Through the Freight Team, analyze invoices, create purchase orders in SAP for all modes of transport (Road, Rail and Vessel), and ensure purchase order release process is accomplished timely and accurately in accordance with the Procure to Pay (P2P) process.
  • Communicate directly with Lafarge Canada Accounts Payable to dispute incorrect invoices directly with supply chain suppliers.
  • Review supply chain blanket order purchase order requirements, maintain purchase order tracking, create new purchase orders and update current purchase orders with new amounts.
  • Assures the timely and accurate entering and maintenance of all freight rates and accessorial charges and adjustments in SAP and regular audit, management and maintenance of carrier payables.
  • Oversees the Freight Team in the administration of SWAP/Wholesale/Import agreements, including PO’s, reconciliations, invoices, and Manual BOLS.
Terminal Oversight
  • Oversee the management and performance of third party owned and operated terminals in Quebec, including management of the contracts, renegotiation and ensuring sites are following Lafarge requirements.
Continuous Improvement
  • Supports the Cement group by working with both internal groups (sales, operations, manufacturing) and external groups (service providers, agencies, customers) representing truck shipping. Lead continuous improvement opportunities for current processes within the role to foster further simplification, visibility and efficiency.
  • This includes use of tools such as root cause analysis to identify constraints, developing solutions and implementation solutions.
  • Lead the review and implementation of new technology for integration of visibility and metric tracking for the logistics team and other stakeholders.
  • Integrate analysis of data to provide necessary business insights and make recommendations to improve the business and optimize our fleet.
  • Focus of carrier assessorial charges and develop strategies to reduce inefficiencies leading to them.
Procurement Strategy
  • Leads, with procurement support, negotiations with carriers any any trucking-related RFP Process.
  • Provides insights on opportunities for both inbound and outbound truck movements.
  • Provides vendors’ a performance based scorecard measured on a consistent and ongoing basis.
Forecast & Budget
  • Work with the cement and finance teams to develop monthly cost forecasts and monitoring tools.
  • Provide visibility and understanding to exceptions from the plan including active participation in monthly financial performance reviews.
  • Responsible for departmental budget development, monitoring, and analysis and explanation of variances.
Human Resources
  • Function as the onsite leader for the on-road logistics team in Laval and perform direct supervisory responsibilities for the Customer Value Centre Supervisor and freight team members.
  • Initiate and participate in recruiting activities as required for the team, mentor and coach employees including participation in the performance review process.
  • Develop annual objectives for the team and train all new staff during the orientation and onboarding processes.
  • Foster and maintain a positive, open, team-oriented work environment.
  • This includes excellent communication and strong working relationships with internal stakeholders from Sales, Logistics, and Operations teams who support the same customer base.
Specific Accountabilities
  • Freight-to-Customer and Freight-to-Terminal on-road truck freight execution and administration
  • Adherence to any allocation plans and ensuring close collaboration between sales and supply
  • Assures the timely and accurate entering and maintenance of all freight rates and accessorial charges and adjustments in SAP, and follow through of correct carrier payments.
  • Develops and implements continuous improvement processes and strategies for CVC and freight teams.
  • Travels as needed to meet with carriers, key customers and sales force to identify and incorporate service improvement opportunities.
  • Manage the RFP process by defining service requirements and reviewing bids in conjunction with bid process team
  • Manages budget, forecasts and other business cycle activities; Provides key performance reports.
  • Continues to improve the consistency of practices in ECAN to identify best practices, communicate and implement them
Relationship With Others
  • Interfaces intensely with Cement Sales, Manufacturing and Distribution organizations as well as the Product Line VP. Development of a strong relationship with the centralized back office team will also be critical for success in the role.
Dimensions

Areas of responsibility: All truck deliveries in Eastern Canada (Ontario & Quebec)

Delivered tonnes: 2,000,000 – 2,500,000 tonnes transported

Annual Spend: >$60m

Travel: Up to 20%

Direct Reports (# of): 5

Education And Work Experience

 Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field from an accredited university is required.
  • Minimum of 7 years of management/supervisory experience
  • Experience in on-road logistics a strong asset
  • Prior field sales experience and/or experience in distribution
  • Customer service experience preferred
  • Experience using an ERP / SAP system preferred
  • Knowledge of building materials industry preferred
  • Bilingual English and French is an asset
Knowledge And Skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated strong problem solving skills; a self-starter
  • Proven ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong time management skills essential
  • Ability to maintain composure in dealing with difficult situations; demonstrates positive customer service attitude
  • Flexible work schedule is required. This position may require the incumbent to work outside of normal working hours.
Lominger Competency
  • Drive for Results
  • Leading People
  • Customer Focus
  • Conflict Management
  • Developing Direct Reports & Others
  • Managing & Measuring Work
  • Motivating Others
LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

process.

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Operations and Logistics Manager
description:
Job Posting: Operations & Logistics Manager

Terms of Employment: Full-Time

Location: Vancouver - Office and work from home

Reports to: CEO/Director of Flight Operations

Term: 40 hours a week, indefinite

Application Deadline: May 25, 2022

Start Date: June 1, 2022



The primary purpose of the Operations & Logistics Manager is to assist in organizing, planning, collaborating, and helping execute HWB’s deliveries and missions in BC. The candidate will play an important role in developing systems during the adolescent years of this young charity. Primary responsibilities include ground logistics, airport logistics, community coordination and communication, cargo management, risk management, and working closely with beneficiaries, volunteers, employees, contractors, partners, donors, and community partners to oversee our flight missions from beginning to end. You will report and work in close collaboration with the CEO, COO, and DFO (Director of Flight Operation) on a daily basis.


Responsibilities

Mission

  • Assist with developing and implementing programs, curricula, and systems for all flights.
  • Coordinate with communities and health authorities to identify current needs.
  • Request supplies from donors, partners, and suppliers as needed while maintaining an excellent and professional working relationship.
  • Consult with communities and air service providers to schedule flight missions and delivery dates, times, and logistics.
  • Ensure that cargo is appropriately stored and tracked, and that inventory is kept secure and meets expiration guidelines (food perishables cargo).
  • Be onsite, at the hangar, pre and post missions to help coordinate, organize, and manage shipments to and from the hangar, and assist in loading cargo.
  • Provide timely assistance in administrative functions such as pre-mission documentation, outcome reports, external and internal communications, logbooks, vehicle use, receipt management, community files, program evaluation, and tracking.
  • Prioritize requests; consult and design the coordination of flight schedules and supplies.
  • Build and enhance relationships with community members and governance to ensure ongoing engagement.
  • Creating, improving, and maintaining an organized system in your departments.
  • Collaborate with all departments to come up with realistic and efficient process improvements on an ongoing basis.
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving solutions for irregular operations (IROPS) of weather, cargo, aircraft mechanicals, and supply chains. 
  • Create and maintain relationships with potential and existing air service providers.
  • Create and maintain relationships with potential and existing NGO partners and suppliers, while connecting donor and community beneficiaries where appropriate.
  • Report and log all activities, while ensuring database management is current and effective.
  • Maintain a list of current and potential donors including in-kind donations.
  • Maintain efficient tracking of flight, passenger, and cargo details.
  • Manage HWB’s CRM platform Keela.
  • Manage master cargo tracking forms on Excel.
  • Perform other duties as directed.

 

People & Culture

  • The practice of cultural safety and humility is imperative to work with HWB and its network, as the charity works with a diverse range of cultures, beliefs, religions, and mental models. The successful candidate will be open-minded and able to listen and learn from new norms.
  • Be a support mentor to co-workers, volunteers, donors, and stakeholders; assist co-workers with their responsibilities in their absence.
  • Participate in meetings on a daily and weekly basis.
  • Ability to work efficiently in a team environment and individually, as required.
  • Adhere to all HWB policies, guidelines and applicable legislation related to the staff and volunteer practices.

 

Finance

  • Understand and implement proper fiscal controls for mission expenses and budgets.
  • Submit all documentation in a timely fashion.
  • Track all expenses and report on a bi-weekly basis.

 

Working Conditions 

The candidate should be comfortable being a passenger on our flights if this is required. HWB is an emergency response organization and job flexibility is required. Primarily this is a 0900-1700, Monday to Friday type position. However, the successful candidate needs to understand this position can involve hours being shifted to evenings, weekends, and multi-day commitments because of its involvement in emergencies and health care situations. In this scenario, work can be done from home in most cases if desired. Working outside in inclement weather and performing physical tasks (i.e., moving loaded boxes, hours on foot, loading aircraft and storage of cargo) is required.

 

Job Requirements

  • Fluent in English
  • Two-year experience either in aviation, health care, non-profit or a related industry or job description.
  • Ability to work in Canada and travel internationally if needed.
  • Hold a valid Canadian driver’s license.
  • Have access to their own vehicle.
  • Comfortable driving company trucks and vans.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Office 365
  • Considering the mission we serve, enjoy a healthy lifestyle.
  • Proof of complete vaccination against Covid-19
  •  High School Diploma Certificate

 

Considered an Asset

  • Experience in aviation and/or non-profit management.
  • Current helicopter or fixed-wing licence.
  • Post-secondary education in a related field.
  • Working knowledge of Indigenous protocols and culture, trauma-informed care and charitable sector.
  • First Aid – Level 1

 

Notes

Review of applications will begin immediately, and interested candidates are encouraged to submit their complete applications to the email below promptly. We appreciate all interested individuals, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the interview process.

 

Ps. We understand we are a unique charity, so please do not be intimidated if your experience does not perfectly align with this job posting. If you are hardworking, a quick learner, and want to create change with a charity unlike most, then we hope to see your resume and cover letter.

 

Send Resumes to:

hwb@helicopterswithoutborders.org, with your name at the beginning of the subject line please.

 

Thanks!!

The HWB Crew

 

Helicopters Without Borders would like to acknowledge, with gratitude, that we live, work and fly on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territory of the Coast Salish peoples–Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), Stó:lō and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) and xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam).

title: Logistics Manager
description:
The Logistics Manager (On-Road) leads Lafarge Eastern Canada’s on-road transportation team, encompassing the customer-facing Customer Service Centre (CVC) and the administrative On-Road Freight Team. The Manager is responsible to maintain senior relationships with numerous contracted third-party carriers and accountable to ensure effective and efficient shipping of finished materials and, in some cases, inbound trucking of materials. Additionally the incumbent will have direct responsibility for the oversight of 3rd Party owned and operated cement terminals in Quebec contracted to Lafarge. This position will be the point of contact for truck-related topics, and will manage the carrier selection process to define service requirements, review bids and measure truck carrier performance against freight contracts to optimize truck assets and cost of delivery.

 

Critical for success in the role will be the ability to bring creativity and manage complexity to drive cost performance while maintaining service levels. As an expert for on-road logistics, the Logistics Manager (On-Road) ensures delivery of top-notch service for all Customer, Plant, and Terminal touch-points and interactions managed by the CVC and Freight teams. Focus must be on the utmost highest standards for safe, quality assured, environmentally-friendly, reliable and low-cost delivery of Lafarge’s products to both customer and intermediate storage locations as per the supply plan. Lastly, the Logistics Manager (On-Road) is accountable for the administration and resolution of carrier accounts as well as support to the other cement teams in resolving issues.

 

 

Safety:

  • Initiates, develops and maintains appropriate programs, priorities, and resources to manage health and safety risks for employees, customers, and vendors.
  • Actively leads implementation and compliance of Transport Canada and Lafarge Safety Standards.
  • Takes the lead on reporting/investigating any safety issues that involve local truck carriers.

 

Customer Focus:

  • Build and maintain relationships of trust with customers in assigned geography.
  • Drive and own customer satisfaction at all times.
  • Responsible for continuous improvement of customer service results.
  • This includes KPI development and tracking. Supervise a team tasked with providing consistent and reliable customer service from order placement through delivery and carrier payment.
  • Maintain an ordering and subsequent delivery service that is a positive, value-added experience for Lafarge’s customers.
  • Maintain an efficient order management process

 

Operational Excellence:

  • Actively selects opportunities to improve shipping schedule to minimize delivery times while providing oversight of transportation optimized by source, customer and margins to minimize cost of delivery.
  • Coordinate with Site Managers to assist in inventory management including a thorough understanding of related customer demand, daily coordination with onsite personnel, and consistent engagement of the inventory replenishment pipeline/plan for these locations.
  • Ensure the most productive use of asset through robust lane selection strategies are employed.

 

Carrier Management:

  • Maintain strong working relationships with carrier/external truck partners in order to support overall customer experience.
  • Function as primary point of contact with senior carrier management.
  • Lead tactical planning/asset management to match carrier fleet capacity with customer requirements in each market.
  • Leverage internal and vendor interactions to support service strategy, manage costs, and identify and incorporate opportunities for improvement.
  • Take leadership role in identifying and implementing changes to improve capacity utilization, improve service quality, and reduce costs.

 

Carrier Administration:

  • Through the Freight Team, analyze invoices, create purchase orders in SAP for all modes of transport (Road, Rail and Vessel), and ensure purchase order release process is accomplished timely and accurately in accordance with the Procure to Pay (P2P) process.
  • Communicate directly with Lafarge Canada Accounts Payable to dispute incorrect invoices directly with supply chain suppliers.
  • Review supply chain blanket order purchase order requirements, maintain purchase order tracking, create new purchase orders and update current purchase orders with new amounts.
  • Assures the timely and accurate entering and maintenance of all freight rates and accessorial charges and adjustments in SAP and regular audit, management and maintenance of carrier payables.
  • Oversees the Freight Team in the administration of SWAP/Wholesale/Import agreements, including PO’s, reconciliations, invoices, and Manual BOLS.

 

Terminal Oversight:

  • Oversee the management and performance of third party owned and operated terminals in Quebec, including management of the contracts, renegotiation and ensuring sites are following Lafarge requirements.

 

Continuous Improvement:

  • Supports the Cement group by working with both internal groups (sales, operations, manufacturing) and external groups (service providers, agencies, customers) representing truck shipping. Lead continuous improvement opportunities for current processes within the role to foster further simplification, visibility and efficiency.
  • This includes use of tools such as root cause analysis to identify constraints, developing solutions and implementation solutions.
  • Lead the review and implementation of new technology for integration of visibility and metric tracking for the logistics team and other stakeholders.
  • Integrate analysis of data to provide necessary business insights and make recommendations to improve the business and optimize our fleet.
  • Focus of carrier assessorial charges and develop strategies to reduce inefficiencies leading to them.

 

Procurement Strategy:

  • Leads, with procurement support, negotiations with carriers any any trucking-related RFP Process.
  • Provides insights on opportunities for both inbound and outbound truck movements.
  • Provides vendors’ a performance based scorecard measured on a consistent and ongoing basis.

 

Forecast & Budget:

  • Work with the cement and finance teams to develop monthly cost forecasts and monitoring tools.
  • Provide visibility and understanding to exceptions from the plan including active participation in monthly financial performance reviews.
  • Responsible for departmental budget development, monitoring, and analysis and explanation of variances.

 

Human Resources:

  • Function as the onsite leader for the on-road logistics team in Laval and perform direct supervisory responsibilities for the Customer Value Centre Supervisor and freight team members.
  • Initiate and participate in recruiting activities as required for the team, mentor and coach employees including participation in the performance review process.
  • Develop annual objectives for the team and train all new staff during the orientation and onboarding processes.
  • Foster and maintain a positive, open, team-oriented work environment.
  • This includes excellent communication and strong working relationships with internal stakeholders from Sales, Logistics, and Operations teams who support the same customer base.

 

Specific Accountabilities:

  • Freight-to-Customer and Freight-to-Terminal on-road truck freight execution and administration
  • Adherence to any allocation plans and ensuring close collaboration between sales and supply
  • Assures the timely and accurate entering and maintenance of all freight rates and accessorial charges and adjustments in SAP, and follow through of correct carrier payments.
  • Develops and implements continuous improvement processes and strategies for CVC and freight teams.
  • Travels as needed to meet with carriers, key customers and sales force to identify and incorporate service improvement opportunities.
  • Manage the RFP process by defining service requirements and reviewing bids in conjunction with bid process team
  • Manages budget, forecasts and other business cycle activities; Provides key performance reports.
  • Continues to improve the consistency of practices in ECAN to identify best practices, communicate and implement them

 

Relationship with Others

 

  • Interfaces intensely with Cement Sales, Manufacturing and Distribution organizations as well as the Product Line VP. Development of a strong relationship with the centralized back office team will also be critical for success in the role.
Dimensions

Areas of responsibility:           All truck deliveries in Eastern Canada (Ontario & Quebec)

Delivered tonnes:                    2,000,000 - 2,500,000 tonnes transported

Annual Spend:                        >$60m

Travel:                                     Up to 20%

Direct Reports (# of):              5

 

 

Education and Work Experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field from an accredited university is required.
  • Minimum of 7 years of management/supervisory experience
  • Experience in on-road logistics a strong asset
  • Prior field sales experience and/or experience in distribution
  • Customer service experience preferred
  • Experience using an ERP / SAP system preferred
  • Knowledge of building materials industry preferred
  • Bilingual English and French is an asset

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated strong problem solving skills; a self-starter
  • Proven ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong time management skills essential
  • Ability to maintain composure in dealing with difficult situations; demonstrates positive customer service attitude
  • Flexible work schedule is required. This position may require the incumbent to work outside of normal working hours.

 

Lominger Competency

  • Drive for Results
  • Leading People
  • Customer Focus
  • Conflict Management
  • Developing Direct Reports & Others
  • Managing & Measuring Work
  • Motivating Others

title: Yard & Logistics Manager - Get Hired Fast
description:
We are searching for a motivated Yard & Logistics Manager to join our stellar team at Raven Recycling in Whitehorse, YT.

Growing your career as a Full Time Yard & Logistics Manager is a terrific opportunity to develop exceptional skills.

If you are strong in project management, teamwork and have the right experience for the job, then apply for the position of Yard & Logistics Manager at Raven Recycling today!

Yard & Logistics Manager

Raven Recycling

Whitehorse, YT

Full Time

Compensation: $68,000 to $78,000 Annually

Common Good Plan, annual bonuses based on length of employment and performance
  • Administration And Clerical
  • Customer Service
  • Environmental & Natural Resources
  • Management
  • Sales & Retail
  • Security & Building Maintenance
  • Shipping & Delivery
  • Trades & Labour
Duration

Permanent

Closing Date

Until filled

Job Level

Senior management

Intended job posting audience

Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

Overview

Raven Recycling Society is a non-government organization and a social enterprise operating within the Traditional Territories of the Kwanlin Dun First Nation and the Ta'an Kwach'an Council. The Society's purpose is to promote sustainable Yukon communities and healthy ecosystems through responsible consumption and waste management by citizens, the public sector and the private sector.

While respecting and embodying Raven’s Zero Waste and community building philosophy throughout, the incumbent’s focus is on leading yard operations, including metals, e-waste and shipping. This is a busy and dynamic position that demands an exceptional ability to balance administrative and operational duties.

The Yard Manager works closely with all members of the Raven team. Excellent interpersonal skills, the ability to lead with dignity and respect, and a good sense of humor are essential.

Duties & Responsibilities

Administrative
  • Recruitment, training, performance management, team building and scheduling of yard, e-waste and metals employees
  • Budget management and reporting
  • Management of shipping and receiving paperwork and data entry
  • Routine monitoring of the yard for safety and environmental compliance
  • Bidding on tenders, such as for the management of e-waste.
  • Maintaining current understanding of commodity prices and markets and negotiating new arrangements with brokers when necessary.
Supervision & labour
  • Coordination of metals, e-waste and yard operations
  • Maintaining effective use of equipment and staff
  • Coordinating receiving, processing and shipping of all materials in collaboration with warehouse and depot staff
  • Loading shipping containers to maintain high efficiency and quality of outgoing commodities
  • Undertaking the duties and responsibilities of a variety of yard workers as required
Other duties
  • Participating in strategic planning with particular focus on metals, e-waste and shipping operations
  • Ensuring equipment, and yard are maintained to safety levels required by WCB and fire inspection including snow removal, litter clearing and commodity storage clearances.
  • Purchasing supplies as necessary
  • Responding to public, customer and funder inquiries and ensure a high level of customer service is provided by all Raven employees
  • Sourcing, collecting and processing material for Raven’s wood chip boiler throughout the year to ensure an adequate supply in advance of boiler season.
  • Communicating with the City of Whitehorse Waste and Water Services personnel to maintain a good working relationship and collaborate on improving the recycling and waste management systems.
  • Occasional project management related to infrastructure maintenance and repair
Required Skills

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:
  • Experience with human resource management
  • Understanding of workplace safety requirements and legislation, including the Occupational Health & Safety Act, Employment Standards Act and Yukon Human Rights Act
  • Class 5 Driver’s license
  • Experience operating heavy machinery, large equipment and a variety of vehicles
  • Dedication and commitment to promoting waste reduction and a circular economy and ability to lead by example
  • Excellent organizational, time management, prioritization and leadership skills
  • Ability to foster and maintain effective relationships among peers, stakeholders, staff and the public
  • Proficiency with basic office software such as Excel and ability to transition to new software when needed
Required Certifications (training May Be Provided)
  • WHMIS certification
  • Standard First Aid/CPR-C
  • YHRC Human Rights 101
  • Leadership for Safety Excellence
  • Joint Health & Safety Committee Training
  • Return to Work Training
Recommended Training
  • Managing Recycling Systems, Solid Waste Association of North America
Desired Equipment Operation Experience

Mobile Equipment operation including
  • Linde Diesel forklift truck
  • CASE diesel forklift truck
  • Bobcat skid-steer (S770, S300, T740)
  • Linde electric forklift
  • Cube vans
Warehouse equipment including
  • Harris badger two ram baler
  • Harmony vertical baler
  • REM glass breaker
  • Conveyor systems
Experience with machine maintenance is an asset

 Welding experience is an asset

 WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Most administrative work is performed under normal office conditions
  • Regular use of heavy machinery and mechanical equipment
  • Regular exposure to temperature extremes between office, warehouse and yard
  • Regular exposure to chemicals, odors, fumes and waste materials
  • Physical risk associated with site visits, heavy equipment and mechanical equipment and vehicle operation
Additional Application Instructions

Applicants are encouraged to call the Executive Director to discuss your interest in the job. (867)667-7269 ex. 25

Company Benefits
  • Company offers great benefits
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Attractive package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Logistics Manager - Gestionnaire, Logistique
description:
Gestionnaire, Logistique


Qui sommes-nous ?

  • Nous sommes disruptifs, dynamiques et très motivés
  • Nous aimons imprimer des canettes et les transformer en œuvres d'art
  • Nous sommes fiers d’être une alternative aux manchons et étiquettes en plastique
  • Nous croyons en notre équipe et savons que la somme de tous nos talents nous permettra d’atteindre nos plus grandes ambitions!

Écoutez notre vidéo! (https://youtu.be/jtfPzOlMHd4)

Qui êtes-vous ?

  • Vous possédez des compétences de leadership exceptionnelles;
  • Vous avez une connaissance approfondie des systèmes de gestion des transports; 
  • Vous aimez l'organisation et la planification et avez d'excellentes capacités d'analyse;
  • Vous êtes à l'aise avec la technologie et vous apprenez rapidement les nouveaux outils numériques; 
  • Vous êtes avant-gardiste et vous vous efforcez toujours d'apporter des changements positifs; 
  • Vous êtes naturellement passionné.e, innovant.e et stratégique;
  • Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement hautement dynamique à croissance rapide.

Tâches et responsabilités quotidiennes

  • Planifier, organiser et superviser les activités opérationnelles quotidiennes de transport de marchandises vers nos clients;
  • Optimiser notre réseau de transport pour atteindre les meilleures pratiques en alignement avec la croissance des affaires ;
  • Rechercher et négocier des services et des tarifs préférentiels pour les transitaires ou les transporteurs (internationaux et locaux);
  • Organiser et contrôler l'entrée et la sortie des marchandises, en se concentrant sur l'efficacité, les prix et le niveau de service;
  • Recommander des solutions/proposer de nouvelles initiatives pour améliorer continuellement nos opérations de transport, nos processus, notre service client et réduire/optimiser l'enveloppe globale des coûts de fret;
  • Superviser les opérations de dédouanement pour les importations et les exportations pour le Canada et les États-Unis et fournir les documents nécessaires ;
  • Créer et maintenir des indicateurs de performance mesurables (KPI) pour les activités de transport entrant et sortant ;
  • Diriger la mise en œuvre de toutes les modifications, politiques et procédures de logistique et d'expédition/réception ;
  • Recruter, former, gérer et coacher une équipe;
  • Superviser les enquêtes et la résolution des plaintes des clients et des expéditeurs.

Connaissances et compétences requises

  • +5 ans d'expérience dans les opérations logistiques, l'expédition/la réception et/ou les opérations d'entreposage ;
  • Compréhension des procédures d'expédition et des douanes à l'importation et à l'exportation, un atout important ;
  • Un diplôme d'études postsecondaires, un certificat, un diplôme ou l'équivalent, concentration en logistique de transport, opérations ou similaire, un atout ;
  • Excellentes compétences en communication en français et en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral ;
  • Souci du détail et excellentes compétences multitâches avec la capacité d'établir des priorités ;
  • Capable d'analyser des données, de résoudre des problèmes et de recommander des solutions
  • À l'aise avec la technologie et les outils infonuagiques, ainsi qu'une solide connaissance des logiciels de traitement de texte et de tableur ;
  • Sociable et dynamisé.e par les interactions humaines ;
  • Travaille bien en équipe, à l'aise avec des équipes à distance.

Avantages

  • Une croissance fulgurante - la vôtre et la nôtre. Chez Hart Print, les possibilités de croissance personnelle et professionnelle sont nombreuses. C'est parce que nous croyons au développement, à l'investissement et à la promotion à l'interne !
  • Une excellente culture d'entreprise : Nous sommes inclusifs, collaboratifs et dynamiques. Venez travailler dans un cadre décontracté avec des gens formidables.
  • Repos et équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle : 3 semaines de vacances payées, jours de maladie et jours personnels payés. 
  • Avantages sociaux après 3 mois, couverture jusqu'à 80%
  • REER et CELI parrainés par l'entreprise
  • Plan de soutien en santé parrainé par l'entreprise
  • OPUS à l'année
  • Formation individuelle, développement et planification de carrière


*****************************************************


Logistics Manager


Who are we?

  • We are disruptive, dynamic and super driven
  • We love printing cans and turning them into art
  • We love being an alternative to plastic sleeves and labels
  • Our inkjet technology unlocks the potential for full printing versatility
  • Sky's the limit on our growth, and we’re building the team that will get us there!

Watch our video! (https://youtu.be/tkzH7o9LBaA)

Who are you?

  • You possess exceptional leadership skills 
  • You have extensive knowledge of transportation management systems 
  • You enjoy organization and scheduling and have excellent analytical skills.
  • You are at ease with technology and are a quick learning new digital tools 
  • You are forward thinking and always strive for positive change 
  • You are passionate, innovative and strategic by nature
  • You love working in a rapid growth and highly energetic environment

Daily tasks and responsibilities 

  • Plan, organize, and oversee the day-to-day operational activities of transporting goods to our clients;
  • Optimize the transportation network to achieve best practices in alignment with business growth;
  • Source and negotiate for services and preferential rates for freight forwarders or carriers (international and local); 
  • Organize and control the inbound and outbound of goods, focusing on efficiency, pricing, and service levels;
  • Recommend solutions/propose new initiatives to continuously improve our transport operations, processes, customer service and reduce/optimize the overall freight cost envelope;
  • Oversee custom clearance operations for imports and exports for both Canada and USA and provide needed paperwork;
  • Create and maintain measurable performance metrics (KPI’S) for inbound and outbound transportation activities;
  • Lead the implementation of all logistics and shipping/receiving changes, policies and procedures; 
  • Recruit, train, manage and coach a team;
  • Oversee investigations and resolution of clients and shippers complaints.

Knowledge and skills required

  • +5yrs experience in logistics operations, shipping/receiving and/or warehouse operations; 
  • Understanding of import & export shipping procedures and customs a strong asset; 
  • A post-secondary degree, certificate, diploma or equivalent, concentration in transportation logistics, operations or similar as an asset;
  • Excellent communication skills in French and English, both written and verbal;
  • Detail-oriented and great multitasking skills with the ability to prioritize;
  • Able to analyze data, utilize problem-solving skills, and recommend solutions;
  • At ease with technology and cloud base tools, as well as strong knowledge of word processing and spreadsheet software;
  • Outgoing, sociable and energized by people interactions;
  • Works well as part of a team, at ease working with remote teams.

Benefits

  • Rocketing growth – yours and ours. With Hart Print, there are lots of opportunities for personal and professional development. That's because we believe in developing, investing, and promoting from within!
  • Great company culture: We are inclusive, collaborative and dynamic. Come work in a casual setting with great people.
  • Rest and work/life balance: 3 weeks paid vacation, paid sick days and personal time. 
  • Benefits after 3 month, coverage up to 80%
  • Company sponsored RRSP & TFSA
  • Company sponsored health support plan
  • OPUS all year long 
  • Individual training, career development and planning

title: Logistics Manager / Gestionnaire de la logistique
description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be Earth's most Customer-centric Company and Earth's Best Employer. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build and expand the Cloud in Canada, this is your chance to make history.

Amazon is looking to hire a Logistics Manager to support our data centers. The Logistics Manager oversees the life cycle of the incoming and outgoing IT components that are used in our systems to provide Customers with services from our Data Centers. They manage a small team of Logistics Associates and scale the team to meet business demands at multiple sites within a single region. The Logistics Manager reviews Data Center inventory, in-bound and out-bound shipments and keeps-up with our ongoing demand to ensure proper stock levels are maintained to support build and repair activities in all locations. Working with Data Center Managers, they create plans to optimize the flow of parts through the inventory and asset life cycle; tracking inventory location, movement, age, and turns. They work closely with Data Center Operations Technicians and Data Center Engineers to fulfill parts quickly and accurately and assure the business is never constrained due to missing or damaged spare parts. They make sure that their team works well with Procurement and Hardware Engineering to purchase new parts and interfaces with vendors to process RMAs and receive replacements. They are responsible for accurate data entry and resolving questions from peer organizations. The ideal Logistics Manager will dive deep into data to understand everything about the Data Center asset life cycle.

This position requires that the candidate selected obtain and maintain an active Reliability Status security clearance with the Government of Canada.

Chez Amazon, nous nous efforçons d’être l’entreprise la plus axée sur le client et le meilleur employer au monde. Pour y arriver, nous avons besoin de personnes exceptionnellement talentueuses, brillantes et motivées. Si vous souhaitez nous aider à construire et à développer le Cloud au Canada, c’est votre chance de faire l’histoire.

Amazon recrute actuellement un gestionnaire de la logistique pour rejoindre l’équipe d’exploitation de nos centres de données. Le gestionnaire de la logistique supervise la gestion d’entrée et de sortie des composants informatiques utilisés dans nos systèmes pour offrir aux clients les services de nos centres de données. Il gère une petite équipe d’assistants en logistique et l’agrandit pour répondre à la demande opérationnelle de plusieurs sites au sein d’une même région. Le gestionnaire de la logistique contrôle l’inventaire du centre de données, les livraisons entrantes et sortantes, et s’assure que les stocks sont maintenus à des niveaux appropriés pour soutenir les activités de construction et de réparation dans tous les établissements. En collaboration avec les gestionnaires de centre de données, il est responsable de l’élaboration de plans visant à optimiser le mouvement des pièces tout au long du cycle de vie de l’inventaire et des biens, en suivant l’emplacement, les mouvements, l’âge et la rotation des stocks. Il travaille en étroite collaboration avec les techniciens et les ingénieurs du centre de données pour s’assurer que les pièces de rechange manquantes ou endommagées n’entravent pas les activités de l’entreprise et que les pièces de rechange sont disponibles rapidement et sans erreur. Il travaille avec les services d’approvisionnement et d’ingénierie matérielle pour acheter et recevoir directement des fournisseurs de nouvelles pièces et interfaces, puis s’occupe des autorisations de retour d’articles (RMA) et reçoit les pièces de rechange. Il est responsable de la saisie exacte des données et de la résolution des questions des organisations homologues. Le gestionnaire idéal de la logistique analysera les données pour comprendre le cycle de vie des actifs du centre de données.

Ce poste exige que le candidat sélectionné obtienne et conserve une cote de sécurité active du statut de fiabilité auprès du gouvernement du Canada.

A day in the life

About The Hiring Group

Job responsibilities


Basic Qualifications
  • A Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 5+ years logistics experience.
  • 3+years of experience training and managing people and a team.
  • 1+ years of experience dealing with freight haulers, overnight shippers, and air freighters.
  • 2+ years of experience with inventory management
  • Ability to prioritize in a complex, fast-paced environment
  • Must have the ability to read/write/speak/communicate fluently (English) with respect to complex technical instructions and concepts.
Compétences De Base
  • Baccalauréat, ou une expérience et un niveau d’éducation équivalents;
  • Plus de 5 ans d’expérience en logistique;
  • Plus de 3 ans d’expérience de formation et de gestion de personnes et d’équipes;
  • Plus d’un an d’expérience dans le domaine des transporteurs de marchandises, des expéditeurs de nuit et des transporteurs aériens;
  • Plus de 2 ans d’expérience dans la gestion des stocks;
  • Être en mesure d’établir les priorités dans un environnement complexe et rapide;
  • Capacité à lire, écrire, parler et communiquer aisément en anglais en utilisant des instructions et des concepts techniques complexes.
Preferred Qualifications
  • 3+ years of Data Center experience
  • Ability to provide after-hours support as needed.
  • Bilingual in French and English. Ability to read and speak/communicate in French is considered an asset.
Compétences souhaitables
  • Au moins 3 ans d’expérience de travail en centre de données.
  • Possibilité de fournir un soutien en dehors des heures de travail au besoin.
  • Bilinguisme (français et anglais). Capacité à lire, à écrire et à communiquer en français est un atout.

Company - Amazon Data Services CAN, Inc.

title: Planners
description:
PLANNER

RST Industries Limited and Sunbury Transport Limited are leading carriers utilizing the most advanced technology to deliver world class transportation services throughout North America. We offer a wide range of creative transportation solutions; specializing in chemicals, petroleum, bulk, flatbed, van and food grade products.

Sunbury Transport is currently seeking a highly motivated individual to fill the role of Planner located in Saint John, NB.

Qualifications
  • Education Required: Bachelor's Degree in Business; concentration in Supply Chain or Logistics considered an asset
  • Years of Experience Required: 2-5 years work experience; Transportation and/or Logistics experience considered an asset
  • Computer software skills are essential; experience working with ERP systems considered an asset
  • Superior organizational, decision-making and problem-solving abilities
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Team-oriented and results-driven
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be committed to quality, safety, and service
  • Must be available for weekends on-call
Key Responsibilities
  • Plan and coordinate all loads and equipment with Fleet Managers
  • Coordinate with Customer Service and Dispatch on all commitments (i.e. meeting volume metrics, exceeding the needs of our customers, completing driver requirements)
  • Ensure maximum utilization on all equipment (trucks, trailers, satellite, etc.); tracking trailers to ensure customer needs are met
  • Coordinate trailer maintenance; ensuring property damage is thoroughly investigated and reported
To Apply For This Career Opportunity

Please apply online by _____.

We appreciate your interest in our company however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

To learn more about our products and services, click here.

Sunbury Transport is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

Additional Information
  • Posting Date: Apr 13, 2022

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Summary

The Logistics Manager has a key role in ensuring that products are received, verified, stored, and transported to the sales floor or in the warehouse in a safe and efficient manner. Associates are also responsible for keeping the warehouse neat, tidy, and well maintained. This position includes a lot of lifting and carrying.

Responsibilities & Tasks

Customer Service
  • Provides the team with the necessary supporting processes to enhance the overall customer experience within the store through:
    • Maintaining housekeeping disciplines in the warehouse in order to facilitate location of products by all staff.
    • Responding to and handling customer and staff inquiries, requests, and concerns in a timely manner.
Operations
  • Receives, scans, verifies, and stores all incoming and overstock products according to established procedures and policies.
  • Ships returns and completes proper paperwork.
  • Reconciles inventory differences.
  • Prepares merchandise for filing, sorts and fills merchandise carts for the retail floor.
  • Is responsible for garbage disposal, cardboard recycling, and the disposal of broken products in accordance with store policy.
  • Processes damaged and returned claims.
  • Repairs broken packages as needed.
  • Reports stolen and damaged goods to Management.
  • Operates computer and scanning tools, and enters all relevant coding in Canadian Tire systems.
  • Handles dangerous goods and hazardous products according to established procedures.
  • Plays an active role in the warehouse team by openly sharing opinions and ideas on how to improve the warehouse, and by participating in meetings and all training as required.
  • Engages in learning activities and listens to feedback to improve their own abilities.
  • Complies with company, store, and warehouse policies.
  • Abides by all health and safety programs and regulations. Reports any observed or potential hazards immediately.
  • Uses professional language and maintains a professional appearance (e.g., uniform, hygiene, grooming and name tag) when interacting with others.
  • Completes other tasks, as required.
Requirements
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Basic math and computer skills.
  • Ability to work in other areas of the store is an asset.
  • Certification in operating warehouse equipment is an asset.
  • Work experience in a warehouse/distribution environment, in a Canadian Tire store, is also considered an asset.
Required Skills & Abilities

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following competencies:
  • Strong belief in the Canadian Tire Values of honesty, integrity, and respect.
  • Results-oriented individual.
  • Effective written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to complete detail oriented retail tasks according to instructions and to demonstrate responsibility for outcomes.
  • Ability to work in a team environment that provides assistance and support to co-workers to achieve common goals.
  • Ability to resolve retail and/or customer issues.
  • Ability to adapt and cope with challenging and changing situations.
  • Positive attitude, punctuality, and solid work ethic.
POTENTIAL CAREER OPPORTUNITIES
  • Next levels: Merchandiser, Supervisor, Warehouse Manager and Promotions Manager.
  • Other retail, customer service and management opportunities in a large network of more than 485 Canadian Tire stores across the country.
  • Career opportunities across the larger Canadian Tire family (Canadian Tire Petroleum, PartSource, Mark’s, FGL Sports Ltd, Canadian Tire Corporation Limited, and Canadian Tire Financial Services).
PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORKING CONDITIONS

In compliance with the store’s Health and Safety Policies and Procedures:
  • Standing/walking for 8 hours.
  • Lifting and/or carrying of merchandise items, as required, on a regular, frequent and unassisted basis. Merchandise items may vary in weight from “light” to “heavy”.
  • Lifting and turning repeatedly throughout the shift.
  • Lifting and twisting above the shoulder, from the floor to shoulder, and floor to waist.
  • Ability to go up and down a ladder and stairs while carrying merchandise.
  • Walking and carrying things at the same time and pushing/pulling, as required.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
Job Seekers can review the Job Applicant Privacy Policy by clicking HERE.

You are the driving force behind our company.

Start your career with Ryder today!

Summary

We are seeking a Logistics Manager to work with drivers, managers, and dispatchers over multiple accounts.

You will be the leader, planner, and problem solver for close to 100 employees.

Why Ryder?
  • A Fortune 500 company that is noted for its top notch treatment of its staff.
  • A corporate support system for payroll, HR, training, and recruiting.
  • RRSP, Stock Options, and a COMPANY PAID PENSION PLAN
  • Brand new PTO policy: available immediately.
  • Health benefits after 30 days.
  • Weekly pay with direct deposit
Essential Functions
  • Interface directly with the customer to ensure issues are resolved in a timely manner while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction.
  • Strategic operational planning and execution for the operation.
  • Identify and/or solve operational issues with the account(s) by implementing continuous improvement and LEAN initiatives, to strengthen team unity, goals, productivity and results.
  • Hire, supervise, develop and manage performance for employees and maintain a positive employee relations environment at assigned account(s).
  • Maintain open and effective communications within the work group(s) and with other work groups within the organization. Review data, identify and implement necessary actions as required.
  • May manage the profit and loss statements based on the complexity and scope of the organization.
  • Lead a proactive safety program within the work group(s) consistent with company policy in order to provide a safe and secure work environment. Instruct and enforce location safety management plans, training and processes. Monitor the maintenance of equipment for assigned work group(s) by using checklists and observations as required.
Additional Responsibilities
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
Skills And Abilities
  • Excellent problem solving skills.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated leadership capabilities.
  • Ability to create and maintain professional relationships within all levels of the organization (peers, work groups, customers, supervisors).
  • Ability to work independently and as member of a team.
  • Flexibility to operate and self-driven to excel in a fast-paced environment.
  • Capable of multi-tasking, highly organized, with excellent time management skills.
  • Detail oriented with excellent follow-up practices.
  • Strong organization, analytical, and computer skills.
  • Ability to create and develop an inclusive and engaged work environment.
  • Ability to effectively manage Profit & Loss statements may be necessary depending on the complexity and scope of the operation (preferred).
Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree required in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, or a minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience.
  • Master's degree preferred in Business, Logistics, or Supply Chain.
  • Five (5) years or more in Supply Chain, Logistics, warehouse or industry related field required.
  • Three (3) years or more Supervisory experience required.
  • Two (2) years or more Profit & Loss experience preferred.
  • Two (2) years or more Application experience of Lean principles, systems and tools required.
Travel: 0-10%

DOT Regulated: No

Description Du Poste

Le titulaire de ce poste est responsable de la supervision directe des opérations assignées dans l'environnement de gestion de la distribution. Il s'assure de la conformité aux politiques, aux procédures et aux instructions de travail des services et de l'entreprise afin de fournir un environnement de travail sécuritaire et productif, un service à la clientèle optimal et des dossiers exacts

Le titulaire de ce poste est responsable de mener, d'orienter, de former et de diriger les chefs d'équipe, les superviseurs de la logistique clientèle (SLC), les gestionnaires de la logistique clientèle (GLC) et/ou les gestionnaires de la logistique (GL). Le titulaire de ce poste travaille directement avec les gestionnaires, les superviseurs et les employés à salaire horaire, et peut interagir avec le client et/ou a une responsabilité à l'égard des profits et des pertes en fonction de la complexité et de la taille de l'organisation

Tous les travaux sont soumis à une vérification par les gestionnaires de la logistique de groupe (GLG) ou les directeurs de la logistique clientèle (DLC), et les responsables des processus d'affaires de Ryder, comme les finances, les ressources humaines, la sécurité, etc. Une erreur pourrait entraîner l'insatisfaction des clients, la perte de stocks, la perte de profits, la sécurité ou un incident

Responsabilités

Interagir directement avec le client pour s'assurer que les problèmes sont résolus en temps opportun tout en maintenant un haut niveau de satisfaction client

Planification opérationnelle stratégique et mise en œuvre pour l’exploitation

Déceler et/ou résoudre les problèmes opérationnels avec le ou les comptes grâce à la mise en œuvre d’un processus d’amélioration continue et des initiatives de gestion allégée afin de consolider l'unité, les objectifs, la productivité et les résultats de l’équipe

Embaucher, superviser, perfectionner et gérer le rendement des employés et maintenir un environnement favorisant des relations positives avec les employés pour le ou les comptes assignés

Maintenir l'ouverture et l'efficacité des communications au sein du ou des groupes de travail et d'autres groupes de travail au sein de l'organisation. Examiner les données, trouver et mettre en œuvre les mesures nécessaires, au besoin

Possibilité de gérer le compte de profits et de pertes en fonction de la complexité et de la portée de l'organisation

Diriger un programme de sécurité proactif conforme à la politique de l'entreprise au sein du ou des groupes de travail en vue de fournir un milieu de travail sûr et sécuritaire. Enseigner et mettre en œuvre des plans, de la formation et des processus liés à la gestion de la sécurité de l'établissement. Surveiller l'entretien de l'équipement pour le ou les groupes de travail assignés à l’aide de listes de vérification et des observations, au besoin

Exigences

Baccalauréat affaires, logistique, chaîne d’approvisionnement ou minimum de 8 années d'expérience pertinente

Maîtrise affaires, logistique, ou chaîne d’approvisionnement

Cinq (5) ans et plus affaires, logistique, chaîne d’approvisionnement ou minimum de 8 années d'expérience pertinente

Trois (3) ans ou plus d'expérience en supervision

Deux 2 ans ou plus expérience dans les profits et les pertes {de préférence}

Deux 2 ans ou plus expérience pratique des principes, des systèmes et des outils de gestion allégée

Excellentes compétences en résolution de problèmes.

Excellentes compétences en communications orales et écrites avec des capacités reconnues de leadership

Capacité de créer et d’entretenir des relations professionnelles au sein de tous les niveaux de l’entreprise (collègues, groupes de travail, clients, superviseurs)

Capacité à travailler indépendamment et en tant que membre d'une équipe

Souplesse de fonctionnement et forte motivation d’exceller dans un environnement au rythme rapide

Capable d’effectuer plusieurs tâches en même temps, très bien organisé, avec d’excellentes compétences en gestion du temps

Minutieux avec d'excellentes pratiques de suivi

Fortes compétences en organisation, analyse et informatique

Capacité de créer et développer un environnement de travail inclusif et engagé

La capacité de gérer efficacement les pertes et les profits peut être nécessaire selon la complexité et la portée de l'opération (de préférence)

La capacité de gérer efficacement les pertes et les profits peut être nécessaire selon la complexité et la portée de l'opération (Intermédiaire level)

Connaissance des systèmes de gestion d'entrepôt (Intermédiaire level, de préférence)

Connaissance de l’équipement de manutention des matériaux (EMM) peut être nécessaire en fonction du poste (Intermédiaire level, de préférence)

Connaissance d’OSHA (Intermédiaire level.

Connaissance des normes du DOT/MdT possiblement e, selon le compte (Intermédiaire level, de préférence)

title: Planner, Bus Priority
description:
TransLink is looking for skilled, motivated transportation planners or engineers to join TransLink’s Bus Priority Programs team as a Planner.

The Bus Priority Programs team is responsible for planning, conceptual design, and funding of bus priority measures ranging in scale from individual hotspot treatments to full corridors. We are a team of planners, engineers, data scientists, project coordinators, and public affairs staff.


The Planner will develop small-to-medium scale plans and projects for the Bus Speed and Reliability (BSR) Program. The BSR team program focuses on strategic placement of bus bulbs, queue jumps, signal improvements, and bus lanes to help buses get through the most congested streets. The work involves data analysis, conceptual design, and stakeholder engagement.


Experience with bus priority measures, street design, and collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams, consultants, and municipal partners are assets for the Planner position.


RESPONSIBILITIES


This role Provides transportation planning expertise and leadership to projects of smaller/medium scope in support of a designated program related to transportation policy, forecasting, infrastructure/service development in an integrated multi-modal environment.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES


  • Contributes transportation planning expertise and leadership to the development of program strategies, plans, and tactics and to designated projects.


  • Develops transportation planning methods, techniques, and models in support of designated program and project deliverables, ensuring compliance with department standards, policies, and procedures.


  • Contributes as a member of a program team, providing transportation planning expertise and identifying planning and project risks and opportunities based on analysis of transport data, trends, and issues. Alerts Senior Transportation Planner and Manager to critical issues.


  • Collaborates with leaders and professionals across the organization, with a view to optimizing planning services and project outcomes.


  • Researches and analyzes transportation data, trends, and issues. Develops technical reports and delivers presentations for both internal and external stakeholders.


  • Develops and manages relationships with stakeholders to understand needs, maintain communication, and resolve moderate issues within defined limits. Provides technical support and advice to municipal/provincial working teams and advisory committees.


  • Provides work direction to contractors and consultants and monitors contract compliance.


  • Provides technical guidance to junior planning staff where applicable.


QUALIFICATIONS


Education and Experience:


The competencies for this position are typically acquired through a Master's degree in Planning, Engineering, or a related discipline, plus 3 years' experience providing expertise and leading projects in an agency specializing in planning or transportation.


Other Requirements:


  • Sound knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts, and practices of transportation planning.


  • Basic knowledge of plans, products, roles, and responsibilities of government agencies, NGOs, and associations.


  • Sound knowledge of Translink's decision-making context including its strategic context and organizational and governance structure.


  • Solid leadership skills with the ability to provide technical guidance and expertise to other transportation planning professionals and to lead projects.


  • Solid analytical skills including the ability to identify and communicate transportation planning and project-related risks and opportunities in an integrated, multi-disciplinary environment; includes skills to analyze transport data, trends, and issues.


  • Solid communication skills including the ability to write and deliver well-prepared reports and presentations.


  • Solid interpersonal skills including the ability to build trust by consulting with others and applying a team approach as needed to achieve solutions. Includes negotiation skills as they pertain to making refinements to contracts and to conflict resolution at a basic level of risk and complexity.


  • Solid decision-making skills including the ability to resolve transportation planning and project-related issues within defined limits, and to identify and know when to refer issues to others.


WORK DESIGNATION

Hybrid

This is a full-time temporary position for 36 months (3 years)


RATE OF PAY

Salary starting from $71,327 per annum


The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.


OTHER INFORMATION

TransLink is looking for skilled, motivated transportation planners or engineers to join TransLink’s Bus Priority Programs team as a Planner.


The Bus Priority Programs team is responsible for planning, conceptual design, and funding of bus priority measures ranging in scale from individual hotspot treatments to full corridors. We are a team of planners, engineers, data scientists, project coordinators, and public affairs staff.


The Planner will develop small-to-medium scale plans and projects for the Bus Speed and Reliability (BSR) Program. The BSR team program focuses on strategic placement of bus bulbs, queue jumps, signal improvements, and bus lanes to help buses get through the most congested streets. The work involves data analysis, conceptual design, and stakeholder engagement.


Experience with bus priority measures, street design, and collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams, consultants, and municipal partners are assets for the Planner position.


COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy

To support public health, and protect the health and safety of our employees, customers, and their families, TransLink employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will need to provide proof of full vaccination status in compliance with the employer’s COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy.


Accommodations may be applicable under the BC Human Rights Code. Should an applicant be unable to provide proof of full vaccination and should accommodation be requested, additional information will be required to determine whether the individual is entitled to be accommodated.


Equal Employment Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating and supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is free of all forms of discrimination. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds, skills and perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us.


HOW TO APPLY

Please click the apply button or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

title: Analyst, Global Supply Chain
description:
Horizon Recruitment is recruiting an Analyst, Global Supply Chain for our enterprise client downtown Vancouver with an excellent reputation and fantastic long-term career opportunity. The Analyst will be conducting analysis in support of global supply chain decisions, including transport movements, target inventory levels and purchase requirements over a 120-day planning horizon. Analysis includes comparison of cost and risk for various tactical decisions keeping in mind: security of supply, low cost, and value creation. This position also is responsible to support all reporting activities related to the Global Supply Chain function, including weekly supply/demand balances, inventory reports, vessel tracking, cost management reports, KPIs, etc. The Global Supply Chain Analyst provides back-up for the Global Supply Chain Planner and therefore must work closely and communicate effectively with the Global Tactical Planning Team. This position is also a key contact for any IT related projects impacting the Global Supply Chain function.

Requirements
  • A university degree, preferably in an associated discipline (i.e. accounting, engineering, business administration, operations).
  • 1-3 years’ participation in multi-regional teams (within context of a globally operated business is preferable)
  • 1-3 years’ experience in international supply chain and logistics or other technically relevant field.
  • Ability to identify and deliver value-added cross-functional strategies and processes that deliver competitive advantage in cost, quality of service, people and environment.
  • Understanding of the dynamics of a global commodity business that influences supply/demand and cost.
  • Learn and have insight about the internal customer to achieve continuous improvement.
  • Experience with Demand and Supply Chain Planning software would be an asset.
  • Must have strong computer skills in desktop applications (Excel, Word, MS Project, Access).
Responsibilities
  • Reporting weekly Supply/Demand update, Terminal Inventory Report, Tactical Plan
  • Develop and update cost management reports
  • Monthly Global Supply Chain report, inventory reconciliation for Corporate Finance, Operations Plan, sales forecast
  • Develop and update KPIs related to the Global Supply Chain function
  • Supports Senior Business Analyst with delivery of strategic reporting and analysis as required
  • Tactical Planning & Support
  • Analyze global supply (Manufacturing plants, off-takes, global swaps, spot purchases)/demand balances with the objective of identifying trends, areas of risk, and potential improvements.
  • Maintain effective communications with key stakeholders to ensure timely sharing of high-quality information on which to make decisions.
  • Communicate closely with shipping to ensure decisions impacting transport movements are properly reflected in tactical planning analyses.
  • Assists in the management of short-term operational issues when required. Act as back-up to the Global Supply Chain Planner.
IT Projects
  • Team’s key contact for all IT Initiatives related to or impacting Global Supply Chain function
  • Synthesizes and communicates key business requirements to technical team
  • Keeps Global Supply Chain team informed of project progress and implications
  • Only candidates who are eligible to work in Canada will be considered.**
Horizon Recruitment Inc. is a specialized recruitment and search firm with two complimentary practice areas: Finance & Supply Chain.
