title: Gestionnaire de la Logistique / Logistics Manager (On Demand Last Mile)
description:
Marché Goodfood (TSX: FOOD) est un service d'épicerie en ligne de premier plan au Canada, offrant des solutions de repas frais qui permettent aux membres, d'un océan à l'autre, de savourer chaque semaine de délicieux repas à la maison. La mission de Goodfood est de faire de l'impossible une réalité, de la ferme à la cuisine, en permettant aux membres de planifier leurs repas hebdomadaires et de faire leur épicerie en quelques minutes. Les membres de Goodfood ont accès à une sélection unique de produits en ligne ainsi qu'à des prix exclusifs rendus possibles grâce à son écosystème de classe mondiale de traitement des commandes qui sont livrées directement au consommateur. Goodfood compte actuellement plus de 300 000 membres actifs et plus de 3 800 employés dévoués et passionnés à travers le Canada.

Nous recherchons un/une Gestionnaire de la Logistique, passionné (e) par le secteur de l'alimentation, ainsi que motivé (e) de se joindre à notre équipe de logistique et de l'aider à passer au niveau supérieur. Sous la responsabilité du Directeur Logistique, vous dirigerez le développement de la chaîne logistique pour le transport des marchandises périssables et non périssables. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'établissement de relations clés avec les partenaires logistiques et la mise en place des réseaux logistiques appropriés pour garantir que toutes les expéditions de Goodfood sont reçues à temps, intégralement et au coût le plus compétitif.

Compétences Et Capacités
  • Expérience de la distribution de commerce en ligne
  • Expérience en management d'équipe
  • À l'aise avec un horaire flexible et capable de prendre en charge des opérations commerciales critiques, y compris les fins de semaine et les jours fériés
  • Souci du détail - Vous possédez de solides compétences organisationnelles et démontrez constamment une approche méthodique pour éliminer toutes les erreurs dans votre travail.
  • À l'aise dans Excel - Vous avez la possibilité de traiter rapidement les données dans les feuilles de calcul (RechercheV et tableaux croisés dynamiques au minimum) et les outils existants ; vous êtes à l'aise pour apprendre de nouvelles technologies.
  • Être fier et s'approprier — quelqu'un qui est extrêmement fier et s'approprie les activités qu'il gère quotidiennement
  • Orienté vers le service et les résultats - Vous êtes compétent pour identifier, résoudre ou escalader les défis logistiques et possédez un parti pris pour faire avancer les choses et obtenir des résultats tout en travaillant en équipe
  • Capacité a prioriser efficacement, à effectuer plusieurs tâches et à gérer facilement le stress
  • Excellents aptitudes à la communication en français et en anglais (oral et écrit)
Les Atouts
  • Expérience avec Python, SQL, API, Looker, SIG et autres outils sont un atout
  • Une passion pour le commerce en ligne, la logistique, la chaîne d'approvisionnement et la technologie
POURQUOI GOODFOOD?

Ce Que Nous Avons à Offrir à Nos Employés
  • Assurance collective compétitive;
  • Des journées personnelles;
  • Crédit annuel de remise en forme;
  • Programme d'options d'achat d'actions pour les employés et plus!
We are looking to recruit an ambitious operations-focused individual in a dynamic supply chain role as an Logistics Manager in Montreal on Goodfood's new On Demand Logistics Team. As an operational leader, you are at the front-lines of Goodfood's on demand grocery delivery effort, and you will be responsible for managing and developing a team that ensures on-demand orders are delivered on-time and cost effectively.

This role requires the ability to balance daily execution and the implementation of Goodfood's last mile strategy. The Manager of Logistics is responsible for overseeing a team of Logistics Supervisors and Dispatchers who oversee cross-functional planning, route optimization and dispatch of last-mile activities in Montreal. This role includes people management, process development, and project implementation: all with the objective of exceeding the delivery promise made to each of our Members.

Position - Areas of Responsibility
  • Ensure on-time delivery of hundreds of boxes per day through coordination with drivers, fulfillment, and Logistics teams
  • Lead the day-to-day operations of a team of Logistics Specialists and Coordinators, and set clear expectations for them by regularly measuring performance, sharing feedback and coaching
  • Own on-time and cost KPIs by holding your team accountable to results and managing appropriately
  • Gain alignment across key stakeholders and operationalize cross functional initiatives
  • Lead planning and execution of strategic initiatives required to maintain the company's rapid growth
  • Act as a subject matter expert for Goodfood's final mile network in the local area and provide guidance on optimal routes and distribution strategies
  • Govern the implementation and adherence of operational SOPs for
  • Implement continuous improvement projects and share ideas that drive efficiencies, best practices, and cost savings across shifts and the delivery network
Requirements
  • KPI fixated leader and manager - You have experience coaching and keeping colleagues and direct reports accountable to high standards through continuous feedback, experience with or deep understanding of a P+L
  • Fluent in Excel (or any other tool) - You have a proven ability to develop creative solutions with existing tools and are comfortable learning new technologies
  • Nimble and resilient — You have the ability to manage projects while handling changing priorities and use good judgment in stressful situations
  • Team builder— You have previous success interviewing, hiring, conducting performance management, developing, and terminating employees to build and maintain an all-star team
  • Detail oriented - You possess strong organizational skills and consistently demonstrate a methodical approach to all your work
  • A natural communicator - structured and strategic mindset; ability to break down complex problems and deliver insights & recommendations to key stakeholders
Cultural Fit
  • Customer obsessed and willing to do whatever it takes to ensure an excellent Member experience
  • Ownership mentality that drives a get-it-done culture for you and your team
  • Commercial mindset with an understanding of what to do in order to be profitable and successful while serving all Goodfood members
  • Resourceful leader who can think out of the box and leverage multiple teams to drive innovation in an ambiguous problem space
Comfortable working a non-standard schedule where needed to best align with critical business operations including weekends and holidays

Why Goodfood?

Our team strives to give our members a world class customer experience. We believe in being ambassadors of the brand to make the impossible come true from farm to table!

What We Have To Offer Our Employees
  • Competitive Group Insurance;
  • Personal No Questions asked days;
  • Annual bonus program;
  • Annual fitness credit;
  • Annual Goodfood credit;
  • Employee share purchase plan;
  • Employee STM program & more!

title: Logistics Manager - with Great Benefits
description:
We are on the lookout for an expert Logistics Manager to join our all-star team at Canadian Tire - Riverview (Store #691) in Riverview, NB.

Growing your career as a Full Time Logistics Manager is a terrific opportunity to develop exceptional skills.

If you are strong in planning, persuasion and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Logistics Manager at Canadian Tire - Riverview (Store #691) today!

Summary

The Logistics Manager has a key role in ensuring that products are received, verified, stored, and transported to the sales floor or in the warehouse in a safe and efficient manner. Associates are also responsible for keeping the warehouse neat, tidy, and well maintained. This position includes a lot of lifting and carrying.

Responsibilities & Tasks

Customer Service
  • Provides the team with the necessary supporting processes to enhance the overall customer experience within the store through:
    • Maintaining housekeeping disciplines in the warehouse in order to facilitate location of products by all staff.
    • Responding to and handling customer and staff inquiries, requests, and concerns in a timely manner.
Operations
  • Receives, scans, verifies, and stores all incoming and overstock products according to established procedures and policies.
  • Ships returns and completes proper paperwork.
  • Reconciles inventory differences.
  • Prepares merchandise for filing, sorts and fills merchandise carts for the retail floor.
  • Is responsible for garbage disposal, cardboard recycling, and the disposal of broken products in accordance with store policy.
  • Processes damaged and returned claims.
  • Repairs broken packages as needed.
  • Reports stolen and damaged goods to Management.
  • Operates computer and scanning tools, and enters all relevant coding in Canadian Tire systems.
  • Handles dangerous goods and hazardous products according to established procedures.
  • Plays an active role in the warehouse team by openly sharing opinions and ideas on how to improve the warehouse, and by participating in meetings and all training as required.
  • Engages in learning activities and listens to feedback to improve their own abilities.
  • Complies with company, store, and warehouse policies.
  • Abides by all health and safety programs and regulations. Reports any observed or potential hazards immediately.
  • Uses professional language and maintains a professional appearance (e.g., uniform, hygiene, grooming and name tag) when interacting with others.
  • Completes other tasks, as required.
Requirements
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Basic math and computer skills.
  • Ability to work in other areas of the store is an asset.
  • Certification in operating warehouse equipment is an asset.
  • Work experience in a warehouse/distribution environment, in a Canadian Tire store, is also considered an asset.
Required Skills & Abilities

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following competencies:
  • Strong belief in the Canadian Tire Values of honesty, integrity, and respect.
  • Results-oriented individual.
  • Effective written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to complete detail oriented retail tasks according to instructions and to demonstrate responsibility for outcomes.
  • Ability to work in a team environment that provides assistance and support to co-workers to achieve common goals.
  • Ability to resolve retail and/or customer issues.
  • Ability to adapt and cope with challenging and changing situations.
  • Positive attitude, punctuality, and solid work ethic.
POTENTIAL CAREER OPPORTUNITIES
  • Next levels: Merchandiser, Supervisor, Warehouse Manager and Promotions Manager.
  • Other retail, customer service and management opportunities in a large network of more than 485 Canadian Tire stores across the country.
  • Career opportunities across the larger Canadian Tire family (Canadian Tire Petroleum, PartSource, Mark’s, FGL Sports Ltd, Canadian Tire Corporation Limited, and Canadian Tire Financial Services).
PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORKING CONDITIONS

In compliance with the store’s Health and Safety Policies and Procedures:
  • Standing/walking for 8 hours.
  • Lifting and/or carrying of merchandise items, as required, on a regular, frequent and unassisted basis. Merchandise items may vary in weight from “light” to “heavy”.
  • Lifting and turning repeatedly throughout the shift.
  • Lifting and twisting above the shoulder, from the floor to shoulder, and floor to waist.
  • Ability to go up and down a ladder and stairs while carrying merchandise.
  • Walking and carrying things at the same time and pushing/pulling, as required.
Company Benefits
  • Excellent benefits
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Competitive salary
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Network Planner
description:
Open up to the Possibilities!

At Purolator, you’ll be proud knowing you’re working for a Canadian company that truly values its employees. And it’s community. This is an exciting and evolving industry and we’re leading the change as we strive to deliver the future. Here you will be empowered to help move the business forward. Each and every day. Are you open to the possibilities?

Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. If you have questions, please feel free to ask during your interview.

Job Description
  • Responsible for planning ground and/or air network routing and schedules based on forecasted and historical data for quarterly and peak planning
  • Coordinate special requirements for Holidays and special shipping programs
  • Forecast, review and schedule maintenance for static and dynamic networks such as the Transportation Management system, AirOps DataBase, and any other related systems accuracy and compliance monitoring
  • Provide accurate volume analysis and reporting on utilization, on time departure and arrival of LH, lane segments, and capacity in order to accommodate potential customer volumes on national and regional networks; and for budget planning
  • Analyze network lane segments and recommend cost saving initiatives for network reroutes while maintaining service
  • Plan and design routing and schedules for Purolator Ground and/or Air networks, including holidays, peak plans, and quarterly operations, for all Purolator’s line of business
  • Communicate planning activities with operations, internal and external customers, vendors, and Purolator management
  • Liaise with internal (Operations) and external customers, and vendors on all holidays, network changes, schedule changes and available capacity
  • Report on variation to plan and carrier performance
  • Create monthly reports for management on network utilization, capacity, and volumes
  • Provide proactive problem solving, re-routes, alternate hub sorts
  • Provide management with costing on network re-routes and charters based on current costing model
  • Work with Ground and Air Operations Teams for network change planning and execution
  • Support Network engineering and capacity planning teams on optimization projects
  • Indirectly lead PM and AM shift coordinators via planning, pre-shift briefing and post shift de-briefing, provide guidance on trip options and recommend actions to improve service, experience or cost
  • Actively involved in budget planning and forecasting on all network costing, routes, and capacity issue
Qualifications
  • Minimum four (4) years of experience in supply chain, logistics and/or transportation planning that includes direct exposure to, or demonstrated working knowledge of: LH transportation planning and scheduling, transportation management systems, forecasting, third party carrier management, LH performance, and load planning.
  • Poses a strong understanding of network distribution principles, practices and systems
  • Operational process management experience
  • Knowledge using Business Intelligence Dashboards
  • Ability to work independently and prioritize multiple tasks while achieving timelines and commitments
  • Advance Microsoft Office: Excel, Access, Word, Outlook, etc.
  • Continuous Improvement approach
POSTING DETAILS

Location: Ontario Hub- 62 Vulcan St. Etobicoke ON M9W 1L2

Hours of Work: 37.5 hours/week (Monday-Friday: 7:00am-3:00pm)

Working Conditions: Warehouse Environment; Office Environment

Reports to: National Transportation Manager

We are aware of a fraudulent website that appears to mimic the Purolator careers page. Official job postings from Purolator are shared on www.purolator.com/careers or https://careers.purolator.com . Please ensure any job applications are made directly on these websites. Please note, Purolator will never ask an applicant to make a financial transaction for equipment as part of its recruitment process.

Purolator is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, Aboriginal/Indigenous status or any other factors considered discriminatory. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

We recognize that our employees and their families are key stakeholders. We will only be successful as a business if we provide our employees with a safe and healthy workplace and we have the right people in the right roles with the support they need to succeed. We hire for attitude and train for skills. To learn more about us and our values, go to www.purolator.com.

At Purolator, every day is an opportunity for our employees to connect with one another and with our customers to help make a positive impact in the communities where we live, work and play.

title: Responsable Logistique et service à la clientèle / Logistics and Customer Care, Lead
description:
Notre client est une startup en pleine croissance dans le domaine de la logistique et du transport ! Fondé en 2020, notre client est une Startup technologique basée à Montréal. Centrée au cœur de lindustrie de la logistique, est une plate-forme pour les entreprises qui expédient des marchandises au Canada et aux États-Unis. Comme pour réserver un hôtel en ligne, les clients choisissent des transporteurs évalués, planifient un ramassage et réservent en ligne.

Our client is a growing startup in logistics and transportation! Founded in 2020, our client is a tech Startup based in Montreal. Centred in the heart of the logistics industry , is a platform for companies shipping freight in Canada and the U.S. Like booking a hotel online, customers choose rated carriers, schedule a pickup and book online

Sengager avec les clients et superviser les opérations logistiques pour les expéditions nécessitant une intervention

Établir et maintenir des relations avec des transporteurs fiables

Adhérer les transporteurs routiers et les clients sur la plateforme SaaS

Négocier les tarifs et aider les utilisateurs à mettre à jour la plateforme avec la disponibilité

Soutenir les utilisateurs lors des transactions initiales sur la plateforme

Gérez les comptes dutilisateurs, les transactions et la facturation via notre portail de service client (CSP) personnalisé

Mettre à jour le statut dexpédition dans le CSP pour déclencher des mises à jour pour les utilisateurs

Communiquer avec les principaux clients tout au long de la durée de la commande et communiquer les événements positifs et négatifs, trouver des solutions pour assurer la satisfaction du client

Maintien des dossiers dexpédition personnels en temps opportun avec précision ; désamorcer les problèmes si nécessaire

Travailler avec le service des ventes pour sassurer que les besoins des clients sont satisfaits et dépassés

Travailler avec une variété de départements pour assurer le bon fonctionnement des opérations

Engage with customers and oversee logistics operations for shipments requiring intervention

Building and maintaining relationships with reliable carriers

Onboard truck carriers and customers onto SaaS platform

Negotiate rates, and support users to update platform with availability

Support users with initial transactions on the platform

Manage user accounts, transactions and billing through our custom-built Customer Service Portal (CSP)

Update shipment status in the CSP to trigger updates to users

Communicating with major customers throughout the duration of the order and communicating both positive and negative occurrences, finding solutions to ensure client satisfaction

Maintenance of personal shipment files in a timely manner with precision; deescalating problems when necessary

Working with the sales department to ensure clients’ needs are met and exceeded

Working with a variety of departments to ensure functioning operations

RequirementsMinimum de 5 ans dexpérience connexe dans la chaîne dapprovisionnement et la logistique

Au moins 3 ans dexpérience de travail direct avec le transport par camion

Excellente connaissance du courtage de chargements de camions, de la négociation des tarifs, du développement des transporteurs, de la planification des ramassages et des livraisons et du suivi des expéditions

Connaissance du système harmonisé (Canada et États-Unis) et être familier avec les procédures et les exigences des entrepôts sous douane

Excellente compréhension des réglementations canadiennes et américaines sur les heures de service

Compréhension approfondie de la sécurité et de la conformité dans le transport

Solides compétences en résolution de conflits

Résolution de problèmes créative et efficace

Bien organisé, enthousiaste, professionnel et un membre déquipe positif

À laise avec les programmes Microsoft Office, Slack, Hubspot (CRM)

Parle couramment langlais et le français

La connaissance des tarifs des transporteurs publics, des classes de fret, des NMFC, des systèmes TMS et des panneaux de chargement est un atout

Une expérience dans la chaîne dapprovisionnement mondiale est un atout

Minimum 5 years of related experience in supply chain & logistics

At least 3 years’ experience working directly with truck transportation

Excellent Knowledge of brokering truckloads, negotiating rates, carrier development, scheduling pickups and deliveries, and tracking shipments

Knowledge of harmonized system (Canada & United States) and be familiar with bonded warehouse procedures and requirements

Excellent understanding of Canadian and US Hours of Service regulations

In depth understanding of safety and compliance in transportation

Strong conflict resolution skills

Creative and effective problem solving

Well-organized, enthusiastic, professional and a positive team member

Comfortable with Microsoft Office programs, Slack, Hubspot (CRM)

Fluent in English and French

Familiarity with common carrier tariffs, freight classes, NMFCs, TMS systems and Load Boards is an asset

Experience in global supply chain is an asset

BenefitsUn environnement dynamique. Lorsque vous vous sentez comblé, nous faisons notre travail et respectons notre engagement envers vous. Nous offrons des horaires de travail flexibles et du travail à distance en plus davoir un bureau au centre-ville de Montréal lorsque vous souhaitez travailler dans un environnement plus collaboratif.

Travailler pour une start-up peut être très difficile, mais aussi très gratifiant. ils partagent les défis et les succès. Pour vous, cela signifie laccès à des responsabilités et à une ancienneté à croissance rapide au sein de lentreprise ainsi que des primes

Salaire compétitif entre 55-70k

A great environment in which to do it. When you feel fulfilled, we are doing our job and meeting our commitment to you. We offer flexible work schedules and remote work in addition to having an office in downtown Montréal for when you want to work in a more collaborative environment.

Working for a start-up can be very challenging, but also highly rewarding. they share in challenges and successes. For you, this means access to rapid growing responsibilities and seniority within the company as well as bonuses

Competitive salary between 55-70k

title: OPE/Network Planner
description:
Emplacement Du Poste

Vaughan

État/Province

Ontario

The OPE Planner will coordinate and oversee numerous projects, located in multiple locations. He/she will continually monitor costs and job progress to ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget. The Project Planner will be required to consult with resources in the engineering and/or construction departments and is expected to work closely with the associate managers, consultants, design engineers and construction contractors to ensure that the needs of the company are being met, delivering Cable and Structure Placement project functions from project setup to project completion, along with supporting the Rogers OPE department.

Responsibilities
  • Provide technical support for new designs, including participation in new design planning;
  • Provide administrative management and planning of the fiber optic network; system being utilized for design and construction of the fiber network;
  • Engage cross functional teams to ensure collaborative integrated planning and execution;
  • Ensure engineering/design activities comply with company and contract requirements and support overall construction schedule;
  • Plan the layout of cabling routes from device to device. Coordinate efforts across multiple platforms to ensure compatibility and integration of the systems;
  • Coordinate with the professional services firm(s) to assure completeness and correctness of design and construction documents;
  • Ensure that engineering deliverables are compatible with client’s requirements;
  • Any and all other duties as assigned in order to meet Company objectives.
Requirements
  • Civil Engineering Technology or other related discipline;
  • Experience in Civil construction an asset;
  • 3-5 years’ experience in Telephony/CATV or related fields;
  • Thorough Understanding of Telecommunications/CATV industry and principals;
  • Proficient in SpatialNET and AutoCAD;
  • Excellent leadership, customer relations and communications skills;
  • Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite of products;
  • Strong analytical skills;
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Problem-solving Skills
  • Able to operate effectively in a fast-paced, changing and highly energetic environment;
  • Ability to work under pressure in meeting project deadlines;
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team environment;
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities.
About Telecon Group

Founded in 1967, Telecon is Canada’s leading telecommunication network infrastructure services provider. The company leverages its national presence, thousands of skilled professionals, client relationships and more than 50-year history to offer industry-leading design, locate, infrastructure and connectivity solutions to telecommunication companies and corporate clients nationwide. Depending on the region and the type of work to be performed, Telecon operates under one of the following brands: Telecon, Telecon Design, AGIR Consultants, Promark-Telecon, Expercom, Chemco-Telecon Infrastructure, Telecon Entreprises, Marcomm, Plexus, Unified Systems Group, SC360, Questzones and TRJ Telecom. For more information on Telecon, visit www.telecon.com/

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Telecon Group welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection

Coordinate efforts across multiple platforms to ensure compatibility and integration of the systems;', 'Provide administrative management and planning of the fiber optic network; system being utilized for design and construction of the fiber network;', 'Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite of products;', 'Strong verbal and written communication skills', 'Strong analytical skills;', 'Excellent leadership, customer relations and communications skills;', 'Ensure engineering/design activities comply with company and contract requirements and support overall construction schedule;', 'Able to operate effectively in a fast-paced, changing and highly energetic environment;', 'Coordinate with the professional services firm(s) to assure completeness and correctness of design and construction documents;']

title: Manager, Continuous Improvement - Customs Brokerage & Logistics / Gestionnaire de l'améloriation continue - Courtage en douane et logistique
description:
French version follows


Omnitrans is looking for its new Manager, Continuous Improvement who will be responsible for formulating, managing, and executing on action plans designed to improve and optimize processes and methods, leading to enhanced profitability and productivity of corporate and divisional operational activities.


Your day-to-day:

  • Work closely with VP operations to define Continuous Improvement roadmap of projects and deliverables and ensure alignment with corporate objectives and strategic direction.
  • Develop and lead the implementation of tactical action plans to improve processes, control mechanisms, and appropriate KPIs based on Continuous Improvement Roadmap.
  • Supervise the CI team and provide with leadership, coaching & development, strategic direction and performance review.
  • Track and lead the execution strategy of project milestones, discussing and planning with key stakeholders to facilitate effective and positive change management while also ensuring that project and initiative timelines are respected.
  • Integrate quickly and efficiently into various teams as required to provide direct support and facilitate the deployment and monitoring of improvement initiatives until full control can be transitioned to the stakeholder.
  • Communicate and work closely with Directors and Managers to ensure adherence to required compliance practices and other departmental needs.
  • Acting as change management agent, coordinate and facilitate training activities and/or resources as needed to ensure successful integrations across any affected internal divisions or external clients.
  • Work with Operations staff to develop a thorough understanding of Omnitrans’ existing processes to identify business requirements, inefficiencies, and potential for improvement.
  • Using all available corporate resources as needed, document the processes and analyze improvement opportunities. (ie. cost, reporting structures, information flow, IT products, etc.)
  • Identify, using standard CI tools and by working in various work groups, possible improvements in: operational processes and controls; information flows and reporting structure, communication needs and individual and group performance.
  • Conduct root cause analysis on quality and performance issues to identify potential improvements.


What would you bring:

  • Bachelor degree in a relevant field, such as Engineering or relevant experience in a role of process improvement.
  • Minimum of 8 years’ experience in projects related to operational improvements.
  • A good understanding of standard CI tools (Process Flow Mapping, Root Cause Analysis, Activity Based Costing, etc.) related to improvement identification, documentation, and analytics.
  • Working knowledge of standard project management.
  • Ability to develop project scope and action plans.
  • Ability to track and manage challenging and simultaneous deadlines relating to different projects.
  • Strong people skills.
  • Ability to adapt and operate in complex situations, possibly involving subject matter and software that are new to him/her where quick learning and thinking will be required to manage improvement projects.
  • Ability to develop and document training material and to conduct training seminars for both individuals and groups.


We offer you the opportunity to:

  • Be part of a well-established company with offices across Canada, United Stated and China and that offers Logistics and Customs Brokerage services for 45 years.
  • Have a concrete and direct impact on operations through your CI plan.
  • To work in hybrid environment with one day per week at the office.
  • To have access to a complete insurance plan.
  • 24/7 virtual medicine services as well as an employee assistance program.
  • To work from abroad few weeks per year.
  • Grow your career in a reputable company.


Omnitrans is committed to creating and maintaining an accessible and inclusive work environment to eliminate discrimination based on age, skin colour, origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation and any other characteristic.

*******************************************************************

Omnitrans est à la recherche de son nouveau Directeur, amélioration continue, qui sera responsable de la formulation, de la gestion et de l'exécution de plans d'action conçus pour améliorer et optimiser les processus et les méthodes, menant à une rentabilité et une productivité accrues des activités opérationnelles de l'entreprise et des divisions.


Votre quotidien:

  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Vice-Président des opérations pour définir la feuille de route d'amélioration continue des projets et des livrables et assurer l'alignement avec les objectifs de l'entreprise et l'orientation stratégique.
  • Développer et diriger la mise en œuvre de plans d'action tactiques pour améliorer les processus, les mécanismes de contrôle et les KPI appropriés basés sur la feuille de route d'amélioration continue.
  • Superviser l'équipe CI et assurer le leadership, l'encadrement et le développement, l'orientation stratégique et l'évaluation des performances.
  • Suivre et diriger la stratégie d'exécution des jalons du projet, discuter et planifier avec les principales parties prenantes pour faciliter une gestion efficace et positive du changement tout en veillant à ce que les délais du projet et de l'initiative soient respectés.
  • S'intégrer rapidement et efficacement dans diverses équipes selon les besoins pour fournir un soutien direct et faciliter le déploiement et le suivi des initiatives d'amélioration jusqu'à ce que le contrôle total puisse être transféré à l'intervenant.
  • Communiquer et travailler en étroite collaboration avec les directeurs et les gestionnaires pour assurer le respect des pratiques de conformité requises et des autres besoins du service.
  • Agir en tant qu'agent de gestion du changement, coordonner et faciliter les activités de formation et/ou les ressources nécessaires pour assurer des intégrations réussies dans toutes les divisions internes ou clients externes concernés.
  • Travailler avec le personnel des opérations pour développer une compréhension approfondie des processus existants d'Omnitrans afin d'identifier les exigences commerciales, les inefficacités et le potentiel d'amélioration.
  • En utilisant toutes les ressources disponibles de l'entreprise au besoin, documenter les processus et analyser les opportunités d'amélioration. (c.-à-d. coût, structures de rapport, flux d'informations, produits informatiques, etc.)
  • Identifier, à l'aide d'outils standards de CI et en travaillant dans divers groupes de travail, les améliorations possibles dans : les processus et contrôles opérationnels ; les flux d'informations et la structure de reporting, les besoins de communication et les performances individuelles et collectives.
  • Effectuer une analyse des causes profondes des problèmes de qualité et de performance pour identifier les améliorations potentielles.


Ce que vous apportez:

  • Baccalauréat dans un domaine pertinent, tel que l'ingénierie ou expérience pertinente dans un rôle d'amélioration des processus.
  • Minimum de 8 ans d'expérience dans des projets liés à des améliorations opérationnelles.
  • Une bonne compréhension des outils CI standard (cartographie des flux de processus, analyse des causes profondes, établissement des coûts basés sur les activités, etc.) liés à l'identification, à la documentation et à l'analyse des améliorations.
  • Connaissance pratique de la gestion de projet standard.
  • Capacité à développer la portée du projet et les plans d'action.
  • Capacité à suivre et à gérer des délais difficiles et simultanés liés à différents projets.
  • Solides compétences interpersonnelles.
  • Capacité à s'adapter et à fonctionner dans des situations complexes, impliquant éventuellement des sujets et des logiciels nouveaux pour lui, où un apprentissage et une réflexion rapides seront nécessaires pour gérer des projets d'amélioration.
  • Capacité à développer et à documenter du matériel de formation et à organiser des séminaires de formation pour les individus et les groupes.


Nous vous offrons l'opportunité de:

  • Faire partie d'une entreprise bien établie avec des bureaux à travers le Canada, les États-Unis et la Chine et qui offre des services de logistique et de courtage en douane depuis 45 ans.
  • Avoir un impact concret et direct sur les opérations grâce à votre plan d'amélioration continue.
  • Travailler dans un environnement hybride avec un jour par semaine au bureau.
  • Avoir accès à un plan d'assurance complet.
  • Avoir accès aux services de médecine virtuelle 24/7 ainsi qu'un programme d'aide aux employés.
  • Travailler depuis l'étranger quelques semaines par an.
  • Développez votre carrière dans une entreprise réputée.


Omnitrans s'engage à créer et à maintenir un environnement de travail accessible et inclusif afin d'éliminer la discrimination fondée sur l'âge, la couleur de peau, l'origine, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle et toute autre caractéristique.

title: Environmental Planner - Transportation Infrastructure
description:
Minimum Clearance Required To Start

Not Applicable/None

Job Description

Environmental Planner – Transportation Infrastructure – Toronto, Ontario

Opportunity : Parsons is hiring an Environmental Planner to support Transportation Infrastructure projects in the Toronto Metropolitan Area.

The Environmental Planner’s Key Responsibilities Include
  • Work with other Environmental Planners on Environmental Assessment (EA) projects (MTO, Municipal and Transit projects)
  • Utilize basic foundation of established experience in the field for various planning initiatives in the Toronto Metro region
  • Be involved in a range of infrastructure projects tasks including research, report writing, and supporting consultation programs
  • Work with staff at other Parsons offices and with project sub-consultants
  • Coordinate with internal and external technical service areas, discipline leads and technical staff, on technical studies and preparation of environmental assessment documentation
  • Coordinate, support and be involved with public consultation and stakeholder engagement, including consultation with Indigenous Communities
  • Assist environmental field staff in completing environmental inventories, as required

Skills & Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma in environmental planning, biology, natural sciences, planning or another related discipline
  • 5+ experience working as an Environmental Planner, preferably in the Ontario province
  • Exceptional organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to work in as a part of a multidisciplinary project team and independently
  • Experience in Environmental Assessments including MTO Class EA, Municipal Class EA, Transit Project Assessment Process, Canadian Environmental Assessment Act
  • Familiar with environmental permitting and approvals process
  • Experience in the Ontario market with a focus on infrastructure projects (local/regional municipalities, MTO, Metrolinx, TTC)
  • Experience with regulatory agencies and key stakeholders (NDMNRF, MECP, Conservation Authorities, Transport Canada, Parks Canada, Fisheries and Oceans Canada)
  • Experience with Indigenous Community consultation/engagement an asset
  • Exceptional writing and presentation skills
  • Eligibility for a Registered Professional Planner (RPP), and/or Canadian Institute of Planners (MCIP) professional designation
  • Knowledge of local, provincial and federal environmental policies, legislation and applicable law
  • Ability to travel (locally) to multiple sites
  • Thorough knowledge of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint, experience with GIS software an asset

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.

title: Fibre Network Planner
description:
Fibre Network Planner

 

Hiboo Networks Inc., is a new telecommunications company in the Ottawa-Gatineau region that is wholly owned by Hydro Ottawa Holdings Inc.

 

Hiboo Networks Inc is passionate and excited to provide high-quality and high-speed fibre optic network solutions and internet services to the Ottawa-Gatineau region. Our fast, high-capacity and highly-secure connectivity solutions built on state of the art technology, will deliver the low latency and high reliability network services that the business community increasingly requires to support the region’s global leadership and international growth and success.

 

Imagine working for a new exciting company, where employees have a chance to make a difference, be innovative and contribute to the success of the organization.

 

Hiboo Networks Inc. is currently searching for a talented individual to join our team as the Fibre Network Planner. This position will create efficient outside plant designs, coordinate and oversee numerous build projects (outside plant facilities, primary and secondary data centres), while creating best practices and repeatable standards along the way. 

 

Here’s What You Will Do


  • Propose and leverage fibre modeling and planning tools for the company
  • Leverage existing fibre network assets and introduce new technology and construction methods for optimal deal / growth economics
  • Evaluate fibre network design alternatives and make optimized fibre network capital and operating costs recommendations per build
  • Interface with Outside Plant (OSP) vendors and contract pricing catalogues to estimate and obtain build quotes and estimates 
  • Review and approve cost input for sales opportunity/orders during pre-sales phase for optimal deal / growth economics
  • Provide optimal technical fibre optic network design, topology layout, fiber splice plans, cable duct and routing to pre-sales and outside plant design team
  • Establish and network with permit and right of way partners in the region
  • Propose build synergies and make recommendations based on regional knowledge
  • Lead the final contract and commissioning of work with the OSP vendor for firm sales orders
  • Provide site supervision of OSP vendor activity
  • Document and maintain details in the GIS database including circuit assignments, records, logs, counts, availability, loopback, splice, coupler locations, termination cabinets and panel locations. and fibre network documentation including fibre IRU in GIS database
  • Establish as design vs as built processes between Fibre Network Planning and OSP Vendors
  • Provide engineering support for the operation, maintenance and restoration of the fibre network
  • G.I.S design work, including fibre input (FOSC/Node with profile #’s), Optical Network & levelling, equipment replacement (repeater, amplifiers, nodes/fosc’s) using different profiles.
  • GIS/AutoCAD drafting work as it relates to Outside Plant design (single line diagrams, schematics, MDU/riser plans, etc).
  • Provide details and excerpts requested by coordinators, contractors, and clients
  • Create and follow general Hiboo wireline Aerial / Burial network planning & design rules for FTTx, GPON, etc


Here’s What you Need – Skills and Qualifications


  • A Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or relevant discipline
  • A minimum of three (3) years of experience as a Fiber System Planner with network engineering and Planning experience
  • Experience in GIS database including mapping, planning and establishing fibre network topologies a presenting in diagram / CAD format with Bill of Materials (BoM) and inventory updates
  • Direct involvement in building large fibre networks is required
  • Experience with a major Telecom Service Provider or Cable Operator end processes to maintain impeccable records in


Here’s What’s Great to Have – Core Competencies


  • Knowledge of Outside Plant (OSP) Fiber/hybrid design architectures, specifications, standards, and topologies
  • Experience with creating detailed splice packages
  • Experience with Optical node segmentation analysis
  • FDH, OLT details (racks, floorplans, PAD/PON forms, etc.)
  • Tech details (MUX/DMUX & Detailed splice packages)
  • DDP, FDDP, and other detailed IPE packages
  • Power supply analysis, design, and replacement
  • Adaptable, adjusts and responds to change, can pivot and prioritize
  • Commitment to quality and excellence
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, is innovative, challenges the status quo and can take risks
  • Motivated to “hit the ground running”, a self-starter who can take initiative
  • Integrity, trustworthy, fulfills commitments and does what is right
  • Collaboration skills, a team player who loves working with others and sharing ideas
  • Provides “best in class” customer service
  • Experience in a start-up organization and/or the telecommunications services industry is an asset
  • Bilingual and the ability to effectively communicate to business leaders in both English and French is an asset


Here’s Why You Should Join the Hiboo team!


  • Compensation and Incentive Program
  • Benefits and RRSP Matching Program
  • Generous Paid Leave
  • Employee Referral Bonus
  • Wellness Reimbursement Program
  • Home Office Reimbursement Program
  • Cell Phone Reimbursement Program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Professional Development
  • Flexible Work Arrangements

 

As we build our team, the health, safety and well-being of our employees is our top priority.


Hiboo offers employees flexible work arrangements however, this position is located in Ottawa, and face-to-face meetings with the team will be required. We value the innovation and teamwork that happens when employees come together and are committed to establishing a dynamic workforce that reflects the community it serves. We are stronger together!


Hiboo Networks Inc. is committed to establishing a qualified workforce that reflects the diverse population it serves and we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to preventing and removing barriers to employment for people with disabilities and invite you to contact us if you have questions regarding accessibility or accommodation.

 

If you are looking to join a new dynamic organization that values entrepreneurial thinking, excellence, innovation, integrity, teamwork and best in class service, we want to meet you!

title: Network Planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.

As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.

Rogers is seeking a Technical Specialist to complete Service Impact requests for planned physical network move, adds or changes. This role is critical to ensure we notify our network customers of any planned network impacts related to physical work. This role requires a high degree of detail in analyzing existing networks and ensuring 100% accuracy or submitted reports.

Responsibilities
  • Perform detailed assessment of all impacted circuits & facilities in the Rogers Transport Network resulting from any planned inside or outside physical activity,
  • Analyze all available data, validate from live Transport systems, and investigate all discrepancies
  • Prepare detailed and complete Service Impact & Risk Assessment report on the basis of above, within agreed to Service Level agreements.
  • Involve Wireless Access Engineering/ Enterprise Operations when required, to incorporate their services/ circuits into the report.
  • Liaison with all internal departments to inform/investigate any errors/ omissions/ discrepancies that may arise.
  • Update records/databases as and when required.
Qualifications
  • Education and experience should include, undergraduate university degree in Electrical/Electronics engineering or community college diploma with certification or equivalent. SCTE BCE, BCT, or BTS designation or equivalent work experiences would be a benefit.
  • 3-5 years of work experience with major Telecom Service Provider or Cable Operator in Network engineering while operations experience would be an asset.
  • Knowledge of Fiber Optic, SONET, DWDM, CWDM, Ethernet and Digital Video Transport technologies.
  • Knowledge of NetSmart, Site Manager, OneControl, PONS, CIMS/Objectel and NRM, as well as basic knowledge of Rogers Wireless Network is an asset.
  • Proven ability to work in cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent written and oral communication, prioritizing and relationship building skills.
  • Proven problem solving and analysis skills.
  • Independent self-starter and quick learner who is able to work well under pressure and tight timelines.
  • Ability to present information and advise internal customers on proposed ideas.
  • Ability to advise on technical problems and review work for technical accuracy and adequacy.
  • Advanced Analytical skills; Ability to analyze and investigate any discrepancies that may arise in validating different sources of data.
  • Ability to act independently to determine methods and procedures.
  • Ability to modify established guide lines, advise new approaches, apply existing criteria in new manners, and draw conclusions from comparative situations.
  • Ability to work from assigned objectives, relative priorities and critical areas that impinge on work of other units.
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Full time

Shift Day

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON

Travel Requirements None

Posting Category/Function Technology & Engineering

Requisition ID 262865

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes Digital & Technology

title: Manager, Retail Logistics
description:
Day In The Life

In this role, the Manager, Retail Logistics will be accountable for all movement of retail goods through the HBC network nationally. This role will oversee all operations for inbound and outbound domestic transportation as well as the cross dock functions. The Manager will manage all contracts and partnerships while strategically leveraging those relationships to find synergies and solutions. This position will report to the Director, Retail Logistics.

This opportunity will allow an individual to showcase their negotiation and communication skills to ensure the activities are the most effective while being cost efficient. This individual will lead the team to support our retail stores in executing YOY sales and ensuring merchandise is on time. Managing department assets is a key responsibility while abiding by MTO guidelines.

This role will actively support our DE&I framework by identifying opportunities to increase the diversity of our products and brands. They will lead with inclusion to nurture our OneTeam culture by removing barriers for our Associates and communities.

What You’ll Do
  • Oversee daily operations for store deliveries, vendor pickups as well as any other required freight movement
  • Trailer management including: regulatory compliance, maintenance and repositioning
  • Daily communication via Zoom with team for support
  • Design and execute strategic initiatives, in partnership with various functional partners, related to network improvements & optimization, vendor selection and implementation
  • Relationship management with service providers across Canada, including monitoring and maintaining service levels across the network
  • Collaborate with various internal partners including Store Operations, Logistics partners (DCs, Supply Chain), Merchants, Contact Center & Service Excellence, Asset Protection
  • Process/policy documentation and improvement including department and carrier SOPs covering on time performance, completion of tasks and rate contracts
  • Management of procurement activity related to vendor base including RFPs, negotiation, contracting, contract management
  • Claims resolution with external/internal partners
  • Manage escalations as they relate to freight movement
  • Oversight of vendor setup for Transportation approval of Supplier Maintenance Form & Master Merchandise Vendor Agreements
  • Build the right team to lead transportation organization; coach and mentor team members at varying levels and career stages
  • Ability to be on call to manage operations evenings, weekends, holidays as the role requires
  • Management of store delivery schedule
What You Will Need
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in rail logistics, procurement, project management, supply chain, logistics, transportation
  • Ability to communicate with and influence internal and external business partners; ability to provide internal stakeholder groups timely and relevant information as to the performance of the supply chain
  • Functional knowledge of transportation concepts, pricing dynamics, vendor base across Canada
  • Warehousing and related systems experience would be an asset
  • Change leadership; embodies culture of change
  • Strong interpersonal skills; developing constructive and cooperative working relationships with others
  • Excellent oral and written communication; Proficiency in GSuite or Microsoft Office
  • Highly flexible and adaptable
  • Ability to work autonomously and independently
  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects and tasks
  • Excellent analytical skills and demonstrated ability to solve problems
  • Proven ability to make good decisions under pressure
  • Excellent organizational skills, detail-oriented, setting performance standards and monitoring performance
What You Can Expect
  • Join a people-first culture that celebrates and promotes Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in the workplace.
  • We care about helping Associates achieve a healthy work-life balance. Our hybrid “Ways of Working” Program enables Associates to work when and where it is most effective
  • We offer a competitive benefits package including paid vacation, medical, dental, vision, parental leave top up coverages, retirement savings and more. As a Hudson’s Bay Associate, you will receive benefits that are designed to support you and your family's total well-being
  • We foster a culture that supports our Associates in making healthy lifestyle choices. Our Living Well Program provides a variety of programs and resources to enhance and maintain your physical, mental, and financial wellness, including Corporate gym membership rates.
  • We offer an amazing Associate discount of up to 40% off of top brands
About Hudson’s Bay

Hudson’s Bay is a digital-first purpose-driven retailer helping Canadians live their best style of life. As one of the country’s most iconic brands, Hudson’s Bay operates over 80 full-line locations and thebay.com featuring Marketplace - the 5th largest e-commerce business in Canada. Hudson’s Bay has established a reputation for quality and style through an unrivalled assortment including fashion, designer, home, beauty, food concepts and more.

Hudson’s Bay operates under the HBC brand portfolio and founded in 1670, HBC is North America’s oldest company. The signature stripes are a registered trademark of HBC. The Hudson’s Bay Rewards members share their passion for living a colourful life, and get rewarded for doing the things that bring them joy.

We are proud to share our tenured commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. Learn more about our commitment at HBC Foundation & HBC Heritage.

Our Commitment To Building a Winning Culture

As One Team we have re-established our internal behaviours and culture to ensure we all succeed. One Team provides the tools needed to shift our ways of working and creates change to become a purpose-driven, digital first business. Our 4 pillars for embracing One Team are: Always be Customer Champions, Performance and Purpose Driven, Keep it Simple & Change Agents.

Interested in Social Media?

Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram

Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing non discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence,compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Senior Traffic Engineer - Laval Office
description:
Requisition ID: 140355

Job Level: Senior Level

Department: Design Engineering

Market: Transportation

Employment Type: Full Time

Position Overview

Kiewit Infrastructure Engineering (KIE) has an immediate opening for a dynamic Senior Traffic Engineer in our growing Design Group in Laval, Quebec. You will be part of our rapidly growing Infrastructure Design Department, which includes structural, geotechnical, roadway, MOT, civil, drainage and rail, disciplines, is a multi-faceted and leading-edge division of Kiewit with best-in-class technical expertise focused on the design-build delivery of infrastructure projects. As a Traffic Engineer, your ultimate goal is to ensure our roadways that we design are designed in a safe and efficient way, such that a drivers’ experience is safe and efficient. You will be expected to coordinate with project teams in Canada and the United States to design and product traffic engineering designs for design/build projects in North America.

District Overview

Kiewit Infrastructure Engineering's Design Build Management team are driving clients to turn to Kiewit during all stages of design-build projects to manage their multi-disciplined design teams to improve schedule, control costs and minimize risk. Our construction-driven engineers analyze root causes and resolve design issues before they impact schedule and budget. Particularly on large design-build projects, clients benefit from the proven processes and tools used by Kiewit to minimize project risk. We are an in-house resource that supports projects throughout the company. Our staff shares experiences gained, innovative concepts, and design best practices for all projects that we support.

On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to see more, touch more, and do more than you ever imagined. Working hard will not only bring you satisfaction from a job well done, but it will help propel your career forward faster than you might expect. We will train you, develop your skills, and allow you to take on projects that impact millions across North America. With top-notch health benefits, a wealth-building pension plan, challenging projects and unbeatable growth opportunities, by joining Kiewit, you’re ensuring a lifetime of success.

Location

This role will be based out of our Laval, QC, Canada office with opportunities to travel within the Canada and US regions to projects as required.

Responsibilities
  • Produce and deliver traffic components for North American projects through coordination with multiple design teams.
  • Lead traffic modeling, analysis, and design tasks, acting in responsible charge as needed
  • Conduct capacity analyses, traffic counts on roadways to determine traffic volume and oversee Traffic investigations in the field
  • Conduct traffic simulation / modeling software including Synchro/SimTraffic, Vissim, HCS, and other similar platforms
  • Recommend traffic safety enhancements on basis of field studies
  • Design traffic signals, signage plans (urban, highway, rural), marking plans
  • Design of bicycle facilities (marking, geometry)
  • Design of geometric layouts, including simulations of turning maneuvers
  • Analyze and evaluate complex design and construction phasing plans to formulate effective traffic engineering strategies, and to ensure compliance with the feasibility and safety issues
  • Create design concepts and alternatives for traffic signals, signing and striping, and Execute final design of project traffic elements such as traffic signals, ITS, signing and striping plans, and maintenance of traffic (MOT) plans
  • Lead interdisciplinary design coordination to ensure that project elements are compatible
  • Lead project technical meetings and provide coordination to resolve design issues plans

Qualifications
  • 10+ years of transportation project experience, performing similar traffic duties as outlined above
  • Bachelor’s degree or greater in Civil Engineering
  • Professional Canadian engineer registration required
  • Extensive knowledge of the MUTCD, Roadside Design Guide and construction traffic control design
  • Demonstrable knowledge and experience of designing traffic signal systems, signing and striping elements for transportation projects
  • Familiarity with design-build delivery is preferred
  • Working knowledge and experience of MicroStation, AutoCAD platforms
  • Skills in traffic simulation / modeling software including Synchro/SimTraffic, Vissim, HCS, Aimsun and other similar platforms
  • Experience in developing Maintenance of Traffic Plans is desired
  • Experience developing construction plans for transportation projects is preferred
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English, and preferred basic written/verbal communication skills in French
  • Work will primarily be performed in the Laval office, but must be able to travel to project sites and attend meetings across North America as needed by the project

Additional Requirements:
  • Absent an approved exemption, due to federal, state, local, provincial and/or client-requirements, this position may require an individual to be fully vaccinated by a Health Canada-approved or authorized COVID-19 vaccine or undergo weekly testing upon hire and as a condition of continued employment.

    We believe in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination and comply with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

title: Fall 2022 Co-op: Network Planner
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.

We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.

Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.

Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity

Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and learn from a diverse group of leaders. We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for all Canadians, we believe it starts with Students & New Grads from coast-to-coast-to-coast.

At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let’s make your dream co-op placement possible.

About The Team

The Wireless Network Access Planning team is part of the Rogers Communication engineering function. We plan and implement the new cellular sites and In-building systems to enhance the network capacity and coverage in order to fulfill the service and quality requirements of our rapid growing wireless business.

Successful candidates will be responsible for the development of network build plans and network augmentation plans. You will work closely with network planners to assist them with network analysis, planning documentation/specification and budget exercises.

What You Will Do...

The ideal candidate will be responsible in assisting Wireless Access Network Planners with
  • Statistic analysis for network performance and capacity dimensioning.
  • Identify problematic network performance area and incorporate into the existing and future plans.
  • Help develop in year plans – site prioritization, capacity upgrades, project cost benefit analysis and research market reviews.
  • Provide network documentation/specifications related to new site acquisition and build.
  • Assist in developing in Capital Budgets.
  • Automate processes to improve efficiency.
  • Coordinate with Radio, Civil, Implementation engineering teams for project tracking and general cost accounting.
  • Conduct post-mortem studies for event incidents and new site build.
What You Will Bring...
  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary institution pursuing Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent degree.
  • Basic knowledge of wireless access network, knowledge in radio propagation theory, radio transmitter and receiver circuits, cellular system principles and two-way land mobile communications will be an asset.
  • Experience with GIS tools and analysis can be considered as an asset.
  • Nice to have programming skills in data mining and automate process.
  • Highly motivated individual with superior organizational and analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate plans and solutions to both technical and non technical audiences.
  • Team Player who can work with both technical and non technical individuals and facilitate completion of tasks and projects.
  • Experience in finance and accounting is a plus.
  • The ability to take direction and report on current status.
  • A self-starter with the ability to pick things up quickly
  • A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed
  • As part of the Recruitment process, successful Candidates will be required to complete criminal and credit background checks
What You Can Expect In Return…
  • A team who deeply cares about your development and long term career at Rogers
  • A team that trusts and wants to win together
  • A competitive salary
  • Access to leading edge technology and services so we can make more possible for our customers and our business every day.
  • A campus team that will keep you engaged through onboarding and your work term
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule [[req_RogersFullPartTime]]

Shift Day

Length of Contract 4 Months

Work Location 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON

Travel Requirements None

Posting Category/Function Student/New Grad & Co-op

Requisition ID 268327

At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https//digital.rogers.com/

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
Posting Notes Student and New Grad

title: LOGISTIC AND SALES MANAGER / GESTIONNAIRE À LA LOGISTIQUE ET AUX VENTES
company: Propane Levac Propane Inc. | LGP Energy Inc.
description:
This role is responsible for analyzing and coordinating transportation arrangements to meet customer service expectations, in the most cost-effective manner. The Logistics and Sales Manager organizes inbound transportation of products from suppliers to distribution centers, including but not limited to our own rail terminals, by determining purchase order consolidation and optimize inbound opportunities. Success in this role requires an unwavering commitment to service excellence, efficiency, and teamwork, to enable LGP Energy to deliver on our promise to customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Identify and build relationships with approved freight companies for all bulk shipments negotiate rates and contracts with freight provider;
  • Identifying prospective partners, and negotiating successfully in a constructive, consultative, and collaborative manner;
  • Negotiate terms of contracts;
  • Negotiate annual term deals with customers;
  • Represent our company, with a comprehensive understanding of our offerings;
  • Schedule/Coordinate truck shipments and addressing any issues that come up during transit;
  • Plan and track the shipment of final products according to customer requirement;
  • Develop, implement and document all logistics processes;
  • Generate leads, and build and nurture client relationships;
  • Prepare and review all shipping documentation for accuracy;
  • Address delays in transit or with customs in a timely manner;
  • Identify supply chain issues; source alternate suppliers to mitigate supply gaps;
  • Communicate shipping delays to relevant customers in a professional manner;
  • Maintain organized records of all material movements to ensure full traceability;
  • Ensure inventory is organized and adequately logged through regular inventory counts;
  • Ensure timely delivery of cargoes;
  • Troubleshoot delivery delays and implement corrective action plan;
  • Monitor cargo loading/unloading with supplier if needed;
  • Provide daily updates to various customers via phone and email;
  • Provide inventory reports and balance daily activities;
  • Update and maintain carrier transportation rates.

 

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 5 years experience in freight forwarding, brokering, trucking or freight operations;
  • Minimum 1 year in sales experience;
  • Bachelor’s Degree in supply chain management, operations, logistics, business administration, transportation, engineering, or related field or any combination of relevant education/experience that proves work experience;
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Outlook. Working knowledge;
  • Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills;
  • Ability to persuade, influences, and negotiate with others;
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and handle several projects at any one time;
  • Bilingual (French and English) writing and speaking.

________

Le ou la titulaire du poste est chargé d'analyser et de coordonner les dispositions de transport afin de répondre aux attentes des clients en matière de service, de la manière la plus rentable possible. Le gestionnaire à la logistique et aux ventes organise le transport entrant des produits des fournisseurs vers les centres de distribution, incluant mais sans s'y limiter à nos propres terminaux ferroviaires, en déterminant la consolidation des commandes et en optimisant les opportunités entrantes. Pour réussir dans ce rôle, il faut un engagement inébranlable envers l'excellence du service, l'efficacité et le travail d'équipe, afin de permettre à Énergie LGP de tenir sa promesse envers les clients.


RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Identifier et établir des relations avec des sociétés de transport (par camion ou par train) pour toutes les expéditions en vrac;
  • Négocier les tarifs et les contrats avec le fournisseur de fret;
  • Négocier des contrats annuels avec les clients;
  • Représenter notre entreprise, avec une grande connaissance et compréhension de nos offres ;
  • Générer des opportunités, établir et entretenir des relations avec les clients;
  • Identifier les partenaires potentiels et négocier avec succès de manière constructive, consultative et collaborative;
  • Planifier/coordonner les expéditions par camion / wagon et régler tout problème survenant pendant le transit;
  • Planifier et suivre l'expédition des produits finis en fonction des exigences du client;
  • Développer, mettre en œuvre et documenter les processus de logistiques;
  • Préparer et vérifier l'exactitude des documents d'expédition;
  • Régler les retards en transit ou avec les douanes en temps opportun;
  • Identifier les problèmes de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, trouver d'autres fournisseurs pour réduire les écarts d'approvisionnement ;
  • Communiquer les retards d'expédition aux clients concernés de manière professionnelle;
  • S'assurer que l'inventaire est organisé et enregistré de manière adéquate par le biais d'inventaires réguliers;
  • Assurer la livraison des cargaisons dans les délais;
  • Dépanner les retards de livraison et mettre en œuvre un plan d'action correctif;
  • Surveiller le chargement/déchargement des cargaisons avec le fournisseur si nécessaire;
  • Fournir des mises à jour quotidiennes à divers clients par téléphone et par courriel;
  • Fournir des rapports d'inventaire et équilibrer les activités quotidiennes;
  • Mettre à jour et maintenir les tarifs de transport des transporteurs.

EXIGENCES REQUISES

  • Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience dans l'expédition de fret, le courtage, le camionnage ou les opérations de fret ;
  • Minimum 1 an d'expérience en vente ;
  • Baccalauréat en gestion de l’approvisionnement, des opérations, de la logistique, en administration des affaires, en transport, en ingénierie ou dans un domaine connexe ou toute combinaison d'études et d'expérience pertinente;
  • Connaissance approfondie de Microsoft Excel et Outlook;
  • Excellentes compétences organisationnelles, avec la capacité de gérer les priorités et échéances;
  • Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et aptitudes à la communication;
  • Capacité à persuader, influencer et négocier;
  • Capacité à travailler avec un minimum de supervision et à gérer plusieurs projets à la fois ;
  • Bilingue (français et anglais) à l'écrit et à l'oral.
