title: Ingénieur en planification des transports, CPI
description:
Le groupe TEHORA est présentement à la recherche d’un candidat à la profession dingénieur en planification des transports, ayant d’excellentes aptitudes techniques, d’excellentes connaissances et qui souhaite mettre à profit ses compétences au sein d’une équipe polyvalente.

Sans être exhaustives, voici les services et livrables que devront fournir le CPI retenu :

Principales Responsabilités Et Fonctions
  • Agir à titre de spécialiste auprès des clients en fournissant des services de consultation en auscultation et gestion de chaussées.
  • Collaborer avec les spécialistes dans différents domaines, l’ingénierie, les urbanistes et l’environnement pour fournir des services de qualité et au bon moment afin de contribuer au succès de nos clients.
  • Agir à titre de chargé de projet ou de discipline dans le cadre de certains mandats d’envergure.
Si la planification des transports vous passionne, voici votre opportunité pour vous joindre à l’équipe en rôle d’ingénieur.

Vous travaillerez en collaboration avec l’équipe de projet, différents fournisseurs, et les différents services de la Ville (travaux publics, génie, loisirs).

Profil
  • Diplomé en génie civil, ingénierie de transport, ou autre domaine connecté à la planification des transports.
  • Au minimum deux (2) années dexpérience dans le domaine du planification des transports
  • Connaissance approfondie des normes, formulaires et procédures du M.T.Q. ;
  • Avoir réussi la certification du MTQ en inspection des ponceaux un atout ;
  • Habiletés à utiliser les logiciels de la suite Office ;
  • Connaissances de logiciels CAD un atout ;
  • Avoir accès à un véhicule ;
  • Être Détenteur dun permis de conduire valide ;
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe ;
  • Bonnes habiletés de communication.
Lieu de travail

Le lieu de travail sera déterminé selon le mandat, il peut être en télé travail ou chez le client.

Pourquoi se joindre à TEHORA ?

TEHORA est une firme québécoise multidisciplinaire reconnue pour lexcellence de ses services professionnels, de nature technique et de gestion de projets à léchelle nationale et internationale. Notre mission est daccompagner nos clients dans la concrétisation de leurs projets par lexcellence de notre savoir-faire et de notre créativité.

Depuis sa création en 2017, notre équipe de professionnels connait une croissance exponentielle en répondant aux besoins importants en gestion de projets multidisciplinaires, en génie civil, en TI et plus.

Nos collaborateurs travaillent sur des mandats aussi bien à l’interne que chez des clients d’envergures.

TEHORA se distingue par sa culture d’entreprise, axée sur le bonheur de ses employés et la diversité.

Chez TEHORA, chaque collaborateur est un membre important de léquipe qui contribue à notre succès collectif. Nos membres ont la flexibilité requise pour avoir un équilibre entre le travail et leur vie privée, tout en menant une carrière enrichissante.

Nous offrons un environnement de travail motivant. La diversité des projets, la grande autonomie et l’interaction directe avec les clients sont appréciées. Une telle proximité est possible en raison de notre structure organisationnelle horizontale, qui se traduit par des relations de confiance et une communication efficace entre notre équipe et les clients.

Avantages
  • Du télétravail et de la flexibilité pour s’adapter à vos obligations familiales
  • Un programme d’assurance collective complète
  • Un REER collectif avec une contribution de l’employeur
  • Une culture entrepreneuriale favorisant la créativité et linnovation.
  • Horaires flexibles (selon le type de contrat de travail)
  • Couverture dassurance collective flexible
  • Congés en cas de maladie et à loccasion dévénements familiaux
  • Outils informatiques adaptés
  • Espace de travail épanouissant et motivant.
  • Initiatives sociales et environnementales
  • Programme d’apprentissage en milieu de travail
  • Cheminement de carrière
Salaire

Le salaire sera calculé sur la base du taux horaire moyen correspondant à votre profil. (À partir de 64 000$)
skills: ['Couverture dassurance collective flexible']

title: Chef de service - Logistique
description:
Fabricant innovant de véhicules zéro émission.

Leader en électrification des transports en Amérique du Nord.

Chaque jour, à notre façon on contribue à l’amélioration de notre environnement, de notre société.


Viens redessiner l’avenir avec nous !


Pourquoi te joindre à notre équipe?

  • Tu travailleras dans un environnement de travail stimulant et en constante évolution (pas de risque de t'ennuyer avec nous) !
  • On comprend, tout simplement. Ta famille et ta santé passe en premier !
  • Ton horaire est flexible et on te fait confiance !
  • On a des assurances (Béton) et un beau programme d'aide aux employés !
  • Chez Lion il n'y a aucune limite au potentiel de ta carrière !


Sous la supervision du directeur Logistique & Master planning, le Chef – Logistique est responsable de la logistique entière sur matière première a l’entrée du site et d’assurer un approvisionnement efficace des unités de production. Il prend en charge le personnel responsable de la gestion physique des chariots approvisionnant les lignes de production sur 2 sites de production ainsi que des processus opérationnels permettant sa gestion au quotidien. Il assure la gestion du flux du matériel entre la réception et le point de consommation. Il a aussi la charge de l’entreposage de la matière première qui est livrée directement au site et de la disposition physique de celle-ci.


Principales responsabilités:

  • Superviser le personnel de la logistique a l’approvisionnement des lignes de production ;
  • Superviser le personnel de la réception et de l’expédition ainsi que de la gestion de l’inventaire relative au site. (incluant pièces Kanban) ;
  • Assurer la logistique de la cour d’entreposage sur les sites internes et sites externes (non relié au 3PL) ;
  • Assurer le ‘’shunting’’ des remorques dans la cour au besoin et gérer les urgences au niveau du flux entrant du matériel;
  • Assurer la gestion complète des chariots d’approvisionnement et son flux a l’intérieur de la chaine de valeurs ;
  • Mettre en place et assurer un processus de gestion de la performance à l’aide d’indicateurs-clé de performance ;
  • Gérer le budget du département, le suivi et l’optimisation des coûts ;
  • Maintenir des relations de qualité avec les partenaires internes et externes (3PL) ;
  • Appliquer et se conformer aux politiques d'entreprise et à leur système qualité ;
  • Mettre en œuvre les bonnes pratiques de contrôle physique de la matière première afin de maximiser l’efficacité des opérations de son service, d’optimiser les processus, les ressources matérielles et de réduire les coûts ;
  • Assurer un suivi quotidien du rapport des commandes ;
  • Gérer l’espace d’entreposage de la matière première ;
  • Identifier les sources de gaspillage et amener des solutions permanentes ;
  • Appliquer les règles de sécurité de LION en tout temps et devenir un embassadeur.


Ce qu'il te faut pour réussir dans ce rôle:

Connaissances

  • Capacité à bien communiquer en français et en anglais;
  • Une bonne connaissance de la suite MS Office et MS 365;
  • Une bonne compréhension des systèmes ERP (Syteline un atout).

Habiletés

  • Un fort leadership ;
  • Capacité à structurer les projets et priorités au sein d'une grande équipe;
  • Forte capacité à communiquer efficacement ;
  • Capacité à guider et à travailler au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire ;
  • Fortes aptitudes de résolution des problèmes ;
  • Habiletés relationnelles démarquées.

Formation et expérience

  • 10 années d'expérience dans le domaine manufacturier, dans un poste similaire.
  • Diplôme universitaire en gestion des opérations, ou Génie Logistique.
skills: ['Assurer la gestion complète des chariots d’approvisionnement et son flux a l’intérieur de la chaine de valeurs ;', 'Fabricant innovant de véhicules zéro émission.']

Depuis sa création en 2017, notre équipe de professionnels connait une croissance exponentielle en répondant aux besoins importants en gestion de projets multidisciplinaires, en génie civil, en TI et plus. Nos collaborateurs travaillent sur des mandats aussi bien à l’interne que chez des clients d’envergures. TEHORA se distingue par sa culture d’entreprise, axée sur le bonheur de ses employés et la diversité. Chez TEHORA, chaque collaborateur est un membre important de l'équipe qui contribue à notre succès collectif. Nos membres ont la flexibilité requise pour avoir un équilibre entre le travail et leur vie privée, tout en menant une carrière enrichissante. Nous offrons un environnement de travail motivant. La diversité des projets, la grande autonomie et l’interaction directe avec les clients sont appréciées. Une telle proximité est possible en raison de notre structure organisationnelle horizontale, qui se traduit par des relations de confiance et une communication efficace entre notre équipe et les clients. Avantages Du télétravail et de la flexibilité pour s’adapter à vos obligations familiales Un programme d’assurance collective complète Un REER collectif avec une contribution de l’employeur Une culture entrepreneuriale favorisant la créativité et l'innovation. Horaires flexibles (selon le type de contrat de travail) Couverture d'assurance collective flexible Congés en cas de maladie et à l'occasion d'événements familiaux Outils informatiques adaptés Espace de travail épanouissant et motivant. Initiatives sociales et environnementales Programme d’apprentissage en milieu de travail Cheminement de carrière Salaire Le salaire sera calculé sur la base du taux horaire moyen correspondant à votre profil. (À partir de 64 000$)

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Job Summary

Coordonner et exécuter toutes les activités de l'entrepôt, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter :
  • Contrôle des stocks et tenue du magasin.
  • emballage et préparation des commandes clients.
  • Expéditions locales et internationales.
  • Réception des marchandises, des fournisseurs et des clients.
  • Activités de décontamination.
  • Assister et participer aux réunions hebdomadaires et quotidiennes pour coordonner les activités.
  • Suivre les directives de l'entreprise et les processus de qualité. À traduire
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

Coordinate and execute all warehouse activities, which include and are not limited to,
  • Inventory control and Store keeping.
  • Picking, packing, and preparing customer orders.
  • Shipments both local and international.
  • Reception of goods, from suppliers and customers.
  • Decontamination activities.
  • Assist and engage in weekly and daily meetings to coordinate activities. Follow company guidelines and Quality processes
Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Contrôle des stocks - tenue du magasin.
  • Responsable du contrôle des mouvements de stock dans l'inventaire ou à d'autres endroits, le cas échéant.
  • Vérifier périodiquement l'intégrité des produits en stock, par ex. emballage et étiquettes.
  • Coordonner l'inventaire périodique afin d'assurer l'exactitude du niveau de stock.
Expédition
  • Coordonner les expéditions quotidiennes et communiquer avec les parties internes sur l'état des expéditions,
  • Remplir tous les papiers et formulaires administratifs nécessaires au transport de la marchandise,
  • Contactez les transporteurs spécifiques et organisez le ramassage.
  • Établir et s'engager à respecter un calendrier quotidien de ramassage et de livraison.
  • Élaborer et tenir à jour les directives d'emballage et de transport.
  • Coordonner les envois spéciaux qui nécessitent un suivi et une planification approfondis avec divers fournisseurs
Reception
  • Réception quotidienne dans les délais et directives de réception de l'entreprise.
  • Réception selon le calendrier du planificateur, des fournitures, composants, instruments, outils, équipements et les retours clients.
  • Identifier et étiqueter les composants, instruments, outils et équipements reçus.
  • Décontamination.
  • Si nécessaire, effectuer la décontamination des produits en suivant les procédures établies et des lignes directrices.
  • Effectuer l'entretien de l'équipement selon les dates prévues.
Emballage
  • Nettoyer les composants, les instruments, les outils et l'équipement, le cas échéant.
  • Emballer les composants, les instruments, les outils et l'équipement selon les spécifications et la qualité des lignes directrices.
  • S'assurer de conserver un matériel d'emballage adéquat et suffisant pour répondre aux besoins.
__________________________________________________________________________________________________

Inventory Control – Store Keeping.
  • Responsible to control the movement of stock into inventory, or other locations as applicable.
  • Periodically check the integrity of inventory products, e.g. package, and labels.
  • Coordinate Periodic inventory count, to ensure accuracy of stock level.
Shipping.
  • Coordinate daily shipments and communicate with internal parties on the shipment status,
  • Complete all paperwork and administrative forms required to transport the goods,
  • Contact the specific carriers and organize pickup.
  • Establish and commit to daily pickup and delivery schedule.
  • Follow-up on daily shipments to ensure delivery to the final destination and communicate shipment progress to customer service and customers where and when needed.
  • Initiate, follow-up on complaints and disputes for damages or services not met by Transport Company per contracted services.
  • Develop and maintain packaging and transport directives.
  • Coordinate special shipments that require extensive follow-up and planning with various suppliers (handlers) e.g. Robot.
Receiving.
  • Daily receiving within company reception timeframe and guidelines.
  • Receiving per planner schedule, of supplies, components, instruments, tools, equipment, and customer returns.
  • Identify and label received components, instruments, tools, and equipment.
Decontamination.
  • Where required, perform decontamination of products following set procedures and
guidelines.
  • Perform equipment maintenance per scheduled dates.
Packaging
  • Clean components, instruments, tools, and equipment where applicable.
  • Pack components, instruments, tools, and equipment according to specifications and quality Ensure to maintain adequate and sufficient packaging material to fulfill needs
Expected Areas of Competence
  • Capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique au rythme rapide. Sens de l'urgence et capacité à gérer des situations stressantes.
  • Compétences efficaces en communication orale et écrite
  • Orienté vers la résolution de problème. Ose sortir des sentiers battus
  • Ability to work in a dynamic fast pace environment. Sense of urgency and ability to handle stressful situations.
  • Problem solver and able to think outside the box.
  • Effective oral and written communication skills.
Education/Experience Requirements
  • FedEx Power Ship, facture commerciale, B13, exigences douanières et transfrontalières.
  • Connaissance des applications Microsoft Office, y compris Excel ;
  • Connaissance pratique du MRP et des systèmes d'information informatisés, expérience préférée dans ACCPAC, JDE, Sage X3.
____________________________________________________________________________________________________

FedEx Power Ship, Commercial invoice, B13, Customs, and Cross-border requirements (MUST).

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, including Excel; working knowledge of MRP and computer-based information systems, preferred experience in ACCPAC, JDE, Sage X3.

Travel Requirements

Non applicable

____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Not Applicable.

Follow company guidelines and Quality processes', 'Effective oral and written communication skills.', 'Receiving per planner schedule, of supplies, components, instruments, tools, equipment, and customer returns.', 'Identify and label received components, instruments, tools, and equipment.', 'Picking, packing, and preparing customer orders.', "Emballer les composants, les instruments, les outils et l'équipement selon les spécifications et la qualité des lignes directrices.", 'Contact the specific carriers and organize pickup.', 'Establish and commit to daily pickup and delivery schedule.', 'Periodically check the integrity of inventory products, e.g. package, and labels.', 'Coordinate Periodic inventory count, to ensure accuracy of stock level.']

title: Fall 2022 Co-op: Enterprise Network Solution Planner
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.

We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.

Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.

Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity

Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and learn from a diverse group of leaders. We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for all Canadians, we believe it starts with Students & New Grads from coast-to-coast-to-coast.

At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let’s make your dream co-op placement possible.

About The Team

The Enterprise Network Solutions team focuses on business opportunities for complex, non-standard requests. We are the go-to destination for sales teams looking for information from Roger’s Network/Engineering. Much of what we do is the foundational for large enterprise networks. Solutioning 10G, 100G, 400G connections from coast to coast and everything in between is what we do!

What You Will Do…
  • Collect customer requirements and design customer solutions leveraging Roger’s footprint and external partners.
  • Understands existing and new access topologies as they relate to customer solutions.
  • Be active in Intercompany activity as it relates to Network. Collaborating closely with teams to ensure a successful delivery and tracking method for internal department service requirements.
What You Will Bring…
  • Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Management Engineering, Engineering in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, Computer Network Science, Systems and Networking or equivalent.
  • Fresh approach to designs and implementation of Ethernet and fiber optics.
  • Enthusiastic about knowing more about transport and access networks!
  • Jumping to into micro projects that can improve the way we do things.
  • Having inquisitive mind of creativity, innovation, and energetic drive to succeed.
Here’s What You Can Expect In Return
  • A team who deeply cares about your development and long term career at Rogers.
  • A team that trusts and wants to win together.
  • A competitive salary.
  • Access to leading edge technology and services so we can make more possible for our customers and our business every day.
  • A campus team that will keep you engaged through onboarding and your work term.
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule [[req_RogersFullPartTime]]

Shift Day

Length of Contract 4 Months

Work Location 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON

Travel Requirements None

Posting Category/Function Student/New Grad & Co-op

Requisition ID 268448

At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https//digital.rogers.com/

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
Posting Notes Student and New Grad

title: Systems Manager ( Contract Logistics)
description:
We are looking to hire a Systems Manager for our Contract logistics division in Mississauga.


Your Role

The person handling this role will be responsible for leading the team in its day to day operations supporting the Warehouse Management Systems and associated applications. The Systems Manager will ensure that systems are maintained to Kuehne Nagel (KN) and regulatory standards with focus on quality of service delivered and process efficiencies .This role will also be responsible for creating and maintaining scheduled feedback and continuous improvement cycles with internal and external stakeholders and engagement with regional and global teams.


Your Responsibilities
  • Support on Warehouse Management System (WMS) operations and attached applications (eg. PCIP / WMS / reporting / visibility solutions).
  • Production and maintenance of training documentation and working instructions for IS/IT.
  • Participate in new customer implementations.
  • Scheduled feedback sessions with business units
  • Participate in joint continuous improvement initiatives with operations and clients.
  • System validation - ensure that processes are aligned with customer requirements. Participate in quality and compliance audits.
  • Release management – compliant to KN standards
  • Data extraction and report management.
  • Work in conjunction with KNPS engineer in regards to system automated, KPI / data reporting.
  • Help desk support and monitor ticketing queues (RT).
  • After hours support on a rotation basis.
  • Other duties as assigned by manager.
  • Management of user logins and profiles

Your Skills And Experiences
  • Customer service focused with advanced WMS skills, team engagement skills ,detail oriented, organizational skills, problem solving skills, and communication skills with internal and exeternal clients .
  • Post secondary education required or equivalent work experience.
  • Understanding of Logistics processes.
  • Computer system administration
  • Proven proficiency in an automated warehouse environment.
  • 3 - 5 years work experience in a similar position in a multi client enviroment
Good Reasons to Join

We offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, excellent training programs and a highly dynamic global work environment. req87457

title: Gestionnaire des ressources humaines, Amazon Logistics Québec/ Human Resources Manager, Amazon Logistics Quebec
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Chez Amazon, nous nous efforçons d'être la société la plus centrée sur le client au monde. Pour y arriver, nous avons besoin de gens exceptionnellement talentueux, brillants et motivés. Si vous voulez nous aider à créer l'endroit où trouver et acheter quoi que ce soit en ligne, c'est votre occasion de marquer l'histoire. Nous sommes à la recherche d'une personne dynamique, organisée et pleine d'initiative qui se joindra à notre service des ressources humaines en tant que gestionnaire des RH. Cette personne servira nos nouvelles stations de livraison au Québec et dans une autre province qui sera bientôt annoncée.

Caractéristiques Des Candidats Retenus

Le gestionnaire des ressources humaines joue un rôle à la fois stratégique et pratique en fournissant un soutien complet en matière de ressources humaines à notre centre de distribution (Fulfillment Center). Ce rôle est essentiel à la mise en œuvre de nos initiatives en matière de personnel, à la prestation d'un excellent soutien interne à la clientèle et à l'amélioration des processus et de l'excellence fonctionnelle des ressources humaines.
  • Capacité de comprendre les objectifs commerciaux et de recommander de nouvelles approches, politiques et procédures pour améliorer continuellement les objectifs commerciaux, la productivité et le perfectionnement des ressources humaines au sein de l'entreprise
  • Capacité de créer une vision et des objectifs pour l'équipe des ressources humaines, d'inspirer l'équipe et de la motiver à atteindre l'excellence en matière de soutien à la clientèle et de processus RH de base
  • Approche pratique et capacité de prendre efficacement le « pouls » des employés pour assurer un niveau élevé d'engagement de leur part
  • Expérience dans un environnement de travail complexe en évolution rapide
  • Passion pour les solutions RH innovantes et l'amélioration des processus; expérience démontrée en pilotage de l'amélioration des processus et compétences spécifiques dans les méthodologies Kaizen, de préférence
  • Compétences avancées en gestion de projet; capacité de diriger des projets au niveau du réseau afin d'exercer une influence et d'encourager l'adhésion, puis de gérer l'exécution et d'obtenir de bons résultats
  • Création et mise en œuvre réussies de programmes efficaces et positifs de relations avec les employés, de maintien en poste et de récompenses
  • Capacité de composer avec une lourde charge de travail et de « retrousser ses manches » au besoin
  • Souci exceptionnel du service à la clientèle à l'interne comme à l'externe
  • Capacité de gérer simultanément plusieurs priorités axées sur les résultats
  • Excellentes compétences organisationnelles et interpersonnelles
-------------------------

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Human Resources department as an HR Manager to cover our new delivery stations within Quebec, and soon-to-be-announced additional province.

Successful Candidates Will Demonstrate

The Human Resources Manager is both a strategic and hands-on role that provides full cycle Human Resources support to our fulfillment center. The role is critical in executing our people initiatives, providing great internal customer support, and driving HR functional excellence and process improvement.
  • The ability to understand business goals and recommend new approaches, policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in business objectives, productivity and development of HR within the company
  • The ability to create a vision and goals for a HR team and inspire and motivate the team to achieve excellence in terms of customer support and core HR processes
  • A true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement
  • Experience with rapid and complex changing work environment
  • Passion for innovative HR solutions and process improvement; Demonstrated experience driving processes improvements and specific skills in Kaizen methodologies preferred
  • Advanced project management skills; ability to lead projects at a network level to influence and obtain buy-in, and then drive execution and achievement of the right results
  • Success in creating and driving effective and positive employee relations, retention and reward programs
  • The ability to be comfortable with high volume workload and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves"
  • Stellar internal and external customer service focus
  • The ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously - orientated on results
  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills

Basic Qualifications
  • Un diplôme complète (Baccalauréat) d'une université accréditée
  • Plus de 7 ans d'expérience comme partenaire d'affaires en ressources humaines
  • Expérience du soutien de groupes de plus de 1 000 employés clients payés à l'heure
  • Expérience dans un centre d'appels, un centre de distribution, ou un environnement de logistique ou de fabrication
  • Excellentes habiletés de communication, en français et en anglais, (écrit et oral)
-----------------------
  • Bachelor's Degree Required
  • 7+ years human resource business partner experience
  • Experience supporting hourly employee client groups with employee populations of 1,000+
  • Experience in call center, distribution center, logistics or manufacturing environments
  • Excellent communication skills, in French and English (written and oral)

Preferred Qualifications

Diplôme d'études supérieures (MBA ou maîtrise en gestion des ressources humaines, de préférence)

Curriculum vitae qui indique une progression régulière en gestion des ressources humaines au cours des 7 à 10 dernières années ou plus

Succès démontré dans des affectations étendues qui témoignent d'un rendement supérieur dans les rôles antérieurs

Expérience en direction, accompagnement et mentorat de subordonnés directs, et en direction de grandes équipes RH avec des professionnels RH de talent

Expérience en prise en charge de groupes importants d'employés clients payés à l'heure (environnements de distribution, de fabrication ou de centre d'appels)

Amazon s'engage à fournir des mesures d'accommodement à toutes les étapes du recrutement et de l'emploi conformément à la législation applicable en matière de droits de la personne et d'accommodement. Si l'on vous contacte pour une possibilité d'emploi et que vous avez besoin de mesures d'accommodement, y compris pour poser votre candidature à un poste, veuillez en informer le service des ressources humaines.

Advanced graduate degree (MBA or Masters in HRM preferred)

Resume that shows steady progression in HR Management for the last 7-10+ years.

Demonstrated success in stretch assignments that are evidence of superior performance in previous roles

Prior experience leading, coaching, and mentoring direct reports and leading large HR teams with talented HR professionals

Prior experience supporting large hourly employee client groups (distribution, manufacturing, or call center environments)

Amazon is committed to providing accommodations at all stages through recruitment and employment in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. If contacted for an employment opportunity, advise Human Resources if you require accommodation, including in order to apply for a position.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Amazon s’engage à créer un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Amazon est un employeur qui offre à tous les mêmes opportunités et ne fait pas de discrimination fondée sur la race, l’origine nationale, le sexe, l’identité sexuelle, l’orientation sexuelle, le statut d’ancien combattant protégé, le handicap, l’âge ou autres statuts protégés par la loi. Les personnes handicapées qui souhaitent présenter une demande d’accommodement, sont invitées à aviser leur recruteur.

title: Accounting Manager/ Logistics Industry
description:
Durham Recruiting has a unique opportunity for an Accounting Manager with their CPA for our client in Cobourg. With this role you will bring strong analytics, ideas/solutions, software implementation experience and training capabilities to the team. Due to the growth of this company this is a new role for the team, and they are super excited to add this type of bench strength to the team. With year over year growth of at least 30% expected for years to come this is a very exciting time to come on board.
  • Please note this role is 100% in the office due to the industry they service.
Job Requirement
  • Please note our client has an existing COVID-19 Policy in place for current employees – a copy of this will be available for your review if an employment contract is offered. It should also be noted that our client is also aware of the duty to accommodate under the applicable human rights legislation. If you have proof of an exemption you will be considered for the role with no issues. If there are any questions or concerns please let us know – you can email us at info@durhamrecruiting.ca
The Opportunity

In a nutshell, you will become a part of the senior team to ensure all aspects of the finance lifecycle, including planning, processes, reporting and ad-hoc projects.
  • Annual budget and monthly rolling forecast updates
  • Monthly management financial reporting and annual external financial reporting
  • Accountable for the integrity of financial systems and data
  • Accountable for adherence to internal control policies and procedures, including improvement and adjustment as required
  • Ad hoc financial & business analysis to drive decision making
  • SME for key accounting processes, including accounts payable, receivable, payroll, and time & attendance
  • ERP system maintenance and improvement
  • Financial policy review & development
  • Support to business commercial function, including customer pricing support
  • Support to business procurement function
  • Continuous process improvement
  • Team building & mentorship
What Stood Out For Us

As with every new client we bring on board; each and everyone has their unique reasons for being amazing! With this particular client the company as a whole is relaxed, able to work as cohesive team (as everyone’s roles are clearly defined), they love to have fun but then also know when to put their heads down and get to work!

The finance team has been together for just over a year now, with the Head of the Finance team having worked there for five years now. From the first year on-site the team has grown from 1 to 6 people! In a short time the team has become unified and are excited to bring in a senior mentor as there are a few on the team going through for their CPA. You will have the ability to not only help a company succeed but also grow someone’s career.

Why Choose Our Client
  • Full-Time Permanent Position – 100% in the office
  • $80, 000 to 90, 000 Base Annual Salary + Annual Bonus (10 to 15%)
  • 3 Weeks Vacation – negotiable with experience
  • A family-oriented company with a senior management team that cares about its people
  • Work hard / Play hard philosophy within the company and environment that encourages continuous professional and personal improvement
  • Small location with 15 in the office – super friendly group that loves to laugh
  • Benefits after 3 months + ERP program
  • Annual Physical Activity Benefit
  • ESPP – up to 5% of salary after 1 year of employment
  • Amazing Senion management team that is supportive, collaborative and encouraging
What We Need From You
  • Extremely positive, funny, outgoing and down to earth personality
  • Minimum 5 + years in a similar role – preferably from the Logistics/Warehousing or Manufacturing Industry
  • At least 3+ years experience supervising a small staff of at least 3+ people
  • Experience working with American Companies/Divisions is essential for this role – US GAAP or US State Regulations
  • Must hold your CPA to be considered for this role (this will be verified as a part of the process)
  • Credit check and Background Check will also be conducted as a part of the process
  • 2 References of people you reported into are also nessissary to be considered for this role
  • Experience with Excel(advanced), Microsoft Office, Accounting Software and CRM’s is a must to be considering for the role
  • Preference will be given to those that have experience with integrating new software into a company – there will be a software change in 2022 for this company
  • Excellent time management, multi-tasking skills and the ability to prioritize with ease
  • Proven ability analyze, problem solve and take initiative to improve the companies workflow, software use and accounting principles
We here at Durham Recruiting would like to thank all that apply but only those that are chosen to be a part of our Recruiting Process will be contacted. To see a full list of available jobs please visit us at www.durhamrecruiting.ca
  • Please note that this role will be posted fresh each Monday until the role has been filled.
Diane Kellow

Durham Recruiting

IND HIGH

Durham Recruiting is strongly committed to fostering diversity within our community. Our clients welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of their staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Please notify us if you require accommodation in the application process.

title: Senior Rail & Transit Engineer
description:
Job Summary
AECOM's Western Canada Rail & Transit Team is seeking an experienced design engineer. The Senior Rail & Transit Engineer will lead the design development of freight rail and/or LRT projects across the region, and may be based out of any of our Western Canada offices with work from home flexibility.

Job Duties May Include:

Provide engineering, technical, and management guidance to the Rail & Transit Group.

Demonstrate excellent communication skills and willingness to get involved in planning, design, and construction as projects dictate.

Assist Project Managers and take leadership in pursuing a balance of safety, quality, schedule, and budget.

Lead preparation of proposals, design packages, technical specifications, and tender documentation.

Have a hands-on role in developing track and grade designs in Civil 3D.

Chair meetings with clients, contractors, and others for project delivery and business development.

Act as a technical resource for less experienced team members in both office and field settings.

Provide P.Eng. sign-off on designs and reports.

Maintain a strong knowledge of client, industry and regulatory requirements.

Work independently with minimal guidance except for complex and unusual situations.

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

Minimum Requirements
BSc in Civil Engineering + 8 years of relevant design experience, or equivalent.

P.Eng. designation (or application undergoing review).

Excellent written and verbal communications skills (English).

Preferred Qualifications
10+ years of freight rail and/or LRT experience.

10+ years of civil linear infrastructure design experience.

5+ years of field experience.

Strong understanding of AREMA & Class I Railway standards.

Familiarity with CN, CP, Shortlines, Translink, Calgary Transit, Edmonton Transit, or similar.

Project Management experience.

Willingness for periodic field work and travel.

Bilingual (English primary, French secondary).

AECOM does not mandate an in-office presence, and our Freedom to Grow program supports individual discussions about what works best for you, our clients, and our business in determining working arrangements. Note that this is a full time position, however a part time or contract position would also be considered.

What We Offer
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: Manager, Client Advice I - Pearson International Airport
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

As a member of the Personal and Business Banking team, you’ll develop and coach a team of client service and financial service professionals, working towards a shared goal – delivering an exceptional client experience and deepening client relationships. As a Manager, Client Advice, you’ll inspire team members to perform at their best, while supporting a “One Team” approach that connects each client with the right advice to meet their financial needs. You’re flexible to work our banking centre hours which may include evenings and weekends. To help deliver a great client experience, you’re flexible to work at multiple banking centres within a reasonable travel distance.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, you’ll be on-site full-time. You will be required to work rotational shift work between the hours of Monday to Sunday 5:30am to 10:30pm.

How You’ll Succeed
  • Client experience - Lead by example, show your team how to deepen client relationships and meet client financial needs while providing a high standard of service. Deliver the client experience by encouraging employees to quickly resolve client complaints, escalating when necessary, and manage hard to solve issues. Empower clients to utilize self-service channels.
  • Results driven leadership - Create a culture of collaboration across multiple client offers so that clients are served by those best able to meet their financial needs. Support the Banking Centre Leader in monitoring business performance, put action plans in place to close any gaps and work as one team with all partners to increase the banking centre’s overall performance.
  • People Leadership - Create a team oriented, positive and productive working environment by recognizing the contributions of your team. Lead and coach a successful client service and financial services team. Advocate CIBC within the community to recruit employees who share and demonstrate our values.

Who You Are
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take initiative, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You are a caring and accountable leader. You’re passionate about developing and growing team members abilities. You have experience providing coaching and hands on support to meet team goals.
  • You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.
  • You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You connect with others through respect and authenticity
  • You will be required to obtain the Transport Canada Airport Clearance.
  • It's an asset if you have current accreditation and good standing Mutual Funds License (Canadian Securities Course or Investment Funds In Canada) and you’ve completed any of the following: Branch Compliance Officer’s Course (BCO), Branch Managers Examination Course (BME), Conducts & Practices Handbook (CPH) Wealth Management Essentials (WME); or Certified Financial Planner (CFP)
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What You Need To Know
  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Job Location

5980 Airport Rd, Pearson Int

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Customer Service

title: Chargé de projets / Ingénieur sénior - Planification des transports (Pipeline)
description:
Job Description

Chargé(e) de projets, Ingénieur(e) Sénior – Planification des Transports - Pipeline

Joignez-vous à un chef de file mondial en services professionnels. Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation.

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un Chargé(e) de projets, Ingénieur(e) senior – Planification des transports pour se joindre à notre équipe de la grande région de Montréal. La personne qui occupera ce poste fera partie de l’équipe de Planification des Transports de GHD – Est du Canada. Elle aura l’occasion, sous la supervision de la Cheffe – Planification des Transports et du Responsable du Groupe d’affaires Transports de réaliser quotidiennement un large éventail diversifié et stimulant de tâches.

En travaillant au sein de notre équipe multidisciplinaire expérimentée de transport, le candidat au poste aura les tâches et les responsabilités suivantes, sans être une liste exhaustive:

  • Définir, coordonner et participer à la réalisation d'études en planification du transport telles que par exemple, les études de besoins, de solutions, de pré-concepts, d’avant-projets, de circulation, ou stratégiques;
  • Préparer, coordonner, participer à et réviser la réalisation des différentes tâches techniques de telles études, par exemple :
  • L’identification des intrants requis
  • Les analyses des demandes actuelles et futures en déplacements, tous modes
  • Des études de circulation, de stationnement et simulations de plans de circulation pour tous les modes de transport
  • Des améliorations de réseaux et d’infrastructures routières, de transport collectif ou actif
  • Des concepts préliminaires d’infrastructures routières de transport collectif ou actif
  • La préparation et la révision de matériel de support / présentation pour les clients et partenaires aux projets
  • La révision du travail technique en s’assurant du respect des normes en vigueur
  • Réaliser de la gestion de projet, dont notamment :
  • Coordonner un travail multidisciplinaire : planification des transports, municipal, structures, modélisations de transport (micro, méso et/ou macro-simulations), développements de concepts sur dessins CAD, etc.
  • Assurer la coordination avec les équipes de conception;
  • Participer à la production d’offres de service et élaborer la planification des projets et estimer les besoins en ressources.
  • Contribuer au développement de l’équipe et de ses compétences

Compétences requises :

  • Détenir un baccalauréat en génie civil ou toute autre domaine connexe
  • Détenir un minimum de 15 ans d’expérience en études de planification de transports et/ou de circulation
  • Être membre en règle de l’OIQ – Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec
  • Être bilingue Français / Anglais à l’oral et à l’écrit
  • Avoir des habilités de gestion de projets : gestion des équipes de projet, des échéanciers, budgets, tâches techniques et talents de coordination;
  • Détenir une bonne connaissance des règlements, normes et pratiques en matière de planification des transports et circulation
  • Détenir une bonne connaissance des bonnes pratiques et critères de conception des infrastructures pour le transport collectif et les modes actifs
  • Logiciels :
  • Connaissances approfondies dans les logiciels suivants: Synchro / SimTraffic, Sidra, Vissim, AIMSUN, EMME et/ou autres logiciels de modélisation en transport
  • Expérience avec AutoCAD, BlueBeam et GIS, un atout

Pourquoi choisir GHD?

Notre culture consiste à toujours donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes.

Nous sommes une famille de gens intelligents, innovateurs, créatifs et passionnés par la résolution de problèmes. Dans notre entreprise détenue par ses employés, tout nous tient davantage à cœur. Lancez-nous des défis et aidez-nous à trouver de nouvelles solutions pour assurer la durabilité de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation pour les générations à venir.

Notre engagement envers vous

« Engagement » est un mot puissant qui définit notre façon de faire des affaires, de servir nos clients et de nous soucier du bien-être de chacun. Nous vous fournirons les outils dont vous avez besoin pour exceller et nous soulignerons vos réussites. Nous vous laisserons donner libre cours à votre curiosité pour permettre aux esprits brillants d’accomplir le meilleur travail possible. Nous investirons dans de nouvelles idées et éliminerons les obstacles autant que possible. Enfin, nous vous encouragerons à collaborer avec des milliers d’autres personnes diversifiées dans l’ensemble de notre entreprise mondiale.

Qui nous sommes

Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation. GHD est une entreprise de services professionnels dotée d’une expertise de pointe en ingénierie, en construction et en architecture. Fondée en 1928, GHD appartient entièrement à ses employés. Nous sommes plus de 10 000 employés diversifiés et qualifiés, unis sous la bannière GHD dans plus de 200 bureaux et sur cinq continents : Amérique du Nord et Amérique du Sud, Asie, Australie et Europe, ainsi que dans la région du Pacifique. En livrant d’excellents résultats sociaux et économiques, nous visons à bâtir des relations durables avec nos partenaires et nos clients.

En tant qu’organisation diversifiée et inclusive, nous encourageons les réalisations individuelles et reconnaissons la force d’un milieu de travail diversifié. GHD est un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Sur demande, GHD fournira des mesures d’adaptation raisonnables pour les candidats handicapés tout au long du processus de recrutement et de sélection.

About Us

Pourquoi choisir GHD?

Notre culture consiste à toujours donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes.

Nous sommes une famille de gens intelligents, innovateurs, créatifs et passionnés par la résolution de problèmes. Dans notre entreprise détenue par ses employés, tout nous tient davantage à cœur. Lancez-nous des défis et aidez-nous à trouver de nouvelles solutions pour assurer la durabilité de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation pour les générations à venir.

Notre engagement envers vous

« Engagement » est un mot puissant qui définit notre façon de faire des affaires, de servir nos clients et de nous soucier du bien-être de chacun. Nous vous fournirons les outils dont vous avez besoin pour exceller et nous soulignerons vos réussites. Nous vous laisserons donner libre cours à votre curiosité pour permettre aux esprits brillants d’accomplir le meilleur travail possible. Nous investirons dans de nouvelles idées et éliminerons les obstacles autant que possible. Enfin, nous vous encouragerons à collaborer avec des milliers d’autres personnes diversifiées dans l’ensemble de notre entreprise mondiale.

Qui nous sommes

Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation. GHD est une entreprise de services professionnels dotée d’une expertise de pointe en ingénierie, en construction et en architecture. Fondée en 1928, GHD appartient entièrement à ses employés. Nous sommes plus de 10 000 employés diversifiés et qualifiés, unis sous la bannière GHD dans plus de 200 bureaux et sur cinq continents : Amérique du Nord et Amérique du Sud, Asie, Australie et Europe, ainsi que dans la région du Pacifique. En livrant d’excellents résultats sociaux et économiques, nous visons à bâtir des relations durables avec nos partenaires et nos clients.

title: Senior Engineer, Rail
description:
Requisition ID: 43902

Job Category: Infrastructure; Engineering

Location: Mississauga, ON, Canada

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining , energy , and infrastructure sectors, we see challenges evolving in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff , with experience in over 150 countries , to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.

Our expertise in infrastructure includes aviation, highways and bridges, planning and advisory services, ports, rail and transit, tunnels, and water. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our cities? Then the infrastructure team is for you!

Looking to take the next step in your career?

Hatch is currently seeking a highly motivated Senior Engineer – Rail to join the Infrastructure group in our Rail team in the Mississauga, Ontario location.

New infrastructure and revitalizing assets are a key part of growth for any economy. We work with our clients to imagine and build rail networks of the future through a constant commitment to innovation and cutting-edge technology. Our clients include port authorities, mines, rail operators and 3rd party siding clients.

Our knowledge of freight rail infrastructure includes track, earthworks, bridges and structures, planning and advisory services, terminals and ports, tunnels, traction power, and rail systems and communications. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our future transportation network? Then the infrastructure team is for you!

As the successful candidate, you will be responsible for various technical leadership and project management support duties on freight rail projects. These projects could include feasibility analyses; conceptual, preliminary and detailed design; cost estimating; construction and contract administration support; and inspections of rail projects in western Canada and potentially throughout North America.

More specifically, your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
  • Planning, organizing and working with technical groups in the delivery of project deliverable requirements, this includes interfaces with rail and terminal operations, signaling, wayside monitoring, overhear catenary systems, rail communications, structures, drainage, roads and rolling stock;
  • Completing civil engineering analyses and review including: evaluating vertical and horizontal grade and track alignments; quantity and construction cost estimates; engineering design reports; technical specifications; material and equipment selection; cost estimates; construction contract documentation; compilation of design/construction drawings; etc.
  • Interfacing and communicating with the Client on project specific tasks;
  • Providing support to business development and strategic initiatives, including preparation of proposals, estimating deliverables and the associated effort to complete;
  • Participating with senior leaders in the establishment of short- and long-term plans for the development and growth of the group in the region;
  • Providing support to other Hatch offices around the globe in the development and delivery of project requirements;
  • Through your project efforts and involvement in industry activities, developing and maintaining client relations;
  • Actively participating in and supporting internal and external development and training activities;
  • As appropriate, supporting the development of more junior staff within the region;
  • Support to business initiatives and projects within the western Canada region;
  • Ensuring compliance to Hatch quality policies and procedures;
  • Ensuring we follow a design for safety approach.
You Bring To The Role
  • Engineering degree from an accredited University;
  • 7 years+ of rail industry experience;
  • Registered as a P.Eng. in Ontario and/or other Canadian provinces;
  • Project Management and/or Project Engineering experience, including client-consultant interaction;
  • Work knowledge and use of Civil 3D for design purposes;
  • Knowledge of North American rail design standards and best practices;
  • Able to work in a team environment, working on multiple projects simultaneously, mentoring or supervising Engineers-in-Training and junior designers;
  • Able to write clear, concise technical reports and proposals;
  • Able to check and review the work of other staff and consultants.
Why join us?
  • Work with great people to make a difference
  • Collaborate on exciting projects to develop innovative solutions
  • Top employer
What we offer you?
  • Flexible work environment
  • Long term career development
  • Think globally, work locally
We're committed to fostering a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and serve. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to age, race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status. If you have any accommodation requirements, please let us know. We'll do our best to meet your needs in accordance with applicable local legislation.

title: Senior Rail Safety Assurance Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Railways for the world of tomorrow .

DB is a leading global rail engineering, consulting, and operations company. We advise our clients on technically sophisticated and customised infrastructure, mobility, and transport solutions. With a strong commitment to zero emissions solutions, we assist with sustainable economic development of regions as well as making important contributions to the protection of the environment and help shape the world of the future.

Since 1966, DB Engineering & Consulting has delivered thousands of projects through over 6,000 engineers and consultants operating in more than 84 countries. DB offers exciting, challenging and varied professional development opportunities for both technical and project delivery professionals.

Operating in Australia and New Zealand since 2013, we focus on strategic consulting, rail planning, operations and maintenance advice, rail systems and systems integration, safety assurance, project reviews and independent verification, project management and zero emissions solutions. DB is also exploring rail operations and maintenance opportunities in this region.

We are currently assisting clients in the delivery of major rail infrastructure projects such as Melbourne Metro Tunnel, Geelong Fast Rail, Melbourne Airport Rail Link, Cross River Rail and Auckland Light Rail. We are also delivering zero emission solutions for clients in Australia, the United States, South America, and Europe.

We are recruiting a Senior Rail Safety Assurance Engineer as a pivotal participant in the delivery of one of DB’s core products being delivered to the Australian and global markets.

Responsibilities:

Key functions will include:
  • Promote high levels of employee engagement and business performance consistent with DB’s values
  • Project manage acceptance and assurance activities
  • Lead client relationship management and tender preparation
  • Provide system safety assurance and system safety and safety in design management services
  • Develop and/or review system safety assurance documentation and specifically system safety and safety in design related systems, processes, tools and documents for the assigned project
  • Provide specialist system safety assurance and system safety and safety in design management services to the engineering and technical design teams for the assigned project
  • Assist the development and implementation of system safety assurance management plans
  • Provide system safety assurance and system safety and safety in design management services
  • Lead the development of system safety assurance case and safety argument with associated evidence
  • Adhere to statutory rules, codes of practice and client internal guidelines
  • Maintain professional relationships with our partners, stakeholders and the client
  • Produce high quality technical reports and other project related artifacts
  • Assist in capability development of the rail systems team

A detailed overview of the responsibilities can be discussed during interviews.

Qualifications:
  • At least 8 years of experience. Proven experience in the railway industry required.
  • Experience in railway infrastructure projects and system safety assurance and related system safety & safety in design management practices, specifically referencing the RAMS standard EN 50126, 8, 9 and Commonwealth and State laws and regulations
  • Knowledge and experience in handling of system safety assurance and related system safety and safety in design management as per EN50126, 8, 9, including specified processes and processes to create/deliver comprehensive requirement management structures, services, artefacts and documentation to the project
  • Knowledge of and experience with GSN (Goal Structured Notation) to assist in building and illustrating the safety argument for the safety case
  • Prior knowledge of and experience with Victorian Government suite of system safety assurance and risk management guidelines and standards is an advantage
  • Business development training, management training
  • Demonstrated competence in providing key technical expertise across a broad range of highprofile rail projects
  • Competent in managing risk on substantial projects
  • High level skills in applying safety in design practices and processes.
  • Demonstrated multiple instances of delivering best client outcomes/options which have saved the client costs/time
  • English as main language is required

Benefits:

International career opportunities

As a global company, we offer attractive career opportunities - worldwide. We provide a work environment that encourages growth and creativity. You will work on complex and innovative projects with international teams across all continents. Your impact brings markets and people together – around the world.

Intercultural teams

With more than 5,000 employees from over 80 countries across all technical and engineering disciplines worldwide, we are shaping railways for the world of tomorrow. We offer an inspiring environment for personalities who are open-minded, curious, and committed. A strong team spirit, an intercultural mindset and engagement at work are essential parts of our success.

Professional onboarding and development

We invest in the development of our employees. To ensure the best start for you, we provide a global onboarding program and intercultural training and support you in preparing for the next career step.

Attractive employment conditions

We offer you attractive working conditions and a competitive compensation package based on country conditions.

Mobilization & relocation support

To ensure a smooth and successful start for your international employment, we assist you with relocation and immigration.

Work safety

Our international security support ensures safe working conditions worldwide and provides you with relevant information for a safe living around the globe.

title: Manager, Data Science - Logistics & Shopper Pay
description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart is seeking a Data Science Manager with experience leading extraordinary teams at a high-growth company. In this position you will partner with senior product and engineering leadership to grow and drive Instacart’s Marketplace team. Marketplace sits at the core of Instacart. Our systems support millions of shoppers on the Instacart platform by offering immediate and flexible earnings opportunities, and so we must remain highly reliable at all times to ensure that Instacart’s customers receive timely and high-quality deliveries. A major aspect of the team's success is finding the efficient frontier between service availability and fulfillment cost, all the while providing the best customer experience!

You will lead a growing Marketplace data science team and will take on some of the most challenging and impactful problems that are redefining how people buy groceries every day. We build industry-leading technology to power a balanced, sustainable and resilient marketplace that drives growth through efficiently meeting customer demand, incentivizing shoppers, and offering a widening range of high quality services.

You will hire and lead a team of data scientists responsible for generating insights to advise product and algorithm improvements that drive angle-changing growth. You will be a trusted partner to colleagues in product and engineering, helping to provide vision and direction to a data-driven product team. We’re looking for an experienced leader who can get going quickly and influence decision-making across the entire organization!

About The Job
  • You will lead a team of hard-working data scientists
  • You and your team will have a high impact on your stakeholder teams, product, and operations; you will hold yourself accountable to measurable improvements in business outcomes
  • You and your team will use expertise in causal inference, operations research, machine learning, complex systems modeling, economics, etc. to influence Instacart’s product and algorithms
  • You and your team will design rigorous experiments and interpret results to draw detailed and practical conclusions
  • You and your team will develop statistical models to extract trends, measure results, and predict future performance of our product
  • You will be responsible for the health of your team’s data - its completeness and quality
  • You and your team will enable objective decision making across the company by democratizing data through dashboards and other analytical tools
  • You and your team will present findings in a compelling way to influence Instacart’s leadership
About You
  • 5+ years experience working in a quantitative role at a product or ecommerce company
  • 2+ years experience managing a team of data scientists
  • Graduate degree in Operations Research, Machine Learning, Economics, Statistics or a related technical field
  • Experience working on gig economy issues, multi-sided marketplaces, logistics, pricing or e-commerce
  • Ability to run rigorous experiments and come up with scientifically sound recommendations
  • Consistent track record of forming effective cross-functional partnerships with XFN partners
  • Ability to create and improve team processes and articulate a technical vision and strategy
  • Experience driving quarterly or half-yearly planning processes
  • Ability to translate business needs into analytical frameworks
  • Eagerness to learn, flexibility to shift when needed, savviness to navigate and thrive in a dynamic environment, and a growth mindset needed to build a successful team and company
Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.
