title: Planificateur transport et logistique junior
description:
Poste : Planificateur transport et logistique junior
Lieu : Près de Joliette
Mandat de type temporaire
Domaine : Manufacturier
Salaire : 20 à 24$ de l'heure selon l'expérience
Durée : 3-4 mois

Vous êtes une personne connue comme étant organisée et méthodique? Vous souhaitez gagner en expérience dans un poste au transport et logistique? Voici une superbe opportunité! Bienvenue aux étudiants !

Une entreprise établie et impliquée dans sa communauté dans la belle région de Lanaudière, plus précisément dans le secteur de Joliette recherche un Planificateur transport et logistique junior pour quelques mois.

Au plaisir de vous connaître !

Avantages
- Excellente opportunité de gagner en expérience comme Planificateur transport et logistique junior ouverture aux profils junior et/ou aux étudiants
- Horaire flexible | 35h par semaine
- Salaire: 20-24$ selon l'expérience ou selon le niveau de diplomation
- Excellente formation offerte, soyez bien accompagné
- Mandat: 3-4 mois (possibilité de prolongement)



Responsabilités
Comme Planificateur transport et logistique junior, vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes:

-Responsable de la gestion complète des matières à recycler pour les lieux qui sont sous la responsabilité du département;
-Responsable de la création des bons de livraison pour les mouvements de matière première, prise de rendez-vous pour les entrepôts sous sa gouverne et du transport vers les autres usines
-Responsable de la gestion de l’espace et de l’inventaire de matières premières;
-Responsable de l'expédition selon les besoins et le transport s’y rattachant;
-Voir à l’approvisionnement de la fibre recyclée pour le 200 Tonnes incluant la gestion des entrepôts externes;
-Responsable de la facturation de tous les éléments sous la responsabilité du poste.

Qualifications
- Bonne gestion du stress
- Anglais fonctionnel
- Connaissance de SAP (Un atout)
- Excel de base, au minimum
- Aimer jouer avec les chiffres, faire des calculs


Sommaire
Intéressé par ce mandat temporaire de quelques mois comme Planificateur transport et logistique junior près de Joliette?

Faites-nous parvenir votre CV sans tarder!

stephanie.croteau@randstad.ca
elyse.charlebois@randstad.ca

Au plaisir de discuter avec vous !

Randstad, l'humain en tête !

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Transportation Engineer, Planning
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for a Transportation Engineer to join our Transportation Services group as a Project Manager. In this role you will oversee the analysis and preparation of Transportation Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Studies while liaising with clients, planners and review agencies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage the preparation of detailed traffic modelling, designs and studies for a wide variety of residential, commercial and transportation projects considering active transportation as well as vehicular traffic.
  • Participate on various project teams to identify issues and mitigative measures to satisfy approval requirements, assisting our clients in advancing projects toward completion.
  • Identify and provide transportation engineering design and planning solutions with multi-modal considerations to meet the needs of all road users.
  • Develop and utilize knowledge of requirements of reviewing agencies such as Ministry of Transportation of Ontario (MTO) and municipal authorities.
  • Review and finalize technical reports and design briefs to summarize analyses.
  • Work within other civil engineering specialties to gain knowledge of all facets of land development engineering.
  • Manage all aspects of projects to achieve the client’s goals, including schedule, budget, and quality objectives through the application of formal project management processes.
  • Collaborate with internal and external team members to deliver multi-disciplinary projects through preliminary and detail designs for our clients.
  • Provide team leadership to support the growth of our Transportation Services group.
  • Take responsibility for the entire project process from the proposal through preparation of reports.
  • Cultivate strong client relations; liaise with professional colleagues and municipal/agency staff to move projects forward.
  • Coordinate with client, municipalities, agencies, subconsultants and all internal disciplines involved in the project.
  • Deliver projects within budget and in accordance with QA/QC procedures.
  • Supervise, direct and support/mentor junior staff.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Licenced Professional Engineer with a minimum of 6 years experience.
  • Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in Ontario.
  • Experience in preparation and analysis of transportation studies such as Traffic Impact Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Management Plans, etc.
  • Client focused with the ability to cultivate and nurture relationships.
  • Project management experience in a consulting engineering environment.
  • Dynamic, resourceful team motivator with proven track record in mentoring and leading teams.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge even when We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyer’s Program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Intermediate or Senior Transportation Design Engineer
description:
Are you a Transportation Design Engineer who enjoys crafting creative solutions to manage the evolving transportation challenges of our clients? Are you interested in working on a diverse range of projects where no two days are the same?  If so, we want to hear from you!


A Little About Us
We are engineers, technologists, planners, landscape architects, scientists, and their support teamsthat work together to deliver infrastructure, minimizing environmental impact and maximizing benefit to the community.  We work hard and play hard because that is what #ISLLIFE is all about!  Check us out on Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

ISL’s Transportation Team works collaboratively so that our employees can flourish and focus on our client’s success.  Committed to finding, mentoring, and growing the right individual, our team approach is integral to our success:
  • Client centric - we are known for our creative approach to problems and provide our clients with innovative, cost effective and award-winning solutions
  • Continuous improvement – we are never satisfied with the status quo and are always looking for creative ways to improve and get the job done
  • Support - we trust our people and do not micromanage, but also give them the tools, resources, and mentorship for individual and team success
  • Fun and flexible office environment – we understand the dynamic nature of life, so we offer workplace flexibility to allow achievement of personal and team goals and have fun doing it 


A Little About You
Your cover letter must include:
  • A listing of the major transportation projects you have been involved in
  • Your approach to problem solving and challenging the ideas of others
  • How you build and maintain internal and external relationships

Your resume should show us:
  • Registration as a P.Eng. with EGBC
  • 8+ years’ experience – title and compensation will reflect years of experience
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD and Civil 3D as well as Microsoft business products and PDF software for drawing markups and comment tracking
  • Proficiency in the application of TAC and BC Supplement to TAC design guidelines and transportation design practices

Bonus points for:
  • Prior consulting experience
  • 3+ years BC experience
  • Experience on BC Ministry of Transportation projects
  • Experience coordinating with other civil disciplines on multi-discipline transportation projects: traffic engineering, bridges/structures, drainage, utilities, geotechnical, environmental, etc.
  • Transportation design experience in all aspects of project delivery including planning, preliminary design, detailed design and tender preparation, and construction


A Little More About the Role
The successful applicant will be exposed to the entire project lifecycle - from planning to concept through detailed design, tender, and construction services.  Exposure will be based on experience and individual skill set and career development opportunities.

Responsibilities:
  • Proposal writing, project cost estimating, and timely delivery of successful project proposals
  • Project management of projects of all sizes, including scope, schedule, and budget
  • Collaborate with multi-discipline project teams and liaison with internal ISL disciplines as well as external sub-consultants to address complex project problems and provide comprehensive project solutions
  • Work in accordance with Quality Management processes, ensure technical quality of deliverables, and ensure schedule milestones are achieved
  • Liaise with clients and ensure client satisfaction through effective design management
  • Fulfill roles of Project Manager / Design Manager and/or Transportation Design / Highway Design Engineer of Record
  • Provide engineering design solutions to address project issues and constraints to achieve client project objectives
  • Complete highway and roadway designs for various types of rural and urban transportation projects
  • Produce and review project construction cost estimates, risk registers, contract documents and specifications
  • Provide design review during construction through to completion of post-construction drawing records and documentation
  • Review third party designs to ensure accuracy and compliance with project as a whole
  • Document preparation including memo’s, reports, plans, briefing materials and guidelines
  • Develop, guide and mentor staff
  • Business development through client meetings, conferences, mixers, and development of appropriate marketing materials
  • Maintain and build strong client relationships
  • Present project successes at conferences as well as attend industry technical committees


 

We are engineers, technologists, planners, landscape architects, scientists, and their support teams that work together to deliver infrastructure, minimizing environmental impact and maximizing benefit to the community. 

  • We work on fascinating projects right in our community.
  • We are nimble. We integrate the right team to solve our clients' biggest challenges.
  • We are social. Follow our hashtag #isllife on Twitter and Instagram or check out our YouTube Channel.
  • We get together.Every year, Staff Development Seminar brings together ISLers from all over western Canada to learn, share and connect.
  • We are independent problem solvers.Employee owned and operated, we like to work hard with minimum bureaucracy.
  • We encourage and reward high performance. Employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP, and competitive salaries with opportunities for annual bonus.


Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities?

Visit us online at www.islengineering.com/about/join-the-team

title: Transportation & Traffic Engineer
description:
Gannett Fleming’s Toronto office is looking for a Transportation & Traffic Engineer. With a strong transportation/traffic engineering background to support planning, design, and construction management activities for various projects as part of our roadway team in the Greater Toronto Area.

In this role, you will be responsible for leading several tasks/contracts with local clients to include MTO, Metrolinx, and municipal clients. You will be charged with marketing Gannett Fleming to surrounding public service entities to develop relationships and business opportunities. 

The ideal candidate will be expected to provide expertise, quality management, design, and technical services to clients. With a working knowledge of all engineering disciplines related to transportation projects, the successful candidate will use experience and judgment to solve problems for a wide range of public sector clients. You will be highly proactive, have excellent technical writing skills, and have experience with traffic analysis, modeling, and simulation programs. 

Education | Experience:

Minimum Qualifications:

  • A Bachelor’s Degree in Civil/Traffic Engineering or equivalent.
  • A Professional Engineer license in Ontario, P.Eng.
  • Eligible for MTO’s RAQS registration.
  • 7-12+ years of experience working in traffic studies/design/transportation planning. 
  • Familiarity with all relevant Ontario municipal and provincial (MTO) standards and requirements.
  • Heavily involved in transportation planning projects and traffic engineering scope on mid-size to larger projects.
  • Ability to lead and/or provide input to business development efforts and Capture Planning.
  • Perform operational analyses and simulations of transportation systems using Synchro/SimTraffic and Highway Capacity Software (HCS)
  • Strong understanding of project management principles.
  • Supervise data collection and field investigation efforts for transportation studies, including traffic counts, travel time runs, and inventories of roadway elements.
  • Utilize the Ontario Traffic Manuals (OTMs), the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, TAC, and other transportation standards, manuals, and requirements to perform signal warrant studies and assist in the development of maintenance of traffic plans for highway construction and utility projects.
  • Read, interpret, review, and prepare engineering plans and drawings, specifications, presentations, reports, and other documents.
  • Supervise and independently evaluate and summarize operational and forecast data for use in transportation studies.

Desirable Qualifications and Abilities:

  • RAQS Qualified
  • Experience working on Municipal traffic studies/design and/or transportation planning.
  • Supervise and perform operational analyses and simulations of transportation systems using software packages such as VISSIM, VISUM, , TORUS and/or SIDRA/ARCADY.
  • Supervise and independently develop traffic and transit travel demand forecasts using travel demand models and the Institute of Transportation Engineers’ Trip Generation Manual.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in using one or more of the industry-relevant software (Civil3D, Inroads, EMME, AIMSUN) would be an asset.
  • Review and supervise the development of traffic signal, electrical signal, signing & markings, and maintenance and protection of traffic designs.

title: Senior Transportation Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

IBI Group’s Markham office is searching for a Senior Transportation Engineer to join its growing team.  We take pride in offering career growth and challenging opportunities within a global organization, solving today’s difficult urban issues. If successful, you will work on major transit/subway projects, alongside a supportive team of industry-leading experts!  The goal of the projects is to foster sustainable and healthy communities in the Greater Toronto Area by adding capacity and connectivity to an existing busy transit network and connecting to a number of other transit systems to make it easier to travel within the city and beyond!

Our Team practices flexible working arrangements, including flexible work hours, plus we support your working from home. As a leader, you’ll be expected to attend meetings at your home office in Markham, and at client offices and sites. You can also take advantage and work from any of our Greater Toronto Area and Hamilton offices.

What You Will Bring to the Company:

As a Senior Transportation Engineer, you will undertake complex assignments requiring a diverse knowledge of transportation engineering, design principles and practices, and transportation planning. With a working knowledge of all engineering disciplines related to environmental assessments for transportation projects, you will use your experience and judgement to solve problems for a wide range of public sector clients.

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • Oversee the transportation team working on P3 projects. This work includes both Temporary Traffic and Transit Management Plans (TTMP) and permanent design for large scale transit projects
  • Act as Technical Advisor (TA) responsible for the preparation of the Reference Concept Design (RCD) and Project Specific Output Specifications (PSOS)
  • Responsible for necessary design activities to advance the work through the bid phase
  • Develop innovative and practical design solutions within the bounds of good civil design
  • Work closely with traffic, utilities, natural, heritage, urban design and other disciplines to develop solutions
  • Prepare design concepts related to active transportation projects, traffic impact studies, parking and traffic calming studies, and traffic management plans
  • Prepare technical reports, presentations, and other documentation, including cost estimates
  • Review drawings and perform quality control checks on drawings and reports
  • Follow quality assurance/quality control, and health and safety requirements
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Degree
  • 10 years traffic engineering experience, preferably in large-scale P3 Projects
  • Proven analytical and problem solving skills for dealing with complex transportation engineering assignments with minimal direction
  • Experience in transportation planning, including the feasibility and preliminary design of new or enhanced BRT, LRT, road and highway facilities
  • Experience in transit infrastructure and stations, parking, and active transportation facilities is an asset
  • Experience with project management and/or construction management is an asset.
  • Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to be flexible and collaborate, while maintaining quality work within a fast paced environment


Additional Information

We are currently exclusively on a work from home model during COVID-19. On return to office, we will support a highly flexible working arrangement with work-from-home and work-from-office options, and multiple office locations across the GTHA to choose from. Our home office for this assignment is located in the Remington Corporate Centre and is situated in the heart of Canada’s High-Tech Capital, Downtown Markham. As one of IBI Group’s newest offices, the facility reflects the most up to date standards and design technology for an inviting and productive workspace, all to better serve clients of the region. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Engineer - circulation and transport
description:
The engineering service started in 2020 a transformation of its service by adding divisions and creating several new positions of managers, engineers and specialists in administration.

This new reorganization of the service was necessary since the city of Laval is growing. This evolution brings many challenges and a great diversity of mandates to achieve in the coming years.

Work at Engineering Service in the city of Laval is working in a perspective of sustainable development and innovation With a multicultural team where resources are available to carry out your projects.

The challenges are quite present in your daily life!

Come and build The future of Laval With us, your expertise is in demand as:

engineer - circulation and transport

Temporary extension 2 years

The challenges that await you:

You will coordinate and perform studies and projects in circulation and transport . You will participate in the Project Planning on the city's territory of standards and regulations relating to the road sign, to the development of the road network and the traffic lights . You will develop and participate in the design of traffic light systems and programming attached to it. You will have to take care of the management of assets related to the different equipment of these systems.

The desired profile:

  • be a member in good standing of the Order of Engineers of Quebec;
  • Possess a university degree in bachelor's degree in civil engineering;

you too, take part in the change.

Apply before May 5, 2022

The city of Laval applies a program to access equality employment. It values ​​diversity and invites women, visible minorities, ethnic minorities, Aboriginal people and people with disabilities to apply. For the latter, do not hesitate to share with the necessary special arrangements, in the event that you are invited to a selection process.

title: Intermediate Transportation Engineer / Technologist
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood provides environmental and transportation engineering design expertise to provincial, regional and municipal road authorities employing over 5,500 individuals in our Environment & Infrastructure Solutions business across North America.   Operating from 17 offices across Ontario, our company offers a comprehensive suite of services, including proven success in leading multi-disciplinary teams on projects of varying size, complexity and procurement models, from preliminary assessment and design through to detail design, contract preparation, tendering, construction administration, inspection and post-construction monitoring.

 

Wood Environment & Infrastructure Solutions is seeking an Intermediate  Transportation Engineer or Transportation Technologist to join our Transportation Group based in either Cambridge, Burlington or Richmond Hill, ON.

 

This is an exciting opportunity to work on dynamic transportation projects in a team environment for municipal and provincial highways projects.

 

Key Responsibilities:

 

  • Undertake preliminary and detail engineering design for rural or urban road and highway improvement projects including Design Build and P3 Delivery
  • Manage multiple projects and staff that may be assigned to provide technical support
  • Provide technical direction including completion of quality control reviews
  • Prepare standard engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs and estimates
  • Prepare and review tender documents
  • Undertake contract administration and construction liaison
  • Liaise and coordinate with multiple project team disciplines
  • Mentor and supervise junior engineers and technicians
  • Liaise with clients and agencies
  • Prepare or contribute to preparation of proposals and project presentations
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education with an undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering or a Civil Engineering Technologist diploma
  • Minimum of four (4) years of experience with road and highway projects
  • Experience with all aspects of roadway design (i.e. alignments, geometrics, staging, utilities, roadside safety, quantity calculations, contract documents and constructability)
  • Experience on MTO projects is an asset
  • Knowledge of several or all of the following software packages an asset: AutoCAD, MicroStation, Civil 3D, InRoads and MTO design standards and guides
  • Professional licensing with PEO or an OACETT membership would be an asset
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Intermediate Transportation Engineer
description:
exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Transportation Engineer to join our Transportation Division in Vancouver, BC. In this role, you will be assisting with engineering design of roads and highway projects, including drawings, cost estimates, and specifications.
We have industry-leading professionals and mentors, and a culture that fosters growing future leaders. Our team has a reputation of taking great care in developing our people and fostering a positive, friendly, and rewarding work environment.

Advantages
Competitive compensation
Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
Continuous support for your professional development and growth

Responsibilities
What You’ll Be Doing:
Serve as the client contact, project managing highway design projects across BC and AB
Direct a team of designers in preparing cost effective, accurate and timely transportation engineering designs and drawings that meet all client and approval agency requirements and standards
Develop concept designs and advance them to the detailed design stage, also overseeing cost estimates
Prepare tender document special provisions and specifications
Manage major highway design projects to ensure schedules, budgets and quality control standards are achieved
Transform preliminary concepts and sketches into engineering designs, plans and drawings based on project requirements, using primarily an AutoCAD / Civil 3D platform, as well as other technical software as needed (e.g. Infraworks, Microstation, InRoads, RoadEng)
Communicate and work in an integrated team environment to ensure project schedules, budgets, and quality control standards are achieved and maintained
Provide supervision, training and mentorship to junior technical staff.
Contribute to business development, including attendance at industry events and proposal preparation.


Qualifications
Degree in Civil Engineering, with a focus in transportation engineering with at least 5 – 10 years of experience
Experience working with the Ministry of Transportation is preferred
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Some knowledge of relevant transportation planning and traffic engineering policies and procedures in Western Canada
Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Effective people, client and project management skills


Summary
If this seems like a good fit for you, please reach out to me at patrick.stegner@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Intermediate Transportation Engineer
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Transportation Engineer to join our Transportation Division in Vancouver, BC. In this role, you will be assisting with engineering design of roads and highway projects, including drawings, cost estimates, and specifications.
We have industry-leading professionals and mentors, and a culture that fosters growing future leaders. Our team has a reputation of taking great care in developing our people and fostering a positive, friendly, and rewarding work environment. Join McElhanney, a firm with big company opportunities, and a small company feel!

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Serve as the client contact, project managing highway design projects across BC and AB
  • Direct a team of designers in preparing cost effective, accurate and timely transportation engineering designs and drawings that meet all client and approval agency requirements and standards
  • Develop concept designs and advance them to the detailed design stage, also overseeing cost estimates
  • Prepare tender document special provisions and specifications
  • Manage major highway design projects to ensure schedules, budgets and quality control standards are achieved
  • Transform preliminary concepts and sketches into engineering designs, plans and drawings based on project requirements, using primarily an AutoCAD / Civil 3D platform, as well as other technical software as needed (e.g. Infraworks, Microstation, InRoads, RoadEng)
  • Communicate and work in an integrated team environment to ensure project schedules, budgets, and quality control standards are achieved and maintained
  • Provide supervision, training and mentorship to junior technical staff.
  • Contribute to business development, including attendance at industry events and proposal preparation.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Degree in Civil Engineering, with a focus in transportation engineering with at least 5 – 10 years of experience
  • Experience working with the Ministry of Transportation is preferred
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Some knowledge of relevant transportation planning and traffic engineering policies and procedures in Western Canada
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
  • Effective people, client and project management skills

What Can We Offer You?
  • Competitive compensation
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,000 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.


If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor
#LI-AM3McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Transportation Engineer - Graduate
description:
Join a global professional Service Leader. We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

 We are looking for a Transportation Engineer-in-Training to join our Transportation team in Vancouver, Calgary or Edmonton.

 *This position will commence in June 2022*

The Transportation group within GHD Canada works with Provincial, Regional, and local municipal transportation agencies on large scale projects across the whole Transportation spectrum of highways, roads and bridges, transit infrastructure, transportation planning and roundabouts.  Our team provides integrated transportation services throughout the project lifecycle from initial policy, transportation economics and business case advice, through concept, Environmental Assessment, detailed design and construction administration.

Responsibilities:

  • Undertake research and analysis of land use, demographic and travel data
  • Determine requirements and broader transportation impact development proposals
  • Undertake traffic operational assessment using capacity analysis and/or micro-simulation analysis
  • Assist or manage in the preparation and analysis of travel forecasts
  • Develop and assess alternative road improvements
  • Develop preliminary road designs, prepare technical memo’s, reports and graphics
  • Incorporate transit, pedestrian, TDM and active transportation into studies
  • Provide traffic engineering services for Environmental Assessments, Preliminary and Detail roadway projects
  • Review and develop on-site circulation and prepare vehicle sweep paths
  • Prepare parking justification and loading studies
  • Undertake parking demand and utilization studies

 

Skills, Qualifications and Experience:

  • Civil engineer with a E.I.T. registration in BC
  • Valid class 5 driver’s license with driving record in good standing
  • Understanding of travel data collection and analysis techniques, intersection capacity and level of service analysis techniques.
  • Knowledge of intersection capacity analysis and micro-simulation modelling
  • Knowledge of travel demand analysis
  • Proficient with in Excel, Word, Synchro/SimTraffic, Vissim, Aimsun, Emme, HCS, AutoCAD, AutoTURN, Trip Generation, functional design, site circulation, traffic modelling and assignment
  • Knowledge of travel forecasting methods & roadway geometrics
  • Excellent report/letter/technical memo writing skills along with superior verbal communications
  • Preforms well independently as well as in a team environment

As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Intermediate Urban Planner
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Our dynamic Toronto Urban Planning practice is seeking an Intermediate Urban Planner to join their team!  The Intermediate Planner role will be involved in assisting and taking lead roles on policy and master planning assignments, obtaining development approvals, providing professional advice and consulting with a range of stakeholders. The individual will report to the office planning leads and work with other professional staff within and outside the office. 

Most of the Things You'll Be Working On:

  • Assisting with range of policy and land use planning projects, with an increasing level of autonomy and project management responsibility:
  • Conducting research, highest and best use reviews and planning policy analysis
  • Preparation of site plans, master plans and municipal and regional planning strategies
  • Coordination of planning applications and securing approvals
  • Public consultation, including creation and delivery of presentations for public meetings, open houses and workshops
  • Preparation of proposals and contracts for public and private sector clients  
Qualifications

You'll Need To Have:

  • University Degree in Urban and Regional Planning
  • Full member of the Ontario Provincial Planners Institute (OPPI) and the Canadian Institute of Planners (CIP) or in the process of becoming of a full member
  • Minimum of 4 years of relevant planning experience in land development and land use planning
  • Strong understanding of the planning and development processes in Ontario
  • Analytical thinker and creative problem solver with high attention to detail
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills. Experience in project management would be an asset
  • Ability to work individually or in a team environment
  • Exceptional written communication skills (samples of written work will be required)
  • Excellent oral communication skills and experience with public speaking 
  • User functionality in MS Office products. Knowledge of GIS, CAD, Illustrator, SketchUp, or similar programs would be an asset
  • Valid Class "G" Ontario Driver's Licence is required


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada. 

We request applicants submit RESUME AND PORTFOLIO highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.

title: Professional advisor - Urban Design
description:
Come and make a difference in a modern, expanding city, which has its citizens at heart. An environment where your creativity contributes to the realization of major stimulating projects favoring the well-being of Lavallois. In addition to offering you career possibilities, you will be part of a large public organization on a human dimension.

for its town planning service, City of Laval is In search of:

Professional advisor (LE) - Urban design

permanent position

The urban development and design division, in charge of some planning and projects in urban design offers a permanent position for a motivated professional to support a highly qualified team in order to help them meet these few challenges.

The challenges awaiting you:

The holder will participate in the visual design, the development and planning of Various urban development projects. In addition, he will participate in the management of mandates and projects in urban design and will ensure its implementation on occasion.

more particularly, you will have:

  • Make detailed plans as well as visual presentation documents, perspectives, visual 3D simulations and maps and cartographic documents in urban design using software and adequate tools to represent concepts ;
  • Design, develop and propose requalification or urban development projects according to approaches and trends in development and town planning;
  • Performing studies and analyzes concerning the possibilities of 'Urban planning, consult stakeholders in the field and formulate parameters and action plans for the implementation of projects;
  • Organize, collaborate in the organization, participate and present consultation workshops , conferences, congresses, study days, form sessions ation and information;
  • Represent the city with citizens, consultants or other as well as on various committees.

why consider a job within from the city of Laval:

  • A work schedule of 33.75 hours per week , allowing to reconcile work and personal life;
  • 16.5 holidays per year including several days off in holidays;
  • A Competitive group insurance;
  • Retirement regime with determined service.

the profile sought:

  • Hold a baccalaureate in architecture or any other area linked to urban design;
  • Holding a mastery in urban design will be considered an asset;
  • Have four (4) years of experience notably in the design of overall development plans or development potential studies;
  • Master Sketchup, Autocad and the Adobe Software (Illustrator, In Desi gn and photoshop);
  • have the capacity and ease of graphic representation;
  • Atout: Draw and represent Masterplan type ideas and concepts. UL>

title: Urbaniste
description:
Le groupe TEHORA est présentement à la recherche d’un collaborateur urbaniste, ayant d’excellentes aptitudes techniques, d’excellentes connaissances et qui souhaite mettre à profit ses compétences au sein d’une équipe polyvalente. 
Sans être exhaustives, voici les services et  livrables que devront fournir l’urbaniste retenu :


Principalesresponsabilités et fonctions :
  • Agir à titre de spécialiste auprès des clients en fournissant des services de consultation en urbanisme.
  • Collaborer avec les spécialistes dans différents domaines, l’ingénierie, les urbanistes et l’environnement pour fournir des services de qualité et au bon moment afin de contribuer au succès de nos clients.
  • Agir à titre de chargé de projet ou de discipline dans le cadre de certains mandats d’envergure.

Si lurbanisme vous passionne, voici votre opportunité pour vous joindre à l’équipe en rôle d’urbaniste.

Vous travaillerez en collaboration avec l’équipe de projet, différents fournisseurs, et différents clients issus du secteur gouvernemental.

Profil

  • Baccalauréat en urbanisme ou domaine connexe.
  • Au minimum deux (2) années dexpérience dans le domaine de l’urbanisme, préférablement en relation avec le transport ;
  • Connaissance approfondie de l’écosystème ESRI (ArcGIS Desktop/Server/Enterprise) et des applications de la plateforme infonuagique ArcGIS Online (Field Maps, Survey123, ArcGIS Hub, ArcGIS Notebook, ArcGIS Dashboard, ArcGIS Hub, Workforce, notamment).
  • Connaissance de la plateformes Safe Software (FME Workbench et Server).
  • Connaissance des bases de données (SQL Server, Oracle, Postgresql ou MySQL).


Lieu de travail
Le lieu de travail sera déterminé selon le mandat, il peut être en télé travail ou chez le client.


Pourquoi se joindre à TEHORA ?
TEHORA est une firme québécoise multidisciplinaire reconnue pour lexcellence de ses services professionnels, de nature technique et de gestion de projets à léchelle nationale et internationale. Notre mission est daccompagner nos clients dans la concrétisation de leurs projets par lexcellence de notre savoir-faire et de notre créativité.

Depuis sa création en 2017, notre équipe de professionnels connait une croissance exponentielle en répondant aux besoins importants en gestion de projets multidisciplinaires, en génie civil, en TI et plus.

Nos collaborateurs travaillent sur des mandats aussi bien à l’interne que chez des clients d’envergures.

TEHORA se distingue par sa culture d’entreprise, axée sur le bonheur de ses employés et la diversité.

Chez TEHORA, chaque collaborateur est un membre important de léquipe qui contribue à notre succès collectif. Nos membres ont la flexibilité requise pour avoir un équilibre entre le travail et leur vie privée, tout en menant une carrière enrichissante.

Nous offrons un environnement de travail motivant. La diversité des projets, la grande autonomie et l’interaction directe avec les clients sont appréciées. Une telle proximité est possible en raison de notre structure organisationnelle horizontale, qui se traduit par des relations de confiance et une communication efficace entre notre équipe et les clients.

Avantages

  • Possibilité dêtre pigiste ou salarié
  • Du télétravail et de la flexibilité pour s’adapter à vos obligations familiales
  • Un programme d’assurance collective complète
  • Un REER collectif avec une contribution de l’employeur
  • Une culture entrepreneuriale favorisant la créativité et linnovation.
  • Horaires flexibles (selon le type de contrat de travail)
  • Couverture dassurance collective flexible
  • Congés en cas de maladie et à loccasion dévénements familiaux
  • Outils informatiques adaptés
  • Espace de travail épanouissant et motivant.
  • Initiatives sociales et environnementales
  • Programme d’apprentissage en milieu de travail
  • Cheminement de carrière


Salaire
Le salaire sera calculé sur la base du taux horaire moyen correspondant à votre profil. (À partir de 52 000$)

title: Senior Advisor, Transit Oriented Communities (Real-Estate / Project Development)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">IO’s Development Enterprise Team engages new partners in new types of partnerships to promote the development and strategic management of publicly-owned assets. The team develops commercial solutions, executes procurements, and manages assets across new asset classes and infrastructure sectors, including subways, transit-oriented development, and long-term care facilities.

Position level: P4

Position Purpose: 
The purpose of this role is to coordinate the optimization and implementation of Transit Oriented Community (TOC) opportunities in Real-Estate/Project Development. The Senior Advisor (TOC) will support proposed and existing transit stations for government to reduce costs, increase revenue, improve service delivery and unlock economic impact. In addition, this role will also help the rezoning process with the municipal counterpart, the negotiations with the private sector and/or other levels of government including but not limited to private developers, other agencies, Ministries and the Premier’s office around TOC opportunities. As well as to maintain the identification and implementation of areas of improvement within the TOC Program’s existing or new lines of business and/or internal processes.

Closing date:Sunday, May 8, 2022


At Infrastructure Ontario, we strive to create a culture that encourages a diverse equitable and inclusive environment that fosters belonging. We believe that experience comes in many forms and through learning from each others’ differences and perspectives gives us strength. We are committed to enhancing our culture and encourage applications from all walks of life. Let us know if you require any accommodations for the selection process, by contacting the Talent Acquisition Team.

By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

title: Senior Urban Designer
description:
Do you have a creative spirit?  Are you looking for your next career move? If so, we are seeking an inquisitive, self-motivated and a detail driven Senior Urban Designer to join our Land Development team located in our Whitby, ON office, with options to work from our Markham, location.

This dynamic role allows you to play a significant design role and work with multidisciplinary teams to advance complex planning projects. So, if you’re looking for personal growth and challenge, we have the role for you! So come show us your portfolio of what you are most proud of!

Responsibilities include:

  • Lead the preparation of a range of complex residential and non-residential land use plans including block plans, draft plans of subdivision, draft plans of condominium and development concept plans
  • Lead the preparation of high-quality graphic materials including planning report figures, by-law amendment schedules and other public presentation materials
  • Prepare other land use planning and development maps and diagrams
  • Build strong positive relationships while you collaborate with Planners, Architects and Engineers on a variety of private and public sector urban design and master planning projects 
  • Work in collaboration with your Project Leader to support the preparation of reports, presentations, panels, and other materials for communication with clients and project partners

Qualifications, Skills & Experience:

  • 5 or more years of proven experience in Urban Design or related fields, with experience in multi-disciplinary projects  
  • Experience in residential and non-residential site planning and design development
  • Previous consulting urban design experience working with private sector clients ideally in Greater Toronto area (GTA) 
  • A Design Degree or Diploma. Master’s degree in Architecture, Landscape Architecture and/or Urban Design is preferred
  • Proficient in contemporary ArchiCAD and graphic software including AutoCAD, ArcGIS, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, ArchiCAD or similar BIM software and other drafting, graphic design, and layout software
  • Comprehensive understanding of municipal design criteria applicable to plans of subdivision and other land use plans
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Proven strong verbal, written and graphic communication skills while ensuring a high level of professionalism and design excellence is upheld within each project 
  • Capacity to uphold design excellence in challenging project time frames and deadlines 
  • Membership with the Canadian Association of Certified Planning Technicians (CACPT) is an asset

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

description:
Employment Opportunity

Title:                     City Planner

Department:      Planning and Development

Status:                  Full-time Permanent

Salary:                  $81,655.34 per annum, 35 hour/week

Settlement

Allowance:         $20,907.43 per annum

Union Status:     Unionized

Closing Date:     Open until filled

Under the direction of the Director of Planning and Lands, the incumbent is responsible for assisting with the management, administration and operation of all land use planning carried out by the City of Iqaluit.  They will administer and review planning applications, conduct research and analysis of community planning issues and conduct community outreach on land use related issues.  They will be required to make presentations at Council meetings, committee meetings and to represent the City at public meetings and Development Appeal Board hearings. They must possess a university degree in Planning or in a related field.  APPI/CIP regulated membership is required. Provisional members or candidates for membership with APPI/CIP may be considered.  

Required Qualifications:

  • University Degree in Urban and Regional Planning or related field;
  • APPI/CIP regulated membership is required, however provisional members or eligible candidates for APPI/CIP membership may be considered;
  • Valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • Experience with developing plans and policies;
  • Previous administrative work and experience in Municipal, Territorial, or Federal Government issues is an asset;
  • Knowledge of territorial legislation, including Nunavutâ€™s land ownership system, Nunavutâ€™s Land Claims Agreement and Northern issues is an asset;
  • Familiarity with computer software including Geographic Information Systems, AutoCAD, and Microsoft Officer is an asset.

Equivalencies that include a combination of education, knowledge, skills and abilities to formal education may be considered.

Due to the nature of this position, the successful candidate must provide a clear Criminal Record.

Please visit our website https://www.iqaluit.ca/careers to apply. 

The City of Iqaluit embraces the intent and spirit of the Nunavut Land Claims Agreement.  Priority will be given to Nunavut Inuit; Candidates must clearly identify their eligibility in order to receive consideration under this agreement.

Only those selected to interview will be contacted.

title: SENIOR HEALTHCARE PLANNER
description:
We are an employee-owned, award-winning, architectural practice firm with a proven track record in practical, innovative and economical design. We have designed some of Canadaâ€™s most notable buildings.

With offices throughout Canada we serve both Canadian and international clients with the immediacy and attention of a local service. Our design influence can currently be found in eight of Canadaâ€™s provinces, and in Nunavut.

Parkin is staffed with well over 100 experienced architects, designers, project managers, administrative staff, including LEED, Evidence-Based Design and LEAN accredited professionals, many of whom are dedicated to specific market sectors. We believe in personalizing the design experience for clients and maintaining a hands-on approach to projects. Every project they undertake has the direct involvement of Directors and Principals. Promoting mutual trust, they address the full scope of a facilityâ€™s operational requirements, from addressing technology and space needs to optimizing everyday movements, as well as employee health, well-being and productivity. Our unique ability to provide truly meaningful services to our clients is largely derived from the partnerships that they foster with them.

SENIOR HEALTHCARE PLANNER

Role and Responsibilities

  • Demonstrate expertise in clinical processes across major inpatient and outpatient departments.
  • Understand the differences in institutional, ambulatory, and business occupancy environments.
  • Work with end users to outline process flows and critical adjacencies of clinical rooms.
  • Understand and guide discussions on medical equipment needs.
  • Lead the medical planning process within the design team to create department floor plan concepts reflective of operations.
  • Manage the deliverables for the medical planning team within the greater project deliverable schedule.
  • Serve as the main point of contact for the client on planning issues.
  • Mentor staff for depth and support of the specialized knowledge execution process.

Qualifications and Education Requirements

  • Qualified candidates will have a bachelorâ€™s in architecture.
  • Minimum of 10 years of healthcare planning experience required with proven experience in clinical planning leadership and knowledge of architectural design and code requirements.
  • Proficiency with Revit is required.
  • Strong presentation, communication, organizational, team building, collaboration and communication skills are a must.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office.

Preferred Skills

  • Master of Architecture from an accredited program preferred.
  • Registered Architect

title: Urban Designer
description:
Are you a Junior Urban Designer or ambitious Architectural Technologist looking for a career with an established and successful architecture firm? Do you enjoy creating and editing technical drawings in Revit? Do you enjoy collaborating with a creative and supportive team?

This is an exciting new role developed out of growth. As the Junior Urban Designer / Architectural Technologist,you willutilize your technical expertise and experience withRevitto create designs and layouts for the architecture team. Working on a diversity of files/projects with opportunities to build and grow your career with an established architecture firm, that understands if you're successful they're successful.

This company has a great team environment and compensation respectful of your education and work experience. If you are interested in building your architectural career with a progressive, well established and fast-growing architecture firm, then apply now!

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted

title: Senior Transportation Planner/Engineer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is currently seeking an Senior Transportation Planner/Engineer to join our rapidly growing Infrastructure Planning Solutions team.

 

The position is ideally located in Burlington, Ontario, however other Southern Ontario locations may be considered including Cambridge, Hamilton, London and Ottawa, or even remotely.

 

Wood's Transportation and Municipal Infrastructure Sector has a proven track record of developing innovative solutions that address the long-term needs of our clients. Our client base includes federal, provincial and municipal governments; airports; railroads and transit agencies; ports; and private developers. Across Ontario, we provide a comprehensive range of transportation and municipal infrastructure services from planning and environmental studies to preliminary engineering design, traffic engineering studies, and future mobility programs.

 

We are looking for a key individual to join our experienced and growing Infrastructure Planning team of specialists to provide a full range of discipline specific studies, EA support, planning process and consultation based services, and staff mentoring for infrastructure project delivery across Ontario.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Coordinate and support the delivery of Environmental Assessments under the Ontario Class EA for Transportation Facilities, Municipal Class EA, Transit Project Assessment Process
  • Manage and/or coordinate consultation and stakeholder engagement programs for projects across Ontario
  • Coordinate and participate in consultation events including meetings, public information centers, workshops, presentations, and project site tours
  • Manage, prepare, and track communications and consultation materials
  • Manage, attend, and assist in facilitate client and regulatory agency meetings
  • Collaboratively coordinate with internal technical discipline leads, technical staff and sub-consultants for the timely execution of technical studies and preparation of documentation required to support the above noted EA process, and conduct senior review of such document deliverables prior to client release
  • Manage EA commitment and compliance related deliverables through infrastructure project lifecycles
  • Cooperatively coordinate resourcing of project assignments, and delivery of high quality program/project deliverables
  • Lead and/or assist in proposal preparation and business development activities
  • Manage, coach and mentor junior/intermediate technical and planning staff; and
  • Other duties as assigned to you from time to time
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education in Environmental Science, Environmental Planning, Environmental Policy, or a related science/engineering discipline
  • 10+ years project experience within the Ontario environmental assessment process with sector experience focus in MTO Class EA, Metrolinx TPAP, and Municipal Class EA (various)
  • Eligibility as a Registered Professional Planner (RPP) in Ontario is an asset
  • Preparation of Environmental Reports and Environmental Assessments
  • High caliber interpersonal skills, ability to communicate clearly both verbally and in writing, with strong public speaking skills
  • Maturity and leadership ability to guide clients and colleagues, and ability to collaboratively work with clients, colleagues and multi-disciplinary teams
  • Strong sense of both establishing big picture project needs, as well as awareness of technical details that require risk recognition and prompt collaborative solution definition
  • Ability to recognize and provide meaningful input to solve complex problems
  • Sound understanding of design and construction applications as they pertain to planning
  • Sound time management, coordination and organizational skills
  • Fluency with use of MS Office Suite including Excel, Word, Project, PowerPoint
  • Class G driverâ€™s license and access to a vehicle
  • Demonstrated capability and willingness to develop business from new and existing clients
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people.  www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Optical Transport Planner
description:
Job Description:       
Role:  Optical Transport Engineer

What you will be doing

· Completing lab certifications/evaluation of optical equipment and engineering projects on your own.
· Analyze and evaluate optical hardware/software.
· Engineering support for problem cases in commercial network, lab replication of the field issues, interoperability testing.
· Support vendor negotiation during tenders.
· Assisting with transport the ongoing engineering projects.
· Technical writing and editing.
· Optimize Optical transport network.
· Assist decision-making on technical issues.

What you have….
· 5-10+ years Optical Transport Engineer exp. in the lab
· Engineering degree.
· Experience and knowledge of the optical industry.
· In depth understanding of Optical Networking (DWDM, OTN, SONET).
· Experience working in the lab with optical transport equipment.
· Familiarity with Ciena, Nokia, Fujitsu and/or Ribbon/ECI optical platforms a definite plus.
· Strong ability to complete varied engineering assignments with minimal supervision, particularly in the lab environment.
· Understanding of potential impacts of work on other areas and technological developments.
· Ability to remain current on technology industry and market trends.
· Strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills – especially Excel modelling ability.
· Good presentation skills and ability to present information on technology matters.
· Ability to work effectively within teams and independently.   

Mandatory Skills:       
EXCEL (5), SONET (5), TELECOMMUNICATIONS (5), DWDM (5) 

Nice-to-Have Skills:   
DATA MODELLING - LOGICAL (3)

title: Transportation Planner / Engineering Intern
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

From high-rises to industrial buildings, schools to state-of-the-art hospitals, transit stations to highways, airports to toll systems, bike lanes to parks, we design every aspect of a truly integrated city for people to live, work, and play.

Our collaborative and combined approach focuses not only on creating the best solutions today, but also determining the right solutions for tomorrow. We believe cities in the future must be designed with intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, efficient infrastructure, and a human touch.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

IBI Group is a leader in providing professional services to clients resulting in sustainable regional and urban transportation systems that define the cities of tomorrow.  IBI Group’s active transportation practice supports towns, cities, counties and regional governments throughout North America and beyond in creating places that are safe, comfortable, and convenient for people to travel on foot or by bicycle. 

The Active Transportation team in our Hamilton office is looking for a transportation planner / EIT to join our practice!

Your knowledge of transportation planning and /or transportation engineering and design will be applied to projects with an active transportation focus.  Be part of a core team delivering quality design projects for pedestrian, cycling and trails projects.

Most of the things you'll work on:

  • Assisting Active Transportation Project Managers with a variety of tasks, including reviewing relevant policies, performing technical analysis, writing reports, and preparing presentations for clients.
  • Assisting on active transportation studies ranging from long-range network master plans to corridor-specific planning and design studies, supporting active transportation and TDM components of transportation master plans.
  • Preparing design concepts related to active transportation, complete streets and traffic calming studies.
  • Knowledge of GIS would be an asset allowing you to undertake project work related to network plans, mapping and feasibility review.
  • Business development and proposal writing
Qualifications

You'll need to have:

  • 3-5 years of experience in consulting or municipal environments with understanding of transportation planning and/or engineering principles.
  • Bachelors and/or master degree in planning, civil engineering, transportation engineering or equivalent experience.
  • Candidates with a Civil Engineering Technologist College Diploma or landscape architecture background are also welcome to apply with demonstrated relevant experience.
  • Understanding of and knowledge of transportation planning / transportation engineering, transportation demand management and/or active transportation planning and design principles.
  • Excellent analytical and decision-making skills, with a commitment to excellence and high-quality work.
  • Attention to detail and excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  •  Working knowledge of ArcGIS Pro and/or AutoCAD or Microstation is an asset.
  • Knowledge of graphic programs such as Photoshop, Illustrator or InDesign is an asset.
  • Working towards or have achieved RPP, P.Eng., CET or similar designation.


Additional Information

Located on the 2nd floor of 360 James Street North, our Hamilton office is in the historical Hamilton CNR Station downtown and is easily accessible by bike, rail and car.  In addition to being a cultural hub, James Street North is known for its variety of restaurants, cafes, shops and boutiques, all of which are in walking distance to our office.

Our employees enjoy our small office feel and all the perks of a big office support system. You’ll have direct access to management while benefiting from our enthusiastic and helpful organizational resources team. The floors are open concept and creative and represent our collaborative approach to projects. As a global architecture, engineering and technology design firm.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.
