title: Senior Designer, Transportation
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for an Engineering Technologist or Technician to join our growing Transportation team. We are looking for someone who has a minimum 5 years’ experience in road design, working on private land development projects.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate with Project Managers and Project Engineers to identify complete design requirements.
  • Produce functional and detailed engineering drawings including plan and profile, removals, pavement markings and cross section drawings for road construction and widening using Civil 3D.
  • Complete design of new roads, upgrades/modifications to existing roads, intersections and associated drainage infrastructure.
  • Prepare traffic signal drawings in conjunction with our electrical group.
  • Prepare supporting documentation such as cost estimates, design briefs, and comment response.
  • Provide QA/QC for in-progress and completed designs.
  • Assist with redlines/revisions for in-progress and completed designs.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current Provincial and Municipal engineering standards.
  • Coordinate with clients, municipalities, agencies and sub-consultants to facilitate/expedite design completion.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Certified Engineering Technologist or Technician or Professional Engineer (P.Eng).
  • Demonstrated road design experience with Civil 3D and AutoCAD as well as other business software (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).
  • Well-developed knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Provincial and Municipal standards and their application to specific projects.
  • Mature, self-motivated individual possessing effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to prioritize deadlines, track status and facilitate progress on multiple projects.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyers program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Wireless access planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.   Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company where employees are committed to meeting big challenges and making a real difference. That's Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters. As the Wireless Access Planner, responsible for design and optimization of LTE and UMTS networks for Atlantic Canada. Plan and cost out projects to support network evolution to meet growing subscriber demand, analyzing coverage, available capacity and low throughput sites to determine the best approach. Develop and analyze the most economical solution to meet organizational objectives regarding network expansion and strategy, subscriber growth, usage patterns and Top Offenders. The candidate must be familiar with Macro, Micro, Pico and Small Cell technology and architecture as well as In Building systems. Some of the duties of this role will include:PlanningCreate/submit all project related planning specifications for Land Acquisition, Network Augmentation, New Site Build, (Macro, Small Cell and In-building systems) COW and Site Relocations.Plan, coordinate, and submit all project related infrastructure requirements.Monitor and action network capacity requirements.Ensure all network infrastructure projects adhere to current standardsIdentify and report risks based on budget for each project and recommend remediation plans as neededEstablish and foster internal relations with Sales and Marketing to achieve Business goals and priorities.Interface with Radio Engineering and Real Estate for service requirements, providing feedback on proposed deployment locations.Work with and provide guidance to Radio and Civil Engineering, Transport Planning, Equipment Engineering, Site Prep specialists, and Operations.Actively participate in network collaboration meetings, design reviews, and change meetings.Submit Design and Cost Request specifications, work with various team members in providing accurate design and project cost projections.Work with various groups towards acquiring budgets and approvals Material management:Identify RBS equipment requirements, submit quote requests, monitor deployment schedules and place equipment orders for efficient on demand needsMonitor and ensure ongoing Equipment deployments from warehouse to vendors.Coordinate with Delivery Manager, Engineering, Purchasing and Procurement to attain deployment goals.Introduce new product, engineering changes and identify customer requirements for IB systems. Network Analyst:Identify worst offenders for Access, Utilization, Drops, Integrity, and MobilityDetermine route cause of performance degradation and work with Operation/Engineering for resolution.Track for potential infrastructure requirements. Qualifications and Skills:Engineering degree in Telecommunications with specialization in Wireless technology with 5 years planning experienceThree Year Electronics Engineering Technology Diploma with 5 years experience in planning for complex wireless networksMicrosoft OfficeArieso Geo AnalyticsPlanetMapInfoMust be able to complete complex projects with minimal to no supervisionEffective problem-solving skillsAbility to multi-task and prioritize work according to company prioroties a must As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.  Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 70 Assomption Blvd (171), Moncton, NB
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 260962
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Transportation Engineer, Planning
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for a Transportation Engineer to join our Transportation Services group as a Project Manager. In this role you will oversee the analysis and preparation of Transportation Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Studies while liaising with clients, planners and review agencies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage the preparation of detailed traffic modelling, designs and studies for a wide variety of residential, commercial and transportation projects considering active transportation as well as vehicular traffic.
  • Participate on various project teams to identify issues and mitigative measures to satisfy approval requirements, assisting our clients in advancing projects toward completion.
  • Identify and provide transportation engineering design and planning solutions with multi-modal considerations to meet the needs of all road users.
  • Develop and utilize knowledge of requirements of reviewing agencies such as Ministry of Transportation of Ontario (MTO) and municipal authorities.
  • Review and finalize technical reports and design briefs to summarize analyses.
  • Work within other civil engineering specialties to gain knowledge of all facets of land development engineering.
  • Manage all aspects of projects to achieve the client’s goals, including schedule, budget, and quality objectives through the application of formal project management processes.
  • Collaborate with internal and external team members to deliver multi-disciplinary projects through preliminary and detail designs for our clients.
  • Provide team leadership to support the growth of our Transportation Services group.
  • Take responsibility for the entire project process from the proposal through preparation of reports.
  • Cultivate strong client relations; liaise with professional colleagues and municipal/agency staff to move projects forward.
  • Coordinate with client, municipalities, agencies, subconsultants and all internal disciplines involved in the project.
  • Deliver projects within budget and in accordance with QA/QC procedures.
  • Supervise, direct and support/mentor junior staff.


WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Licenced Professional Engineer with a minimum of 6 years experience.
  • Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in Ontario.
  • Experience in preparation and analysis of transportation studies such as Traffic Impact Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Management Plans, etc.
  • Client focused with the ability to cultivate and nurture relationships.
  • Project management experience in a consulting engineering environment.
  • Dynamic, resourceful team motivator with proven track record in mentoring and leading teams.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.


WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge even when We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyer’s Program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Senior Transportation Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

IBI Group’s Markham office is searching for a Senior Transportation Engineer to join its growing team.  We take pride in offering career growth and challenging opportunities within a global organization, solving today’s difficult urban issues. If successful, you will work on major transit/subway projects, alongside a supportive team of industry-leading experts!  The goal of the projects is to foster sustainable and healthy communities in the Greater Toronto Area by adding capacity and connectivity to an existing busy transit network and connecting to a number of other transit systems to make it easier to travel within the city and beyond!

Our Team practices flexible working arrangements, including flexible work hours, plus we support your working from home. As a leader, you’ll be expected to attend meetings at your home office in Markham, and at client offices and sites. You can also take advantage and work from any of our Greater Toronto Area and Hamilton offices.

What You Will Bring to the Company:

As a Senior Transportation Engineer, you will undertake complex assignments requiring a diverse knowledge of transportation engineering, design principles and practices, and transportation planning. With a working knowledge of all engineering disciplines related to environmental assessments for transportation projects, you will use your experience and judgement to solve problems for a wide range of public sector clients.

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • Oversee the transportation team working on P3 projects. This work includes both Temporary Traffic and Transit Management Plans (TTMP) and permanent design for large scale transit projects
  • Act as Technical Advisor (TA) responsible for the preparation of the Reference Concept Design (RCD) and Project Specific Output Specifications (PSOS)
  • Responsible for necessary design activities to advance the work through the bid phase
  • Develop innovative and practical design solutions within the bounds of good civil design
  • Work closely with traffic, utilities, natural, heritage, urban design and other disciplines to develop solutions
  • Prepare design concepts related to active transportation projects, traffic impact studies, parking and traffic calming studies, and traffic management plans
  • Prepare technical reports, presentations, and other documentation, including cost estimates
  • Review drawings and perform quality control checks on drawings and reports
  • Follow quality assurance/quality control, and health and safety requirements
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Degree
  • 10 years traffic engineering experience, preferably in large-scale P3 Projects
  • Proven analytical and problem solving skills for dealing with complex transportation engineering assignments with minimal direction
  • Experience in transportation planning, including the feasibility and preliminary design of new or enhanced BRT, LRT, road and highway facilities
  • Experience in transit infrastructure and stations, parking, and active transportation facilities is an asset
  • Experience with project management and/or construction management is an asset.
  • Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to be flexible and collaborate, while maintaining quality work within a fast paced environment


Additional Information

We are currently exclusively on a work from home model during COVID-19. On return to office, we will support a highly flexible working arrangement with work-from-home and work-from-office options, and multiple office locations across the GTHA to choose from. Our home office for this assignment is located in the Remington Corporate Centre and is situated in the heart of Canada’s High-Tech Capital, Downtown Markham. As one of IBI Group’s newest offices, the facility reflects the most up to date standards and design technology for an inviting and productive workspace, all to better serve clients of the region. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Senior Highway Transportation Engineer, Project Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood provides environmental and transportation engineering design expertise to provincial, regional and municipal road authorities employing over 5,500 individuals in our Environment & Infrastructure Solutions business across North America.   Operating from 17 offices across Ontario, our company offers a comprehensive suite of services, including proven success in leading multi-disciplinary teams on projects of varying size, complexity and procurement models, from preliminary assessment and design through to detail design, contract preparation, tendering, construction administration, inspection and post-construction monitoring.

 

Wood Environment & Infrastructure Solutions is seeking a Senior Transportation Engineer / Project Manager  to join our Transportation Group based in either Cambridge, Burlington or Richmond Hill, ON.

 

This is an exciting opportunity to work on dynamic transportation projects in a team environment for municipal and provincial highways projects.

 

Key Responsibilities:  

  • Undertake preliminary and detail engineering design for rural or urban road and highway improvement projects including Design Build and P3 Delivery
  • Manage multiple projects and staff that may be assigned to provide technical support
  • Provide technical direction including completion of quality control reviews
  • Prepare standard engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs and estimates
  • Prepare and review tender documents
  • Undertake contract administration and construction liaison
  • Liaise and coordinate with multiple project team disciplines
  • Mentor and supervise junior engineers and technicians
  • Liaise with clients and agencies
  • Prepare or contribute to preparation of proposals and project presentations
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education with an undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering or a Civil Engineering Technologist diploma
  • Minimum of eight (8) years of experience with road and highway projects
  • Experience with all aspects of roadway design (i.e. alignments, geometrics, staging, utilities, roadside safety, quantity calculations, contract documents and constructability)
  • Experience on MTO projects is an asset
  • Knowledge of several or all of the following software packages an asset: AutoCAD, MicroStation, Civil 3D, InRoads and MTO design standards and guides
  • Professional licensing with PEO or an OACETT membership would be an asset
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Highway Engineer-in-Training
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Our Waterloo office is looking for an Engineer-in-Training passionate about Highway and Road Design ready to join our growing Canadian Operations within the Transportation Group.

The Highways, Roads, and Bridges team in works with Provincial, Regional, and local municipal transportation agencies, as well as select contracting partners, on large scale projects to deliver quality highway and road design projects. The Waterloo team is passionate about delivering technical excellence for highway planning and design projects.

Candidates’ career path:

  • This role is a phenomenal opportunity for a new graduate from a Civil Engineering program eager to learn and grow as a highway design engineer. The role will include a mix of design, engineering, and project management support ideal for someone looking to grow their career as a proficient highway engineer, and eventually a project manager.

Candidates’ career experiences may consist of:

  • Successful participation in the delivery of highway and freeway projects.
  • Production of preliminary design, detailed design, and technical specifications, cost and schedule estimating for highway expansion and reconstruction projects.
  • Supporting the Project Manager (PM)through the life cycle including proposal preparation, project administration, record-keeping, cost and schedule tracking, and communications with clients and customers.
  • Coordinating multi-discipline teams comprising designers, specialists, and client interface under the direction of the PM.
  • Collaboration in small and large teams. Integration with other engineering subject areas, engineers and design staff in the production of high-quality project work.
  • Preparation of reports, and contract documents for review agencies, clients, and the public.
  • Coordinating with sub-consultants, clients, agencies, utility companies and other customers.

Candidate Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary degree in Civil Engineering.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Registered as an EIT in Ontario, or eligible to do so.
  • Proven passion for launching a career in highway engineering.
  • Familiarity with design software such as AutoCAD, Civil 3D, MicroStation, InRoads, and/or OpenRoads would be an asset.
  • Previous work experience in an engineering or contracting environment would be an asset.
  • Familiarity with geometric design principals (i.e. TAC Geometric Guidelines) and Ontario design standards (i.e. OPSS) and client specific standards and requirements (i.e. MTO) would be an asset.

title: Intermediate Transportation Planner/Engineer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is currently seeking an Intermediate Transportation Planner/Engineer to join our rapidly growing Infrastructure Planning Solutions team.

 

The position is ideally located in Burlington, Ontario, however other Southern Ontario locations may be considered including Cambridge, Hamilton, London and Ottawa, or even remote.

 

Wood's Transportation and Municipal Infrastructure Sector has a proven track record of developing innovative solutions that address the long-term needs of our clients. Our client base includes federal, provincial and municipal governments; airports; railroads and transit agencies; ports; and private developers. Across Ontario, we provide a comprehensive range of transportation and municipal infrastructure services from planning and environmental studies to preliminary engineering design, traffic engineering studies, and future mobility programs.

 

We are looking for a key individual to join our experienced and growing Infrastructure Planning team of specialists to provide a full range of discipline specific studies, EA support, planning process and consultation based services, and staff mentoring for infrastructure project delivery across Ontario.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Coordinate and support the delivery of Environmental Assessments under the Ontario Class EA for Transportation Facilities, Municipal Class EA, Transit Project Assessment Process
  • Manage and/or coordinate consultation and stakeholder engagement programs for projects across Ontario
  • Coordinate and participate in consultation events including meetings, public information centers, workshops, presentations, and project site tours
  • Manage, prepare, and track communications and consultation materials
  • Manage, attend, and assist in facilitate client and regulatory agency meetings
  • Collaboratively coordinate with internal technical discipline leads, technical staff and sub-consultants for the timely execution of technical studies and preparation of documentation required to support the above noted EA process, and conduct senior review of such document deliverables prior to client release
  • Manage EA commitment and compliance related deliverables through infrastructure project lifecycles
  • Cooperatively coordinate resourcing of project assignments, and delivery of high quality program/project deliverables
  • Lead and/or assist in proposal preparation and business development activities
  • Manage, coach and mentor junior/intermediate technical and planning staff; and
  • Other duties as assigned to you from time to time

Skills / Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in Environmental Science, Environmental Planning, Environmental Policy, or a related science/engineering discipline
  • 5-7 years project experience within the Ontario environmental assessment process with sector experience focus in MTO Class EA, Metrolinx TPAP, and Municipal Class EA (various)
  • Eligibility as a Registered Professional Planner (RPP) in Ontario is an asset
  • Preparation of Environmental Reports and Environmental Assessments
  • High caliber interpersonal skills, ability to communicate clearly both verbally and in writing, with strong public speaking skills
  • Maturity and leadership ability to guide clients and colleagues, and ability to collaboratively work with clients, colleagues and multi-disciplinary teams
  • Strong sense of both establishing big picture project needs, as well as awareness of technical details that require risk recognition and prompt collaborative solution definition
  • Ability to recognize and provide meaningful input to solve complex problems
  • Sound understanding of design and construction applications as they pertain to planning
  • Sound time management, coordination and organizational skills
  • Fluency with use of MS Office Suite including Excel, Word, Project, PowerPoint
  • Class G driver’s license and access to a vehicle
  • Demonstrated capability and willingness to develop business from new and existing clients

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Optical Transport Planner - 135979
description:
Role: Optical Transport Specialist
Key Responsibilities/Job Functions:
  • Issue Network Planning Specifications (NPS) that clearly explain, justify, and initiate augmentations and reconfigurations to the ROGERS transmission network.
  • Monitor transmission capacity usage and initiate timely upgrade plans.
  • Create and maintain a capital budget for their area of responsibility.
  • Maintain network planning documentation corresponding to their area of responsibility.
  • Short-term and long-term IPRAN capacity planning based on demand and projected growth rates to support new Wireless technologies (LTE advanced, 5G).
Job Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of SQL/JAVA/Linux.
  • Experience with APIs such as JSON/REST/SOAP.
  • Familiarity with network technology such as IP/SONET/DWDM/Flexgrid/business grade ethernet services (MPLS/VPLS/EPL/EVPL).
  • Working knowledge of a network inventory tool, such as Netcracker/Objectel/NRM.
  • Experience with system integration and automation.
  • Experience with tool migration.
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite especially Excel.
  • Produce and present technical training/information to a wide audience.
  • Undergraduate qualification, preferably in Electrical Engineering, Telecommunication, or Computer Engineering.
  • 7 years experience in engineering/planning transmission networks.
  • In depth understanding of various types of mobile backhaul topology.
  • Knowledge of IPRAN capacity planning/dimensioning principles
  • Experience in engineering and planning of L2/L3 IP networks a definite asset.
  • Knowledge of IPRAN performance management protocols, particularly TWAMP.
  • Advanced understanding of current and next generation wireline transport technologies: CWDM, DWDM, OTN, SONET, PON, Active and Fronthaul.
  • Knowledge of current and next generation wireless transport technologies: licensed and unlicensed microware (MW), LOS and n/NLOS MW, P2P and P2MP MW, mmMW (E-band, V-band).
  • Knowledge of synchronization protocol: PTP 1588, SyncE, NTP
  • Knowledge of 2G/3G/4G/5G architecture and RAN elements
  • Strong business writing skills, particularly in report writing.
  • Advance level of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access) and database software.
  • Strong budgeting and planning abilities.
  • Proven analytical, planning and forecasting skills.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Proven ability to work in cross-functional teams     

Mandatory Skills:       
SQL (3), PYTHON (3), GIS (3)   

Nice-to-Have Skills:   
ORACLE (3)

title: Senior Designer, Transportation
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for an Engineering Technologist or Technician to join our growing Transportation team. We are looking for someone who has a minimum 5 years’ experience in road design, working on private land development projects.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate with Project Managers and Project Engineers to identify complete design requirements.
  • Produce functional and detailed engineering drawings including plan and profile, removals, pavement markings and cross section drawings for road construction and widening using Civil 3D.
  • Complete design of new roads, upgrades/modifications to existing roads, intersections and associated drainage infrastructure.
  • Prepare traffic signal drawings in conjunction with our electrical group.
  • Prepare supporting documentation such as cost estimates, design briefs, and comment response.
  • Provide QA/QC for in-progress and completed designs.
  • Assist with redlines/revisions for in-progress and completed designs.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current Provincial and Municipal engineering standards.
  • Coordinate with clients, municipalities, agencies and sub-consultants to facilitate/expedite design completion.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Certified Engineering Technologist or Technician or Professional Engineer (P.Eng).
  • Demonstrated road design experience with Civil 3D and AutoCAD as well as other business software (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).
  • Well-developed knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Provincial and Municipal standards and their application to specific projects.
  • Mature, self-motivated individual possessing effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to prioritize deadlines, track status and facilitate progress on multiple projects.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyers program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Principal Wireless Access Planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.   Business Title: Principal Wireless Access Planner
This position will be driving the wireless access strategy and wireless investments.   Responsibilities:You are technology and strategy expert that will develop the 3-year wireless access roadmap for Rogers.Own capital planning and wireless strategy to support network evolution and to meet growing subscriber demand.Act as a lead and develop and analyze alternatives to recommend the most economical solution to meet departmental and organizational objectives regarding future network expansion, subscriber growth and usage patterns.Work closely with vendors and national planning teams and create Rogers specific wireless roadmap. Create studies to determine the best way forward for the wireless network.Evaluate Rogers position in Canadian market and create plans for best allocation of the capital spend. Distribute the capital spend based on the network priorities.Act as Network Lead and work closely with business teams to develop multiyear Network expansion plan for wireless.Create Wireless standards and reporting for National and Regional Planning teams.Recommend course of action to management to resolve capacity and technical issue within the access network. Provide comparison of costs and/or impact of these recommendations versus other options.Collaborate with Business teams, Regional Planning, Network Implementation and Engineering teams to communicate priorities.Conduct studies for special projects
Qualifications:Highly effective leader & strong communicator with expert understanding of the LTE and 5G RAN (Radio Access Network) capacity and optimization processHighly adaptive and flexible to changing environments and priorities. Ability to see full picture in order to deliver on objectives. Out of box thinker.Strong understanding of designing & building, Capacity dimensioning and monitoring of Wireless Access Networks and systems including experience with roles and functions of all access network elements. Expert on industry standards and vendor roadmaps.Strong financial acumen, understanding of project budgets and cost analysisEducation experience should include a post-secondary education, Bachelor of Electrical or Telecommunication Engineering preferably.Strong aptitude for research, data analysis and trend developmentExpert knowledge of MapInfo, Power BI and other mapping and analytics toolsProfessional designation with 7 years of work experience in a wireless environmentAbility to operate autonomously, within general direction guidelines.Personal Competencies: Self Motivated; Leadership; Problem Solving / Judgment; Customer Service Orientation; Teamwork and Collaboration; Initiative; Achievement Orientation As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.  Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 261230
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.
 
Posting Notes:  Digital & Technology

title: Transportation Engineer, Planning
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for a Transportation Engineer to join our Transportation Services group as a Project Manager. In this role you will oversee the analysis and preparation of Transportation Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Studies while liaising with clients, planners and review agencies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage the preparation of detailed traffic modelling, designs and studies for a wide variety of residential, commercial and transportation projects considering active transportation as well as vehicular traffic.
  • Participate on various project teams to identify issues and mitigative measures to satisfy approval requirements, assisting our clients in advancing projects toward completion.
  • Identify and provide transportation engineering design and planning solutions with multi-modal considerations to meet the needs of all road users.
  • Develop and utilize knowledge of requirements of reviewing agencies such as Ministry of Transportation of Ontario (MTO) and municipal authorities.
  • Review and finalize technical reports and design briefs to summarize analyses.
  • Work within other civil engineering specialties to gain knowledge of all facets of land development engineering.
  • Manage all aspects of projects to achieve the client’s goals, including schedule, budget, and quality objectives through the application of formal project management processes.
  • Collaborate with internal and external team members to deliver multi-disciplinary projects through preliminary and detail designs for our clients.
  • Provide team leadership to support the growth of our Transportation Services group.
  • Take responsibility for the entire project process from the proposal through preparation of reports.
  • Cultivate strong client relations; liaise with professional colleagues and municipal/agency staff to move projects forward.
  • Coordinate with client, municipalities, agencies, subconsultants and all internal disciplines involved in the project.
  • Deliver projects within budget and in accordance with QA/QC procedures.
  • Supervise, direct and support/mentor junior staff.


WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Licenced Professional Engineer with a minimum of 6 years experience.
  • Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in Ontario.
  • Experience in preparation and analysis of transportation studies such as Traffic Impact Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Management Plans, etc.
  • Client focused with the ability to cultivate and nurture relationships.
  • Project management experience in a consulting engineering environment.
  • Dynamic, resourceful team motivator with proven track record in mentoring and leading teams.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.


WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge even when We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyer’s Program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Senior Transportation Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

IBI Group’s Markham office is searching for a Senior Transportation Engineer to join its growing team.  We take pride in offering career growth and challenging opportunities within a global organization, solving today’s difficult urban issues. If successful, you will work on major transit/subway projects, alongside a supportive team of industry-leading experts!  The goal of the projects is to foster sustainable and healthy communities in the Greater Toronto Area by adding capacity and connectivity to an existing busy transit network and connecting to a number of other transit systems to make it easier to travel within the city and beyond!

Our Team practices flexible working arrangements, including flexible work hours, plus we support your working from home. As a leader, you’ll be expected to attend meetings at your home office in Markham, and at client offices and sites. You can also take advantage and work from any of our Greater Toronto Area and Hamilton offices.

What You Will Bring to the Company:

As a Senior Transportation Engineer, you will undertake complex assignments requiring a diverse knowledge of transportation engineering, design principles and practices, and transportation planning. With a working knowledge of all engineering disciplines related to environmental assessments for transportation projects, you will use your experience and judgement to solve problems for a wide range of public sector clients.

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • Oversee the transportation team working on P3 projects. This work includes both Temporary Traffic and Transit Management Plans (TTMP) and permanent design for large scale transit projects
  • Act as Technical Advisor (TA) responsible for the preparation of the Reference Concept Design (RCD) and Project Specific Output Specifications (PSOS)
  • Responsible for necessary design activities to advance the work through the bid phase
  • Develop innovative and practical design solutions within the bounds of good civil design
  • Work closely with traffic, utilities, natural, heritage, urban design and other disciplines to develop solutions
  • Prepare design concepts related to active transportation projects, traffic impact studies, parking and traffic calming studies, and traffic management plans
  • Prepare technical reports, presentations, and other documentation, including cost estimates
  • Review drawings and perform quality control checks on drawings and reports
  • Follow quality assurance/quality control, and health and safety requirements
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) Degree
  • 10 years traffic engineering experience, preferably in large-scale P3 Projects
  • Proven analytical and problem solving skills for dealing with complex transportation engineering assignments with minimal direction
  • Experience in transportation planning, including the feasibility and preliminary design of new or enhanced BRT, LRT, road and highway facilities
  • Experience in transit infrastructure and stations, parking, and active transportation facilities is an asset
  • Experience with project management and/or construction management is an asset.
  • Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to be flexible and collaborate, while maintaining quality work within a fast paced environment


Additional Information

We are currently exclusively on a work from home model during COVID-19. On return to office, we will support a highly flexible working arrangement with work-from-home and work-from-office options, and multiple office locations across the GTHA to choose from. Our home office for this assignment is located in the Remington Corporate Centre and is situated in the heart of Canada’s High-Tech Capital, Downtown Markham. As one of IBI Group’s newest offices, the facility reflects the most up to date standards and design technology for an inviting and productive workspace, all to better serve clients of the region. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Senior Highway Transportation Engineer, Project Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

 

Wood provides environmental and transportation engineering design expertise to provincial, regional and municipal road authorities employing over 5,500 individuals in our Environment & Infrastructure Solutions business across North America.  Operating from 17 offices across Ontario, our company offers a comprehensive suite of services, including proven success in leading multi-disciplinary teams on projects of varying size, complexity and procurement models, from preliminary assessment and design through to detail design, contract preparation, tendering, construction administration, inspection and post-construction monitoring.

 

Wood Environment & Infrastructure Solutions is seeking a Senior Transportation Engineer / Project Manager to join our Transportation Group based in either Cambridge, Burlington or Richmond Hill, ON.

 

This is an exciting opportunity to work on dynamic transportation projects in a team environment for municipal and provincial highways projects.

 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Undertake preliminary and detail engineering design for rural or urban road and highway improvement projects including Design Build and P3 Delivery
  • Manage multiple projects and staff that may be assigned to provide technical support
  • Provide technical direction including completion of quality control reviews
  • Prepare standard engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs and estimates
  • Prepare and review tender documents
  • Undertake contract administration and construction liaison
  • Liaise and coordinate with multiple project team disciplines
  • Mentor and supervise junior engineers and technicians
  • Liaise with clients and agencies
  • Prepare or contribute to preparation of proposals and project presentations

Skills / Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education with an undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering or a Civil Engineering Technologist diploma
  • Minimum of eight (8) years of experience with road and highway projects
  • Experience with all aspects of roadway design (i.e. alignments, geometrics, staging, utilities, roadside safety, quantity calculations, contract documents and constructability)
  • Experience on MTO projects is an asset
  • Knowledge of several or all of the following software packages an asset: AutoCAD, MicroStation, Civil 3D, InRoads and MTO design standards and guides
  • Professional licensing with PEO or an OACETT membership would be an asset

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Senior Transportation Planner/Engineer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is currently seeking an Senior Transportation Planner/Engineer to join our rapidly growing Infrastructure Planning Solutions team.

 

The position is ideally located in Burlington, Ontario, however other Southern Ontario locations may be considered including Cambridge, Hamilton, London and Ottawa, or even remotely.

 

Wood's Transportation and Municipal Infrastructure Sector has a proven track record of developing innovative solutions that address the long-term needs of our clients. Our client base includes federal, provincial and municipal governments; airports; railroads and transit agencies; ports; and private developers. Across Ontario, we provide a comprehensive range of transportation and municipal infrastructure services from planning and environmental studies to preliminary engineering design, traffic engineering studies, and future mobility programs.

 

We are looking for a key individual to join our experienced and growing Infrastructure Planning team of specialists to provide a full range of discipline specific studies, EA support, planning process and consultation based services, and staff mentoring for infrastructure project delivery across Ontario.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Coordinate and support the delivery of Environmental Assessments under the Ontario Class EA for Transportation Facilities, Municipal Class EA, Transit Project Assessment Process
  • Manage and/or coordinate consultation and stakeholder engagement programs for projects across Ontario
  • Coordinate and participate in consultation events including meetings, public information centers, workshops, presentations, and project site tours
  • Manage, prepare, and track communications and consultation materials
  • Manage, attend, and assist in facilitate client and regulatory agency meetings
  • Collaboratively coordinate with internal technical discipline leads, technical staff and sub-consultants for the timely execution of technical studies and preparation of documentation required to support the above noted EA process, and conduct senior review of such document deliverables prior to client release
  • Manage EA commitment and compliance related deliverables through infrastructure project lifecycles
  • Cooperatively coordinate resourcing of project assignments, and delivery of high quality program/project deliverables
  • Lead and/or assist in proposal preparation and business development activities
  • Manage, coach and mentor junior/intermediate technical and planning staff; and
  • Other duties as assigned to you from time to time

Skills / Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in Environmental Science, Environmental Planning, Environmental Policy, or a related science/engineering discipline
  • 10+ years project experience within the Ontario environmental assessment process with sector experience focus in MTO Class EA, Metrolinx TPAP, and Municipal Class EA (various)
  • Eligibility as a Registered Professional Planner (RPP) in Ontario is an asset
  • Preparation of Environmental Reports and Environmental Assessments
  • High caliber interpersonal skills, ability to communicate clearly both verbally and in writing, with strong public speaking skills
  • Maturity and leadership ability to guide clients and colleagues, and ability to collaboratively work with clients, colleagues and multi-disciplinary teams
  • Strong sense of both establishing big picture project needs, as well as awareness of technical details that require risk recognition and prompt collaborative solution definition
  • Ability to recognize and provide meaningful input to solve complex problems
  • Sound understanding of design and construction applications as they pertain to planning
  • Sound time management, coordination and organizational skills
  • Fluency with use of MS Office Suite including Excel, Word, Project, PowerPoint
  • Class G driver’s license and access to a vehicle
  • Demonstrated capability and willingness to develop business from new and existing clients

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Senior Designer, Transportation
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for an Engineering Technologist or Technician to join our growing Transportation team. We are looking for someone who has a minimum 5 years’ experience in road design, working on private land development projects.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate with Project Managers and Project Engineers to identify complete design requirements.
  • Produce functional and detailed engineering drawings including plan and profile, removals, pavement markings and cross section drawings for road construction and widening using Civil 3D.
  • Complete design of new roads, upgrades/modifications to existing roads, intersections and associated drainage infrastructure.
  • Prepare traffic signal drawings in conjunction with our electrical group.
  • Prepare supporting documentation such as cost estimates, design briefs, and comment response.
  • Provide QA/QC for in-progress and completed designs.
  • Assist with redlines/revisions for in-progress and completed designs.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current Provincial and Municipal engineering standards.
  • Coordinate with clients, municipalities, agencies and sub-consultants to facilitate/expedite design completion.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Certified Engineering Technologist or Technician or Professional Engineer (P.Eng).
  • Demonstrated road design experience with Civil 3D and AutoCAD as well as other business software (MS Word, Excel, Outlook).
  • Well-developed knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Provincial and Municipal standards and their application to specific projects.
  • Mature, self-motivated individual possessing effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to prioritize deadlines, track status and facilitate progress on multiple projects.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyers program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Sr. Wireless Access Planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.   Senior Wireless Access PlannerImagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company where employees are committed to meeting big challenges and making a real difference. That's Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.As a Wireless Access Planner in the GTA Wireless Network Planning & Performance team, the successful candidate will be responsible for the planning of the radio access networks GSM-EDGE/UMTS-HSPA, LTE and 5G.  Responsibilities: Identify site capacity requirements. Plan, budget and initiate projects to support network evolution and to meet growing subscriber demandDevelop new site build plan and analyze alternatives in order to recommend the most economical solution to meet departmental and organizational objectives regarding network expansion, subscriber growth and usage patternsProduce applicable project specification documents to initiate and synchronize all stakeholders to accomplish in-building system initiativesCollaborate with Regional Network Implementation and RF team for support and guidance for site acquisition, lease and design issues. Maintain up-to-date understanding of project status and identify obstacles that have negative impact on project completion targetsAnalyze and identify problematic areas with capacity and coverage issue, propose solutions to senior wireless access planners for new site build and capacity add programsEstimate cost and prepare CA for new site build and capacity augmentation projectsPrepare capacity for event, coordinate with event management and performance monitoring, conduct postmortem study on event performanceManage COW deployment for event and temporary site relocationsConduct studies for special projects
Experience and EducationUndergraduate degree with 3-6 years of work experience in a wireless environmentProfessional designation – P. Eng, PMP etc - is a plus Technical skillsStrong understanding of Wireless Network functionality and elements. Full Scope of LTE/5G/HSPA Radio AccessStrong knowledge of LTE, 5G, HSPA capacity requirements and capacity KPIsStrong understanding of the RAN (Radio Access Network) capacityFamiliarity with Ericsson radio base station hardware and configurationStrong aptitude for research, data analysis and trend development.Strong planning and budget, cost estimation and accounting skills.Microsoft Office suite
 CompetenciesAbility to provide direction and guidance to internal and external groups.Specific background in projects involving multiple geographic regions, cross-functional teamsAbility to manage and track projectsAbility to operate autonomously within general direction guidelines.Personal Competencies: Leadership; Problem Solving / Judgment; Customer Service Orientation; Teamwork and Collaboration; Initiative; Achievement Orientation.Highly motivated individual with superior organizational and analytical skillsC-Suite Level communications and presentation skills  As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.  Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: No Selection
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 250559
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Transportation Engineer, Planning
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Crozier is looking for a Transportation Engineer to join our Transportation Services group as a Project Manager. In this role you will oversee the analysis and preparation of Transportation Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Studies while liaising with clients, planners and review agencies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage the preparation of detailed traffic modelling, designs and studies for a wide variety of residential, commercial and transportation projects considering active transportation as well as vehicular traffic.
  • Participate on various project teams to identify issues and mitigative measures to satisfy approval requirements, assisting our clients in advancing projects toward completion.
  • Identify and provide transportation engineering design and planning solutions with multi-modal considerations to meet the needs of all road users.
  • Develop and utilize knowledge of requirements of reviewing agencies such as Ministry of Transportation of Ontario (MTO) and municipal authorities.
  • Review and finalize technical reports and design briefs to summarize analyses.
  • Work within other civil engineering specialties to gain knowledge of all facets of land development engineering.
  • Manage all aspects of projects to achieve the client’s goals, including schedule, budget, and quality objectives through the application of formal project management processes.
  • Collaborate with internal and external team members to deliver multi-disciplinary projects through preliminary and detail designs for our clients.
  • Provide team leadership to support the growth of our Transportation Services group.
  • Take responsibility for the entire project process from the proposal through preparation of reports.
  • Cultivate strong client relations; liaise with professional colleagues and municipal/agency staff to move projects forward.
  • Coordinate with client, municipalities, agencies, subconsultants and all internal disciplines involved in the project.
  • Deliver projects within budget and in accordance with QA/QC procedures.
  • Supervise, direct and support/mentor junior staff.


WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Licenced Professional Engineer with a minimum of 6 years experience.
  • Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in Ontario.
  • Experience in preparation and analysis of transportation studies such as Traffic Impact Studies, Parking Studies, Transportation Demand Management Plans, etc.
  • Client focused with the ability to cultivate and nurture relationships.
  • Project management experience in a consulting engineering environment.
  • Dynamic, resourceful team motivator with proven track record in mentoring and leading teams.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.


WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge even when We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyer’s Program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.
