title: Airport Planner
description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

We are actively seeking candidates to join our growing Airport team in an airport and heliport planning capacity. We can offer individuals exciting opportunities to lead and support on a wide range of Canadian airport and heliport projects. We are well established at major airports, including Vancouver and Kelowna and are pursuing international airport projects.

As part of SNC-Lavalin’s Engineering Services group, the Airports team specializes in providing a full range of planning and engineering services for airport and heliport infrastructure projects to local, national and international clients. Projects range from small assignments, such as runway extension studies and apron expansions, to airport master plans and taxiway and runway infrastructure rehabilitation projects.

The Airport team is looking for a Senior Airport Planner to join our growing team. This position reports to the Airports Director. As a Senior Airport Planner, your primary role will be to manage and deliver airport planning assignments. This role can be based in either Vancouver, Calgary or Toronto. The Airport team currently operates a hybrid working model with our teams splitting their working week between working from home and in the office. Vancouver is currently the home office for a large section of the Airports team.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Development of airport master plans.
  • Scoping and undertaking studies on airfield layout, apron configuration and passenger. terminal planning, groundside access planning and land use plans.
  • Data analysis, demand and capacity assessment and interpretation thereof.
  • Taking responsibility for the delivery of technical reports and presentations.
  • Leadership of design meetings, site meetings and all other project related meetings.
  • Providing support to the market team in business development activities including leading and contributing to tender submissions.
  • Actively engaging with Atkins / SNCL’s global network of aviation and infrastructure planning professionals.
  • Providing guidance and leadership to more junior members of the team.
  • Liaising with clients on existing projects and pursuing new project opportunities.
  • Working collaboratively to assist other project team members, and to incorporate input from other parts of the business on multi-disciplinary projects.
  • Reviewing project documentation to check clarity, accuracy, consistency in presentation, and compliance with project specifications and applicable standards.
  • Managing project scope, schedule and finances.
  • Maintaining good working relationships with internal project support groups.

What will you contribute?

  • Hands on experience in airport planning, with understanding of airfield planning, terminal planning, surface access planning, facilities planning and Transport Canada, ICAO, FAA, EASA airport and heliport design standards.
  • A relevant first degree or equivalent qualification with preference for an air transport related post graduate qualification.
  • Understanding of the market economics and key drivers of Airport Planning and Development, including the interactions between aviation and airport operations, people and baggage movement, development, design concept, retail, advertising, and surface access.
  • Understanding and experience of recognised software used in airport master planning.
  • Skills in AutoCAD or MicroStation and familiarity with AviPLAN Airside Pro.
  • A high sense of accountability with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with a drive to deliver high quality work.
  • Proven track record in coordinating and delivering technically excellent studies and projects on time and to budget.
  • The ability to work with a range of project stakeholders, contractors and clients.
  • Understanding of project contractual and commercial requirements.
  • Ability to lead on business development activities and able to demonstrate successful role in bids/tenders.
  • A willingness to travel to undertake short-term assignments overseas.
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and oral communication; fluency in French desirable.

For this position, there is flexibility for work locations. You will have options to work in our offices in BC, Albert, or Ontario.

We offer an opportunity to work on varied and interesting projects in Canada and around the world. Salary will be commensurate with your experience.

SNC Lavalin recognises that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements.

While we sincerely thank all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available at snclavalin.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: City Planner
description:
As a City Planner you are accountable for coordinating assets to satisfy the needs of clients, drivers and the company. Your key role as Planner are to accurately predict availability and potential of assets in your assigned region, and properly acquire freight to effectively utilize those assets in the best of interest of the company. You are a natural problem solver, that realizes opportunities and communicates them in a thorough and timely fashion with all co-workers.
As a member of the Planning team, you will be responsible for:
  • Establish resource availability through analysis of the drivers, tractors and trailers in their region and interpret what restrictions and opportunities they present. The IP must take all relevant factors into consideration from individual driver requirements, equipment restrictions and overall balance issues
  • Establish and forecast customer needs and demands. Corporate accounts will involve monitoring, forecasting and servicing the clients’ needs on a regular basis. The IP is expected to have a thorough understanding of the priority of a given client, their volumes, cycles, flexibility, urgency and additional opportunities they may hold
  • Assemble the overall strategy by taking all relevant information, developing a plan and communicating it in an effective and timely manner to the Fleet Management group for execution. Recognizing the need to adjust plans, such as required, is critical
  • Click here to learn more.
You’ll gain lots of experience in this role, but before you do, you should have:
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proven analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Demonstrated skills in aligning goals with strategic direction to achieve targeted business results
  • Proven team player with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and to develop and maintain collaborative working relationship
  • Strong knowledge of company goals, work direction and practices

Why Bison:
  • Thrive in a supportive team that provides coaching and training to help develop your skills and progress your career
  • Dispersed work environments that promote a healthy work-life balance
  • Meaningful and impactful work and projects with an essential service provider
  • Join our engaging Wellness Program & extracurricular sports teams
About Bison:
  • Celebrating over 50 years in Business
  • Named as Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures
  • Active in giving back through Corporate Social Responsibility and Charitable Giving
  • Committed to environmental sustainability
Bison Transport is committed to Diversity and Inclusion in the Workplace.

title: Production Planner
description:
Cascade Aerospace is looking for an additional Production Planner to plan activities for assigned projects and tasks related to designated areas of responsibility. A large component of this role will involve scheduling management, utlizing methodologies and processes to create schedules with Microsoft Project. This is a non-union position

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

  • Create and maintain project specific schedules and communicate the schedule status to Programs and/or Customers;
  • Facilitate necessary schedule review meetings, identify schedule & budget risks;
  • Facilitate problem solving sessions among Operations team for proper corrective & preventative actions for any schedule related issues/risk;
  • Produce weekly production plan in accordance with approved overall schedule, and quantitatively tracking the progress, by following established processes/procedures/working instructions;
  • Produce weekly production resource demand for assigned project according to weekly plan and ensure the accuracy of overall resource demand at all time on rolling wave basis;
  • Review materials, resource application, and Engineering status, as the inputs for ongoing schedule tracking/assessment;
  • Manage post induction work scope changes (include Customer Requests and emergent works), identify any schedule, budget risk and communicate to Program/Customer. Identify all requirements, communicate to appropriate stakeholders;
  • Collaborate with Operation Supervisor to populate and maintain Project boards;
  • Produce Daily Production Status Report, weekly Operations/Cards closure report, and weekly report as required;
  • Ensure all work performed by the team is in accordance with the customer’s check packages, regulatory bodies, operating procedures, all maintenance, manufacturing and policy manuals and scope of their certification authority;
  • Ensure all work performed exceeds quality standards while meeting safety guidelines and productivity goals and objectives;
  • Other duties as required.

CORE SKILLS

  • Excellent communication skills: fluent written and verbal English are mandatory;
  • Advanced MS Project skills are mandatory;
  • Strong computer skills: Excel, and database programs;
  • Strong interpersonal skills;
  • Demonstrated leadership skills;
  • Advanced level of collaboration and problem solving skills.

TRAINING & EXPERIENCE

  • Degree or diploma in Aviation or Operation Management or Certificate in Aircraft Maintenance (Approved by TCA)
  • 3-5 years' experience planning heavy maintenance on transport category aircraft

REASONS TO APPLY

  • Employee retention and engagement is important to Cascade, we value our employees;
  • Competitive salary, Extended benefits, Employee Resilience Program (all 100% paid by Cascade) are offered after 3 months employment;
  • Pension matching;
  • 3 weeks' paid vacation;
  • Company-wide social events and family functions throughout the year.

ABOUT CASCADE

Cascade Aerospace Inc. is a dynamic, privately-held Canadian specialty aerospace and defence contractor focused on providing long-term integrated aircraft support programs for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), military, government and commercial customers.

All employees are encouraged to realize their true potential and play an active role in fostering an environment of safety, quality, customer satisfaction and continuous improvement. We are a diverse organization that strives to be respectful and inclusive of everyone and to treat employees fairly and equally.

At Cascade Aerospace we strongly believe in the value of teaming - with our employees, our customers, our suppliers, and our communities. It is by "Teaming with the best" and working collaboratively with our many partners that we are able to offer custom-tailored solutions for each customer's unique requirements. Our value proposition is that we build enduring customer relationships, and our strategic focus is customer satisfaction. It is a driver in all our decisions.

Cascade Aerospace is committed to the principle of Employment Equity. Creating an environment where diverse perspectives are valued begins with self-declaration. Count yourself in and self-declare by identifying which employment equity group(s) you belong to. In order to self-declare, please ensure to indicate this in your application, cover letter, or resume.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $55,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

COVID-19 considerations:
As per the federal government mandate, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated.

Application question(s):

  • This position requires Controlled Goods clearance immediately upon hire. What is your work status? (Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or Require Sponsorship to work in Canada)
  • Do you have experience with MS Project?
  • What are your wage expectations?

Education:

  • AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

Experience:

  • Planning heavy maintenance: 3 years (preferred)

title: Staff Planner - Occ
description:
Job Description - Staff Planner - OCC (2211921)
Job Details
Staff Planner - OCC-2211921
Primary Location
  • North America-CA-Toronto-Toronto Pearson International Airport (YYZ)
Schedule
  • Full-time
Unposting Date
  • May 20, 2022, 9:59:00 PM
Organization
  • Ground Handling
About us

Swissport International Ltd. is the leading Ground Services Provider to the aviation industry. Swissport is employing over 68,000 dedicated professionals, serving over 800 client companies at 315 stations in 50 countries on five continents. Swissport delivers unparalleled value in the areas of Ground Handling, Cargo Services, Executive Aviation, Travel Services, Fueling and Aircraft Maintenance. We strive to operate with the core values of People, Professionalism, and Partnership in all that we undertake. Our mission is simple – “To provide the aviation industry with consistent and tailor-made solutions around the globe, for a better customer experience”.

Role and Function

Plan and assign the duties for any and all staffing requirements. Creating schedules and assisting all levels of management with any scheduling requirements including daily operations.

Job Responsibilities
Forecast, plan, create and implement the schedule, including controlling the bid, for the PAX department.
Must apply all airline scheduling requirements to scheduling needs of the department
Clear and acknowledge all time card exceptions for payroll processing
Communicate to all levels of staff any changes to the flight schedules
Prepare the daily rosters
Assist with the staffing coverage, calls for overtime, etc.
Attend and address all communications (telephone calls, email, SITA, fax messages) necessary
Maintain good relationships with employees, co-workers, customers and airline authorities
Maintain and observe confidentiality with respect to employee records
Familiar with WSIB rules pertaining to injury at the work site, along with Swissport reporting requirements
Assisting with capturing revenue by accurately completing the Daily Flight Logs
Must have control with the staffing hours required for service.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications & Competencies

Staff planning/allocation experience required
Must possess strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task
Effective communication skills (verbal and written)
Internal and external customer relations skills
Knowledge of Passenger Service Operation and strong understanding of the Collective Bargaining agreement
Must obtain and maintain valid unrestricted Transport Canada Security Clearance
Flexible work schedule including evenings, weekends and holidays
Ability to operate in a fast paced environment, while maintaining accuracy and diplomacy
Available and flexible to work various shifts (day, evening, weekend and holidays) by operational requirements

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Swissport as an equal opportunity employer bases its hiring decisions on the business need and the best qualified candidates available, and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. Candidates who are offered employment may be subject to a criminal record and other background checks as permitted or required by company policy or applicable law.

title: Vessel Operations Representative - East Coast (Montreal)
description:
Vessel Operations Representative* - East Coast (Montreal)*
Interested in being a part of the MSC family?
Who is MSC? Behind every one of our containers, our 600 container vessels, sailing on over 200 trade routes, you’ll also find a whole lot of company with people that love what they do and the company they work for.
Working at MSC, you are part of a continuously evolving organization. Employees don’t only facilitate ocean transport, they aspire and achieve professional growth.

  • Are you passionate or interested in learning about maritime shipping & logistics?
  • Are you entrepreneurial at heart and want to be a part of a family owned company?
  • Are you a people person who cares for others?
  • Are you a dedicated and committed individual who believes in continuously evolving?

If so, read below to see if this position is right for you!
Department Summary
The Vessel Operations team is responsible to provide all assigned land-based transportation within the set timelines by providing optimal service along with efficient turnaround of containers from import to export in Canada. This team also works with internal and external stakeholders to ensure complete compliance with Canadian Border Services Agency (CBSA) regulations and timelines. They must process with extreme accuracy within timeliness all importing container documentation and handle daily requests to ensure efficient release of our customers’ containers.
Position* Summary*
Providing an excellent customer experience for clients and colleagues in every written and verbal communication, the Vessel Operations Representative is responsible for ensuring effective operations for all vessels and terminals across our Canadian ports. Adhering to vessel and terminal cut-offs, the Vessel Operations Representative creates and provides highly accurate reporting and schedules to various stakeholders both inside and outside the Agency. The Vessel Operations Representative, in the area of door moves, is responsible for all dispatch of door moves, invoicing for additional charges and ensuring the manifested transport amount always matches the transport selling amount.
Key accountabilities

  • Act as liaison between MSC Agency and terminals
  • Creating daily reports to all terminals on vessels per service
  • Ensure required adjustments to vessel and rail planning based on what is in-gated to the terminal
  • Perform daily cleaning of vessel for Rail and terminal by reducing and cancelling bookings
  • Carry out Comparative of physical count at terminal vs MSC Link
  • Communicate with Customer Service to verify missing VGMs
  • Communicate with the Equipment Department list of empty containers for repositioning for final planning with OBL (list of full containers)
  • Create, merge, edit and send OBL (list of full containers) to terminal planners (with Manager approval)
  • Finalize Hazardous containers. Providing export hazardous rail billing to the terminal
  • Reconcile any discrepancies between terminal load list and MSC link
  • Create daily Overpayload Report
  • Create routings for Bookings Team
  • Transmit OBLX to Vessel Planners
  • Create discrepancy report upon vessel sailing
  • Manage all inquiries pertaining to container Hold, Roll & Pick up
  • Create EDI 404 Rail Billing Report
  • Create/submit Import Vessel Report submitted to terminals
  • Provide Import Reefer Forecast to CN
  • Create weekly CN Export Reefer RV’s
  • Submit manual Rail billing for Hazardous & Multi B/L containers
  • Submit Import hazardous manifest to the POM
  • Create daily Reports: Rail Dwell, Linehaul, Doormoves Storage, Mass Notifications
  • Dispatching Import & Export Linehauls
  • Validate inland rate manifest
  • Creating and verifying invoices pertaining to door moves
  • Request delivery instructions for door moves from customer
  • Dispatch work order to truckers
  • Invoice any additional charges incurred during door delivery to customer

Additional tasks may be added or removed based on departmental needs.

*
Qualifications and Competencies*
All MSC Canada employees are expected to exhibit the MSC Values, striving to drive customer centric results in all interactions with colleagues and customers alike.

  • Logistics/Supply Chain college degree or other related fields.
  • Excellent command in spoken and written English with bilingualism (French and English) preferred.
  • Autonomy and initiative.
  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Shipping/Logistics/Supply Chain.
  • Proficiency using Microsoft office applications, knowledge of Power BI (asset).
  • Strong communication skills for negotiation and reconciliation.
  • Open to flexible scheduling and rotating shifts. (Tuesday to Saturday / 8:30am to 5pm.)

*
What We have to offer*
Great people who work hard and look out for each other because we’re a team—it’s that simple!
Just to name a few of our perks:

  • Health and dental benefits coverage
  • RRSP coverage with MSC Canada matching a portion of employee contribution
  • Tailored training program opportunities for employee development
  • Employee mentorship, leadership and assistance opportunities
  • An employee referral incentive program
  • Community Involvement
  • Gym facility
  • Health & Wellness Program

Hurry, and apply now!
MSC Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage applications from all interested parties. Accommodations are available, upon request, for those with a disability or medical need during any stage of the recruitment process. We thank all candidates for their interest in MSC Canada however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Show more

title: Maintenance Operational Fleet Planner
description:
Why WestJet:


Every WestJet journey has the potential to enrich lives; a career with us is no exception.


WestJet arrived on the Canadian airline scene in 1996 and changed the industry for the better. We made air travel more affordable for Canadians and now we're going global.


Join us and love where you’re going.


What this role is all about:


The Technical Operations team at WestJet is peopled with the best technical and maintenance personnel in the airline industry. The people of Technical Operations have an eye for detail and safety, and for keeping their jobs fun and exciting. The Maintenance Operational Fleet Planner (MOFP) reports to the Maintenance Operational Lead Planner (MOLP), the MOFP is positioned to provide 24/7 oversight and technical dispatch for all schedule maintenance activities for WestJet, Encore, and Swoop. As well as, act as a conduit between maintenance planning, front line operations and the Maintenance Control Center (MCC). The Maintenance Operational Fleet Planner (MOFP) will partner closely with the commercial operations team to align aircraft availability, working to reduce the impact to operations during IROPS.


What you will bring to the team:

  • Detail orientated and strong time management skills;
  • Strong analytical skills, natural ability to multi-task and work under pressure;
  • Ability to make quick sound decisions as well as react quickly to an ever-changing work environment while maintaining a positive attitude;
  • Ability to remain calm, especially when faced with difficult and challenging situations;
  • Highly motivated, energetic and goal-oriented with the ability to work in a fast-paced team environment;
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively communicate with others in a positive, professional manner;
  • Will build key businesses relationships both internal stakeholders and external vendors.

Core requirements of the role include:

  • Must hold valid Transport Canada (M2, E, or S) license;
  • Proven technical aptitude with a minimum 6 years’ related experience in aircraft maintenance or the equivalent aircraft maintenance planning;
  • Must hold or be able to obtain a WestJet Aircraft Certification Authority (ACA) for one or more types of Transport category aircraft operated by the company;
  • Advance knowledge of the following: TRAX (CMTS), Sabre Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, Maintenance Control Manuals and Maintenance Procedures Manuals;
  • Must be able to obtain an Airport Restricted Area pass (RAIC) issued by Transport Canada;
  • Must have solid knowledge of the Transport Canada Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs) requirements;
  • Flexibility to work shift work and overtime.

The benefits of being a WestJetter:

WestJet provides all WestJetters with a competitive total rewards package. On top of that, we offer:

  • A fun and friendly culture with colleagues who work together to win
  • Travel privileges for you and your family, effective from your start date
  • Savings and Benefit programs that are flexible to meet your specific needs

Think we are a fit? Apply now!


About WestJet Group of Companies

Together with WestJet's regional airline, WestJet Encore, we offer scheduled service to more than 100 destinations in North America, Central America, the Caribbean and Europe and to more than 175 destinations in over 20 countries through our airline partnerships.


Our Safety Promise

At WestJet, the safety and security of our people and our guests is a core value and at the heart of what we do. As safety and security is a shared responsibility, it is expected that you will use safe work practices to ensure your well-being and the safety of others.

WestJet recognizes that the use of Alcohol and Drugs can adversely impact a safe work environment and the well-being of others including guests, suppliers and the public, as well as place WestJet's operations at risk. All roles that are identified as safety sensitive are required to pass a Pre-Employment Alcohol and Drug Test as per WestJet's Alcohol and Drug Policy.

As a federally regulated company, the WestJet group of companies is required to comply with all federal mandates. In order to be compliant with the recently-announced vaccination mandate, and to keep our guests/employees safe, all employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of employment.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We embrace what makes us each unique, and what makes us uniquely WestJet. WestJet is committed to inclusiveness, equity, and accessibility and if you require accommodation during the selection process, please let our Talent Acquisition team know. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in WestJet; however, only those candidates who are selected will be contacted.


For more information about everything WestJet, please visit WestJet.com.

title: Demand Planner
description:
Company Description

Doka’s expertise in formwork technology is unparalleled in the industry and we are proud of the difference we make globally! “It’s not just formwork – it’s DOKA” is impressively demonstrated worldwide in buildings like the Burj Khalifa (Dubai), in hydroelectric generating stations like the Keeyask (Nelson River in northern Manitoba) – and in parts of the Brenner Base Tunnel (European Alps). Collaborative teamwork of nearly 7000 employees in over 160 distribution/logistics facilities in more than 70 countries is one of the primary reasons behind our success. With more than 150 years of history as a family owned company, we recognize and appreciate our employee’s work every day by rewarding them with flexible work hours, competitive wages, bonuses, training/development opportunities and a comprehensive group benefits program including RRSPs.

Job Description

Summary of Position:

The Demand Planner works collaboratively with several Operations personnel (Commercial Office Coordinators, Logistics Coordinators, Project Managers and Sales) to place accurate orders for materials needed for customer’s projects.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Responsible for material planning & availability as per project forecast;
  • Ensure material order processing from DC (Distribution Center) or other Doka subsidiaries on time & in full as per customers need & requirements;
  • Attend Sales & Operations meetings with Sales to understand the future requirements and forecast from the sales team;
  • Coordinate with the commercial department any order processing requirement and updates of Delivery dates in DISCOS II;
  • Monitor and optimize stock levels including safety stock for all Doka items to ensure availability at lowest possible costs and inventory level as per budget;
  • Coordinate sourcing with Supply Planner & Head of Operation branch to avoid negative inventories;
  • Timely reserving the material in system for customer orders and should be always on top of all issues with respect to orders;
  • Coordinate with Engineering for substitution or alternate material in case of shortage or long Lead Time of material available in Stock;
  • Coordinate and check return planning from client’s jobsites with other departments to ensure stock levels are met and avoid any surplus of materials;
  • Proactively monitor all material movements and solve any problems arising from disputes during the project period;
  • Adhere to reporting deadlines and support period closings (month and year end).
  • Ensure orders are created & seek approvals on timely manner as per authority levels;
  • Take care of all logistics requirement within the branch;
  • Timely closing of purchase orders or any journals for the reporting period;
  • Coordinate actively with all other subsidiaries transport & release of materials;
  • Other work related tasks upon request of Head of Operations – Canada;
  • Source & confirm inter-company orders in compliance Work Instructions & Logistics guidelines set in DCAN & NAM region.

Other Responsibilities / Peripheral Functions:

  • Actively participates in Sales & Operations Department meetings as required;
  • Performs other tasks/projects as assigned;
  • Coordinate capacities with the Yard Team & Operations;
  • Proactively work on Transport Cost reduction;
  • Any other official duties as may be assigned by the management;
  • Works effectively in a complex, result driven environment requiring strong decision-making skills.

Qualifications


Qualifications / Technical Proficiency:

  • High school diploma required;
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply chain or Logistics. Commercial / Technical qualification is a plus;
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in relevant area;
  • Must be analytical and possess strong numeric aptitude;
  • Possess an assertive, take-charge management style with an ability to work independently and achieve results with minimal supervision;
  • Able to work effectively in a team and achieve desired objectives;
  • Must possess exceptional organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills;
  • Know-how and product knowledge (cost calculation, company accounts, inventory valuation, order processing, inventory and data management systems);
  • Substantial working knowledge of logistics processes and policies (material/yard/ transport logistics); Doka-specific knowledge preferred;
  • Knowledge of Doka´s supply network concept, strategies & policies is considered an asset;
  • Site construction knowledge;
  • Customer Support Function knowledge.

Skills / Characteristics:

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and go the extra mile
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Team player
  • Well organized
  • Customer oriented
  • Process and improvement drive approach

Problem Solving

  • Possesses strong skills in problem-solving, decision-making, creativity methods, error prevention;
  • Able to analyze management ratios and controlling instruments (i.e., cost accounting, key performance indicators and project controlling) ensuring actual figures are in line with budgets.

Communication

  • Extensive daily interaction with internal colleagues, headquarters, management and customers;
  • Able to perform effectively in a team environment and possess the ability collaborate with others ensuring Company/ Distribution Center targets are achieved.

Mental Effort

  • Position requires the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to be organized and manage time effectively to meet deadlines;
  • Consistently possess a positive attitude towards others in the working environment (colleagues, supervisors, senior management, clients, suppliers, etc.);
  • Open to new ideas and changing processes;
  • Open-minded towards different cultural groups;
  • Awareness of responsibility and identification with function, team, employees and targets;
  • Ability to inspire self and others;
  • High resilience.

Working Conditions

  • Conditions vary from an office environment: dry, cool, well lighted, to outside conditions (equipment yard or job site), high noise level in certain areas, extreme outdoor temperatures.

Additional Information

If you have a passion to support business accuracy and development, we look forward to receiving your application for this new role!

This position will remain open until suitable candidate(s) are located. If interested, please submit your resume as quickly as possible as interviews will be conducted intermittently.

To qualify:

  • applicants must currently reside in Canada and must be authorized to work for any employer in Canada (Permanent resident or Canadian work permit holder);
  • must clearly state their desired salary expectations in their cover letter;
  • should preferably reside within local area of the facility as there is no relocation allowance designated for this position.

Important note for remote work - this role is set to work within the office but you may be asked to work remotely, as required. Working remotely is not guaranteed.

Doka is an Equal Opportunity Employer. A company of the Umdasch Group.

title: DISPATCH / LOAD PLANNER
description:
Rosedale Transport is a family owned business since 1969. With 15 terminals across North America we can provide and service our customers freight knowing their product will arrive quickly and safe to its destination.

Rosedale Transport in Dorval, QC requires an evening Dispatch / Load Planner.

Shift: Midnights

Hours: Tuesday – Saturday 20:00 – 4:00 (Flexible)

Bonus Program

Responsibilities:

  • Plan, organize and line up loads to ensure that deliveries are made within LTL schedule.
  • Maximize load factor for optimal revenue per load
  • Go on the dock to view product and work with dock supervisor to understand freight
  • Prepare dock sheets with loading instructions and details in a timely manner
  • Prepare and print driver route information
  • Collaborate and coordinate scheduled assignments of drivers and equipment
  • Assist in preparing necessary paperwork relating to shipping schedules, customs, loading and provide to the appropriate stakeholders
  • Maintaining and building a positive rapport with all drivers and other departments
  • Back up for department staff, when required
  • All other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years of previous experience within the transportation industry required
  • Ability to identify and constructively make recommendations regarding operational improvements
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
  • Strong leadership skills and ability solve problems efficiently and effectively
  • Knowledge of Highway Traffic Act, hours of service logs, load security and Regulations required
  • General experience with MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Flexible to cover other shifts as required
  • Bilingual French / English

This position includes a paid family benefit program - Dental and Medical.

In order to be considered for this position, you must have the required experience posted. Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview .

The Rosedale group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourages cultural diversity in the workplace. Applications from aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups and women are all welcome and we also have an accommodation policy in place

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Night shift

title: Planner, Bus Priority
description:
Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE


Provides transportation planning expertise and leadership to projects of smaller/medium scope in support of a designated program related to transportation policy, forecasting, infrastructure/service development in an integrated multi-modal environment.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES


  • Contributes transportation planning expertise and leadership to the development of program strategies, plans and tactics and to designated projects.

  • Develops transportation planning methods, techniques and models in support of designated program and project deliverables, ensuring compliance with department standards, policies and procedures.

  • Contributes as a member of a program team, providing transportation planning expertise and identifying planning and project risks and opportunities based on analysis of transport data, trends, and issues. Alerts Senior Transportation Planner and Manager to critical issues.

  • Collaborates with leaders and professionals across the organization, with a view to optimizing planning services and project outcomes.

  • Researches and analyzes transportation data, trends and issues. Develops technical reports and delivers presentations for both internal and external stakeholders.

  • Develops and manages relationships with stakeholders to understand needs, maintain communication and resolve moderate issues within defined limits. Provides technical support and advice to municipal/provincial working teams and advisory committees.

  • Provides work direction to contractors and consultants and monitors contract compliance.

  • Provides technical guidance to junior planning staff where applicable

Qualifications

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE


The competencies for this position are typically acquired through a Masters degree in Planning, Engineering or a related discipline, plus 3 years’ experience providing expertise and leading projects in an agency specializing in planning or transportation.


OTHER REQUIREMENTS


  • Sound knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of transportation planning

  • Basic knowledge of plans, products, roles and responsibilities of government agencies, NGOs and associations

  • Sound knowledge of Translink’s decision-making context including its strategic context and organizational and governance structure

  • Solid leadership skills with the ability to provide technical guidance and expertise to other transportation planning professionals and to lead projects

  • Solid analytical skills including the ability to identify and communicate transportation planning and project-related risks and opportunities in an integrated, multi-disciplinary environment; includes skills to analyze transport data, trends and issues

  • Solid communication skills including the ability to write and deliver well-prepared reports and presentations

  • Solid interpersonal skills including the ability to build trust by consulting with others and applying a team approach as needed to achieve solutions. Includes negotiation skills as they pertain to making refinements to contracts and to conflict resolution at a basic level of risk and complexity.

  • Solid decision-making skills including the ability to resolve transportation planning and project-related issues within defined limits, and to identify and know when to refer issues to others.

Other Information

TransLink is looking for skilled, motivated transportation planners or engineers to join TransLink’s Bus Priority Programs team as a Planner.

The Bus Priority Programs team is responsible for planning, conceptual design, and funding of bus priority measures ranging in scale from individual hotspot treatments to full corridors. We are a team of planners, engineers, data scientists, project coordinators, and public affairs staff.

The Planner will develop small-to-medium scale plans and projects for the Bus Speed and Reliability (BSR) Program. The BSR team program focuses on strategic placement of bus bulbs, queue jumps, signal improvements, and bus lanes to help buses get through the most congested streets. The work involves data analysis, conceptual design, and stakeholder engagement.

Experience with bus priority measures, street design, and collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams, consultants, and municipal partners are assets for the Planner position.

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy

To support public health, and protect the health and safety of our employees, customers, and their families, TransLink employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will need to provide proof of full vaccination status in compliance with the employer’s COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy.

Accommodations may be applicable under the BC Human Rights Code. Should an applicant be unable to provide proof of full vaccination and should an accommodation be requested, additional information will be required to determine whether the individual is entitled to be accommodated.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

This position is full-time temporary for 36 months.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary starting from $71,327 per annum


The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan upon eligibility. Focus on your development through training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How to Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: April 14th, 2022
Closing Date: Until it is filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating and supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is free of all forms of discrimination. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds, skills and perspectives.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

title: Linehaul Dispatcher
description:
LINEHAUL DISPATCHER


Midland Transport Limited has become a leader in the transportation industry by providing superior quality service to our customers. Our services include LTL, T/L, Courier Services, and Third Party Logistics/ Brokerage which provide the convenience of one-stop shipping.


Midland Transport is looking for a strong candidate to join us as Linehaul Dispatcher based at our head office in Dieppe, NB.


Qualifications:

  • Minimum High school diploma
  • Experience in a Dispatch/Operations role is an asset
  • Solid interpersonal, communication (oral and written), and organizational skills
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision under pressure and time constraints
  • Knowledge of computerized dispatch systems - AS400, ICC Logistics is an asset

Key Responsibilities:

  • Day to day communication, via phone and satellite, with an assigned fleet of drivers to ensure proper load instructions are passed along and carried out
  • Manage service concerns, as required, to limit exposure and minimize impact on the customer
  • Coordinate with Planners to keep them updated on any issues within the fleet
  • Update trip records in the dispatch system ensuring the accuracy of miles paid accessorial, and log hours
  • Assist other Dispatch staff as required during spikes in workload
  • Assist Planners by preparing and analyzing various Linehaul reports as required
  • Provide Drivers with the right information and equipment to make the entire customer experience positive from start to finish

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Logistics Planner / Distribution Planner
description:
Company Description


At Techo-Bloc, we aren’t just paving patios – we’re paving the way for great careers! Founded on a culture of innovation, we manufacture landscaping products focused on design, durability and flair. Our growing team is seeking passionate people, ready to make an impact. Intrigued? Come grow with us.

Why Work for Us?

We love to brag. Techo Bloc offers its valued employees a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.

Here are a few of our perks:

  • Leaders who are invested in your success;
  • Have a dynamic job and evolving career path;
  • Develop your skills and grow;
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care;
  • Competitive salary + Recruitment commissions program + Annual bonus
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties;
  • Possibility of remote work;
  • Generous bonus program;
  • Snack filled kitchens;
  • Free parking;
  • Considerable referral bonuses;
  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products;
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7);
  • English and French language courses available (if it’s a work requirement);

Job Description


Under the supervision of the Demand and Distribution Manager, the Distribution Planner will be responsible for managing the demand and distribution of Techo-Bloc’s products throughout their network. As such, you will work with internal stakeholders to ensure the daily distribution/replenishment of our finished goods from our manufacturing sites to our 18 locations across Canada and the United States.

Essential Functions:

  • Managing the demand and distribution of our products using our vastly automated Microsoft Dynamics AX ERP system;
  • Based off sales forecasts, in collaboration with the Demand & Distribution Manager, participate in the process of establishing our Min-Max and target inventory levels for the distribution of our finished goods;
  • Responsible for organizing the daily distribution/replenishment of our finished goods from our manufacturing sites to our 18 locations based off orders and safety stock;
  • Collaborate with the production planners to organize timely replenishment of our finished goods that is aligned with our production schedule;
  • Responsible for identifying actual or potential overstock situations in our depots and altering our replenishment strategy accordingly;
  • Collaborate with the purchasing department to organize the replenishment of resale items across our locations;
  • Collaborate with the marketing department to organize the replenishment of marketing merchandise across our depots;
  • Collaborate with the customer service order department to organize the distribution and fulfillment of special orders to our depots;
  • Work with the transport department to establish and maintain the most cost-effective distribution routes to replenish our depots;
  • Ad hoc analysis.

Qualifications
  • College or university degree in a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a related field;
  • Bilingualism (French/English);
  • Strong computer system skills. Advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUP, SUMIF etc.);
  • The ability to work independently, multi-task and prioritize tasks with strict deadlines;
  • Strong team player and organizational skills;
  • Ability to learn and suggest process improvement through problem solving;
  • Reacts well under pressure and detail oriented;
  • Fundamental knowledge of Supply Chain (planning and scheduling, production process and capabilities, inventory planning etc.) will be considered a strong asset;
  • Experience in using MRP will be considered a strong asset.

Additional Information


The use of the masculine gender has been adopted to facilitate reading and has no discriminatory intent.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Network Planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.


Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.


As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.


Rogers is seeking a Technical Specialist to complete Service Impact requests for planned physical network move, adds or changes. This role is critical to ensure we notify our network customers of any planned network impacts related to physical work. This role requires a high degree of detail in analyzing existing networks and ensuring 100% accuracy or submitted reports.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform detailed assessment of all impacted circuits & facilities in the Rogers Transport Network resulting from any planned inside or outside physical activity,
  • Analyze all available data, validate from live Transport systems, and investigate all discrepancies
  • Prepare detailed and complete Service Impact & Risk Assessment report on the basis of above, within agreed to Service Level agreements.
  • Involve Wireless Access Engineering/ Enterprise Operations when required, to incorporate their services/ circuits into the report.
  • Liaison with all internal departments to inform/investigate any errors/ omissions/ discrepancies that may arise.
  • Update records/databases as and when required.


Qualifications:

  • Education and experience should include, undergraduate university degree in Electrical/Electronics engineering or community college diploma with certification or equivalent. SCTE BCE, BCT, or BTS designation or equivalent work experiences would be a benefit.
  • 3-5 years of work experience with major Telecom Service Provider or Cable Operator in Network engineering while operations experience would be an asset.
  • Knowledge of Fiber Optic, SONET, DWDM, CWDM, Ethernet and Digital Video Transport technologies.
  • Knowledge of NetSmart, Site Manager, OneControl, PONS, CIMS/Objectel and NRM, as well as basic knowledge of Rogers Wireless Network is an asset.
  • Proven ability to work in cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent written and oral communication, prioritizing and relationship building skills.
  • Proven problem solving and analysis skills.
  • Independent self-starter and quick learner who is able to work well under pressure and tight timelines.
  • Ability to present information and advise internal customers on proposed ideas.
  • Ability to advise on technical problems and review work for technical accuracy and adequacy.
  • Advanced Analytical skills; Ability to analyze and investigate any discrepancies that may arise in validating different sources of data.
  • Ability to act independently to determine methods and procedures.
  • Ability to modify established guide lines, advise new approaches, apply existing criteria in new manners, and draw conclusions from comparative situations.
  • Ability to work from assigned objectives, relative priorities and critical areas that impinge on work of other units.


As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: None
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 262865

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment


What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes: Digital & Technology

title: Demand Planner
description:
Company Description


Doka’s expertise in formwork technology is unparalleled in the industry and we are proud of the difference we make globally! “It’s not just formwork – it’s DOKA” is impressively demonstrated worldwide in buildings like the Burj Khalifa (Dubai), in hydroelectric generating stations like the Keeyask (Nelson River in northern Manitoba) – and in parts of the Brenner Base Tunnel (European Alps). Collaborative teamwork of nearly 7000 employees in over 160 distribution/logistics facilities in more than 70 countries is one of the primary reasons behind our success. With more than 150 years of history as a family owned company, we recognize and appreciate our employee’s work every day by rewarding them with flexible work hours, competitive wages, bonuses, training/development opportunities and a comprehensive group benefits program including RRSPs.


Job Description


Summary of Position:

The Demand Planner works collaboratively with several Operations personnel (Commercial Office Coordinators, Logistics Coordinators, Project Managers and Sales) to place accurate orders for materials needed for customer’s projects.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Responsible for material planning & availability as per project forecast;
  • Ensure material order processing from DC (Distribution Center) or other Doka subsidiaries on time & in full as per customers need & requirements;
  • Attend Sales & Operations meetings with Sales to understand the future requirements and forecast from the sales team;
  • Coordinate with the commercial department any order processing requirement and updates of Delivery dates in DISCOS II;
  • Monitor and optimize stock levels including safety stock for all Doka items to ensure availability at lowest possible costs and inventory level as per budget;
  • Coordinate sourcing with Supply Planner & Head of Operation branch to avoid negative inventories;
  • Timely reserving the material in system for customer orders and should be always on top of all issues with respect to orders;
  • Coordinate with Engineering for substitution or alternate material in case of shortage or long Lead Time of material available in Stock;
  • Coordinate and check return planning from client’s jobsites with other departments to ensure stock levels are met and avoid any surplus of materials;
  • Proactively monitor all material movements and solve any problems arising from disputes during the project period;
  • Adhere to reporting deadlines and support period closings (month and year end).
  • Ensure orders are created & seek approvals on timely manner as per authority levels;
  • Take care of all logistics requirement within the branch;
  • Timely closing of purchase orders or any journals for the reporting period;
  • Coordinate actively with all other subsidiaries transport & release of materials;
  • Other work related tasks upon request of Head of Operations – Canada;
  • Source & confirm inter-company orders in compliance Work Instructions & Logistics guidelines set in DCAN & NAM region.

Other Responsibilities / Peripheral Functions:

  • Actively participates in Sales & Operations Department meetings as required;
  • Performs other tasks/projects as assigned;
  • Coordinate capacities with the Yard Team & Operations;
  • Proactively work on Transport Cost reduction;
  • Any other official duties as may be assigned by the management;
  • Works effectively in a complex, result driven environment requiring strong decision-making skills.

Qualifications


Qualifications / Technical Proficiency:

  • High school diploma required;
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply chain or Logistics. Commercial / Technical qualification is a plus;
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in relevant area;
  • Must be analytical and possess strong numeric aptitude;
  • Possess an assertive, take-charge management style with an ability to work independently and achieve results with minimal supervision;
  • Able to work effectively in a team and achieve desired objectives;
  • Must possess exceptional organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills;
  • Know-how and product knowledge (cost calculation, company accounts, inventory valuation, order processing, inventory and data management systems);
  • Substantial working knowledge of logistics processes and policies (material/yard/ transport logistics); Doka-specific knowledge preferred;
  • Knowledge of Doka´s supply network concept, strategies & policies is considered an asset;
  • Site construction knowledge;
  • Customer Support Function knowledge.

Skills / Characteristics:

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and go the extra mile
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Team player
  • Well organized
  • Customer oriented
  • Process and improvement drive approach

Problem Solving

  • Possesses strong skills in problem-solving, decision-making, creativity methods, error prevention;
  • Able to analyze management ratios and controlling instruments (i.e., cost accounting, key performance indicators and project controlling) ensuring actual figures are in line with budgets.

Communication

  • Extensive daily interaction with internal colleagues, headquarters, management and customers;
  • Able to perform effectively in a team environment and possess the ability collaborate with others ensuring Company/ Distribution Center targets are achieved.

Mental Effort

  • Position requires the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to be organized and manage time effectively to meet deadlines;
  • Consistently possess a positive attitude towards others in the working environment (colleagues, supervisors, senior management, clients, suppliers, etc.);
  • Open to new ideas and changing processes;
  • Open-minded towards different cultural groups;
  • Awareness of responsibility and identification with function, team, employees and targets;
  • Ability to inspire self and others;
  • High resilience.

Working Conditions

  • Conditions vary from an office environment: dry, cool, well lighted, to outside conditions (equipment yard or job site), high noise level in certain areas, extreme outdoor temperatures.

Additional Information


If you have a passion to support business accuracy and development, we look forward to receiving your application for this new role!

This position will remain open until suitable candidate(s) are located. If interested, please submit your resume as quickly as possible as interviews will be conducted intermittently.

To qualify:

  • applicants must currently reside in Canada and must be authorized to work for any employer in Canada (Permanent resident or Canadian work permit holder);
  • must clearly state their desired salary expectations in their cover letter;
  • should preferably reside within local area of the facility as there is no relocation allowance designated for this position.

Important note for remote work - this role is set to work within the office but you may be asked to work remotely, as required. Working remotely is not guaranteed.

Doka is an Equal Opportunity Employer. A company of the Umdasch Group.

title: Coordonnateur(trice) au transport/ Load Planner
description:
We heard you knock!

OBJECTIF GÉNÉRAL DU POSTE

Organiser et développer une planification quotidienne des expéditions de production qui optimise l'efficacité de notre usine et du camionnage tout en répondant aux exigences de livraison de nos clients.

FONCTIONS ET RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES

  • Élaborer le calendrier de production quotidien de l'usine dans la séquence la plus efficace tout en répondant aux exigences des clients.
  • Développer la planification quotidienne des camions.
  • Coordonner avec les compagnies de transport afin de s'assurer que les horaires de livraison sont établis de manière à maximiser les chargements dans un ordre efficace tout en répondant aux exigences des clients.
  • Coordonner avec le service clientèle pour la programmation de la production et l'expédition des commandes des clients dans les temps.
  • Informer l'équipe de production des problèmes ou des situations qui peuvent affecter la performance de l'usine.
  • Respecter le calendrier de production quotidien. Faire des recommandations pour optimiser le calendrier afin d'atteindre les objectifs de coût, de qualité, de livraison et de service.
  • Mettre en œuvre et suivre les plans visant à améliorer les délais de livraison et la productivité de l'usine.
  • Suggérer et mettre en œuvre des plans pour aider à réduire les coûts de l'entreprise en matière de livraison et d'efficacité de l'usine.
  • Examiner la force de livraison pour rechercher les domaines à améliorer.
  • Communiquer avec les collègues pour éviter les problèmes entre les départements.
  • Créer un bon moral au sein du service en faisant preuve d'équité, de cohérence et d'intérêt pour les problèmes des employés. Maintenir la confidentialité.
  • Mettre en œuvre, maintenir et soutenir toutes les politiques et procédures de l'entreprise, le programme de sécurité et la bonne tenue des locaux.
  • Produire des rapports quotidiens sur la ponctualité des livraisons et trouver des moyens d'améliorer la ponctualité des livraisons.
  • D'autres tâches peuvent être assignées par la direction.

Connaissances/ compétences/ aptitudes

  • Habile communicateur, tant à l’écrit que verbal
  • Doit être motivé et capable de travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe.
  • Apte à bien prioriser et travailler sous pression
  • Excellent sens de l'organisation et qualités de leadership
  • Compétence dans l'utilisation de Microsoft Word, Excel et Outlook.
  • Travailler avec intégrité et respect en faisant preuve de tact et de diplomatie.

Qualifications

  • Formation en transport et logistique
  • Minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience connexe en gestion du transport

-

GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB

Organize and develop daily production shipment planning that optimizes our plant efficiencies, trucking efficiencies yet meet our customers’ delivery requirements.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop daily plant production schedule in the most efficient sequence while meeting customer requirements.
  • Develop daily Truck
  • Supervise external truck Drivers and ensure delivery schedules are set to maximize loads in an efficient sequence while meeting customer requirements.
  • Coordinate with CSR’s for the production scheduling and shipment of the customer orders on time.
  • Inform production team of problems or situations that may affect plant performance.
  • Adheres to daily production schedule. Makes recommendations for optimizing the schedule to meet cost, quality, delivery and service goals.
  • Implement and track plans to improve delivery times and plant productivity.
  • Suggest and implement plans to help reduce company costs in delivery and plant efficiency.
  • Review Mobile Delivery Force to investigate areas for improvement.
  • Communicate with colleagues to avoid problems between departments.
  • Establish high morale within department by showing fairness, consistency, and an interest in employee problems. Maintain confidentiality.
  • Implement, maintain, and support all company policies and procedures, safety program, and good housekeeping.
  • Produce daily on-time delivery reports and find ways to improve on-time delivery
  • Additional duties may be assigned by management.

Knowledge/ skills/ abilities

  • Skilled communicator, both written and verbal
  • Must be self-motivated and able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to prioritize and work well under pressure
  • Excellent organizational and leadership skills
  • Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Work with integrity and respect by being tactful and diplomatic.

Qualifications

  • Shipping and logistics scholarship
  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years related experience in transportation management

Open to extraordinary!

Type d'emploi : Temps Plein

title: Wireless access planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.


Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.


Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company where employees are committed to meeting big challenges and making a real difference. That's Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.


As the Wireless Access Planner, responsible for design and optimization of LTE and UMTS networks for Atlantic Canada. Plan and cost out projects to support network evolution to meet growing subscriber demand, analyzing coverage, available capacity and low throughput sites to determine the best approach. Develop and analyze the most economical solution to meet organizational objectives regarding network expansion and strategy, subscriber growth, usage patterns and Top Offenders. The candidate must be familiar with Macro, Micro, Pico and Small Cell technology and architecture as well as In Building systems.


Some of the duties of this role will include:

  • Planning
  • Create/submit all project related planning specifications for Land Acquisition, Network Augmentation, New Site Build, (Macro, Small Cell and In-building systems) COW and Site Relocations.
  • Plan, coordinate, and submit all project related infrastructure requirements.
  • Monitor and action network capacity requirements.
  • Ensure all network infrastructure projects adhere to current standards
  • Identify and report risks based on budget for each project and recommend remediation plans as needed
  • Establish and foster internal relations with Sales and Marketing to achieve Business goals and priorities.
  • Interface with Radio Engineering and Real Estate for service requirements, providing feedback on proposed deployment locations.
  • Work with and provide guidance to Radio and Civil Engineering, Transport Planning, Equipment Engineering, Site Prep specialists, and Operations.
  • Actively participate in network collaboration meetings, design reviews, and change meetings.
  • Submit Design and Cost Request specifications, work with various team members in providing accurate design and project cost projections.
  • Work with various groups towards acquiring budgets and approvals


Material management:

  • Identify RBS equipment requirements, submit quote requests, monitor deployment schedules and place equipment orders for efficient on demand needs
  • Monitor and ensure ongoing Equipment deployments from warehouse to vendors.
  • Coordinate with Delivery Manager, Engineering, Purchasing and Procurement to attain deployment goals.
  • Introduce new product, engineering changes and identify customer requirements for IB systems.


Network Analyst:

  • Identify worst offenders for Access, Utilization, Drops, Integrity, and Mobility
  • Determine route cause of performance degradation and work with Operation/Engineering for resolution.
  • Track for potential infrastructure requirements.


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Engineering degree in Telecommunications with specialization in Wireless technology with 5+ years planning experience
  • Three Year Electronics Engineering Technology Diploma with 5+ years experience in planning for complex wireless networks
  • Microsoft Office
  • Arieso Geo Analytics
  • Planet
  • MapInfo
  • Must be able to complete complex projects with minimal to no supervision
  • Effective problem-solving skills
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize work according to company prioroties a must


As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 70 Assomption Blvd (171), Moncton, NB
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 260962

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment


What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Dispatcher
description:
ABOUT THE JOB
We are currently looking for a Dispatcher for the day and afternoon shift at the Mississauga facility. If you have experience working in a large fleet company, apply now.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
LTL dispatching
Set up truck routes for the dock to load trailers and straight trucks
Routing experience of the GTA
Call drivers and control the fleet, keep track of drivers
Keep track of freight that needs to get out on time
Provide cross-functional support to Planners and Schedulers to cover frictional staffing shortages
Resolve routing issues
Perform a variety of tasks in a fast-paced environment with tight time constraints
Maintain input accuracy
Accurately enter departure times, destinations, cargo and expected times of delivery
Closely monitor delivery requirements in support of operational needs, communicating with team members, customers, and Supervisor
Promptly respond to all customer requests with optimal customer service
Monitor driver hours to ensure compliance with HOS regulations
OUR OFFER
Annual salary between $45k and $47k; based on experience
Day and afternoon shift available
Monday to Friday schedule
Permanent full-time position
Health insurance benefits after completing 3 months of service
Weekly pay through direct deposit every Thursday
OUR REQUIREMENTS
LTL routing/dispatching experience
Large fleet transport company experience
Ability to work independently, in a fast-paced environment
Attendance and punctuality is crucial
Dependability
Organizational skills and strong multitasking skills
Ability to complete tasks and follow-ups in a timely manner
CONTACT
Krupa Patel
Talent Acquisition Consultant
416-206-7549
krupa.patel @drakkar.com
