title: Demand Planner
description:
Company Description

Doka’s expertise in formwork technology is unparalleled in the industry and we are proud of the difference we make globally! “It’s not just formwork – it’s DOKA” is impressively demonstrated worldwide in buildings like the Burj Khalifa (Dubai), in hydroelectric generating stations like the Keeyask (Nelson River in northern Manitoba) – and in parts of the Brenner Base Tunnel (European Alps). Collaborative teamwork of nearly 7000 employees in over 160 distribution/logistics facilities in more than 70 countries is one of the primary reasons behind our success. With more than 150 years of history as a family owned company, we recognize and appreciate our employee’s work every day by rewarding them with flexible work hours, competitive wages, bonuses, training/development opportunities and a comprehensive group benefits program including RRSPs.

Job Description

Summary of Position:

The Demand Planner works collaboratively with several Operations personnel (Commercial Office Coordinators, Logistics Coordinators, Project Managers and Sales) to place accurate orders for materials needed for customer’s projects.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Responsible for material planning & availability as per project forecast;
  • Ensure material order processing from DC (Distribution Center) or other Doka subsidiaries on time & in full as per customers need & requirements;
  • Attend Sales & Operations meetings with Sales to understand the future requirements and forecast from the sales team;
  • Coordinate with the commercial department any order processing requirement and updates of Delivery dates in DISCOS II;
  • Monitor and optimize stock levels including safety stock for all Doka items to ensure availability at lowest possible costs and inventory level as per budget;
  • Coordinate sourcing with Supply Planner & Head of Operation branch to avoid negative inventories;
  • Timely reserving the material in system for customer orders and should be always on top of all issues with respect to orders;
  • Coordinate with Engineering for substitution or alternate material in case of shortage or long Lead Time of material available in Stock;
  • Coordinate and check return planning from client’s jobsites with other departments to ensure stock levels are met and avoid any surplus of materials;
  • Proactively monitor all material movements and solve any problems arising from disputes during the project period;
  • Adhere to reporting deadlines and support period closings (month and year end).
  • Ensure orders are created & seek approvals on timely manner as per authority levels;
  • Take care of all logistics requirement within the branch;
  • Timely closing of purchase orders or any journals for the reporting period;
  • Coordinate actively with all other subsidiaries transport & release of materials;
  • Other work related tasks upon request of Head of Operations – Canada;
  • Source & confirm inter-company orders in compliance Work Instructions & Logistics guidelines set in DCAN & NAM region.

Other Responsibilities / Peripheral Functions:

  • Actively participates in Sales & Operations Department meetings as required;
  • Performs other tasks/projects as assigned;
  • Coordinate capacities with the Yard Team & Operations;
  • Proactively work on Transport Cost reduction;
  • Any other official duties as may be assigned by the management;
  • Works effectively in a complex, result driven environment requiring strong decision-making skills.

Qualifications


Qualifications / Technical Proficiency:

  • High school diploma required;
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply chain or Logistics. Commercial / Technical qualification is a plus;
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in relevant area;
  • Must be analytical and possess strong numeric aptitude;
  • Possess an assertive, take-charge management style with an ability to work independently and achieve results with minimal supervision;
  • Able to work effectively in a team and achieve desired objectives;
  • Must possess exceptional organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills;
  • Know-how and product knowledge (cost calculation, company accounts, inventory valuation, order processing, inventory and data management systems);
  • Substantial working knowledge of logistics processes and policies (material/yard/ transport logistics); Doka-specific knowledge preferred;
  • Knowledge of Doka´s supply network concept, strategies & policies is considered an asset;
  • Site construction knowledge;
  • Customer Support Function knowledge.

Skills / Characteristics:

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and go the extra mile
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Team player
  • Well organized
  • Customer oriented
  • Process and improvement drive approach

Problem Solving

  • Possesses strong skills in problem-solving, decision-making, creativity methods, error prevention;
  • Able to analyze management ratios and controlling instruments (i.e., cost accounting, key performance indicators and project controlling) ensuring actual figures are in line with budgets.

Communication

  • Extensive daily interaction with internal colleagues, headquarters, management and customers;
  • Able to perform effectively in a team environment and possess the ability collaborate with others ensuring Company/ Distribution Center targets are achieved.

Mental Effort

  • Position requires the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment along with the ability to be organized and manage time effectively to meet deadlines;
  • Consistently possess a positive attitude towards others in the working environment (colleagues, supervisors, senior management, clients, suppliers, etc.);
  • Open to new ideas and changing processes;
  • Open-minded towards different cultural groups;
  • Awareness of responsibility and identification with function, team, employees and targets;
  • Ability to inspire self and others;
  • High resilience.

Working Conditions

  • Conditions vary from an office environment: dry, cool, well lighted, to outside conditions (equipment yard or job site), high noise level in certain areas, extreme outdoor temperatures.

Additional Information

If you have a passion to support business accuracy and development, we look forward to receiving your application for this new role!

This position will remain open until suitable candidate(s) are located. If interested, please submit your resume as quickly as possible as interviews will be conducted intermittently.

To qualify:

  • applicants must currently reside in Canada and must be authorized to work for any employer in Canada (Permanent resident or Canadian work permit holder);
  • must clearly state their desired salary expectations in their cover letter;
  • should preferably reside within local area of the facility as there is no relocation allowance designated for this position.

Important note for remote work - this role is set to work within the office but you may be asked to work remotely, as required. Working remotely is not guaranteed.

Doka is an Equal Opportunity Employer. A company of the Umdasch Group.

title: Campus Planner
description:
Please refer to the
How to Apply for a Job (for External Candidates)
job aid for instructions on how to apply.
If you are an active McGill employee (ie: currently in an active contract or position at McGill University), do not apply through this Career Site. Login to your McGill Workday account and apply to this posting using the Find Jobs report (type Find Jobs in the search bar).
Position Summary:
The Campus Planner reports to the Director, Development Projects of Campus Planning and Development Office. The incumbent contributes to the development and planning of physical development initiatives for the University. The incumbent collaborates in all aspects of project planning, from evaluating project or initiative feasibility to defining the final scope of the project or initiative for internal and/or external approval. The incumbent will communicate key information concerning planning initiatives to internal and external stakeholders and decision makers. The incumbent is responsible for space planning and management to represent CPDO interests relating to space management, development and planning initiatives in support of the short and long-term goals of the University. The incumbent is responsible for ensuring the efficient day to day planning for the development needs of the University. This is accomplished by effectively overseeing the activities relating to planning and development, land sales and providing associated administrative support. The incumbent advises on the effective use of land and property resources. In carrying out this work, the incumbent takes account of the economic, social and environmental factors impacting on development proposals and is skilled at understanding the business case for property and land development in a highly regulated environment. The incumbent advises on issues such as site planning, development, conservation and transport options, while taking account of rapidly changing market conditions.The Campus Planner reports to the Director, Development Projects of Campus Planning and Development Office. The incumbent contributes to the development and planning of physical development initiatives for the University. The incumbent collaborates in all aspects of project planning, from evaluating project or initiative feasibility to defining the final scope of the project or initiative for internal and/or external approval. The incumbent will communicate key information concerning planning initiatives to internal and external stakeholders and decision makers. The incumbent is responsible for space planning and management to represent CPDO interests relating to space management, development and planning initiatives in support of the short and long-term goals of the University. The incumbent is responsible for ensuring the efficient day to day planning for the development needs of the University. This is accomplished by effectively overseeing the activities relating to planning and development, land sales and providing associated administrative support. The incumbent advises on the effective use of land and property resources. In carrying out this work, the incumbent takes account of the economic, social and environmental factors impacting on development proposals and is skilled at understanding the business case for property and land development in a highly regulated environment. The incumbent advises on issues such as site planning, development, conservation and transport options, while taking account of rapidly changing market conditions

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate in the planning and development of initiatives from the moment of idea generation to project scope and concept approval while respecting timelines and budgets. Develop scope and program requirements for specific projects and initiatives.
  • Liaise with internal clients and external agencies, to facilitate development initiatives. Perform administrative duties related to development initiatives.
  • Plans and controls project development including space programing.
  • Collect, maintain and analyze statistical information on all aspects of University activities to respond to requests from Government, other external agencies, faculties and departments.
  • Research and analyze regulations, campus planning and development, space-related and political implications. Make recommendations and communicate results to Senior Management and decision makers.
  • Communicate, as required, relevant initiative information to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Participate in the oversight of a range of feasibility studies to facilitate program scope development.
  • Manage, review and process all development permits, sub-division, rezoning and Land Use Bylaw amendment applications; assists with appeals relating to these areas.
  • Assesses potential land use and property use, including traffic, infrastructure and users’ constraints. • Participates in the development and planning initiatives, from the earliest planning stages through transitioning with other units.
  • Ensures compliance with planning legislation and policy.
  • Oversees developments which are sensitive to the conservation and protection of historic or environmentally sensitive sites and areas.

Other Qualifying Skills and/or Abilities:
Undergraduate degree in a relevant domain is preferred. Knowledge of all phases of project planning and development. Experience in coordinating architects and engineers in the planning phase. Experience managing real estate management or development is an asset. Knowledge of and experience in financial analysis and interpretation. Eligibility for professional certification as Architect and/or Urban Planner is desirable. Strong analytical background and project development skills. Ability to manage multiple development initiatives and to prioritize appropriately. Ability to work in a PC environment and an advanced level proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Basic proficiency in Adobe Suite. Ability to develop creative solutions and to manage in a diverse environment with the focus on the client. Exceptional communication skills with internal stakeholders at all levels of the organization, as well with external stakeholders and authorities. Strong written and excellent spoken communication skills in English and French. Experience in higher education in a related field, an asset.

Minimum Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree 3 Years Related Experience with Bachelor’s Degree / DEC III 5 Years Related Experience with DEC III
Annual Salary:
(MPEX Grade 04) $57,330.00 - $71,660.00 - $85,990.00
Hours per Week:
33.75 (Full time)
Supervisor:
Director Campus Planning and Development
Position End Date (If applicable):
2023-04-21
Deadline to Apply:
2022-05-09
McGill University hires on the basis of merit and is strongly committed to equity and diversity within its community. We welcome applications from racialized persons/visible minorities, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, and persons of minority sexual orientations and gender identities, as well as from all qualified candidates with the skills and knowledge to productively engage with diverse communities. McGill implements an employment equity program and encourages members of designated groups to self-identify. Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence,
accessibilityrequest.hr@mcgill.ca
.

title: Analyst, Supply Chain
description:
Job Address:
1425 The Queensway, Etobicoke, Ontario, M8Z 1T3

Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts. We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.
Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake. We are hiring a supply chain analyst who will play a critical role in the daily execution of the supply and distribution plan across the network. This role is ideal for someone who has excellent organizational and problem solving skills as well as familiarity with food production or fast moving consumer goods.
What You'll Do:
  • Support daily operations, working with Bakeries, Transport and Distribution to co-ordinate flow of goods through the network
  • Maintain and publish daily KPIs and undertake process improvement efforts, focused on improving Case Fill Rate
  • Execute seasonal activities plans provided by planners and develop holiday and long weekend plans to adjust delivery schedules
  • Analyze and ensure all data management pertaining to product allocations and movements are maintained
  • Assist in handling special requests/orders from Key Account Managers and CSRs on major customers’ behalf
  • Recommends process changes leading to more efficiency in the supply chain where applicable
What You'll Need:
  • Post-secondary education in Business, Economics, Engineering or Marketing
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret large amounts of data is required
  • Must be detail oriented and must be able to handle multiple priorities in a faced-paced environment
  • Good interpersonal & communication skills (oral & written)
  • Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment
  • Must have strong computer skills, especially with Excel
  • Previous experience with SAP is an asset

Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Number of openings:
1
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

title: Network Planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.


Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.


As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.


Rogers is seeking a Technical Specialist to complete Service Impact requests for planned physical network move, adds or changes. This role is critical to ensure we notify our network customers of any planned network impacts related to physical work. This role requires a high degree of detail in analyzing existing networks and ensuring 100% accuracy or submitted reports.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform detailed assessment of all impacted circuits & facilities in the Rogers Transport Network resulting from any planned inside or outside physical activity,
  • Analyze all available data, validate from live Transport systems, and investigate all discrepancies
  • Prepare detailed and complete Service Impact & Risk Assessment report on the basis of above, within agreed to Service Level agreements.
  • Involve Wireless Access Engineering/ Enterprise Operations when required, to incorporate their services/ circuits into the report.
  • Liaison with all internal departments to inform/investigate any errors/ omissions/ discrepancies that may arise.
  • Update records/databases as and when required.


Qualifications:

  • Education and experience should include, undergraduate university degree in Electrical/Electronics engineering or community college diploma with certification or equivalent. SCTE BCE, BCT, or BTS designation or equivalent work experiences would be a benefit.
  • 3-5 years of work experience with major Telecom Service Provider or Cable Operator in Network engineering while operations experience would be an asset.
  • Knowledge of Fiber Optic, SONET, DWDM, CWDM, Ethernet and Digital Video Transport technologies.
  • Knowledge of NetSmart, Site Manager, OneControl, PONS, CIMS/Objectel and NRM, as well as basic knowledge of Rogers Wireless Network is an asset.
  • Proven ability to work in cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent written and oral communication, prioritizing and relationship building skills.
  • Proven problem solving and analysis skills.
  • Independent self-starter and quick learner who is able to work well under pressure and tight timelines.
  • Ability to present information and advise internal customers on proposed ideas.
  • Ability to advise on technical problems and review work for technical accuracy and adequacy.
  • Advanced Analytical skills; Ability to analyze and investigate any discrepancies that may arise in validating different sources of data.
  • Ability to act independently to determine methods and procedures.
  • Ability to modify established guide lines, advise new approaches, apply existing criteria in new manners, and draw conclusions from comparative situations.
  • Ability to work from assigned objectives, relative priorities and critical areas that impinge on work of other units.


As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: None
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 262865

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment


What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes: Digital & Technology

title: Logistics Planner / Distribution Planner
description:
Company Description


At Techo-Bloc, we aren’t just paving patios – we’re paving the way for great careers! Founded on a culture of innovation, we manufacture landscaping products focused on design, durability and flair. Our growing team is seeking passionate people, ready to make an impact. Intrigued? Come grow with us.

Why Work for Us?

We love to brag. Techo Bloc offers its valued employees a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.

Here are a few of our perks:

  • Leaders who are invested in your success;
  • Have a dynamic job and evolving career path;
  • Develop your skills and grow;
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care;
  • Competitive salary + Recruitment commissions program + Annual bonus
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties;
  • Possibility of remote work;
  • Generous bonus program;
  • Snack filled kitchens;
  • Free parking;
  • Considerable referral bonuses;
  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products;
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7);
  • English and French language courses available (if it’s a work requirement);

Job Description


Under the supervision of the Demand and Distribution Manager, the Distribution Planner will be responsible for managing the demand and distribution of Techo-Bloc’s products throughout their network. As such, you will work with internal stakeholders to ensure the daily distribution/replenishment of our finished goods from our manufacturing sites to our 18 locations across Canada and the United States.

Essential Functions:

  • Managing the demand and distribution of our products using our vastly automated Microsoft Dynamics AX ERP system;
  • Based off sales forecasts, in collaboration with the Demand & Distribution Manager, participate in the process of establishing our Min-Max and target inventory levels for the distribution of our finished goods;
  • Responsible for organizing the daily distribution/replenishment of our finished goods from our manufacturing sites to our 18 locations based off orders and safety stock;
  • Collaborate with the production planners to organize timely replenishment of our finished goods that is aligned with our production schedule;
  • Responsible for identifying actual or potential overstock situations in our depots and altering our replenishment strategy accordingly;
  • Collaborate with the purchasing department to organize the replenishment of resale items across our locations;
  • Collaborate with the marketing department to organize the replenishment of marketing merchandise across our depots;
  • Collaborate with the customer service order department to organize the distribution and fulfillment of special orders to our depots;
  • Work with the transport department to establish and maintain the most cost-effective distribution routes to replenish our depots;
  • Ad hoc analysis.

Qualifications
  • College or university degree in a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a related field;
  • Bilingualism (French/English);
  • Strong computer system skills. Advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUP, SUMIF etc.);
  • The ability to work independently, multi-task and prioritize tasks with strict deadlines;
  • Strong team player and organizational skills;
  • Ability to learn and suggest process improvement through problem solving;
  • Reacts well under pressure and detail oriented;
  • Fundamental knowledge of Supply Chain (planning and scheduling, production process and capabilities, inventory planning etc.) will be considered a strong asset;
  • Experience in using MRP will be considered a strong asset.

Additional Information


The use of the masculine gender has been adopted to facilitate reading and has no discriminatory intent.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Show more

title: Linehaul Dispatcher
description:
LINEHAUL DISPATCHER


Midland Transport Limited has become a leader in the transportation industry by providing superior quality service to our customers. Our services include LTL, T/L, Courier Services, and Third Party Logistics/ Brokerage which provide the convenience of one-stop shipping.


Midland Transport is looking for a strong candidate to join us as Linehaul Dispatcher based at our head office in Dieppe, NB.


Qualifications:

  • Minimum High school diploma
  • Experience in a Dispatch/Operations role is an asset
  • Solid interpersonal, communication (oral and written), and organizational skills
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision under pressure and time constraints
  • Knowledge of computerized dispatch systems - AS400, ICC Logistics is an asset

Key Responsibilities:

  • Day to day communication, via phone and satellite, with an assigned fleet of drivers to ensure proper load instructions are passed along and carried out
  • Manage service concerns, as required, to limit exposure and minimize impact on the customer
  • Coordinate with Planners to keep them updated on any issues within the fleet
  • Update trip records in the dispatch system ensuring the accuracy of miles paid accessorial, and log hours
  • Assist other Dispatch staff as required during spikes in workload
  • Assist Planners by preparing and analyzing various Linehaul reports as required
  • Provide Drivers with the right information and equipment to make the entire customer experience positive from start to finish

We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Coordonnateur(trice) au transport/ Load Planner
description:
We heard you knock!

OBJECTIF GÉNÉRAL DU POSTE

Organiser et développer une planification quotidienne des expéditions de production qui optimise l'efficacité de notre usine et du camionnage tout en répondant aux exigences de livraison de nos clients.

FONCTIONS ET RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES

  • Élaborer le calendrier de production quotidien de l'usine dans la séquence la plus efficace tout en répondant aux exigences des clients.
  • Développer la planification quotidienne des camions.
  • Coordonner avec les compagnies de transport afin de s'assurer que les horaires de livraison sont établis de manière à maximiser les chargements dans un ordre efficace tout en répondant aux exigences des clients.
  • Coordonner avec le service clientèle pour la programmation de la production et l'expédition des commandes des clients dans les temps.
  • Informer l'équipe de production des problèmes ou des situations qui peuvent affecter la performance de l'usine.
  • Respecter le calendrier de production quotidien. Faire des recommandations pour optimiser le calendrier afin d'atteindre les objectifs de coût, de qualité, de livraison et de service.
  • Mettre en œuvre et suivre les plans visant à améliorer les délais de livraison et la productivité de l'usine.
  • Suggérer et mettre en œuvre des plans pour aider à réduire les coûts de l'entreprise en matière de livraison et d'efficacité de l'usine.
  • Examiner la force de livraison pour rechercher les domaines à améliorer.
  • Communiquer avec les collègues pour éviter les problèmes entre les départements.
  • Créer un bon moral au sein du service en faisant preuve d'équité, de cohérence et d'intérêt pour les problèmes des employés. Maintenir la confidentialité.
  • Mettre en œuvre, maintenir et soutenir toutes les politiques et procédures de l'entreprise, le programme de sécurité et la bonne tenue des locaux.
  • Produire des rapports quotidiens sur la ponctualité des livraisons et trouver des moyens d'améliorer la ponctualité des livraisons.
  • D'autres tâches peuvent être assignées par la direction.

Connaissances/ compétences/ aptitudes

  • Habile communicateur, tant à l’écrit que verbal
  • Doit être motivé et capable de travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe.
  • Apte à bien prioriser et travailler sous pression
  • Excellent sens de l'organisation et qualités de leadership
  • Compétence dans l'utilisation de Microsoft Word, Excel et Outlook.
  • Travailler avec intégrité et respect en faisant preuve de tact et de diplomatie.

Qualifications

  • Formation en transport et logistique
  • Minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience connexe en gestion du transport

-

GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB

Organize and develop daily production shipment planning that optimizes our plant efficiencies, trucking efficiencies yet meet our customers’ delivery requirements.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop daily plant production schedule in the most efficient sequence while meeting customer requirements.
  • Develop daily Truck
  • Supervise external truck Drivers and ensure delivery schedules are set to maximize loads in an efficient sequence while meeting customer requirements.
  • Coordinate with CSR’s for the production scheduling and shipment of the customer orders on time.
  • Inform production team of problems or situations that may affect plant performance.
  • Adheres to daily production schedule. Makes recommendations for optimizing the schedule to meet cost, quality, delivery and service goals.
  • Implement and track plans to improve delivery times and plant productivity.
  • Suggest and implement plans to help reduce company costs in delivery and plant efficiency.
  • Review Mobile Delivery Force to investigate areas for improvement.
  • Communicate with colleagues to avoid problems between departments.
  • Establish high morale within department by showing fairness, consistency, and an interest in employee problems. Maintain confidentiality.
  • Implement, maintain, and support all company policies and procedures, safety program, and good housekeeping.
  • Produce daily on-time delivery reports and find ways to improve on-time delivery
  • Additional duties may be assigned by management.

Knowledge/ skills/ abilities

  • Skilled communicator, both written and verbal
  • Must be self-motivated and able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to prioritize and work well under pressure
  • Excellent organizational and leadership skills
  • Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Work with integrity and respect by being tactful and diplomatic.

Qualifications

  • Shipping and logistics scholarship
  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years related experience in transportation management

Open to extraordinary!

Type d'emploi : Temps Plein

title: Wireless access planner
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.


Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.


Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company where employees are committed to meeting big challenges and making a real difference. That's Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.


As the Wireless Access Planner, responsible for design and optimization of LTE and UMTS networks for Atlantic Canada. Plan and cost out projects to support network evolution to meet growing subscriber demand, analyzing coverage, available capacity and low throughput sites to determine the best approach. Develop and analyze the most economical solution to meet organizational objectives regarding network expansion and strategy, subscriber growth, usage patterns and Top Offenders. The candidate must be familiar with Macro, Micro, Pico and Small Cell technology and architecture as well as In Building systems.


Some of the duties of this role will include:

  • Planning
  • Create/submit all project related planning specifications for Land Acquisition, Network Augmentation, New Site Build, (Macro, Small Cell and In-building systems) COW and Site Relocations.
  • Plan, coordinate, and submit all project related infrastructure requirements.
  • Monitor and action network capacity requirements.
  • Ensure all network infrastructure projects adhere to current standards
  • Identify and report risks based on budget for each project and recommend remediation plans as needed
  • Establish and foster internal relations with Sales and Marketing to achieve Business goals and priorities.
  • Interface with Radio Engineering and Real Estate for service requirements, providing feedback on proposed deployment locations.
  • Work with and provide guidance to Radio and Civil Engineering, Transport Planning, Equipment Engineering, Site Prep specialists, and Operations.
  • Actively participate in network collaboration meetings, design reviews, and change meetings.
  • Submit Design and Cost Request specifications, work with various team members in providing accurate design and project cost projections.
  • Work with various groups towards acquiring budgets and approvals


Material management:

  • Identify RBS equipment requirements, submit quote requests, monitor deployment schedules and place equipment orders for efficient on demand needs
  • Monitor and ensure ongoing Equipment deployments from warehouse to vendors.
  • Coordinate with Delivery Manager, Engineering, Purchasing and Procurement to attain deployment goals.
  • Introduce new product, engineering changes and identify customer requirements for IB systems.


Network Analyst:

  • Identify worst offenders for Access, Utilization, Drops, Integrity, and Mobility
  • Determine route cause of performance degradation and work with Operation/Engineering for resolution.
  • Track for potential infrastructure requirements.


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Engineering degree in Telecommunications with specialization in Wireless technology with 5+ years planning experience
  • Three Year Electronics Engineering Technology Diploma with 5+ years experience in planning for complex wireless networks
  • Microsoft Office
  • Arieso Geo Analytics
  • Planet
  • MapInfo
  • Must be able to complete complex projects with minimal to no supervision
  • Effective problem-solving skills
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize work according to company prioroties a must


As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 70 Assomption Blvd (171), Moncton, NB
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 260962

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment


What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Dispatcher
description:
ABOUT THE JOB
We are currently looking for a Dispatcher for the day and afternoon shift at the Mississauga facility. If you have experience working in a large fleet company, apply now.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
LTL dispatching
Set up truck routes for the dock to load trailers and straight trucks
Routing experience of the GTA
Call drivers and control the fleet, keep track of drivers
Keep track of freight that needs to get out on time
Provide cross-functional support to Planners and Schedulers to cover frictional staffing shortages
Resolve routing issues
Perform a variety of tasks in a fast-paced environment with tight time constraints
Maintain input accuracy
Accurately enter departure times, destinations, cargo and expected times of delivery
Closely monitor delivery requirements in support of operational needs, communicating with team members, customers, and Supervisor
Promptly respond to all customer requests with optimal customer service
Monitor driver hours to ensure compliance with HOS regulations
OUR OFFER
Annual salary between $45k and $47k; based on experience
Day and afternoon shift available
Monday to Friday schedule
Permanent full-time position
Health insurance benefits after completing 3 months of service
Weekly pay through direct deposit every Thursday
OUR REQUIREMENTS
LTL routing/dispatching experience
Large fleet transport company experience
Ability to work independently, in a fast-paced environment
Attendance and punctuality is crucial
Dependability
Organizational skills and strong multitasking skills
Ability to complete tasks and follow-ups in a timely manner
CONTACT
Krupa Patel
Talent Acquisition Consultant
416-206-7549
krupa.patel @drakkar.com

title: Load Planner/Dispatcher
description:
Turk Enterprises Ltd, a leading refrigerated carrier servicing North America is seeking an experienced Load Planner

The ideal candidate will have a minimum 3 years’ experience in a comparable position within the transportation industry. The following identifies some of the required tasks / skills related to this position.

-Plan and Coordinate the scheduling of Professional Transport Operators, trucks and freight between various locations across Canada and the USA. Direct the P/U and delivery of freight in the most efficient manner.

-Work closely with current customer base and actively sources new customers and freight opportunities where required on a daily basis.

-Monitor arrival and departure times by phone and or satellite.

-Ability to multitask and monitor several vehicles at the same time.

-To work close with customers and fleet managers to achieve the highest level of customer satisfaction.

-The ability to work in a fast paced environment.

-Be a team player and work closely with all departments.

-The ability to solve problems and be a quick thinker.

If you possess the above skills, Turks is the place for you!

We offer a great work environment with room to grow, competitive pay structure and competitive health benefits plan and a company pension.

Turk enterprises is an equal opportunity employer and invite all qualified individuals to apply. Only those applicants that meet the requirements of this position will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • St. Andrews, MB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • planning/dispatching: 2 years (preferred)

title: Planner, Mechanical
description:
Job Description:

Planner, Maintenance - Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta, Canada

At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 23,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.


Reporting to the Specialist, Asset Gatekeeper, the Planner is accountable for developing high quality job work packages to be used for execution of Maintenance and Project activities.

What you will do:

  • Applies actual field condition information, relevant technical data, trade knowledge, personal experience, and where appropriate, input from maintenance, operations and technical resources to develop high quality executable plans
  • Ensures all plans developed are consistent with the Nutrien Planning Standards. This will include safety procedures, maintenance standards/procedures, identification of required resources, estimated task durations, materials, equipment and services required to execute the work identified
  • Develops and maintains Task Lists to ensure complete and accurate records consistent with Nutrien planning standards
  • Assembles fully planned work into formal job packages when required for transport to Maintenance Groups and Projects Group for execution
  • Reports on his/her progress on a weekly basis and communicate any issues that are preventing plans from progressing
  • Reports all safety concerns and takes corrective action for a safety hazard identified that could impact themselves or others


What you will bring:

  • High School Diploma
  • Journeyman ticket, preferably Millwright
  • 10 years’ experience in an industrial process setting
  • Ability to handle large and varied work
  • Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multitask
  • Excellent interpersonal communication, planning and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with SAP, planning and scheduling principles are an asset
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office


Are you a good match? Apply today!

Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. In accordance with Nutrien policies, you will be required to undergo a background check and may be required to undergo a substance test. Being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is a condition of employment and that proof of vaccination will be required, with minimal exceptions, unless prohibited by applicable law. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on: LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter


**EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/veteran

title: Crew Scheduler
description:
Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.

Description

Job Summary:

You are an experienced crew planner or scheduler, ideally with a background in aviation or transportation. The Crew Scheduler is responsible for developing and maintaining the pilot schedule on a month-by-month basis, ensuring crew coverage for all aircraft. In addition, you will book flights and hotels for upcoming rotations and training that occurs away from base.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain flight crew schedule to ensure adequate coverage for all aircraft
  • Ensure schedule complies with company and Transport Canada regulations
  • Assess crew requirements in order to determine acceptability of vacation requests
  • Alter schedule as required for away trips, sick days and vacation time
  • Coordinate and communicate crew change schedules for rotations with clients
  • Ensure proper paperwork and information is provided to crews for first time rotations
  • Schedule training items as required
  • Allocate travel and schedule crew on trips as required
  • Ensure hotels and car rentals are booked for away from base trips as required

Requirements:

  • Previous experience in a crew scheduling, planning and/or dispatch role
  • Related education or training would be an asset
  • Familiarity with Transport Canada and Canadian Aviation Regulations
  • Strong computer skills, particularly MS Excel
  • Analytical and organized, with excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritize and perform effectively in a fast-paced, high volume work environment
  • Proven communication skills to ensure effective and timely flow of information

Working Conditions:

  • Position based in Yellowknife, NT , Calgary, AB, or Edmonton, AB ( preference for Yellowknife)
  • Full time, shift work options available

Additional Information:

Company Description

Summit Air, a member of the Ledcor Group of Companies, has been delivering remote aviation solutions to our customers for over 20 years. We have one of the largest and most diverse fleets in the industry. From moving cargo, to transferring passengers, to recreational flights for adventurers seeking to discover the North, we are a one-stop solution when it comes to safe and reliable aviation support. Learn more at
www.flysummitair.com

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement
here
.

Date Posted
Apr 26, 2022

7008 Roper Road NW, Edmonton, AB, Canada

Show more

title: Staff Planner - OCC
description:
Staff Planner - OCC

  • 2211921
Primary LocationNorth America-CA-Toronto-Toronto Pearson International Airport (YYZ)
ScheduleFull-time
Unposting DateMay 20, 2022, 10:59:00 PM
OrganizationGround Handling

About us

Swissport International Ltd. is the leading Ground Services Provider to the aviation industry. Swissport is employing over 68,000 dedicated professionals, serving over 800 client companies at 315 stations in 50 countries on five continents. Swissport delivers unparalleled value in the areas of Ground Handling, Cargo Services, Executive Aviation, Travel Services, Fueling and Aircraft Maintenance. We strive to operate with the core values of People, Professionalism, and Partnership in all that we undertake. Our mission is simple – “To provide the aviation industry with consistent and tailor-made solutions around the globe, for a better customer experience”.


Role and Function


Plan and assign the duties for any and all staffing requirements. Creating schedules and assisting all levels of management with any scheduling requirements including daily operations.

Job Responsibilities
  • Forecast, plan, create and implement the schedule, including controlling the bid, for the PAX department.
  • Must apply all airline scheduling requirements to scheduling needs of the department
  • Clear and acknowledge all time card exceptions for payroll processing
  • Communicate to all levels of staff any changes to the flight schedules
  • Prepare the daily rosters
  • Assist with the staffing coverage, calls for overtime, etc.
  • Attend and address all communications (telephone calls, email, SITA, fax messages) necessary
  • Maintain good relationships with employees, co-workers, customers and airline authorities
  • Maintain and observe confidentiality with respect to employee records
  • Familiar with WSIB rules pertaining to injury at the work site, along with Swissport reporting requirements
  • Assisting with capturing revenue by accurately completing the Daily Flight Logs
  • Must have control with the staffing hours required for service.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications & Competencies

  • Staff planning/allocation experience required
  • Must possess strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task
  • Effective communication skills (verbal and written)
  • Internal and external customer relations skills
  • Knowledge of Passenger Service Operation and strong understanding of the Collective Bargaining agreement
  • Must obtain and maintain valid unrestricted Transport Canada Security Clearance
  • Flexible work schedule including evenings, weekends and holidays
  • Ability to operate in a fast paced environment, while maintaining accuracy and diplomacy
  • Available and flexible to work various shifts (day, evening, weekend and holidays) by operational requirements

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Swissport as an equal opportunity employer bases its hiring decisions on the business need and the best qualified candidates available, and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. Candidates who are offered employment may be subject to a criminal record and other background checks as permitted or required by company policy or applicable law.

title: Logistics Manager
description:
TKEES is building a world class operational team to increase our ability to consistently surprise and delight our customers. As we continue to grow at an enormous pace, we need to ensure that we manage our supply chain efficiently from start to finish. The Logistics Manager plays a critical role in ensuring this occurs.

Responsibilities and Duties

Oversee entire product life cycle:

-Attend design meetings to agree upon production timelines, transportation expectations & review duties of raw goods and finished product into USA

-Work with Production/Sourcing Manager to ensure factories selected for production are vertically integrated and able to provide all required paperwork and permits

-Communicate with raw material suppliers to ensure they are adhering to all production timelines, and are able to ship materials to factories DDP

-Provide factories with timelines for materials arrival, and discuss if there are are foreseen delays

-Notify marketing team when goods are in production so they can pull samples for photoshoots and influencers

-Meet with finance team to notify them when goods are nearing completion, and payment will be required

-Source quotes from Freight Forwarders to transport goods to warehouse in New Jersey

-Create Products, Listing Skus & Vendor Skus in Skubana prior to goods arrival

-Notify warehouse that goods are on the way and whether they are ECOM or WHOLESALE

-Confirm with design/marketing team when goods are being received at warehouse so everyone is aligned on launch date

-Upload receiving reports received from warehouse to Skubana and confirm with Ecom Merchandising team that units are synced to shopify (all 3 instances) and size scale is correct

-Responsible for all shipments and product movement within company, and ensuring these goods are ready on time

-Purchase Orders from Factories

-Fabric from Mills

-Labels and Notions from Suppliers
-Customer Orders from warehouse

-Work with wholesale team to provide weekly ATS reports and updates on inbound POs to fulfill pending orders

-Communicate daily with warehouse team to ensure they have everything they need to succeed

Other responsibilities include:

-Troubleshoot issues with the warehouse team

-Liaise with all departments of company to ensure deadlines and launch dates are aligned between Design to Marketing to Sales

-Build strong relationships with Freight Forwarders to ensure goods are being delivered on time and in the most economical manner

-Work closely with CX team to address concerns brought forward by customers including: QC, shipment delays and shipment errors

-Work in partnership with Demand Planner and Sourcing/Production Manager to create a seamless supply chain

-Keep track of stock levels, delivery times and transportation costs

-Oversee all existing dropship relationships while exploring new opportunities, negotiate contracts and set up new partners with DSCO/CartRover/Shopify

-Work with customs brokers to ensure most cost effective places and ways to manufacturer and ship goods

Qualifications and Skills

  • 5-10 years of logistics experience
  • Proven experience in all areas of product logistics including, warehousing, order processing, inventory management, computer systems.
  • Excellent English communications skills, both written and verbal
  • Self-motivated person who enjoys challenges and working in a fast-paced environment with a daily sense of urgency. Taking initiative to solve problems and deliver results
  • Detail oriented with a willingness to adapt and be flexible in a growing company
  • Analytical/analysis skills
  • Ability to resolve issues between internal and external stakeholders
  • Ability to act decisively to resolve problems
  • Ability to multi-task and juggle priorities along with strong organizational skills
  • Knowledge and experience with ERP systems.

Basic Requirements

  • Bachelors Degree
  • 6 years’ experience in a logistics management

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00-$85,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
Show more

title: Access Transport Planner
description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.


We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.


Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.


Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity:


This position, reporting to the Manager of Access Transport Planning & Engineering, will be part of a technical team responsible for planning and preliminary design work transforming and evolving the IPRAN network to a Unified Access Transport network supporting Service Expansion and major Wireless/Wireline Programs such as 5G, New Site Builds.


Responsibilities:

  • Support the develop of the short and long range capital budget plans to sustain and grow the access Transport network, in collaboration with Regional Planning teams and business partners
  • Transitioning of the IPRAN transport network to a Unified Access Transport network supporting Wireless, Residential & R4B traffic.
  • Support the preliminary design and preparation of capital & operating cost estimates for IPRAN/Unified Access Transport (UAT) to support programs rollouts.
  • Preparation of Engineering planning/design specifications for changes to the IPRAN/UAT Network.
  • IPRAN/UAT topology design, optimization, and capacity dimensioning
  • Issuance of Transport Program Plans to support UAT, Service Expansion, and Wireless programs
  • Development of capacity planning reports and audits


Qualifications:

  • Highly effective individual, adaptive to shifting priorities, strong communication skills
  • Strong understanding of Transport Networks and well versed on industry and Rogers standards, vendor roadmaps for next generation networks & products
  • Experience in planning and designing Optical, Microwave and Fibre Networks is recommended
  • Experience with advanced analytics in Excel, VBA, SQL, and data visualization
  • Experience in deriving and communicating data-driven insights
  • Education experience should include a post-secondary education, preferably Bachelor of Electrical Engineering or Engineering.


As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.


Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.


Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Engineering
Requisition ID: 263894

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment


What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Material Planner
description:
Req ID: 255239

What if you could play a role in bringing together mobility and responsibility?

Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide

Join us as Material Planner, and you’ll be looking at a career-defining role based in Kingston (ON), CA.

Manage his Supplier's portfolio (Internal and/or External suppliers) for ensuring goods delivery at right time, quantity and place based on Alstom needs. Express delivery needs to suppliers and contribute to governance of the Supplier's delivery performances. Drive action plan for performance improvement & contribute to risk management. Collaborate with the Procurement team to ensure the contractual agreements are reflected in the ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system.

Your responsibilities will include:
Internal suppliers: Manage Purchase Requisition until Material Planning documents creation
External suppliers: Follow up with Procurement the Purchase Requisition level maturity for launching Material Planning documents
Ensure and update the accuracy of material planning master data (in compliance with stock and logistic constraints)
Create the Material Planning documents (Call-off, Schedule Agreement) & respective Source List and Quota Management
Communicate the Material Planning documents to Suppliers and follow Suppliers confirmation
Analyze Suppliers confirmations vs. Alstom needs and evaluate the risk/impact anticipation on production/projects
Identify priorities associated with risk/impact anticipation and set up recovery actions
Organize and maintain regular reviews with Suppliers in order to check the status of deliveries and their delivery performances
Analyze and manage MRP exception messages and anticipate supply problems (backlogs, shortages, no demand…).
Maintain delivery dates in ERP
Track missing parts until stock availability
Ensure non-conformities replacement through NCR process
Resolve Goods Receipts issues with the applied means of communication (overstock, shortage, damage, documentation, quantity mismatch, Invoices, etc.)
Analyze and share deliveries performances KPI's with different stakeholders (Internal & External)
Collaborate with Material Planning Management/SDPM to validate worst Suppliers and define appropriate action plan
Contribute (when involved) to Supplier Capacity Assessment
Contribute (when involved) to Supplier's Light Capability Assessment (LSCA)
Contribute to new business risk assessments and mitigation action plan

As our ideal candidate:
You graduated at least from Higher Education in Business Administration or Engineering or Supply Chain.
You have a Supply Chain certification.
Experience with ERPs
Knowledge of Supply Chain concepts
Experience with processes continuous improvement
SAP experience.
Materials requirements planning skills
Supplier Delivery Performance Management skills
Inventory management & Material Planning techniques
Knowledge in Industrial scheduling
Transport & Distribution skills
Supply Chain information systems
Data analytics knowledge
Procurement skills
Project Management Basics
Entrepreneurship
Agility
Collaboration

Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?

Join us on the journey to greener mobility!

Equal opportunity statement:
Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

Effective 29 January 2021, Alstom completed the acquisition of Bombardier Transportation. This is a Bombardier Transportation Legal Entity Position - positions at Bombardier Transportation companies are all members of the Alstom Group .

title: Vessel Planner - Vancouver Operations
description:
As an integral part of the Operations Team, the Vessel Planner prepares, executes and monitors the safe and effective planning for loading and discharging containerized shipping vessels.


The successful candidate will have related experience in a container terminal and vessel operations and will bring exceptional communication, interpersonal and organizational skills to the role. Additionally, he or she will possess strong computer literacy skills, and the ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, make fast and accurate decisions and work in a self-directed manner. A tertiary education will be considered an asset.


The successful applicant must be available to work all shifts in a 24/7 environment and acquire Transport Canada Security Clearance. This is a unionized position and the successful candidate will be required to join ILWU Local 514 as a condition of employment, following the successful completion of a probationary period.


For the terms and conditions related to this position, refer to the Collective Agreement between the Companies collectively known as the British Columbia Employers Association and the International Longshore and Warehouse Union Ship and Dock Foremen Local 514 (dated April 1, 2018 to March 31, 2023).


DP World Canada Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.


Please note: All applicants will be required to submit a resume to be eligible for an interview.


Deadline to apply is May 13th, 2022.

A tertiary education will be considered an asset.']

title: Planner, Scheduler
description:
PLANNER/SCHEDULER
REFERENCE # 2022-276

Ornge is a modern, vital, evolving organization that is dedicated to providing the highest quality transport medicine services to the province of Ontario. From air transport services to our critical care land transport program, we provide a range of services to patients and hospitals across the province. We are looking for individuals who are dedicated and energetic and who are looking for a career with a dynamic, patient-focused organization. Ornge is committed to creating and promoting diversity, accessibility and inclusion in the workplace.

The Workforce Planning and Scheduling Department currently has the following vacancy:

Position Available: Planner/Scheduler
Status: Full-time; Non-Union
Hours of Work: This role is expected to be able to work rotational shifts, including days, nights, weekends and holidays.
Location: 5310 Explorer Drive, Mississauga, ON
Reporting to: Manager, Workforce Planning and Scheduling
Department: Workforce Planning and Scheduling

Find out more about our comprehensive total rewards package at: https://www.ornge.ca/careers/working-for-ornge


Position Summary:

The role of the Planner/Scheduler will contribute in a variety of ways to the day to day operations of the Workforce Planning and Scheduling department at Ornge. S/he will plan and forecast short and long term needs of stakeholders related to the staffing of the Ornge fleet and Ornge Communications Center, as well as assist in scheduling training sessions and changes for staffing requirements. S/he will arrange travel, accommodations (HOTAC), car rentals, and other Ornge related business travel for Paramedics, Pilots, AMEs and other personnel as required. S/he will need to become familiar with multiple Collective Bargaining Agreements, service providers, and adhere to Ornge Policy. S/he will work cross functionally with the Operations Control Centre, Aviation, Human Resources and Labour Relations, Medical Operations, and Paramedic Education, in a range of capacities.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Collaborate with other business units to ensure educational requirements are scheduled timely and efficiently;
  • Monitor and manage crew operations and schedules to ensure compliance with Transport Canada Civil Aviation Regulations, Collective Agreements and company policies;
  • Planning and scheduling Continuing Medical Education (CMEs) and Initial Education (IE)
  • Accurately record and maintain scheduling records;
  • Monitor flight and duty time compliance and respond to irregularities;
  • Complete monthly reports as required;
  • Book travel in a timely manner as required and approved and ensure reservations are confirmed and prepared itineraries are met;
  • Provide support and respond to issues regarding travel scheduling, reservations, cancellations and general inquiries;
  • Prepare purchase orders, compare training related invoices with vendor contracts;
  • Complete monthly credit card reconciliations; and
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary education;
  • Experience in scheduling 24/7 operations; aviation and/or medical preferable;
  • Understanding of the provincial Transport Medicine system is an asset;
  • Ability to interpret and execute policies relating to Collective Agreements;
  • Ability to work within policies and practices of multiple stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze issues, develop solutions and execute plans;
  • Ability to establish and effectively manage numerous priorities and meet deadlines;
  • Strong planning and organizational skills;
  • Knowledge or familiarity with Scheduling Software Systems is an asset;
  • Basic knowledge of travel booking tool (Carlson Wagonlit);
  • Must be available to work shift rotation after business hours, on weekends and holidays;
  • Proficient with MS Outlook, Excel, Word, Power Point and Internet Explorer;
  • Ability to multi-task work with flexibility in a fast-paced environment under minimal supervision;
  • Excellent communication skills.

How to Apply:

Qualified candidates are invited to apply on-line at www.ornge.ca/careers no later than May 19, 2022. If you require a disability accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us and provide your contact information. A member of the Human Resources team will contact you within 48 hours.

Ornge is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Human Rights Code and in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Show more

title: Merchandise Coordinator
description:
Company Description


SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kidswear, and Everything Else™.

SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.


Job Description


Reporting to the Logistics Supervisor, the Merchandise Coordinator will act as a liaison between vendors, suppliers and the company, ensuring all aspects of merchandise logistics run smoothly. He/She will be responsible for coordinating merchandise shipments and deliveries, as well as optimizing these processes. The ideal candidate is an efficient planner who is adept at developing and maintaining successful cross-functional relationships.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ensure SSENSE purchase orders are prioritized within our supplier delivery windows
  • Collaborate with vendors to enforce delivery windows and report discrepancies when required
  • Identify the best shipping methods and carriers based on transport costs and estimated shipping time
  • Act as a liaison between the warehouse and the buying teams, coordinating weekly repeats and returns to ensure quick turnaround time
  • Monitor and communicate inventory levels to internal teams
  • Perform data entry as required

Qualifications


REQUIREMENTS

  • Certificate in Supply Chain, Logistics, Transportation, or a related field
  • A Minimum of 2 years experience in a logistics environment, import logistics preferred
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word)
  • Good written and verbal communications skills in both English and French

SKILLS

  • Highly analytical and detail oriented
  • Superior organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to multi-task and work efficiently to meet deadlines
  • Solid interpersonal skills with a natural ability to build relationships

Additional Information


**This position is currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Transportation Planner
description:
Salary and benefits

Organization name

R.J. Burnside & Associates Limited

Duties

Why Choose Burnside?
Are you interested in working for an employer with a 5-decade track record of building a great reputation both internally with their staff and externally with their clients? The Burnside team is a family of colleagues that work together to provide value and service to our clients, while extending care to each other. We know that our employees are our greatest asset, and thus we strive to provide a positive work/life balance.

We offer:
  • A collaborative culture where friendship, honesty and respect are part of our core values and practices
  • Flexible working hours and office locations, including work at home opportunities
  • A competitive compensation and benefits package
  • RSP company matching plan
  • Career growth and professional development opportunities
  • Performance-driven profit sharing
  • Recruiting bonus / finder’s fee for referrals
  • Wellbeing benefit
  • Active social committees
  • A welcoming, positive, and inclusive work environment

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to valuing diversity in the workplace and we welcome resumes from all qualified candidates. Burnside will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the entire recruitment, assessment, and selection process, as required. If you are a person with a disability and require an accommodation during these processes, please contact our Human Resources department.

Company Profile – More about us:
Founded in 1970, R.J. Burnside & Associates Limited is a growing values-driven employee-owned multidiscipline engineering and environmental consulting firm with over 350 staff. Our consistent commitment towards investing in technology advancements and training, in addition to encouraging and promoting professional development, has enabled our firm to meet our ongoing and stated goal of continual improvement.

We actively seek to develop relationships with a broad and diversified client base in the Public, Private, Indigenous, and International sectors. We work on a variety of projects throughout Canada, with nine office locations in Ontario and one in Manitoba.

Burnside has expertise in many technical disciplines including air and noise, asset management, buildings, environmental planning and ecology, GIS, hydrogeology, land development, landscape architecture, municipal drainage, and peer review, solid waste, stormwater management, structures, transportation planning, and design, transit, water and wastewater and well drilling & diagnostics.

The Role

The position will involve (but is not limited to) carrying out the following tasks:

  • Prepare traffic and parking studies;
  • Transportation master plans and multi-modal projects;
  • Travel demand forecasting / Need and justification studies;
  • Transportation model development;
  • Active transportation planning;
  • Review of site plan layout and circulation;
  • Coordinate and conduct field studies;
  • Undertake operational traffic analysis including intersections, corridors and freeway segments;
  • Prepare necessary reports including calculations; and
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

We are interested in speaking with recent graduates and candidates with a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience. Qualified candidates will have:

  • Degree in Engineering or Planning / Diploma in Engineering Technology or equivalent;
  • Familiarity with travel demand forecasting software such as EMME or Visum;
  • Working knowledge of traffic engineering software Synchro and SimTraffic or Vissim;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills;
  • Strong analytical and data management skills;
  • Proficiency in use of Microsoft Office Suite of programs, with strong capabilities with Microsoft Excel;
  • Familiarity with AutoCAD Civil 3D and / or MicroStation Inroads;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and willingness to work in a team atmosphere;
  • Ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects concurrently; and
  • A valid Ontario driver’s license and vehicle.

How to Apply

Transportation Planner | We're Hiring (ultipro.ca)

Deadline for applications

06/03/2022
